Reviews.Title: “An "OK" Resort”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my March break trip (1 week) to Tres Rios at Playa Del Carmen. This was my first time going to this resort but I have travelled to Mexico many times in the past. We had previously attended a timeshare presentation for this resort before they had built it. I am glad I didn't buy into it. First, let me mention the NEGATIVES: - Our reservation was completely messed up. We were promised a 2 bedroom suite and complimentary Swedish massages for everyone in our party (6) during our stay by the booking agent at the resort (we had hard copy proof of this). When we got there, we were told that we could not get the promised room and were instead given 2 junior suites for 6 people + baby. In fact, they said they had no record of any of the promises that were made to us. We provided the proof of our reservation and they even talked to the booking agent we had booked it through (and she admitted to giving us this deal), yet we got no where with our arguments. The front desk manager (Jorge Nolasco and ?Jose...I can't recall his name)) was for the most part unhelpful nor sympathetic to our problem initially (he eventually came around but we still did not get our promised room). I must mention that we were not the only ones with reservation problems as there was one day when there was a long lineup of vacationers outside the managers office waiting to discuss reservation errors. In my opinion, this resort has a problem with communication between the various departments. One hand has no idea what the other hand is doing. They really need to get their act together on this. - The beach is a huge letdown. No one ever swam in the water as it was very muddy looking and unpleasant. The river side of the beach was more calm and amenable to snorkelling and canoeing. However, the snorkelling isn't very good as there are very few fish to see and the water is contaminated with debris from the plants below. If you want to go to a beach, take the shuttle to the sister resort (Fisherman's Village) for a day...there's a fantastic beach there. - The entertainment is incredibly dull and boring. If you want a completely dull, yet relaxing vacation then this place might do. But if you want any form of entertainment, this place just does not cut it. The entertainment that was provided was boring and tacky. They had a few dinners in the conference hall with live mexican bands that struggle to keep you entertained (barely anyone showed up for the dinner nor actually danced). There's also a random Michael Jackson tribute that just doesn't fit any theme. This place is boring during the day and gets even more boring at night. - This resort could benefit from providing more frequent service during busy times. For instance, during a packed March break week, there should be more shuttles to 5th Avenue (shopping/entertainment district) and Fisherman's Village while also providing more frequent snorkelling tours (only 1 per day!!). We found it difficult at times to book activities as there were limited spots and were often booked way in advance. Now to the POSITIVES: - Service in general is great. Right from the beginning, our bellboy (Ivan) was great and very patient. He moved our luggage himself from room to room as we were sorting our room situation out. He was also very informed and gave us a lot of advice about the resort, etc. The dining staff are for the most part good as well. By far the best waiter we ran into was Francisco at the asian fusion restaurant. He's the guy you want serving you every night as he's lively and really knows the food well (I think he used to be a chef). Room service is quick and pleasant while the housekeeping staff are extremely hardworking and creative. You certainly won't find it difficult to keep your hunger and thirst satisfied as staff are everywhere offering to get you a drink or bring you food (even by the pool and beach). Our VIP concierge guy (Luis) was also fantastic as he was always on the ball and helped take care of our issues. He also arranged for our massages and helped book our trips and activities. - We eventually got our complimentary massages and boy were they relaxing. The staff are very professional and provide helpful recommendations. - The food at the a la carte restaurants are generally good. Much of the menu items have an interesting Mexican twist to it so it's a nice break from the norm. I highly recommend trying all the restaurants during your stay. The buffet...well, it's a buffet...nothing special. We mainly had the breakfast buffet which has all your basics such as eggs/omelettes, bacon, sausage, some form of potatoes, etc. Room service is available 24/7 and the selection is decent and tasty. - This place is certainly clean for the most part. It is well maintained and kept and staff work hard to keep it like that. OVERALL: If you want to purely relax and do nothing during your vacation, then this is the place (minus a nice beach to swim in). Great food and good service, clean environment and far away from any form of rowdy activities. However, if you want a nice beach to swim in or to be entertained in any way, then look elsewhere. Be weary of your reservations and always carry hard copies of what you were promised during your vacation as communication between departments at this resort is lacking. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: fort4
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios offers a beautiful setting for relaxation in a secluded area. Ideal for older couples, and young families. Young kids have a lot of fun at the Kids Club, great job Sylvia!! Even though the beach is not the best for swimming, the pools and the two rivers will keep you busy for a while. Do not miss the opportunity to use their kayaks and catamarans. Also, make sure you snorkel in the two rivers, you'll see some crabs, fish and caves. On a week stay, probably a good idea to plan a couple of outings. The staff was always very courteous, and hard at work. Once in a while they may not follow through with your request, but overall they try hard. The food in general was OK. If your stay is all inclusive, favor the restaurants over the buffet: Kotori and Porto Bello offered better quality (Porto Bello did not allow children younger than 12 though). The 2 bedroom suite was very spacious, clean, and comfortable. The water pressure in the shower is low for water conservation purposes, so it is justifiable. Hands up for the ecofriendly approach!! Housekeeping was excellent, thanks Eduardo !! Bring your earplugs, we used them one evening when they were hosting a wedding at the beach with loud music until late hours... It comes handy to have small $ denomination for tips and small purchases. Bring your own hair conditioner since it is not provided. At the resort and parks nearby, they suggest the use of biodegradable sunscreen to protect the swimming habitats.

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jasmyncan
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios in the Riviera Maya is not just another luxury all-inclusive resort in an area where the emphasis is on the Mayan culture and the natural resourses. This eco-friendly resort, including a surrounding nature preserve, allows guests to enjoy a variety of tours and sports involving the beauty of the area without leaving the premises. There are ten cenotes on the property. A centote is a natural spring which has formed a pool. These crystal clear pools are deep in the forest and guests can either walk the centote trail or take transportation provided by the hotel. In addition to swimming it is possible to use kayaks provided by the hotel to explore the fresh water streams running through the jungle. This is a sport that can be enjoyed by the whole family. Food is a very important part of any vacation and the restaurants at Hacienda Tres Rios are varied and excellent. The Italian restaurant , the Spanish restaurant, the Mexican buffet, the poolside grill,the Asian restaurant , the pizza restaurant and the Victorian bar and the Café which serves afternoon tea and pastries , provide something that everyone can enjoy. In addition, there is 24 hour room service. My husband and I spent a week in these luxurious surroundings and can hardly wait to return. It was probably one of the most relaxing vacations we have ever had. This resort gets our five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Relaxing, No Crowds”
Reviews.Author: duluth45
Reviews.Content: We like to travel to new all inclusive resorts each year. This year we brought our teenage kids. We arrived late Sunday night. Check in was smooth but we thought is was because of the late hour. A bellman was assign to take us to our roomwhich was beautiful. Spacious and clean on the 3rd floor overlooking the Mangrove tree tops. It also had a jacuzzi on the balcony. Restaurants were closed so we were told to try room service. We have had room dining before. It usually takes 2-3 hours and is lousy. This was not the case. The food was plentiful and showed up in 27 minutes. We had steak sandwiches, cheeseburgers and quesadillas. They have wireless internet in each room and a room safe. There is no need to get up early to safe chairs since they are never filled up. this was Spring Break! We set in the lovely lagoon, by the pool, in the beach beds, and along the rivers going through the property. We ate at the buffet ( lunch hours- fresh cooked turkey and roast beef), seafood, mexican, steak restuarants. All were very good. We took in the bike tour, kayak tour, snorkeling tour, and the sense adventure with the shamin. All the workers were very friendly and always said hi. We only had one negative item. After dinner there is nothing to do. Two nights they had something from 8pm-9pm. It was all good. We took a walk they watched a movie in the room with the DVD player they provide for each room.:)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Missy E L
Reviews.Content: OK I am as picky as they come and I am telling you that I couldn't be more happy with this resort. My family and I have travelled to a lot of all inclusive resorts over the years and by far this is the one we will be going back to again and again. Amazing staff, great food and such a beautiful facility. Lots to do my all ages. I felt safe. The facilities and our room was VERY clean. They had entertainment every night and they were NOT cheesy as some other resorts. They had lots to do and activities for the whole family. They had a pool for just adults and a pool for families. Just to mention it again... VERY CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “truly is paradise...hope to go every year”
Reviews.Author: evecompere
Reviews.Content: I have meant to write reviews for our vacations @ Hacienda Tres Rios for months....am finally doing it! I'm ready to go back! My husband and I vacationed there a year ago and we bought time there so we could return again and again! We then took my daughter, son-in-law and two kids a few months later and were again thrilled with the beauty of the hotel and grounds (meticulously kept), the staff (incredibly courteous, skilled, always giving 110%) and the activities available. We swam, snorkeled (in such cold, clear cenotes), floated from cenote to ocean in kayaks, sailed, enjoyed shows each night, and ate some very delicious meals!!! All this is included in the "all inclusive fee." My 5 y.o. grandaughter had wonderful times in the "kids club" each day and the 2 y. o. loved the carved birds out of fruits just for her every morning. Since room service is included...we indulged in wine and strawberries @ midnight. Samuel is the hardest working restaurant manager I've ever seen...always doing little extras to make our stay perfect. Oscar (head chef) made sure our meals were also perfect...even sending milk for the baby to the room (and a little wine for her parents!). Nothing was to much for this wonderful staff...they made our time there superb. I can't wait to return. Every year!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn H
Reviews.Content: Just celebrated my 39th anniversary with my husband and we both loved this place. Yes, there was a time share presentation, however the young lady who gave us the tour was delightful and knowledgable. We did have the nuisance of a very pushy guy for the last 10 minutes, who finally desisted when my husband did his demented Bill Murray/Jack Nicholson impression. However that was a really small price to pay for an otherwise amazing and affordable experience. The staff at the resort were, without exception, friendly and helpful at all times. This is not the place for people who want to party, which makes it perfect for those of us who enjoy the tranquil beauty of a place that truly embraces nature. Exploring the cenotes, lounging on beach beds, dining and drinking the beautiful pool... there was no shortage of delightful ways to pass the time. On a Mexican evening we chatted with a lovely man from an area near Mexico City who was celebrating his son's 9th birthday at this resort. The fact that Mexican people choose to vacation here - and have traditional Mexican weddings here, too - is a testament to this genuinely lovely resort. As a vegetarian, I found a multitude of delicious dishes. My carnivorous mate raved about the hamburgers at the poolside grill and we both loved the thin-crust pizzas made in a wood-fire oven. The culinary highlight, though, was the Portabella Restaurant. We've dined in Italy and France, but never had any meals as tasty as the ones we had here. The flambe dessert is extraordinary. Our hostess, Montjuith Robledo, was so warm and welcoming (she also hosted a terrific tequila tasting in the Sports Bar one afternoon) and the manager Rene Serrano does an impeccable job running a first-class restaurant. The dress code here is "Caribbean formal", which basically means long pants for guys, no shorts. . .comfortable but a little classier than beachwear. While I miss the food and drinks, the wildlife (especially the cute coati that hangs out at the pizza place) and the overall beauty, I especially miss all those warm smiles and holas. We hope to go back, but bypass the sales pitch next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: Shera176
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about this trip, because I'd bought the promotion almost a year ago (which included the 90 min sales presentation) and over the past year, the reviews of this resort have not been great. However, we were pleasantly surprised and had a great time. Service was top notch. The staff was incredible and did absolutely everything they could to ensure that your every request was met. Very clean hotel. Food was quite good. Beautiful grounds. 24-7 room service. And even though the resort was booked to capacity (March break), it was never "busy". There was always room around the pools, on the beach, and in the restaurants. As for the presentation - it was 3 hours, not 90 minutes. But I wasn't surprised as I'd read all the reviews. They did do their best to sell us, but didn't bully us when we declined. In fact our sales person was quite nice. Based on our experience, I would highly recommend this resort. Very nice family experience as well. My son is 8 and LOVED his time here. On a side note, the taxi ride to Playa del Carmen is worth the money (about $17 USD each way). We spent the entire day strolling 5th Avenue, and had a wonderful authentic meal in one of the restaurants. But make sure you negotiate with the street vendors - everyone seems to double their prices but if you start to walk away, they quickly offer to bargain. We got some great deals! The other trip worth doing is Xel-ha (pronounced SHELL-HA). Fabulous spot and too much to do in one day. Wish we'd had more time!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay for 2 1/2 weeks in tres rios”
Reviews.Author: geert s
Reviews.Content: after have stayed in sunset royal and lagoon, which by the way are very good resorts, the standard of tres rios is a couple of levels higher. the environment is great and the staff is dedicated and very helpful. the food is perhaps not top, but excellent is also a good quotation. If i compare that with other all inclusives, tres rios score high really high. the availability to switch every day to another restaurant is amazing. the staff is very friendly especially at Kitori and porto bello, where Rene, Montjuith and Gabriel deserves an extra star. for people travelling from Europe , the distance to travel is forgotten when you stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at Hacienda Tres Rios. the weather was wonderful, the service staff was the best I've ever seen, especially Victor at the Hacienda Grill. Couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great Food”
Reviews.Author: loveesilver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from February 27 to March 4. The resort is very nice and I found the staff to be very nice and pleasant. Beware of going there with the expectation that you will sit through their time share presentation. They will stick you in a room with no view and that's supposed to make you want to buy?? There are many nicer places to stay near by. The food at this resort is mediocre at best. By the 3rd day I was ready to order room service (which was better than the food I had in the restaurants) and forget the a la carte restaurants. Breakfast was good, but by the time dinner rolled around they had recycled the food to fit the different themes in the restaurants. The pools were clean and warm and the staff serving drinks were very efficient and friendly.I thought the Grill by the pool served the best food and it came hot and not overcooked.The beach sucks, but the mouth of the river is amazing. It is nice and quiet by the adult pool as long as parents with kids can read. Very relaxing but don't expect gourmet meals. By the way....the beds are the most comfortable of any place I have stayed in Mexico (8th trip).

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE SLIMY SALES PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: travellingsandy
Reviews.Content: Tres Tios is a gorgeous property and many of the staff are helpful. However, I would warn anyone who is considering staying here to say a very loud no to the offer of a timeshare presentation . I am currently an owner at Sunset Fisherman and, although I very much enjoy staying there, I urge you to resist the offers of these slick sales promoters. They will tell you what you want to hear and promise you the moon. However, if you purchase (a contract upgrade in my case), when they call to confirm the contract you will discover what was omitted. I am currently trying to rescind my upgrade and stay with my original, very expensive timeshare purchase. At this moment I am waiting for a callback from someone in the legal department. She is thirty minutes past the time we arranged for her to call. Am I surprised? No. I do have a credit card company that is working with me to refund my purchase and I am grateful to them. At least they keep their word.

Reviews.Title: “March Visit”
Reviews.Author: jak0065
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff with the exception of the male waiters around the pools and the Grill Restaurant. They didn't know how to smile. With the exception of the Grill, the restauants were excellent. The food at the Grill lacked the necessary flavor and was usually luke warm at best. There are several activities on site. if at this facility, you must go to the sensory tour. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The rack rate for this resort with the All-Inclusive package is to high for the for what you get, although if you can get a less expensive package it is worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation 2012”
Reviews.Author: Donna G
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Tres Rios. We had stayed at Sunset Fishermans in the past. Tres Rios is much larger and i was afraid it was going to feel crowded. It did not at all. The food was much like any other all inclusive resort except for the Italian restaurant. It was like dining in an upscale restaurant. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing. We had the pleasure of meeting Rene Serrano, the manager, and Montjuith Robledo, the hostess. We felt very at home. We ended up dining there 3 of our 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Bar”
Reviews.Author: miners79
Reviews.Content: No night life. The bar was boring. Nothing to do. Less than 10 people in there at one time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of deposit”
Reviews.Author: tdwallst
Reviews.Content: We were persuaded to book their timeshare presentation special before I did my usual tripadvisor perusal of the reviews. Needless to say we were quite concerned after reading other travelers reviews and decided to change our destination. I called 3 weeks from our travel date and requested a refund or even a partial refund and was told that was not possible. To their credit they said we could rebook any time between now and the end of the year - but after reading the overwhelming number of negative reviews we just won't risk our vacation time by going there. All inclusives are always a risk - but this one seems particularly worth avoinding.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate All-Inclusive!”
Reviews.Author: SpunkyJ
Reviews.Content: There were so many things that we could have gone away from the resort to do, but after arriving all we wanted to do was stay at the resort. Surrounded by beautiful jungle with an amazing nature trail, kayaks and canoes to use as desired to perouse the many cenotes, a private beach area with amazing scenery, gorgeous water, tons of dining options with excellent choices (particularly liked the outdoor pizza kitchen, the Hacienda Grill and room service breakfast), spacious and elegant rooms with great showers, expert concierge staff (in fact all the staff was so friendly), great evening entertainment, etc, etc, etc. Oh and the sense adventure was really cool, unlike anything else. I would highly recommend this resort for anyone including families, couples or just a gettaway for friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and renew!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1113
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax and renew, Tres Rios in a lovely all inclusive resort. The property is a Eco park with plenty to do, such as snorkeling, swimming, sailing, biking, or just plain hanging out on the beach .....which is lined with beds that make it a delight to hang out and spend the afternoon reading and napping. The food is good and there is plenty of variety among their different restaurants so if you spend a week you don't feel as if you are eating the same food every day. the staff is friendly and very helpful. There is a lovely spa that they plan to expand. If ou awning more adventure there are to us to Tulum and Xelcha to see the Mayan ruins, or to have a spectacular snorkeling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just finished a two week vacation at Hacienda Tres Rios. It was amazing. The food was fabulous, the service incredible there was nothing that the fabulous staff would not get for you. For example my husband likes oatmeal for breakfast which they always had however one morning they didn't, he just casually mentioned that there was no oatmeal and within minutes he had a bowl at our table made especially for him. We were truly treated like king and queen. The staff were great, right from our very cute bellboy ;) Jaime, our concierge Luis, our sweet breakfast waitor Jose and waiters out at the grill Jaime, Justino, Victor and Miguel. And the wonderful hostess Valeria and Capitan Ulises. Hats off to all of you. See you all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing but dull”
Reviews.Author: Mary Beth W
Reviews.Content: Very nice. No night life. Rooms and service are great. Food is good.

Reviews.Title: “La Harencia: Magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: BoyScoutBill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at La Harencia residence club at the Hacienda Tres Rios recently and had a truly wonderful experience. We had booked this by doing a trade through The Registry Collection using some of our fractional ownership time. We've come to expect first-class accomodations through The Registry and this was no exception. From the moment we arrived, where we were met by our butler (no normal check-in for us), who personally walked us to our unit, while pointing out the facilities of the resort, to our own personal "check in" handled by the butler (who was actually one of a team of 3, comprised of Julio, Francisco and Benito), they catered to our every need. An example was when they came in with a larger refrigerator on a dolly to give us some more room to store the food we had brought. Since the resort had just converted from being strickly all-inclusive to all-inclusive optional and we were there that way, the units weren't really set up for someone who wanted to use the kitchens and actually prepare a few meals, so our butlers merely provided the means for us to do so, bringing in the fridge, cooking utensils, dishes and silverware. La Harencia is a separate building from the rest of the resort and is the only one with butler service. On the top of the building is an open sun deck with 2 hot tubs, numerous lounges, tables and chairs. There is a great view of the property from up there, in fact, some may be happy to get their sun and r and r up there and never even go to the beach. The rest of the resort is beautiful! One small negative is that the pools, along with the hot tubs were not very warm and the water on the beach is a bit dirty-looking as there is a lot of organic material due to the discharge from the 3 rivers emptying into the ocean on the property. On the plus side, these 3 rivers connect to a number of "cenotes" upstream and the cool, clear water in them is fun to swim and snorkel in. It makes for a unique experience so don't miss it. The beach itself is very nice with numerous beds with sheets and pillows for those who want them. We also took advantage of the complimentary use of the catamarans and kayaks, which were a lot of fun when exploring the rivers and cenotes. The food in the numerous restaurants on the property was quite good, in general. We did have a bad experience in the eurasian restaurant one night, but management did what they could to make it right by picking up our dinner tab at the Mexican gourmet restaurant a few nights later. The staff at the resort is as good as you'll find, from the waiters to the beach attendants to the concierges. All just want you to have the best time there and return again and again! Did I mention our butlers? Oh yeah! Muchas gracias Julio, Francisco y Benito!!! You guys are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Not a spring break party place”
Reviews.Author: MaddyIowa
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with my husband. Nice, quiet, clean, good pools. Lots of chairs. The resort itself is very unique. Snokling, kayaking in the cenotes. Bike riding tour was good. Not much for nightlife. One bar open at night with some different activities but they have a beautiful beach and should have an outdoor bar with dancing or activities. If you are taking your kids that are 16-24 they are not gonna be very happy with you. One thing we never saw advertized or told about thru the hotel is the "Sense Adventure" it is right there at the hotel and a very unique experience. Definately do that. I would recommond this place one time because it is very unique.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and be pampered”
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: We just spent 12 days at Hacienda Tres Rios, and are still raving about how they treated us. Friendly, helpful staff, clean surroundings, excellent food, nice selection of restaurants to try as many times as you want. Ours was an all inclusive, and that included room service and bar fridge. Service was above & beyond any other place we've been. Italian restaurant the best, lobster dinner was fabulous, enjoyed the outdoor restaurant & pizza. Had to do the time share which got to be a bit much after the 2nd & 3rd person, but no change in service if you didn't buy. We liked the ecological things they are doing, as well. A better mix of times for scheduled events would be nice & entertainment needs work, but a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place - But”
Reviews.Author: saucywench
Reviews.Content: We were here for 1 week and the place is beautiful and clean. All the employees are friendly and and very helpful. The restaurants are great, especially the Italian one, never needed a reservation and the food was wonderful. The menu never changes so it can get a bit tiresome if you are there for longer. The beach is gorgeous white sand except there is organic matter in the ocean that makes it very unpleasant to swim in. The lagoon where the rivers enter the ocean is beautiful and one can swim there though very shallow. There are plenty of beds and loungers on the beach to relax or you can kayak up the rivers, or sail their many hobi cat sailboats. A little quiet in the evenings, but all in all a great time.

Reviews.Title: “HTR WAS GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigeza2000
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before we went tried not to let it alter my opinion when we got there. HTR is awesome!! The rooms are great, the staff is wonderful, the food was good, the resort is beautiful!!! We stayed for a week and it was pure luxury the entire time. The grill and the buffet was the best. We did not like the Italian restaurant. Service was terrible and food was so slow. The beach beds are the best just make sure to get up early to get one. All the resort entertainment was fun. Just a great overall trip. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “truly endless luxury”
Reviews.Author: klwaffle
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful for its activities, cenotes, cleanliness, food, and attention to detail. And if that were not enough, the friendly staff make it absolutely the best hotel I have ever been to. They are so helpful, so welcoming, so happy, funny, and genuine. There are beautiful places all over the world, but you cannot always find such wonderful people to be around. Other nice things about HTR - tall shower heads were a real treat for my tall husband who is used to ducking all the time, snorkeling in the cenotes was magical, Motega is hilarious in the cocktail and tequila classes, the concierges were amazingly helpful in setting up all sorts of fun adventures, and I really liked all the cute crabs when we were kayaking. Bad part - Lots of cocktails but the only beer is Corona or Budweiser.

Reviews.Title: “Counting the Days Until We Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara D
Reviews.Content: My husband has traveled to Mexico before, but this was my first trip, and I have to say in no uncertain terms that I was completely and utterly blown away! We just got home today, and already are planning our next trip here! Everything about our stay was exceptional—from the food to the beaches, the activities, etc., but what makes this place really shine is the people who work here! Everyone we encountered was very friendly and extremely helpful...if you really want to see them smile, try some Spanish and ask them if you're saying it right! There are legions of willing Spanish teachers eager to help with words and accents! As it's an Eco-Resort, we were quite pleased to hear about and then be able to see for ourselves the wind and solar energy in use, how they are preserving and maintaining the mangroves and beaches, and the different ways they are using energy more efficiently and to great effect. Lighting, air conditioning, pool heating...you name it, they're figuring out ways to do it more efficiently, and with less harm to the environment. There is something for everyone here...we saw many people with little babies, toddlers, young children, tweens and teens, and not one of them seemed bored or out of place. There were young couples, elderly couples, families, people with disabilities (the entire resort is handicap accessible!), and though it was nearly at capacity, we never felt as if there was no place to go to get some quiet time, or as if we were tripping over other people, and if you want social-time, there were always friendly people anywhere you went! And as to food? Well, with five different restaurants and a café, plus 24-hour room service, there really is something to please every palate—from casual buffet-style dining well-suited for families and kids, to an Italian, adults-only restaurant with superior service and incredibly personable servers (Guillermo was awesome!). One really can't go wrong with any of the choices, and with so many different choices, even after a whole week, I had yet to become bored with the offerings. But, I think what I enjoyed most was being able to connect with nature...if you want pristine, perfect white beaches and Caribbean blue waters, you may find yourself disappointed. But if you love an abundance of water and sea birds, 3 kinds of crabs, and a multitude of fresh/salt water fish, you will find yourself as thrilled as I was. Don;t get me wrong, the beaches are beautiful, but because of the three rivers, there will be some run-off, so the waters are crystal clear, but many-coloured, from deep aquas to the lightest greens to clear and sweet, there are no dead waters here, folks; this place teems with life and beauty! We saw coatis, raccoons, spider monkeys, parrots, Mexican blue jays, pelicans, cormorants, plovers, sandpipers, terns, vultures...I could go on and on! And with the opportunity to snorkel, kayak, sail or just swim, there are many ways to enjoy the natural wonders of this resort! We may have taken this trip to enjoy some "adult time", but we can hardly wait to go back in May with our five-year old son, and share this wonderful experience with him!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes it Great!”
Reviews.Author: SBG0429
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Feb. We had a great stay and can't say enough good things about it. Our favorite restaurants were in no particular order were the Italian, Mexican and then the outside grill. We loved the Martini Bar and Coffee Shop. We spent most of our days being taken care of by Jose the beach waiter at the lagoon. He just couldn't have been better. The lagoon is an amazing place so spend some time there.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: Ned C
Reviews.Content: Congratulations!!, this resort is amazing, they did an excellent work from cleaning to entertainment, i really liked it, i only had 2 problems, the beach ( wich was dirty) and kotori restaurant, the food and the service is slow. I recomend the italian restaurant,the food is delicious and the staff is really friendly and attentive. Definitely the best restaurant at the resort, (Monhjut) the host is awsomee so nice and professional, everywere we went she was there there helping and smiling. This is the kind of places that makes you want to return, they made me feel like family. great place people, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymoon in Hacienda Tres Rios”
Reviews.Author: Sally D
Reviews.Content: Tres Rios is beautiful, luxurious and fun...we enjoyed one of the most relaxing holidays we've ever had in this lovely setting. Great swimming pools and activities if you want, but also peaceful areas to relax, especially the super-comfortable 4-poster beachbeds - somehow, there was always at least one available! Although the sand is darkened by the silt from the rivers (well, one of the attractions is the three rivers!), it is beautifully clean, as is the water (although silty in patches). If you prefer cooler water you can swim closer to the river - delightful! We were constantly amazed by the wildlife around the complex and the nature reserve - well done, Tres Rios, for culturing this kind of environment. We had a great time on the kayaks - I'm surprised to read a review saying they weren't available, as they were when we were there, within reason. The gym is another plus point of this place - if you feel as though you've overfed a bit (as you will with all the lovely restaurants on offer here) you can get pumping in the gym. My favourite was the exercise bike in front of a large picture window overlooking the mangrove. The food was mostly excellent, and all the waiters were very happy to accommodate (I like a nice soft-boiled egg in the morning, which wasn't on the menu). The buffet was surprisingly healthy, delicious and fresh, especially breakfast and lunch...dinner could be a bit iffy, but then we spent most dinners at the Mexican restaurant or the Hacienda Grill amongst the swimming pools. The staff were excellent, and this is from an English woman who didn't realise about tipping for a few days. The staff were all clearly very happy to be working there, from the lowliest chambermaids to the Head Chef, Oscar, who is hilarious, but also very professional and extremely hardworking. He would always have one eye on the running of the place, and clearly only accepts the best from his staff, who seem eager to please their boss. The activities were well run by English speaking staff, fun, safe and educational all at once. One tip - make sure you bring proper shoes: I couldn't go on the cycle tour of the cenotes in sandal, gutted! I did, however manage to make a kayak-trip up the river from the sea to one of the cenotes, what a great experience! As a honeymooning couple without kids, we avoided the 'family fun' evenings, but the children and families there seemed to be having a whale of a time whenever we saw them. We enjoyed quiet evening walks along the beaches, and also a couple of outings to Playa del Carmen (let off a bit of steam at Coco Bongo, definitely worth a visit if you enjoy dancing and shows!). What a beautiful paradise - as many of the other reviews say, we just didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Oneskipper
Reviews.Content: We do get to travel to many resorts in Mexico and truly enjoyed this resort. The pillow top mattresses were so comfortable. The fact that you were not limited to number of times to restaurants and no need for reservations was fantastic. Food and service in restaurants was friendly and service in all respects was great. Our favorite waiter was Jose on the beach other side of bridge over river. He was super friendly and so responsive to the guests. The layout was great including the design of the three pools. We were in building three (in the middle) where we had the best view with our room being on the third floor overlooking pools and sea view all the wayt to Coxumel.We found that the main beach was filled with brown colored seaweed and found that all down the beach other resorts had the same but did not have the amount of sandy beach that we had. The best was the beach on the other side of bridge where we always were able to get a bed and swim in the river. That whole area was unique. Don't forget the kayak up the river to top where the cenote starts, hike to cenotes and the plant nursery. Oh yes, do the sense adventure (can't tell you about it, it's different).

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: GJF6322
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay and the hotel is beautiful and in a wonderful setting. Service was very spotty such as being told on website that as an all inclusive resort snorkel gear and kayaks would be available but when we were there they keep equipment under lock and key and only allow usage when on their cenote tours and told by staff to make reservations for dinner at the Italian restaurant but then told at restaurant that reservations are not taken. The staff were wonderful and the many minor inconveniences and communications seem to be a reflection of a management style that is geared to get people in, particularly for time share sales attempts, and this style is reflected in the staff passing the buck. Our room was incredible! We prepaid for the all inclusive "Endless Luxury" program which included tips but even with extremely disappointing service at times I did leave tips for all staff as in discussion with a room service employee I was told that they work six dollars (US) per day and work six days a week. Since we were paying a good deal we were put in a terrific room on the top floor and overlooking the pools and the sea. Beware the hard sell for time shares. I refused to be talked into a session but others we befriended had to sit with a salesperson for three to five hours and undergo the hard sell or feared losing their reduced rate for lodging. Most of these people were roomed in lower floors overlooking the jungle. The place can get loud with partyers.

Reviews.Title: “revisit”
Reviews.Author: jlevymd
Reviews.Content: Returned to tres ríos 10 months after my daughters' wedding there. The staff remembered my group and made us feel at home. Rooms are spotless, and the entire hotel is constantly being cleaned. Service comes with a smile; front desk can be slow, but relax; you are on vacation... Beach is real nice, but the nature reserve section is breath taking. There are rivers, cenotes, walks; great exercise to ride a canoe up the rivers. Food is adequate; all inclusive, but well prepared and served nicely. There are several restaurants, and your dinner can be quite enjoyable. Breakfast and lunch are very good; outdoor restaurants are a plus for my family. Great value; easy to get to from the northeast. Love the place; it's got that charm that is hard to find. It's not the Ritz Carlton, but who cares when you have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned our first big vacation in 7 years and decided to go to Playa to Hacienda Tres Rios. We went in the end of October feeling thinking hurricane season would be over and chances of getting caught in one would be low (we were in a hurricane in on our honeymoon in Cabo San Lucas). Unfortunately on Tuesday we got warning of a strong hurricane heading our way. We were told by staff that the hotel was built with this in mind and there was nothing to worry about. This was absolutely the truth. They didn't have to tape our windows or board them up. The power flickered a couple of times but we felt safe. In fact we couldn't hear the wind or rain through the night. No rattling windows or doors. It was great to know that the hotel was built for the safety of the guests. The food was great, the service was top notch, and the hotel is beautiful inside and out but this was overshadowed by how safe we felt in a rather threatening storm. The next day we went into town and was amazed by number of buisnesses that were closed after having to board up their windows and doors and didn't reopen until later in the afternoon. We had been insulated from it all by the quality of this hotel. The trip was not all we planned it to be, we had to cancel scuba diving and other activities but we were safe and dry.

Reviews.Title: “5 Relaxing Days”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDChandler
Reviews.Content: Overall had a wonderful experience in Mexico. Wasn't sure if I would enjoy it. The Hacienda Tres Rios staff was very friendly and helpful. They bring you drinks to the pool area and the beach. Luved the beds by the beach. Jose was always asking if we wanted another drink or pizza. The breakfast was awesome. It included almost everything you could want for breakfast including a couple mexican dishes. The Italian restaurant had great lasagna and I luved the pizza too. We left our laptop and pesos out in the room and nothing was ever stolen. They do have a safe for valueables too. A cab ride to Playa del Carmen was $20 and a ferry ride will take you to Cozmel. A great trip. Great experience. The people were friendly everywhere we went. Mike from Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Nature and Luxury Combined”
Reviews.Author: GuyTraveler324
Reviews.Content: If you like being in luxury and also like nature, this is your place. It was my place for 4 nights and i will definitely go back! The nature park is where one can snorkel, bike ride, kayak, etc. Then you come back to a first class property, in my opinion. I appreciated the adults only pool area very much. Plenty of space, also. The staff keeps the property beautifully landscaped and meticulous. Go on the bike tour with "Corina". She is a wonderful guide, very professional and took time to stop along the way so that we didn't get too tired. Go on the nursery tour with "Motega". He is very knowledgeable! The whole staff was fantastic, all over the property. Excellent food for the most part. Skip the cheesburger at the grill, however. The Italian restuarant and the Mexican restaurant are excellent. The breakfast buffet, fantastic. Very nice rooms also. I had a mangrove view which was okay i guess, but they wanted $35 a night extra for an ocean view. I decided to save my money. The time share sales session was a pain, but that's part of the deal, i guess. The beach area is very, very tanquil, however. If you're looking for big waves, this is not for you. I took advantage of the "cenotes", however, and they are crystal clear water, and very deep, and very refreshing in which to swim. Skip the hotel zone (in Cancun) this one time and stay here. Take advantage of all the natural things to do in the huge nature park.

Reviews.Title: “Quality resort with great service”
Reviews.Author: chachadancer_gp
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is beautiful inside and out. The hotel and all of its rooms are marbled floored with nice artwork. All rooms have good views of the river, pools and ocean. Rooms are larger than most other hotels rooms and since they opened in 2010 are all newly appointed. The pools separate the hotel from the ocean. The kid's pool is freshwater while the three other pools are saltwater. You have two outdoor facilities to eat. The outdoor pizza oven makes thin and crispy delicious individual pizzas. The outdoor Grill serves lunch and dinner with the dinner meals being very very good. The indoor restaurants are Mexican, Asian or Italian. Long pants and a collared shirt are the dress codes. The meals are beautifully set with equaling taste. The service from all staff is excellent as they are fast and everywhere. There is a coffee/dessert room open most any daylight hour until late in the night. Small venues of entertainment alternates between Karaoke, Singers with accompanying keyboard for dancing, Mexican singers and dancers, Brazilian drummers and dancers and other small groups in different parts of the complex. Larger entertainment on the big stage consisted of a circus performance group, a Michael Jackson dance group, a Mariachi band, all doing fine jobs on a professional local level. The beach is not as large as beaches closer to Playa del Carmen and the ocean is clouded by the rivers emptying into the ocean. Yet One of the greatest attributes of this resort is the rivers. You can snorkel down to the river or kayak up and down them. You can simply let the fairly strong current glide you into the ocean allowing you to walk ankle deep back to do it all over again. They have added more beach accessing a second river since 2010. Improvements will continue as they have the first of 20 towers for their future Zip line along with another complex of rooms. Eventually the resort beach will be just under one mile long when they add the yacht basin. Our friends who have been to 114 countries said they put Hacienda Tres Rios in their top five resorts. If you want nicer beaches and water take their van to their sister resort "Fisherman's Village". It is just South of Playa del Carmen. Try their cream corned soup, mixed seafood grill and Riviera Mayan drink made in layers of Melon liquor, orange juice, and topped by a frozen mixture of vodka and strawberries. I loved anything with tomato sauce and all of their pepper dishes. Other things to do: Shop Playa del Carmen. Take a tour of CHICHEN ITZA but use a guide as they explain the ruins. Without the guide you would loose the flavor of the entire culture. The guided bus trip is too long as it goes first back to Cancun and then Westward to the ruins. It takes 3.5 hours one way. Along the way you have lunch and are treated to authentic Mexican dancers. As top to artisans making tourist items will be another short stop. Quality is assured but if you don't care about quality or authentic items you can buy them much cheaper inside Chitzen Itza. Vendors are said to have to support the Mexican Mafia but believe what you wish. Relatives have told us not to miss XEL-HA and XCARET. We will catch them next time. We visited sister resorts of Sunset Lagoon and the Royal Sunset in Cancun. The rooms and hotels were handsomely designed. Both have been totally redone since 2010. We also visited the Isla Mujeres. The Northern beach was nice as was traveling the entire island in a self driven golf cart. Expect rows of tourist shops in town and a Cuba like 1950's residential ghetto everywhere else. While an experience to see it is not our first choice of a place to visit. Although we didn't do it the snorkeling boats looked like they were having a very good time. In summary the Sunset group of resorts do things the right way with quality and great service. I hope I helped. I did buy a unit in 2010 and am happy I did so.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDKOhio
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios is an all inclusive resort approximately 15 minutes north of Playa Del Carmen. A large beautiful resort inside and out which was originally an eco park. The eco park was nearly destroyed by hurricane Wilma. Unable to get a loan to rebuild Tres Rios stepped up financially to build on the 300 plus acres and provide the necessary funds to rebuild the eco park. There are many beautiful marble filled all inclusive resorts within the riviera Maya but what distinguishes this is it's ties with nature. There are three rivers on the property that empty into the ocean that you are able to explore. You can swim , snorkel , or kayak these beautiful waters. Be sure to bring an underwater camera so you can capture the beauty that lies beneath the waters surface. Many people pay to go on an exursion to partake in these activities which are complimentary at this resort. This sprawling eco park also is home to I believe 6 cenotes that you are also able to explore. You can bicycle on the resort property with the assistance of a wonderful guide to see all that it has to offer. It is an easy bike ride that all ages can partake in. One of the stops on the bike tour is to the nursery they operate to maintain all of the plants at the resort. The interior of the resort is beautiful, clean, and well maintained. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. I highly suggest you ask for a room that is overlooking the outdoor pools on the ocean side of the complex. They host 3 large pools that again are clean and I always felt the water was maintained at a comfortable temperature. During my visit at the end January I found the resort to have a low occupancy level. There was never a need to get up early to play the towel game on a pool chair. It was also an easy task to go to a restaurant of your choice. The culinary choices offered gave a good variety for all to choose from. From the mexican, italian , asian , steak house , international buffet , pizza , coffee shop all the food was good but not great. It was what you can and should expect at an all inclusive resort. But what was impressive was the quality of the service that you received wherever you went. All of the staff was friendly and professional. They go out of their way to make sure you are satisfied. Hacienda Tres Rios is a tranquil resort that has a lot to offer. It is a beautiful pristine resort at one with nature. If you enjoy sitting pool side and soaking up the sun this is the place. If you enjoy frolicking in the water this is the place. If you want a crowded and loud complex it won't be found here. Playa Del Carmen is a short taxi ride away that has the shops , bars , music that some will be looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, BUT BE AWARE OF TIMESHARE SCAM”
Reviews.Author: CG-Tourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios for the first time last November. I must say, the hotel room was amazing -- we had the family suite through my parents-in-law timeshare which consisted of a huge living/dinning room off which are a master bedroom suite (king bed, sitting room area, Jacuzzi bath) and a second bedroom (two queen beds, sitting room area). In addition, the room had three full bathrooms. Everything looked very new, tv's were all flat panel, etc. Now for the food. For an all inclusive resort, I would say the food is what one might expect. Not great, but not bad either. So far so good. Now the things we didn't like about the resort. The pool. Looked very nice and there was always plenty of seating. However, it was really cool, primarily because the nearby fresh water from the close by underground rivers are used to maintain the water in the pool. Such a shame, because my daughter and wife simply decided not to use the pool itself. The beach. Not much to say here, except the ocean water is full of dark stuff (seaweed??) and so you really don't want to go in the water. This presented more of an issue for me, because we found the swimming pool too cool to enjoy. Also, the beach itself, while it looked like white sand, was rock hard underfoot so not nice for the kids to play on. NOW THE WORST -- the timeshare scammers. As soon as you check in there's pressure from the concierge, the check-in people, basically everyone to go to a timeshare presentation. They couch it in terms of an orientation presentation, although it's pretty clear what they are trying to do -- sell timeshares. In fact, we weren't permitted to check-in until we sat through 30 mins of one of the concierges trying to convince us to attend one of the presentations. Later that same day, my parents-in-laws checked in and agreed to go to the presentation even though they already own a time share with the group operating the hotel. They were told that they would receive "IMPORTANT" information about their current time share. During the presentation they were pressured into agreeing to upgrade their timeshare into a "fractional ownership" by which they were told they would have part ownership in the property. That was a complete lie. When I reviewed the contract, they had been duped into signing a contract for a timeshare exactly the same as they already had except the annual fees were considerably higher. They also duped into giving up their previous timeshare as part of the "deal." The only reason they agreed to this was because they were told they would be part owners of the property and so it would be a good investment which they "guaranteed" would quadruple in value within two years. Clearly, the contract bore no resemblance to what they had been told they were purchasing. Luckily under Mexican law, all time share contracts must have a clause by which you can change your mind within 5 days (i.e., to revocate the contract). We immediately did that for my parents-in-law, following the instructions within the contract exactly. Within 15 days of that, the timeshare company (Sunset Group) was required to return the deposit. Guess what -- that didn't happen. Luckily, the deposit was made by credit card, so they were able to dispute it. However, since November, the Sunset Group has been pestering them for the money threatening the use of a collections agency. My Advice -- PLEASE PLEASE do not let yourself be scammed into purchasing a timeshare at any of the Sunset Group Hotels (including the Hacienda Tres Rios). If you are inclined to buy a timeshare at one of their resorts, do yourself a favor and look online for others trying to sell theirs -- they cost considerably less than buying direct from the hotels. Also, don't believe them if they try to tell you that what you're buying is an investment or some sort of fractional ownership in the property -- it simply is not. Oh by they way, I confronted the management and asked them put in writing that they would buy back the timeshare for the "guaranteed" amount they said it would be worth in the future. Surprise, surprise they would not.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is perfect, but this was close. Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Towerns
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share with you, our experience with the Hacienda Tres Rio... which was awesome. I guess if you look for things to critiize, you'll find what your looking for, however both my husband and I agree that our experience there was great. The resort, the service, all the anemities, the beaches and the weather were awesome. As a first timer going into Mexico, we were a little apprehensive, however, this feeling was totally overcome by the 6 days spent at this resort. Given the opportunity, we would certainly have a return visit. Oh did I mention that we could not have asked for a better week weather wise....that certainly helped. I gueaa if we had to note one negative, it would be the presentation we attended (not overly impressed with that part). But we certainly would not let that alone cloud our judgement on the overall experience. We are both very glad we went.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service! Great place for families and outdoor people!”
Reviews.Author: SarahAllman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Iberostar Grand 6 months ago, and the service at the Tres Rios was far superior. We are still here and are sad to leace on Wednesday. The staff here goes above and beyond to make sure your experience is perfect. I love that there are kayaks, cenotes right on property. Typically, you would have to spend $100's of dollars for an entrance fee to another park in order to have the same experiences that you can have right here at the Rios. Room service is fast. Make sure if you need your mini bar stocked to call room service. They are happy to do this. I love that the property has its own water filtration systems. The tap water here tastes better than the bottled water that is served all over Mexico. There is no funny "aftertaste" in their food. The food, well, its "All Inclusive". I learned early on that if you choose to stay at an all inclusive, cut them some slack. It's no chop house, but over all, very enjoyable. What I love most about the food is that you can essentially ask them to prepare anything special, and they will do it. If you are on a diet, this is your plave. They serve steamed chicken and veggies EVERY day. When I say steamed, I mean steamed, no oil, no seasoning. When we 1st arrived, we stayed on the bottom floor in a jacuzzi suite, very lovely room, however there was an ant problem. We paid to upgrade, it would have been nice to be upgraded without a charge, since there were ants. I do, however, understand this property is on a lush/tropical resort. Nature will be nature. There are DVD's in every room, and I recommend bringing your own DVD's as the ones to rent on property are very out-dated. The beach is not the best, but everything in this hotel is super clean. If you love adventure, this is your place. So much to do! Awesome service. We upgraded to room 1302, which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for nature lovers”
Reviews.Author: LisaT1969
Reviews.Content: H3R is built on the site of a former nature park which was partially damaged by Hurricane Wilma several years ago, so it can offer an array of on-site activities such as kayaking, cenote snorkelling, cycling and nature walks free of charge, in addition to the usual beach resort activities. They have a nursery which is being used in part to reforest the parts of the mangrove which suffered damage, and the environment of the property as a whole is very healthy, as is evidenced by the vast numbers of fish living in the small rivers. They take being "green" to a whole new level; for example, the heat generated by the air conditioning units is used to heat the water in your shower, and they have their own desalinization system to minimize the amount of water taken from the natural environment. That said, you'll never think about ecology once you sit down at the dinner table - wow! The food at H3R is as gourmet as you'll find anywhere, and unlike some all-inclusives you could stay here for weeks and not eat the same dish twice. I highly recommend finishing dinner with a Mayan coffee - it's great for settling the stomach after over-indulging! (Gabriel at the Italian restaurant makes it the best!) As for the beverages, I can vouch for their mojitos being the best I've ever had, and sipping cappucinos by the river in the morning or martinis on the terrace in the evening feels incredibly decadent. The staff were all friendly and gave excellent service, with each one taking pride in doing their job well. The luxurious decor of this hotel seems to blend seemlessly and tastefully with the natural environment around it, using soft earth tones, mahogany wood, and an abundance of marble. If there is a drawback, it's just that at times a dark "sludge" washes up on parts (not all) of the beach, making thoses areas unappealing for bathing. (It's just organic material which washes out from the rivers into the sea, nothing harmful.) I'm so glad we had a chance to stay at this resort, and would highly recommend it to anyone, from families with children to couples looking for a romantic getaway. (Btw, nearly everything on the grounds is fully accessible for those with limited mobility, too.)

Reviews.Title: “My sons wedding”
Reviews.Author: RoseM4
Reviews.Content: L,et me start by saying that I travel extensively to Mexico and the Caribbean and only at all inclusive hotels. Hacienda was by far the worst experience. We had over 40 people in attendance for the wedding which was planned a year in advance and I spent most of my time at the front desk fighting for our guests. I was also told they were at 80% capacity and that there were no king sized beds available for most of our guests. Turns out this is a family resort and that is who they cater too. The resort was clean, if you don't mind your room being cleaned at 5 pm when your getting ready for dinner and the food was barely edible. The Grill was the best so for 5 days that is where we ate, everything we were entitled to as a large group was a fight. Out of my 6 day stay, 5 of them was spent fighting with front desk over something or concierge trying to get things organized. I was given an upgraded room with jacuzzi on roof and it never worked and when it did it was scummy. Topping on the cake was when my safe would not open and they had to drill it put and replace it. Another 3 hours spent in my room instead of with my guests. If traveling to Mexico I recommend the Excellence playa Mujeles adult all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tropical Vacation”
Reviews.Author: samontine
Reviews.Content: Tres Rios is a beautiful resort with the friendliest of staff, unspoiled beaches and delicious food. Our room was gorgeous & had lovely tile floors, with stone "night lights" in the bed & privacy screen. The shower is a spacious walk in shower with the appearance of a skylight! The housekeeping staff kept it spotless during our stay. Hector & Dian, the concierge, planned fun activities on & off the resort for us. They are the best!! I reccomend a visit to Chichen Itza, and the Sense Adventure on property. All of the 5 restaurants and room service are delicious & serve varying cuisine. My favorites were the pizza, juice therapy, and the ceviche at the outdoor grill. The resort & nature park are gorgeous & natural, and provide activities to do all day. Swimming, snorkeling, kayaking....etc!! There are guided tours, and you can also go on your own! You can start with a walk in the jungle, jump into the river & snorkel, wich will lead you into the ocean, where you can swim, then get out & enjoy a cozy lounge chair or canopy bed on the beach, with a margarita. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Good for families and groups”
Reviews.Author: HappyGoLuckyNJ
Reviews.Content: My parents booked this resort because they ran a Groupon. We had to reschedule because Hurricane Irene grounded all flights out of Newark, NJ but HTR was excellent in changing our original booking. They arranged for transportation to pick us up at the airport and it took us straight to the hotel. The hotel/resort is only a year old and it definitely felt that way. The one thing that kind of put me off was the intro our "concierge" gave us when we arrived. Yes, she acquainted us with the resort and told us all we needed to know but then came the sell to have us tour the timeshares so we could get free massages or a free dinner as an incentive. It was a clever way to rope us in. The resort is great for families who like outdoor activities. You can run along the walking trails or the beach. You can kayak up 3 of the rivers that run through the 300+ acres that make up the resort property. There's snorkeling in the rivers and the ocean and much more. They also have a biking tour throughout the property and they even let you tour their nursery where they're growing more indigenous species to continue planting on the eco-friendly resort. The letdowns were the food and the drinks. I'm a bit of a foodie and I like my swim-up pool bars. There are 2 pools but they're not much to look at and they don't have swim up bars. There are 5 restaurants to eat at for dinner and the Asian one was by far the best. They have a nice selection of food to eat but nothing stood out as exemplary. The beach isn't the best but it's still relaxing to grab a cabana on the beach and listen to the waves. The nightlife is so-so, since the resort is more family-friendly. Also, the walls of the rooms are a bit thin, so if you have noisy neighbors who want to continue partying past closing time, bring earplugs (something I needed to use). The standouts were the staff and the cleanliness of the resort. The staff are just the nicest, sweetest people ever. They cleaned 'round the clock and they're super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort With Wonderful Employees”
Reviews.Author: Francine F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios for three weeks and had a wonderful time. The people working there were extremely attentive and personable to us. Sami, Franciso and Shakira were just wonderful. They could not do enough for us. Whenever we needed something, Sami was always there to help us. He made us feel like family. Francisco ( the butler in our building) went out of his way to help us as did Shakira in VIP Services. They made our vacation so enjoyable. We highly recommend going to Tres Rios. It was like a dream vacation. Francine and Gerald Falkowitz

Reviews.Title: “Pickiest of Travellers Report”
Reviews.Author: Persuader23
Reviews.Content: In my profession, my wife and I travel a lot as we bring groups of clients from Canada to amazing destinations all over the world. To say I'm picky is an understatement!! I'm pretty demanding as I only want the very best for the clients who are our company's largest accounts...makes sense right?? The resort is gorgeous but not THE most beautiful resort we have ever seen. The night life is almost none existent but we weren't there to party into the wee hours. The service is undeninably the best we have ever encountered in the 30 years we have been travelling. ANYTHING you want gets done and it gets done with a huge smile followed by perfectly spoken English and a willingness to do even more. We stayed in the Los Hodas building which came with its own Butler and our 2 bedroom room was 2000 sq ft with a massive patio. The resort itself is on a nature preserve and they have won awards for being so ecologically cognisent of their surroundings. There are many cenotes (swimming holes) with rivers that have a nice soft current that allows you to effortlessly snorkel all the way to the ocean. They give you a life jacket and away you go. There are 2 rivers...take them both...this is a MUST do. The beach itself is at the end of many miles of beach and yes, it's not the nicest section because of the mirkiness of the mangos that are beside this resort for a few miles. A small walk up the beach and you have the water you most like to see while vacationing in this region. A couple of other MUST DO's while here; have the chef's dinner which is a private meal in the kitchen prepared personally for you by their head chef. Sounds unappealing but you have to spoil yourself with this. It's free, but they ask you to buy a bottle of wine which will run you $100. The next must do is having a private dinner in your room. Anything you want will be brought to you and served to you all the time of your meal with every aspect of a $500 meal taken care of....free. The food anywhere in this resort is probably some of the best food we have had anywhere...and I'm very picky about my food. Order your drinks with the best booze of your choice and they have it...don't be shy to ask every time. The most expensive Rye, Rum Vodka, Scotch etc etc is all for the asking...no extra charge. Upstairs in the Mexican restaurant is a wonderful area with a Tequila Bar. The bartender's name is Jose and he knows everything there is to know about Tequila. You'll sample the best Tequila in the country and this isn't the stuff you throw back and suck a lime. This is par to some of the world's best Scotch's, so treat it accordingly. There are time-shares here....and I never thought I would ever say this in my life, but take the tour. NOT hard sell and very worth the while looking at if you like to travel in the very best and pay the very least (this is my motto and I spend weeks investigating the best deals to be had).

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Johanne250
Reviews.Content: A little far from Playa but if you like tranquility, it is the place to stay. Great food and great service, HTR made me feel most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Food that was almost as good as the leftovers in a soviet era bomb shelter”
Reviews.Author: wacawaca
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a saturday afternoon in what seemed to be a monsoon. The person checking us in told us we were the last of the wedding party to arrive and that the hotel was 80% booked (he said this with so much pride that i gather they rarely get to this level of capacity). We went to our room which had two beds, when we specifically asked for one king. We walked back to the check in desk which was in a separate building (thus requiring us to once again traipse accross a bridge over a lagoon that smelled distinctly of diarrhea in the pouring rain). At that point, the manager told us they were at capacity and that even if we had booked a king room, what we were given was all they had. When I pointed out that the snide gentleman who had checked us in mentioned that they were at 80% capacity she retorted that "we have a limited number of king beds". Well, then don't guaratnee people king beds. At that point, after having traveled for 12 hours we were in no mood to argue and returned to our rooms in the pouring rain over the lagoon that smelled of diarrhea. Some of the light bulbs in the room didn't work. We were at the resort for two nights and our room was not cleaned once. The housekeeper did knock on our door on our first full day at 5pm (after we had been out all day, giving her ample time to clean) and we told her to come back at 6pm. We made sure we were gone by then. When we came back, the room was never cleaned. The resort was beautiful, but it all seemed very surface. The resort is a giant "Monet". The closer you get to anything, the more you notice it is crumbling, there are little ants crawling around everywhere, and dishes are cleaned by hand outdoors with no soap. The beach was nice and the service personnel were extremely hard working, and attentive. They deserve all the credit for making the stay bearable. The front desk people were completely rude, disorganized and uninterested. They also cursed at me in spanish under their breath. But, luckily I understood them and cursed right back. Now, the icing on the proverbial cake. The FOOD: As I mentioned, the servers were amazing. But the food they served, awful. The pasta with tomato sauce that we ordered in room service was actually pasta with tobasco sauce. The pizza was inedible, even after 15 tequila shots. The Buffet restaurant was equally terrible and frustrating. The "cold cuts", I kid you not, was spam, and turkey spam (at least they gave a choice). The breakfast consisted of runny eggs that were clearly powdered, and french toast, waffles and pancakes that were so hard they would literally shatter if you banged them on your plate. Even though the resort is all inclusive, they wouldnt let us bring any snacks from the buffet to the bar to watch the Giants/Packers playoff game. Even though EVERYONE IN THERE WAS PAYING THE ALL INCLUSIVE. No one I spoke to out of the 150 person party I was with had anything good to say about the food. It was literally inedible. If we had been there for a week I don't know what we would have done, other than lose weight (a secret benefit!). Do yourself a favor, avoid this place, unless you are on a diet. Key Takeaways: Horrible food Smells of Diarrhea in certain spots Pretty surroundings (visually) Great service at the bars/restaurants Front Desk staff will call you a bendejo if you ask them why they screwed up your confirmed in writing reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ZeeMoi
Reviews.Content: As a family of five (13, 12 & 8), everyone had excellent time. The service was great - the resort with all the extra that comes with a large natural park (Snorkeling, kayaking, biking, plus many more) is amazing. Rooms and facilities are top notch and vary spacious. I called them on their Pillow menu and yep - received four different types to try (felt just like home). The a la carte restaurents are beyond exquisite, the size encorage you to try a variety of things and all were excellent. The breakfast was above average but with a great variety of fruits. Snorkling and kayaking in the resort owned rivers (part of the natural park) was free (with or without the guide) and was great. The kids had great time as well. We recommend trying it especially for family type vacations.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return to Hacienda Tres Rios!”
Reviews.Author: Negirlinkc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-day trip and our biggest complaint is that we didn't plan to stay long enough! The resort is fantastic, staff was WONDERFUL (tip a few pesos to make a difference), accomodations were nice, and the food was very good. If only it hadn't rained the last day, we were looking forward to kayaking to the cenotes.

Reviews.Title: “HONEST REVIEW OF RESORT (GOOD & BAD) & SEXUALLY ASSAULTED/GROPED LAST NIGHT OF MY HONEYMOON!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: On the last night of my honeymoon, I somehow randomly ended up at the beach after talking with a nice older couple in the sports bar (right within the lobby area)...... the last thing I remember is putting my husband to bed and going back to look for something I'd forgot & thank the older gentleman for helping my husband to our room, whilst he was intoxicated and sleepy. I brought my own bottle of water from my hotel room. I wasn't drinking at this point and next thing I remember after the older couple left and after I was having a few shots at the pool table was blacked out and I'm on the beach being held from behind by someone. Scary as all hell. The only reason I knew it was a wait staff/hotel employee was due to the fact that I spotted another man to the side with their hotel uniform on and the one behind me holding me, just kept repeating, it's okay, seniorita.... okayyyyyy seniorita, as i was fondled below. Coming to at that point was extremely frightening and I bolted for the hotel lobby. I have blood all over my jean capris.... which have been thrown out due to the memory of it all, and am recovering from a large gash going from my knee up my thigh..... possibly from falling upon escape. I did look up on google and found similar other stories horror stories from Mexico Mayan Riviera area. This was reported to my booking agency, as I do not want this to happen to anyone else. I'm traumatized. And it was my honeymoon. The best they could do at the front desk was offer me tea.... I got no check up by a doctor (they claim to have one on site) and that's when I went back out to the front desk to try to get somewhere. Pretty much nothing happened. I barely wrote anything about it on a generic comment sheet they make you sign on the way out..... because who the hell wants to relive that the day after the event!?! I was told the employee would be found and fired and I'd receive an email shortly from them about what was happening. NO EMAIL..... I'm sure it wasn't reported. This is a "5 star resort" - they must want to keep up their good appearance. Now let me tell you about the resort..... it was beautiful, sterile like a hospital inside but beautiful. Stocked fridges in rooms w soda and corona. I preferred the coca cola. The entrance LOOKS heavily secured, they check all in going and out going vehicles and room #s. But that doesn't mean that they check their employees with the same security so watch out. Also if you are a female.....( with curves, or even with just 2 legs and 2 arms I'd say), several of the male staff will look you up and down - very uncomfortable. Word of advice, do not leave your hotel room after 11pm as most people have gone to bed and it's like a ghost town on the premises. With it being a so called 5 star hotel, and the appearance of security and the fact that you're on a gated in community, you'd think you'd be safe. But please please don't take your chances..... I can say as many great things as I can think of about their food, the bed, the shower, etc...... but it doesn't change the fact that it doesn't feel safe after 11 when restaurants are closed, etc. Now, for the rest of my review on the hotel itself......... Hotel inside was always freezing...... beach looks nothing like the web pictures.... it's pretty but not swimable for the most part. The pools are freezing..... hot tubs aren't hot enough in the pool area. Drinks aren't blended well enough by 8/10 of the staff and you get big ice chunks in a smoothie/slush drink. Other hand, drinks were never watered down - good ratio of alcohol to non alcoholic contents. There was one lady with a blue skirt always walking around pool area but mainly beach waiting on people out on the beds..... she was excellent - quick, friendly, even took me and showed me where I could find a bathroom - ps. no close bathroom to the pool - gotta hitch it to your room or inside the lobby - imagine that with a kid!!! I don't want to imagine that. Food= Buffet..... if you're a vegetarian like myself, plan on eating meat, eggs and stuff with cream in it all week - you can't survive on just melons & local fruits at breakfast and you'll find only a weak flavored salad at the Grill restaurant outside at night. Or you could eat guacamole 24-7. So anyway, not being a strict strict vegetarian, I went down the seafood route - I do eat some seafood - and had omellettes in the morning. Omellette lady's awesome. So is the lady in the coffee shop. So, this resort offers very few seafood dishes.... no shrimp cocktails!!!!!!! WHAT?!!!!
