We only snorkeled in one when we were there, but it all depends on the season, since some of the clarity of the cenotes depend on this. The third river contains no cenotes, and is sometimes inaccessible if the water is too low. We kayaked the third river, but almost got stuck a few times since it was pretty low. There is also a nature park on the premises too. I meant to get up early each morning and hike to the front of the park as there are supposedly monkeys that can be seen early. They have very nice large pools, but I preferred to swim where the rivers met the ocean, as the water was ALOT cooler than the pools. My highest praises to this resort go to the staff and waiters. They are very eager to earn a small tip, and will really go out of there way to accomodate you in any way. I will address two of the issues that i had before I got there and that seems to come up--the beach/ocean and the time share presentation. I was very worried about both of these before arriving. The ocean RIGHT OUT FRONT of the hotel is very brackish because of the organics coming from the rivers. But if you goto either side, the water improves and is very swimmable. We were greeted at the hotel by a staffer, and the time share presentation was brought up, but I declined once, and it wasn't brought back up, so that was relief. Overall, we loved it, and I just think we would bored not having cenotes and kayaking in rivers. It's a big deal for us, which is why we loved this resort. They also had extra stuff like mariachis, brazlian fire dancing, on certain nights that wasn't even announced. We are definately going back when we find a deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: treesprite07
Reviews.Content: First thing to say is that we don't have a time share here. Secondly, we were never pressured into going to a presentation. It was mentioned to us but we were never given a hard sell or even a soft sell. The resort was beautiful. We had a lovely view of the ocean and our rooms were very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and always willing to assist us with our concerns. We did many of the activities because of weather issues. Maya and Jennifer were two of the staff members that were very friendly and made staying at HTR very fun. The food was good and we ate way too much! Porto Bello, the Italian restaurant was our favorite. I loved their chocolate dessert. Poolside, we enjoyed their pizza and their chicken kabobs. Drinks were brought out constantly and we certainly enjoyed them. We went kayaking on our own and it was a lot of fun. We also enjoyed the bike tour. I liked having the nature park right there. I was able to see many kinds of birds. We did not swim at the cenotes as the water temperature was a little brisk. The beach was okay. It does get a lot of plants washed up but there was someone out there raking it up every morning. We enjoyed the beds that were set up out there. These are sunning beds so they are not meant to have sheets. (Why would someone think they would have sheets??) We were a party of six adults and we all liked the size and how friendly this resort was. We had a great time at Hacienda Tres Rios!

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Jody G
Reviews.Content: The wait staff at the pool and the maid service was very good. The facilities were nice. The checkin staff and regular concierge staff rude. The wait staff in restaurants were so anxious to please that they removed dishes before we were finished. The food was average if not out-right poor quality. We had two very nice meals in the evening out of the entire week. The couple we vacation with every year said it was the worst buffets ever. We have been going to Mexico for 25 years, and in fact, we were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The rooms were ok but nothing special. A microwave in the room would have been nice. There is a shuttle that runs from the hotel to Playa del Carmen but you are only allowed to use it for one trip to and from. The taxi fare from the hotel to Playa is $20 each way so it made the trips to Playa for evening entertainment expensive as well as to Cancun being expensive to get to and from. When we arrived at the hotel our room was not ready and we were not offered a place to change from traveling clothes to beach clothes so that we could at least wait at the pool. (There really is no beach at this hotel...rocks, seaweed primarily.) The room was supposed to be ready at 3:00 p.m. but we did not get our room until 4:15 p.m. When we got to the rooms, we found that they were not connecting rooms. We had specifically asked for "adjoining rooms". When we asked to be placed in adjoining rooms, we were told that we should have asked for "connecting rooms" and because we only asked for "adjoining", they would not change our rooms even though there were rooms available! They didn't want to be bothered! There apparently was not enough staff to accommodate incoming guests in room preparations. We were not traveling in high season either. The activity people tried to keep people busy and were enjoyable. The Spa receptionist was rude. The prices were higher than normal. We were each entitled to a massage. My husband didn't want his so we were told at checkin that I could use his. When I tried to do so, I was informed I could not nor could I combine the two and pay the difference, which would have netted the Spa an additional $65.00! After much hazzle, I did get the second massage. The massage therapists, Josephina and Leah (not sure if the spellings are correct) were excellent. As with most timeshare presentations, it took twice the time 180 minutes not the 90 you commit to do. PLEASE DO NOT LET THIS RESORT SERVE AS AN EXAMPLE OF WHAT IS AVAILABLE IN MEXICO. We own two other timeshares in Mexico and love them both. We just decided to try somewhere different and we will never come back to this resort or any of its affiliates. I am thankful that we were vacationing with friends which made all the difference as to whether this was going to be just an ok vacation or a better vacation. To say that we were extremely disappointed would be an understatement!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: Debbie G
Reviews.Content: I wishj I would have listened to the reviews that I read because they are ALL true!! When we got there it is off season and slow but no rooms were ready? There is no beach it is NASTY and why in the world they would have beds to look at that mess is beyond me. Not to mention they had no sheets on them. There are 2 pools but one is adult only and the only kids pool was under construction and my little boy was still not allowed to use the other pool. The sales presentation was by far the worst I have been on and I have been on a few and even own a timeshare. Don't go on the off season even if it is free. I went on all inclusive and was still hungry. We only had 1 option for breakfast and 2 resturants at dinner which your options were limited. Room service food was horrible but the delivery boy was nice. Jose was a great waiter at whatever place he was working. None of the drinks are cold even the milk. It didnt make it any better that it rained the whole time and the rainy day activities were boring. I would have to agree with one of the other reviews. This has probably put such a bad taste in my mouth I may never return any part of mexico

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!! Worst service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb V
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say I was supposed to stay at Sunset Fisherman's Resort at my friend's timeshare. However, that resort was being remodeled so my friend and I had no choice but to stay here. The service here was the WORST EVER. I've never been treated so rudely by hotel staff in my life. Our all inclusive plan did not transfer, so we had to pay extra for room service and our choice of restaurants. The bath tub in the room didn't work - there were cracks in the sliding glass doors and windows. The concierges weren't interested in helping you unless you wanted to purchase a timeshare. When you had a question at the front desk, they gave you five different answers. The restaurants were okay - the food and service were hit-or-miss. The beach was HORRIBLE so we went back to Playa del Carmen for swimming and laying out. There was nothing to do when it rained - the only indoor activities consisted of hanging out in the crappy sports bar or spending a fortune at the spa. The timeshare presentation was overly aggressive. I spent a week here and I'm pretty sure I will never come back to any all inclusive resort in Mexico. This resort damaged any positive attitude I might have had about visiting this area!!

Reviews.Title: “Marketing pitch left me with a bad taste in my mouth”
Reviews.Author: Janet C
Reviews.Content: When I heard that Hacienda Tres Rios was a eco-friendly, sustainable resort, I was so sold on the idea that I overlooked many of the bad reviews. In hindsight, I think I would have chosen a different place to stay. To be fair, there were some nice things about the resort - they have handmade sopes and quesadillas for breakfast, the service and food by the pool is amazing (pizzas in a wood burning oven, steak sandwiches), the cenotes on site are beautiful, rooms are ok. However, if you are going to do the presentation as part of the marking package, I would just say either pay the extra to not have to do it or just find a different resort. Although they initially told us it would be a 90 minute presentation and you can leave anytime after that, it was actually a three hour presentation and they DO NOT allow you to leave after 90 minutes. Regardless of whether we chose to buy it or not, we were still guests and I expected to be treated as such. They were very rude, made snarky comments about how we don't "have any money" and then stormed off and slammed the door in our face when we told them we didn't want to buy. The food at the resort is not great, room service food is worse. If you're going to see the beautiful turquoise waters, this is not the hotel to see them from. Also the location of the hotel is about 15 min from Playa Del Carmen which equals a $20 cab ride each way that can really add up if you want to get away from the terrible food. We went on a free kayak tour of the cenotes that was supposed to be for an hour, it lasted about 30 minutes. I would never come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil setting in modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam S
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda offers great food, excellent service, and a beautiful atmosphere. We just got back to Toronto Canada after visiting Hacienda, and can honestly say it was a great experience. Executive Chef and beverage manager Oscar Orbe runs a tight ship on this resort. We had the pleasure of visiting the kitchen and found it super clean. The true Mexican flavor is noted with the friendly staff in all areas, from maintenance and housekeeping to its service in the restaurants. I would definitely go back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place!!”
Reviews.Author: jerry l
Reviews.Content: the place it self is a some we love it!! the entire stuff is very friendly and they treat you like king. the food is great but not to bad only because I love sea food and they do not have much choice of it. Jose the waitress and Claudia the waitress captain are the best!! but, everyone in general are explendit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: AeliandSonia
Reviews.Content: It has been nearly 3 months since our wedding, and we are still talking about what a beautiful and perfect experience Allibe and the other staff at Hacienda Tres Rios prepared for us. In addition to having everything picture perfect (from the presentation of food to the lit-up-dance-floor), the ambiance was a perfect mixture of laid back and warm, welcoming and luxurious. My partner and I come from two different backgrounds: Mexican and Jewish, and when we set out to identify a venue for our wedding we had the additional need of identifying a venue that could accommodate a kosher wedding for about 65 people or so. Though there seemed to be smaller venues that could accommodate a smaller number of people, Hacienda Tres Rios turned out to be the most viable, affordable, and accommodating option. We felt like we hit the lotto after doing a site visit and seeing the property (which is impressive in and of itself with lots of activity options including laying on a semi-secluded beach) and when we met the Chef. Chef Oscar is a real gem. He came with the experience of having worked at an exclusive hotel in Los Angeles that prepares a weekly kosher brunch, and unlike many in this region of Mexico, he already knew the intricacies of kashrut. He even had kosher wine on site for the wedding that we set aside far in advance of the wedding day! At destination weddings (and at weddings in general) the food can often be a toss-up in terms of quality, particularly for kosher events. We were relieved and beyond ecstatic with the feedback from our guests (many of whom were NYC foodies) who said that it was the best meal they had ever had at a wedding -- any wedding, kosher or not. Chef Oscar worked with us to prepare a menu that stayed true to the cuisine of the region while adhering to the strictest standards of kashrut. Allibe, our thoughtful and sweet wedding coordinator from Hacienda Tres Rios, guided us through all aspects of planning our kosher destination wedding, including guidance through the process of choosing credible and affordable local vendors to get all of the details right for the day of our wedding. We had a beautiful chupa complete with music selections of our choosing, wonderful flowers and centerpieces, a traditional Mexican Trio, and a phenomenal photography crew with Rodrigo del Rio Lozano. Allibe was there for every moment of our wedding (including the events before and after our wedding day), making sure that every detail was perfect -- she is truly a consummate professional. Planning a wedding, let alone a destination wedding, can be a challenging, stressful, and difficult undertaking; thanks to Allibe, Luis, and the staff at Hacienda Tres Rios, our planning process was as stress-free as possible, and our wedding was more than we (and our guests) could have possibly hoped for. We are so grateful for the lifetime of wonderful memories we have, in large part thanks to their efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment. I'm sorry I chose this place.”
Reviews.Author: Diana F
Reviews.Content: All the small details that make a vacation experience enjoyable were not there. I did not get a great price for the stay here. I payed for a luxury resort and got a less than average experience. The welcome started having to wear those horrible cheap plastic bracelets all the time (the web page says it's an all inclusive resort, so why make us wear this?). Followed by a terrible buffet lunch at the "Alebrijes" restaurant. The variety and quality of the food was terrible. Not to mention that half of the options were out. The quality of the drinks was no better either. We tried to forget this by going to the pool and beach area. The water in the outside jacuzzis was colder than the pool. The beach is not very nice and the covers of the sofas in this area had already been removed so we could not sit there. When we came back to the room, the shower was terrible, the water hit so hard I could not give my baby a bath. Then the safe box failed and had to be broken to remove our stuff. I requested a change of room and got a new one without the jacuzzi I had payed for. In general the food and drinks were average, nothing great. The service from the waiters and in the pool was very good though. It was very rude how they asked me to check out at 11:00 am the day we were leaving and threatening with extra charges for any delays. To be honest, I was very relieved to leave and never plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - No where near a 5* - 3* at best !”
Reviews.Author: lynnf8709
Reviews.Content: Anniversary wasn't acknowledged as requested. Buffet restaurant was just ok - nothing to make you say wow, as a matter of fact doesn't seem they try to do anything special to give it a wow factor. Very disappoint in the facilities. Just that I expected so much better since it was suppose to be a 5*. However the price was ok, since it was based on a "timeshare presentation". I am a beach person and this was not a nice beach. Steak/Lobster dinner we were looking forward to was cancelled for rain. Free massage was not free. Italian restaurant was ok. The best thing about this place is the employees that work there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Moment!”
Reviews.Author: tiff0204
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tres Rios from September 11th - 18th for our honeymoon. I can't say enough good things about this resort! From the moment we got out of the shuttle we were greeted with warm smiles, beautiful weather and an incredible resort. My husband and I are very much into the green aspect of Tres Rios, we were beyond impressed with the extent that this resort has made to not have a negative impact on the environment. There's really nothing bad I can say about the grounds. No, the beach isn't what you see when you open up a tourism booklet for Mexico. That's not to say that the beach is bad though! More like the lakes that we are used to from back home. What the beach lacks, the rest of the resort makes up in spades. There is so much to do there that is included in the all inclusive package that you almost don't need to leave the grounds for any reason! We kayaked through mangroves, played beach volleyball with the staff, swam in the many pools and was always given exceptional service whatever we did. I highly recommend doing the 7 course Chef's Special if you have the extra money for it. Our waiter Martin was amazing and even though I dislike seafood they made a separate menu for me so I could still enjoy my courses. They even topped it off with a cake at the end of it wishing us a happy honeymoon. :) The breakfast buffet was an interesting blend of regular choices alongside traditional mexican fare. Our one waiter Eidgh (I'm sure I'm spelling that wrong, I'm so sorry!!!) was exceptional and made our meals so enjoyable. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a studio off the side and couldn't get over the luxury of the rooms. From the enormous bathroom (almost as large as our living room back home!) to the king sized bed, jacuzzi and huge balcony with a view of the water was the best thing to look at when waking up. All the food was phenomenal, we especially liked Kotori (Asian restaurant) and PortoBello (Italian restaurant). If you get the chance, I highly recommend going here. It was the perfect blend for us and I'm counting down the minutes until we can come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks polish”
Reviews.Author: MileyMooo
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our 2 year old son stayed at this hotel in June of 2011 for 4 nights/ 5 days. Overall, this was a disappointing experience, although not all together unpleasant. First, the reason we chose the resort was because of our interest in nature and its location on eco preserve. However, the staff did all possible to discourage us from exploring the nature park (by threatening with wild animals). After we took a couple of cenote tours (which were wonderful), I figured out how to get around on my own, but by that time it was almost our day to leave. Similarly with the beach. Not only is the beach not of your typical turquoise color (which is understandable - it is an eco park after all), but they forbid swimming on the beach (stating waves or something else). You are allowed to swim where the river meets the ocean, but the water is much colder there and it is very shallow, so it would not be real swimming. It is a very unique beach , though, because you can snorkel around mangroves there and see some birds and fish. The pool is nice, but not glamorous. And, there is no bathrooms close to the beach or the pool nearest to the beach. So, try drinking a few margaritas, and then going for the bathroom. Also, clean towels are only located in one place, away from the beach and the family pool. The food is nice in terms that although it was all inclusive and unlimited, it was a la carte, so you did not tend to over eat as much. Our favorites were the grill, the pizza, and the Mexican. Asian - not so much. They definitely take spanish speaking people out of turn if you are not looking, so pay attention. The drinks were definitely diluted, but still enjoyable. The amenities: we took advantage of the nature tours. Our package included a free 30 minute massage per person. However, there was still a $12 tax. Not really a lot of money, but not free either. The spa was very nice. The gift shop is super overpriced. The staff: Mostly nice and helpful, but hopeful for a tip. A few dollars goes a long away. especially at the pool. The whole thing with concierge and time shares is really out of control. They would do so much better trying to impress us with the service and the amenities, instead of a sales pitch. Do they think Americans are stupid? When we arrived at the hotel after a 2.5 hour flight, and 45 minute drive, they wanted to give us a 30 minute presentation on the hotel in broken English. Really? With a two year old running around like a maniac? May be you should let us eat lunch first. They try to sell you a time share by inviting you to a "special" breakfast and promising you freebies, such as 1 hour massage, lobster dinner, free transportation to town, etc. We did not agree to it. There is a very poor communication of the hotel events: they need a communication board in the lobby. Otherwise, you never know what is about to happen. The clients were also very interesting. There were some people who owned a timeshare, some mexicans on conference or business trips, some mexican families with their children on vacation, and a lot of people from US who paid super low rates in exchange for agreeing to attend a timeshare presentation, but who had no recollection of signing up for anything like that. The room was nice, and fairly comfortable. We had an "ocean view", but the water was very far, so I would not recommend paying extra. We basically just had a glimpse of water. The furniture in community spaces was worn out and not comfortable. Hard to imagine that this is a new hotel. Overall, this was a unique experience because of the opportunity to visit cenotes, but, otherwise, I would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: MariaS311
Reviews.Content: This was our second time visiting this hotel and we all had a very good time there. It was great to see many old friends (from two years ago) and also to make new friends. Thank you to all the wonderful staff, it was like visiting family. Noe, Kids Club - Silvia - Maya - You're great!!! Chef Oscar, thank you very, very much!! Raquel - Oh soooo good!!! Claudia from Hacienda Grill!!! Yeah!! Samuel!!!! All the restaurants hosts, Hector, Gina, Jose Luis C., Juanito, JUSTINO!!!, Victor Manuel, Miguel, Nicolas, Jaime, Manuel, Gregorio, Martin, David - Thanks for the bike ride, the driver to Fisherman's - I forgot his name, Osiris, the Band and the waiters from the Sports Bar, Mauricio and all the staff at the beach, beautiful sailing experience. Something to improve would be the service from the pool waiters, I was never offered anything!!! They were more focused in serving groups. I only got my drink when I went to the pool bar, mmmmh Silverio I think was the bartender, delicious "Mojitos".

Reviews.Title: “modern luxury with plenty to do, right on the property...”
Reviews.Author: darlinglisa
Reviews.Content: My sisters went with teenage boys and our mother to this lovely resort and we had a great time! The dinners were wonderful and the staff was very friendly.It is a pretty big resort, so there is plenty to do every day.The ocean was unswimable while we were there, due to a mangrove sewage problem,but right next to it was a fresh flowing river out to the ocean, that was fun. I hear they are going to fix that problem in the future, but anyways ,the pools are great too and they serve you food and drinks there as well! This was my first time doing all-inclusive and it was pretty nice eating and drinking as much as you please every day!Every night there was some live shows with singing or dancing, and the sports bar had karoake and a pool table. Our room was very large with a separate living room/dining area and the bathroom was huge with a walk in shower.Marble floors through out and a large balcony made it very luxurious and the bedding was high quality! The area has wonderful eco parks to visit like Xcaret and the Tulum ruins are fantastic.You can get a taxi ride into the town of Playa del carmen for shopping,starbucks,night clubs and more! Next year I am going back to the sister hotel ,Sunset Fishermen with my husband and kids and grandkids.I like a smaller resort right on the beach and I can swim in the ocean or walk right into town.I was surprised how much I liked this part of Mexico,Playa del Carmen, which is about 30 miles from Cancun.If you like a jungle ambience and blue-green waters, this is a great part of Mexico to visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Resort --- Will not return, not even for FREE!”
Reviews.Author: Rose M
Reviews.Content: this has to be the worst place that I have stayed, ever. I arrived with my family August 30th and stayed until September 6th. Upon checking in we were greeted by Marvin who is part of the concierge. All smiles at first. He explained all the "activities" at the resort and told us about all the restaurants on site and gave us the schedule. He then scheduled out Hacienda Tres Rios presentation where we would be informed of all our timeshare benefits. We already own through RCI so I wasn't interested in going but he insisted so we scheduled it. THE ONLY GOO THING ABOUT THIS PLACE IS THE STAFF. Jesus, the bar tender in the sports bar was GREAT and super funny! The pool staff is Amazing, especially Marvilla and Silverio. Marvin told us that there was transportation to their sister hotel Fishermans through out the day but everytime we asked for it, they would say it was booked. When we would pay for our own cab to get there, we were the only ones there. So, who booked the transportation? Also, we paid for the MEXICAN FIESTA on Thursday night and the pick up time was at 5:30pm in the lobby. We waited until 5:50 until my brother decided to ask where the transportation was and we were told the Mexican Fiesta was cancelled. They were very unapologetic for not letting us know in advance and then they said they could not reimburse us but we could get our money applied towards spa services. When we ate at the Mexican restaurant, the food made my brother and husband sick. We cancelled our timeshare presentation because we got food poisoning and Marvin threw a fit. I told him we would reschedule for monday. We still were feeling ill so I offered to come alone to the presentation and Marvin quickly gave me attitude. He said my husband NEEDED to be there and that I could not come alone. I told him that I was going to get a massage and then we can discuss rescheduling and he said" you can forget about the spa services, if you don't go to the presentation." I thought my spa services were for the Mexican FIesta? Well he made it clear to the spa that my services were not to be comped. Also, when I requested transportation to fishermans he told me that they were booked and then hung up on me. I can not believe that they have an individual such as this working with the guests. He was great and all smiles until we cancelled the timeshare presentation and then made our stay a living hell. I wanted to leave early. Not to mention the "beach" is smelly and dark and dirty. Which is why we went to fishermans everyday. Lastly, we made our reservation to stay in the Sunset Lagoon but they told us 3 days before we left that we were going to be moved to Tres Rios. Usually remodeling is scheduled months in advance and not last minute. I am upset that they told us this info only 3 days before we left and that they have no concept of what customer service is. I will never stay here again and I will make it my job to tell everyone NOT to stay at this resort. All that aside, the weight staff was amazing and the website lies, the tips to the waiters are not included with your stay. WHATEVER YOU DO----DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful large suites”
Reviews.Author: stephne
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom and two bedroom units are quite spacious and most have ocean front views. Food in the dining rooms is excellent and served beautifully. Room service was very quick. Two outdoor pools and hot tubs provide an adults only area as well as a family area. There appears to be some communication issues and they were working hard to correct things. Our roof top jacuzzi was not in working order and was never fixed during the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kurtis P
Reviews.Content: I own a share with the Fisherman, but because it was under construction during our trip we got moved to the Tres Rios. The staff here was excellent. Everyone from the guest relations staff to the servers were helpful and super friendly. I prefer the location of the fisherman but I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good closed off all-inclusive resort. I would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aleraSoCal
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes based on all the reviews. The resort has a good potential, but there are a few key things that negate the positives. Some of the points below could have resulted from really low occupancy, as the resort seemed about 70% empty. Here is a recap: Positives: - Newer resort, facilities and rooms look fresh - Good layout with lots of space, large beach - Large pools, enough space for everyone; no need to reserve chairs or palapas (this could be different if the resort were full) - Ecopark and rivers provide some fun activities - Premium drinks - Pizza parlor is a nice option for lunch, pizzas are basic but made well - Staff are friendly enough, seem to be trying but often lack experience / polish that exists at other resorts. Negatives: - Really poor choice of food - very basic breakfast and lunch (far worse than options at similarly priced all-inclusive resorts) - For dinner - only 1-2 restaurants are open, dining options are very basic - One kitchen serves all restaurants and it shows; food at the asian restaurant was very poor - The staff often do not know what restaurants / activities are open; would give contradicting or incorrect information Recommendations: The resort is built well and could really compete with the premium resorts in the area. The owners should "steal" experienced management from well-run resorts (Secrets, Excellence, etc) to make things run better, improve food options (variety and quality), improve service, even if it means charging more. They should also build a bar close to the beach and change the "sports" bar. The developers have a 10 year plan to build 1000 rooms in the space to the north, but unless they improve the food I doubt they will have many returned guests.

Reviews.Title: “We don't want to buy in!”
Reviews.Author: funstream
Reviews.Content: We own at Fisherman's Village, part of the Sunset group, and everytime we go for our week, when they can fit us in, we have to go to a presentation at Tres Rios where they force you to listen to a bunch of bull about the property for five hours. I don't understand why they can't just except the fact that we are proud to own at Fisherman's and that's where we wan't to stay for the rest of our 100 year contract. I'm sure Tres Rios is great for some folks but, not us. The property is beautiful but we are happy with what we have. We were informed that they decided the week before we wen't that they were closing Fisherman's the week after we left which is this week so they changed the meal plan and we were not told when we bought the plan. They have a great beffet that we love but, not this time, it was all ala cart. We would not have bought the plan if we would have know. n this. We saved two of the meals for the last day and all they had was cheese bugers and nachos, not rite.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort Would go Back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSecrets78
Reviews.Content: As a travel Host for a travel club I have been to this resort twice. I believe this was the first GREEN resort in Mexico and they have some informative free tours for those who are interested in the environment. This is a resort you never have to leave to enjoy; great pools, has 3 natural rivers on the property, beautiful beach with a huge snorkeling area, has 10 cenotes on the property, they provide snorkel gear and have kayaks for exploring the rivers. The food is fantastic. It's All Inclusive and besides the main buffet has many specialty restaurants, my favorite being their Asian... one of the best curries I've had. The staff is warm and helpful. It's such a large property with their mangroves... they have bikes you can ride to explore and a special shamen experience but he is only there twice a week so don't miss that. Anyway there is nothing in walking distance, so for more nightlife you need to take a 20-30 min taxi ride into Cancun. I'm not big on clubs so for me the more intimate, romantic setting is nice.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET AND LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: lknight26
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful! Very eco friendly, staff was awesome, food was excellent, drinks were all premium, and the rooms were very clean and moderned. We hated to leave. This was a surprise trip for my husband, and he will never forget the wonderful time we had. The resort is very clean, and has a nice sports bar and french cafe that we stopped into after dinner every night. The dining staff is the BEST. They remember you, and anticipate your needs by day two. We REALLY enjoyed our stay here. If you're looking for a party atmosphere, then this isn't the place for you. But if you want relaxation, sun, sand, and luxury then this resort fits the bill. Just wish they had a swim-up bar! Thanks H3R, you guys rock!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Mexico yet!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: This resort was the best! Im looking forward to going back as soon as possible. I loved the animals we saw at the resort, The badger type creatures were cute.We had read the reviews and the beach problem( lots of brown vegetation in the water) was not a deal breaker, we swam and snorkled in the lagoon instead and used the beautiful beaches. The food was the best ever-haute cuisine! Every meal was fantastic and the room service spoiled us! Everyone worked so hard so we tipped at every meal. They deserved it! They were very attentive and made every meal something to remember. This resort is a green resort and they work hard at it-impressive! Reading the reviews were helpful so we knew to ask for blow dryer when we arrived. Our only suggestions for improvement are to provide hair conditioner ( or at least stock it in the store) and provide a free shuttle for nontime share visitors so you can go into Playa Del Carmen. The taxi was 40$ round trip and Ive always stayed at resorts on the Mayan Reviera which had free shuttles to Playa. Its worth the trip, the shopping is great! Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “OK but we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: SimonH29
Reviews.Content: Just finished a week at HTR and I'm affraid we won't be back. Although the service was excelent it was at times patchy. The food during the evening was very poor esp. the buffet which on occasions was laughable. Def. not much to do at this resort and the beach is poor. Our room had a slight musty smell at the start of our stay and damp patches were very much evedent in the room when we departed. Remember to take your bug spray...mozzies are a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “The place is great and diversified with great amenities and staff thankyou Helen our concierge!”
Reviews.Author: leelee55
Reviews.Content: The food is great. Try the spa the massage was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: DrSchmincke
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed as part of a group attending the wedding of our friends on the resort beach at sunset. It was one of the most beautiful weddings I have ever attended. Our room, which had a jacuzzi on the balcony, was super and plenty of room for my husband, our teenager, and me. The meals at the restaurants were beautifully prepared, fresh ingredients, tasty. The staff were friendly and attentive but not intrusive. The pool was beautiful and we enjoyed eating lunch poolside. The beds on the beach were stellar. We enjoyed walking around the property, kayaking and swimming in the cenote. We all had an excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous pool and grounds. Great service and food. However.....”
Reviews.Author: pschwin
Reviews.Content: This place has everything you could want in a great family vacation spot with a few exceptions. If you're looking for crystal blue waters and a great beach, this ain't the place. If you want a lot of night life at the resort, like shows, nightclub, comedy, etc., this ain't the place for that either. However, the pools and restaurants make up for everything that is lacking otherwise. The buffet is good, especially for breakfast. The lobster (you must tell them you want lobster by 2:00 the same day) is fabulous. The Asian restaurant is top notch, as is the Italian and Mexican. The outside Grille, poolside, serves everything from Sea Bass to Hamburgers all day long. There's a brick oven pizzeria that you can dine at or order poolside. Great calzones too! Men must wear slacks in the Asian and Italian Restaurants and no kids allowed in the Italian. The Wine list is adequate, yet falls short of top notch. There is a Coffee Shop just off the lobby that serves wonderful capucinno and expresso as well as an outstanding array of desserts, pastries and chocolates. The gift shop is nice, but overpriced. The Sports Bar is sub par, but no real activities there during the evening, other than an occasional karaoke night. No night life worth mentioning. One night was a Beach Fiesta which was nice with a live band and the welcome party offered a good Mariacchi Band as well. The Kids Club is great for kiddos 4-12 and they can be entertained all day from 10a.m. til 6p.m. with games, crafts and pool and beach activities. The rooms are nice and updated, especially the 2 bedroom suites which we enjoyed and highly recommend if more than 3 in your party. The internet wireless connection is hit and miss, especially poolside, but even as I write this in the room it sometimes loses connectivity. Don't bother bringing your Region 1 DVDs as they probably won't work in the in room dvd players. Expect to walk quite a bit from your room to the lobby and/or pool area but it's not too bad. Most rooms do not have much of an ocean view, but the grounds and pool offer more than an adequate view. You will not be close to anything and unless you rent a car you must take at least a $20 taxi ride to any place. We did not rent a car and unless you plan on doing a lot of site seeing outside arranged excursions which provide transportation), you probably wont miss having one. Back to the pools: There is an adult only section as well as acres of other pools for either quite time or volleyball. The poolside lacks any sort of music and one guy in our party had a boom box which I would suggest bringing. Poolside bar service was great. All in all, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker0824
Reviews.Content: I’ve traveled for pleasure and work throughout the United States, Europe, Asia, South America and the Caribbean. Tres Rios was truly one of the best times, I have ever had! On vacation!! The service is beyond exceptional and the attention to detail is over the top. The resort is beautifully decorated and EXTREMLY CLEAN. Everyone that works at the resort is very nice and truly polite. This resort is great for singles, families and couples. They have perfected the resort to have activities and areas for every walk of life. The food is truly 5 star. I will be back ever year at least 2 x a year. AWESOME VALUE and you will be treated like royalty. What a miraculous, experience and time!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: Will4013
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. The staff is like family. Samuel was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back!!”
Reviews.Author: BoiseStateFan46
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at Tres Rios. Just can't understand some of the negative reviews related to this resort. Yes, we were prepared for the poor ocean/beach quality. But people did swim in it. (It's actually pulp from Mangroves. Feels like mush when you walk in it.) It doesn't smell, as some reviews state. Plus there is a wonderfully refreshing area to swim in at the North end of the resort. Plenty big enough for everyone. And with the two wonderful pools on the resort, who could ask for more? The resort grounds are so clean and beautifully well-manicured. The service was impeccable. Everyone was so friendly. Always an “hola” or “Buenos dias”. We didn’t want for anything. The pillow menu was great. The food at all of the restaurants was fabulous…so many choices that were terrific…it was hard to make decisions on what to order. Our favorite was the Italian restaurant. We ordered late night room service several times. Loved the cheesecake. The nachos from the Hacienda Grill were so yummy. Great to eat on the Beach beds while enjoying the ocean view and breeze. Do check out the margharita pizza from the Il Forno grill. We do want to recognize the BEST beach waiter: Jose Luis. That man works so hard…always running! He remembered our drinks preferences from one day to the next. Also asked about the others in our party if they weren’t with us. Jose Luis is AWESOME. We would move to the other side of the beach, if we weren’t in Jose Luis’s service area…he’s that good. Bali is a good second. Very friendly and talkative. We took several of the tours. The Senses Tour is relaxing and enjoyable. A must-do is the Jaguar Tour. Mo and Andres were our tour guides for that tour. They are terrific…very fun! Seem to love their job. Mo also was one of our tour guides for our Kayak Tour, as was David. Can’t say enough good things about these three men. They always had a friendly, warm thing to say when we would run into them around the resort. Zena took us on our Bicycle Tour. It was warm, keep in mind it’s the rainy season and very humid. But she made the tour fun and very informative. Mauricio (Mauw) (sp?) gave us our ride on the catamaran. He definitely loves his job. Thanks for allowing us to jump off and swim around out in the ocean, awhile. Frequently saw Chef Oscar out and about making sure everything was running smoothly. We attended several of the resort activities…cocktail lessons, sushi lessons etc. They were all fun…and tasty. But our favorite was the Tequila Tastings. WOW! We learned so much about different tequilas and how to properly judge them. Chef Oscar taught that class and was such an entertainer. What fun we had! You MUST do the Tequila Tasting! The only negative thing I can say is that we wish we had more time at the resort. Would have loved to spend more time walking around the park…and swimming in the cenotes. We will definitely do that next time we go. We are already planning our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great, High Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: DanelskiBR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios in June with my entire family. There were 29 of us, ranging in age from 3-80. We had a wonderful time! The staff at this resort are excellent. The grounds are very clean. The rooms were nice, and were cleaned thoroughly every day. I left my watch out on the table one morning while I went to the pool. When I returned to my freshly cleaned room, instead of finding my watch stolen, It was placed on top of a note asking me to please secure my valuables in the complimentary safe. I have read reviews of people at other resorts getting their valuables stolen. SO this was a nice surprise. The pools are great. We spent a lot of time lounging at the pool and relaxing. The workers are always stopping by to see if you need anything. We ordered dozens of drinks at a time and always got we ordered in a timely manner. You can even have them bring you food. Whatever you want, sometimes even if its not on the menu. The food was amazing. There are a few high end restaurants, a buffet, a pizza hut, and an outdoor grill. Make sure to bring some nice clothes, as there is a dress code for the nicer restaurants. I was always extremely satisfied with what I ordered every single time. The only real downside was the ocean. The beach was not very nice. Instead of sand under the water it was a sort of mucky clay. We only went in the ocean once when I was there. BUT...there is a nice area where the river meets the ocean. You can hop in here to cool off, or get in a kayak and paddle to one of the many cenotes on site. I wish they had a swim-up bar as well. But the staff will serve you drinks while you are in the pool, so I suppose it wasnt really necessary. Overall, this is a nice, small, quiet resort. There is no waiting in lines to eat, or waking up early to save a spot by the pool or ocean. That has been a VERY annoying issue at other resorts I have stayed at in Riviera Maya. I would recommend this resort for family's or anyone that wants to relax and be pampered. ADVICE: Although tips are included in the all inclusive package, its always nice to reward the workers with a few dollars when they are going above and beyond. They will remember your tips and give you special attention for the rest of your stay. I think I gave a total of around $80 in tips throughout the week and it was well worth the extra attention.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Food”
Reviews.Author: 4Travelling
Reviews.Content: I went with the "all inclusive" and enjoyed the food and drinks... the service was outstanding (IMO). When I showed up at the restaurant, the waiter knew what I liked to drink and he would bring it... He knew I loved chocolate and he would always have some unbelievable dessert... I had never been pampered this much. I also liked the internet cafe... I liked my latte and dessert while I was reading my emails. The hotel still is lacking some luster... it still looks a little plain... the pool is nice and the rivers are fun to navigate through but something is missing for me... not sure what. The beach in that area is not the best but there is a little piece where the river meets the ocean that is nice. The entrance to the hotel is like a jungle... very eco-friendly... but it reminds me of mosquitoes... didn't get too many bites but it was February... a little nippy. The rooms are pretty big and I liked having a balcony with a jacuzzi... facing the ocean... I think it's going to be a great place but it needs more time to marinate!

Reviews.Title: “The best time of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: ukliman
Reviews.Content: "This is the best resort I´been in my life, the best staff, the best people and the best restaurants ever, this is the most spectacular vacation experience in my life"

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS RESORT, REALLY ENJOYED OUR STAY AND SOMETHING TO DO FOR EVERYONE!”
Reviews.Author: ABLAYDON
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios resort for a week. What impressed us most was the warm feeling we received during our stay. I loved the fact that this place is huge with something to do for everyone. If you like to mix with other people....perfect!, if you like your own space to do our own thing then perfect as well. I recommend this place if you are looking to relax or if you like to keep busy with outdoor activities.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Klu143
Reviews.Content: PROS: The Hacienda Tres Rios is the ideal place to stay if you are looking for Luxury in a family-friendly atmosphere. this hotel also very safe (safety is a big thing there); no need to worry. The rooms are very spacious and very updated. The staff are INCREDIBLE. You cannot beat the service and care you get from them. Everything great you can think of at a luxury resort is here... The pool is big and spacious. You must check out the Spa. If you go into town "bargain, bargain, bargain" but don't rob the vendors. pay what you think its worth. CONS: There isn't much of a beach. It is covered in sea moss. Workings are manually removing dirty sand each day. There's a small area where the rivera meets the beach that is swimmable and clean but the tides are strong. Lots of flies around the outside eating areas. I guess because of all the fruits there. Not much to do after 10pm on the hotel. The sports bar is open but there's only 1 pool table and nothing else to do. PS. if you are not staying all-inclusive then you better bring your bank with you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT!!!”
Reviews.Author: rbdimples
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Tres Rios!!!! The place is clean. The food is great. The service is excellent!! We will be back!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever.....”
Reviews.Author: mamascadd
Reviews.Content: Two employees of HTR really stood out in our opinion, Nallely and Nickolos(waiter). Nallely ALWAYS had a smile on her face and really acted a liason for us when we had questions. She was extremely helpful and consientous of us. She would remember us from day to day and asked us how our adventure was the day after. Nickolos was just a joy!! He truly knows how to treat people, young and old! He was entertaining besides being an excellent waiter! Soo many others I'd like to recognize but can't remember names! Only one grumpy bartender, but in his defense it was hot and very busy in that outdoor area! Food was excellent..accomodations amazing and the pix on-line are exactly how it looks! I recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Incomplete Resort Poorly Put Together”
Reviews.Author: smager
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that this resort receives good reviews. It seems to me that the owners ran out of money when developing this hotel or did not spend enough time looking at their competition. It is lacking a decent swimming pool and nice restaurants. There is only one decent Italian restaurant, a buffet, Chinese and a small outdoor grill. I was not impressed with the food at all except for the 7 course meal we had comped from all of our complaints. I have to say that Chef Oscar is amazing and Jose Luis is a real stand up guy. When we arrived we were told that we had a Jacuzzi room, but we ended up with a crappy studio. Once I told Jose Luis about the problem he actually made it right and upgraded us to a nice one bedroom. The best part about this resort is the quality of their rooms, but other than that I was very disappointed in the place. It lacked character and activities. When you read about the 300+ acres and the cenotes it seems like it has this wonderful jungle that you can explore and swim in the cenotes. Not at all, there are 300+ acres of unusable land. The small cenotes takes about 20 minutes to swim through and you will have about 50 mosquito bites by the time you get to the end. Other than that there is nothing to do in this resort. There are only two small pools with a very small bar that is overcrowded so it takes way too long to even get a drink. No swim-up bar like most resorts in that area and you can only see the water from one of the pools. The hotel is located about 1/2 mile back from the beach so there are NO ocean front rooms and the beach is unusable. The spa is extremely small and does not offer much, especially for the price. After Tres Rios, I spent a 2nd week at El Dorado Royal and this was an amazing resort. You have to stay in an ocean front Casita!! They have a private swimming pool and Jacuzzi, a butler, amazing staff and the grounds are stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: haleyinlr
Reviews.Content: I took my elderly mother in a wheelchair, and I couldn't ask for nicer service and attention to my mother's needs. The staff went out of their way to accommodate her. We loved the food in the Italian and Asian Restaurants, and the service was great. Nicolas and Armando were the best waiters. So personable and nice. Juan Carlos was the head of Food Services during the evenings, and he was very pleasant and accommodating as well. The service around the pools was great also. I've never had a waiter constantly coming by asking me if I want a drink, even when I don't try to get their attention. It was great. Very clean rooms, and housekeeping comes around your room in the evening making sure you they get you plenty of toiletries, towels, and washcloths. All you have to do it call room service, and they will bring whatever you need, even if it's stocking up your mini-bar (refrigerator). I wasn't too pleased with the food in the buffet, but the other restaurants were fine. The buffet was good if you didn't want to wait. I was very pleased one morning when they had a bottle of champagne and orange juice to make mimosa's though. You could order drinks anytime though. No big deal. You have to ask for premium liquor if you want it. If you don't, you'll get the house stock of liquors. OMG, the beds were so comfortable. Probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in while away from home. I would go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: JennieandBill
Reviews.Content: In June 2011 we stayed for the second time at Hacienda Tres Rios. Our first stay in May 2010 was thoroughly enjoyable but this stay was even better. We would unhesitantly recommend this resort for anyone wanting a five crown resort experience. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary with family and close friends. We had a party of fourteen occupying one two bedroom and four studios. Our experience exceeded our expectations. Everyone rated the Tres Rios as a 10 or better. The lodging facilities were the same quality as on our previous experience but the housekeeping seemed more detailed. The rooms and suite were comfortable and provided a private meeting place for everyone to interact. The room service was reliable and the menu exotic and tasty. Having 24 hour room service is a definite plus. Our compliments to Oscar, the head chef, and Sammy, the manager of food services. You are doing a superb job. The menus are varied, complicated, and extensive. Each and every night we had a reserved table waiting for our party of fourteen. We usually had their suggested menu and every meal was delicious. We appreciated not having to split up our party. We were welcomed and made to feel special. Our servers were attentive, hospitable, reliable, and conscientious. Trinidad, Gregorio, and Claudia are a superb wait staff. Twice we had Mayan Coffee made by Justine. It was quite a treat. On our final night we had a special dinner by the river made by Becky. It was a memorable farewell. We appreciated Oscar and Sammy regularly checking in with us. The food was fabulous. Further kudos go to Jose Luis - Customer Service, Yadira - Head Concierge, Paula Talavera - Member Service Manager, and Juan - Tours. They did everything to make our stay enjoyable and satisfying. Finally, our compliments go to German Fayad, Director of Operations. It was refreshing to see the director constantly supervising the staff and facilities. It communicated the impression that management took pride in Tres Rios, and were always striving to make improvements. This was evident when we suggested to German Fayed that there should be a dedicated phone line for guests who had medical emergencies. Within 24 hours, he communicated with us that they were already working on establishing a dedicated medical emergency line directly to the on site infirmary. It was reassuring to learn that there are on site medical facilities. If you want a unique experience, we suggest that you book a yacht and go to Isla Mujeres. The water was an exquisite array of colors. We went out on the yacht, The Dreamer, to renew our vows. The crew was hospitable and everyone said that the trip on the yacht was the highlight of the week. In conclusion, if you want an upscale vacation experience in the Mayan Riviera, seriously consider Hacienda Tres Rios.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: eliz06
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Everyone was very helpful and friendly, especially Nicolas Lopez our server at Restaurant Kotori, and Demo at the Italian restaurant. The hotel in general was very nice and clean, the rooms are spacious. However, the beach and the water was very dirty, we only used the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Julesshee
Reviews.Content: We were very excited by the reviews and the website for the Hacienda Tres Rios but were disappointed by our actual experience there. It is true it is a reasonably made resort but we were expecting a lot more for our money. The biggest disappointment was the beach which was small, had ok sand but had water heavy with baobab debris so was not very nice to get in. No one swam in it. The vast amount of mosquitos also made sitting outside and touring uncomfortable. Unless you like the smell of OFF I would steer clear. No complaints about most of the staff and the accommodation was comfortable. Food was OK - not spectacular as the website suggests. We didn't have a horrible time, we just didn't have the fantastic time we had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “fun at tres rios”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyCodger
Reviews.Content: Had a great time vacationing here. Lots of fun kayaking down river on the grounds and snorkeling. Bike ride was good also. Well secured and gated resort on very nice grounds. Huge pools, one for adults only. Went all-inclusive and treated very well by staff. Did not take any tours outside of grounds but you can get taxis into Playa for shopping and food. Just don't veer off the main walking road at night while shopping. Rooms were huge and great showers and nice balconies to view ocean or pool grounds below. In room Refrig stocked daily and in room food and restaurants on the grounds were good. Only one drawback...needs another restroom in pool area and air condition them! Very well landscaped and maintained grounds. Beach was nice with huge beds to lounge on. You can also walk about half a mile down on beach thru other resorts. Saw a couple of people selling tourist items on other beaches but not allowed on Tres Rios. Noone in water at our beach because of sea weed but you can walk about 100 yards down to other side of rock pier and wade in clear water about 150 yards out. Lots of beach volleyball, water volleyball, and soccer if you so choose. Shaded pool area and relaxing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and resort .....everything We'd wished for and more”
Reviews.Author: wearetravelhappy
Reviews.Content: Just want to give a special thank you to the staff at Hacienda Tres Rios for making this an extraordinary and memorable stay for me and my two teenagers.From the moment we arrived we were swept off our feet by the outstanding service beginning at our late night arrival.Over the course of a week we were priviledged to get to know some of those who served us as many of them took the time to get to know us. There is a positive vibe from all the servers we had and/ or saw in action from the groundskeepers to the travel agent, the servers and waiters, the room service staff and bell hops, pool side waiters, etc..They treated us like we were their very special guests and did it with a smile and the sincere intention to make us happy. We never witnessed anything resembling frustration or aggravation from any of them and to think that they provide this very public service day in and day to a myriad of people yet we were made to feel special. These people work very hard to make this resort all that it is, which is pretty amazing.Kudos to them all!!! We loved the beautiful clean room and the variety of activities from kayaking , sailing, swimming in the rivers and in the cenotes and the nightly activities as well. There is always something to do and the food is as superb as the service . Hacienda exceededed our expectations and since this was our first trip to Mexico there will be more in our future.For the week Hacienda Tres Rios became out home and the staff like a family. We were sad to leave .

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Becassine007
Reviews.Content: A true marble palace ! Spacious rooms with balcony but must insist on asking for a view over the ocean. Service was certainely above average. Just ask and each member of the personnel will do all they can to please their customers. Special mention for southing treatments at the spa. The month of may brings ''muskitoes'' most anoying. You must live the Mayan experience of ''senses'' on site! True meditation on self descovery. The food is abondante, gastrinomic and personnalized. A short trip to Playa Del Carmen is a must. I recommend this sumptuous Hacienda in a truly écological envirement.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing place where the fun never ends and you always feel at home with the hospitable and friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: panicopen
Reviews.Content: the service is one of the best i have ever experienced!the room i stayed in had an amazing view!This resort is on the beach,so you never had to drive anywhere to find the beach.here you have pools,food,spa,internet,EVERYTHING at your fingertips,without having to leave the hotel!the room service was fast and the staff was very friendly!from the moment you enter, you are greeted and treated like family!there is nothing i didnt like about my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this property - totally want to sell you a time share.”
Reviews.Author: candyochoa
Reviews.Content: This property seems unfinished and way too focused on selling memberships in RCI. There were lots of small children (even in the nice restaurants) and sales personnel everywhere. The beach is a total disappointment (water is not clear and lots of seaweed). The restaurants were great ( no reservations needed) and it was great to not have to mess with towel cards. Overall this property is just average - not up to the Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar where we have stayed in the past. There was not a piano bar or any place to go have a drink in a quiet atmosphere. The primary positive was the food/restaurants. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back but”
Reviews.Author: jrenwick
Reviews.Content: Great resort... Service is the best... but do not take the Spa Day Package.. the services provided are below par.. Also be fully aware of what you are signing up for. We had an unpleasant surprise when we checked out.. Could not find our sales person to clarify the cost.. just make sure that you check and double check pricing on trips, dinners and services.. Only rating a 4 for the few problems that we had.. PS ask for Geogregio as your waiter, the very best waiter... Trini as the butler ..great person, Sammy the manager wonderful.. You will have a great time

Reviews.Title: “They can't do enough for you....”
Reviews.Author: GussiesMom
Reviews.Content: We bought "fractional ownership" (we call it "timeshare" - they call it "fractional ownership") last year and went to Tres Rios this year for two weeks. We can't stop telling people how wonderful it was! From the moment we arrived, they did everything for us but eat our meals --- and we definitely wanted to be the ones eating as the food there is nothing short of stupendous! Andreina was our own personal Concierge and she is unbelievably wonderful! Her warmth, efficiency and overall grace and demeanor is fabulous!!!! (Give her a raise, management - she makes you look GOOD!) The room was gorgeous, quiet, and large (we used a "hotel" or studio, since it was just the two of us. We spent all our time at the adult pool....and HOW NICE to have a quiet pool without kids. I like kids but when I go away to recharge, I don't want to hear them screaming. The music at the pool was smooth jazz and it was very quiet - not loud and booming like so many resorts play. Juanita was always waling around the pool, bring foods and drinks. I kept thinking "so THIS is how the "chosen few" live!" We asked for special things that weren't on the menu a couple of times and the staff was not only DELIGHTED to help us, but we got precisely what we wanted. Unbelievable. If we have asked for special treatment or foods in the US, staff would say "we don't have that.!" I don't think this is a resort for late teens/early twenties as there isn't a disco or loud music or abundant loud activities. This is a resort for discerning adults who like pampering (try the spa - it's GREAT!) to be pampered and to quietly recharge. We will be back next year. CANNOT WAIT!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cathymay888
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this resort is fabulous. Every single aspect of the infrastructure of this place is well thought of. Positives: rooms are AMAZING!!! Perfection is the word to describe the rooms. The spa was by far the greatest spa in the world! The cenotes and kayaking were top of the line... it was a great combination wild life and luxury... The people were great. The managers, especially, Martin Mendicta. He totally went out of his way to help us. We lost our camera and he assisted us in every way he can to search for our camera including calling it in his walkie-talkie radio. He greeted us everytime we saw him. He is a manager but yet everytime we saw him, he was helping someone... He gave every person on vacation the best possible service one can give. We commend him for his work ethics. Another person worth mentioning is Carlos Pritondo (spelling unsure) - the manager of the Mexican restaurant. The management of this resort did not invest in soda machines and serves soda from 2L bottles.. usually, it is flat by the time it gets to the table. We asked Carlos if he would give us canned soda. He went out of his way to ensure we got our canned sodas... Everytime we came in to eat, he made sure we had canned sodas. Exceptional service. he treated us like royalty and made our dining experience suberb. The facilities in the resort are top of the line... everything is first class. Negative: 1. The biggest problem I didn't like is the fact that breakfast sucked. If you want omelette, they lady that cooked it flipped the egg with her bare hands - she touched food without any gloves and quite frankly looked unsanitary. Management should at least issue these employees cooking in front of customers gloves. Breakfast was served only buffet style... half the time, the food is cold. The only thing you can get hot is the omelette which takes 10 minutes to get and you get a omelette cooked by a girl who is not wearing gloves. 2. easy fix - Front desk does not have change for $20. At this resort, we like to tip our servers for their hard work and great service - naturally, we like change for bigger bills to allow us to tip properly... today, we cannot get change for $20. We overheard another customer who ended up tipping his cab driver more than he wanted because the front desk does not have change fo $50 dollars. with all the investment they put on the property, i suggest that they put ONE change machine in the lobby 3. soda - they should get soda fountain machines or just serve canned sodas... the soda was flat all the time. these are cheap investments that would satisfy and eliminate a lot of complains.. 4. sales people - be prepared to get sales talked by a time share representative. avoid it at all possible cause. it's a total waste of time. 5. Room service - horrible. very slow and food is ALWAYS cold. suggestion to management - if you expect room service to take at least 30 minutes, usually 1 hour (even for just drinks), put a microwave in the room so we can heat up our food. Room 4021 (june 18 to 25, 2011)

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for a relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: eyedude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios in June 2011, and I will have to say this is one of the nicest resorts we have stayed at in Mexico! It is still pretty new, so the whole resort is in great condition and well-maintained. We were welcomed in the lobby with a fresh fruit drink and a damp washcloth after the drive from the airport. Check in was quick, and our luggage was taken straight to our room. They did want us to see the concierge first to "tell us more about the resort", but from the reviews I knew this was only to set up the timeshare presentation. Luckily, they were going home for the day, so when we did stop by the next day we just declined the things they were offering for us to go to the timeshare presentation, and they really didn't push us any further. Timeshares just aren't for us. The room we were given was very nice and big! We had the mangrove view, which was fine by me and we could see the ocean also. The beds were comfy, there was a flat screen TV, the bathroom area was nice, and there was free wi-fi too! We didn't spend too much time in the room, but it was very comfortable! There is a stocked mini fridge too, which was handy. The pool area is awesome!! Two large free-form pools, and plenty of pool lounges. No getting up at 7 am to "reserve" your chairs!! It never felt crowded at all during our stay, and the pool by the outdoor Hacienda Grill restaurant was more quiet than the one closer to the beach. There was no swim up bar, which was OK by me as drunk people tend to congregate by them in my experience. But the waiters and waitresses who bring drinks to you work very hard and are really awesome! They will also bring food to you from either the Hacienda Grill or the brick oven pizza restaurant nearby!!! The ultimate for relaxation!! The restaurants were very, very good in my opinion. We ate breakfast in either the buffet or the Hacienda Grill, and both were great. The lady in the buffet restaurant making omelets, sopes, etc was fantastic! The food at the buffet was good and the selection was diverse. Hacienda Grill was a nice breakfast spot too, next to the pool. For lunch we ate at either the Hacienda Grill or had a pizza/calzone from the brick oven restaurant. The Mexican specialty restaurant above the lobby also has lunch, buffet style, and I recommend it also! The dinner restaurants were great - the Asian restaurant, the Mexican specialty restaurant and the Italian restaurant. I thought the food, presentation, and service was very good in all of them. It may not be 5-star gourmet, but very good all the same! (And I'm a bit picky about resort food after having one bad experience at another resort.) Not all the restaurants are open every night, so check with the concierge. Guys have to wear long pants and no sandals. They also have two outdoor buffets during the week. We really liked the bakery/ coffee shop off the lobby that was open in the afternoon and evening and served pastries, cookies, etc. It was fun to pop in a grab a few treats! There's not a lot to do in the evening, so if you are expecting a party place you will be disappointed. They had a few shows to see (the "Cirque de Soleil" type show was pretty cool), and there is a sports bar with a pool table and flat screens. They had a casino night one evening also. This really is mainly a family resort, not the get drunk and party every night resort. The beach, as others have said, is OK for hanging out, especially with the beach beds, but the water is not the crystal clear blue of other places. They did have a guy to take you out on the catamaran, which was fun. And the snorkeling in the cenotes on the property is a must do! Overall, this is a great resort in my opinion. Everyone that works there is great, always a smile and a greeting, and always helpful. We took about $140 in ones for tips, I believe that a nice tip goes a long way, and is appreciated because many people think tips are included somehow. Everyone works so hard, and I can't believe they get paid too much, so it is the right thing to do! We will definitely be back soon to Hacienda Tres Rios, I wish I was there right now!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and I hope to go back!”
Reviews.Author: barley03
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 daughters (10 and 14) and I went to HTR for 6 nights in March and we loved it. We had never been to Mexico, but had been to other Caribbean islands, so I didn't know what to expect. We loved Mexico! The HTR was beautiful, the food was excellent and the rivers leading into the ocean were fun. The only big drawback for me was the main beach. The water was disgusting, and no one swims there. The water in the rivers, however, was great. We did one adventure down the river, which was a lot of fun - swimming in the cenotes and snorkling down to the ocean, and we did the senseadventure, which was awesome! We took a taxi to Playa Del Carmen one afternoon and that was a lot of fun. We also took a taxi to Cancun and took the ferry to Isla Mujeres for the day. The water and the beaches there are amazing! When I booked the vacation, I bought the airport transfer for $200 and that was a total rip off! A taxi would have been much cheaper. All in all, we LOVED this vacation and our stay at HTR. My 14 year old has told me many times, "That was the best vacation EVER!"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinekea
Reviews.Content: Great vacation to relax and not to worry about anything. We were greeted by Orlando when we go to the resort and greeted us with a smile and helped us to our room. Leonardo gave us amazing service in our favorite restaurant and gave us amazing service each night. The pool was amazing for relaxing as the beach didn’t have clear water but was nice to have the beds to lay on. Casamiro was the bartender we used at the beach and he seemed to remember us and the drinks we liked so we never had to ask for anything extra. It was such a nice and relaxing vacation as you could do as much as you wanted or as little as you wanted so that is always nice. I travel all inclusive once a year and sadly I have to say I have never been treated so badly by the concierge as Joy and Geraldine went out of their way to be rude to me and weren’t helpful at all. It was very disappointing but glad I didn’t’ have to deal with them very much as they were very unpleasant to deal with. I would recommend this place to anyone and hope they would enjoy it as much as I did. :-) It is a tough week being back to reality :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: tripdiva35
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at Hacienda Tres Rios. The service and cleanliness of the resort was exceptional. Overall, the staff goes above and beyond the call of duty to please their guests. When we first arrived, we were greeted by two friendly gentleman, Miguel and Orlando. Both were extremely pleasant and helpful! Orlando made sure that our room and accommodations were wonderful. As we entered the lobby each day, he greeted us with a welcoming smile and asked how our stay was going. The rooms were beautiful and well kept throughout our stay. The meals were also fantastic! I recommend the Italian restaurant, where Leonardo will greet you and help create a fantastic evening of food and wine. He ensures that all of your needs are met in the restaurant. He may even show you some table magic tricks :). We enjoyed dining with him on several occassions. The Ilforno Pizzeria by the pool makes exceptional calzones and pizza. Casamrio, poolside bartender, makes a great beachcomber and pina colada. He has a great sense of humor and always remembered what we liked. He was a pleasure to chat with each day. Valerino and Oscar were poolside waiters who worked diligently to make sure we always had what we needed. Their smiles and daily banter were great! Veronica, a hostess in the Mexcian restuarant, always greeted us with a smile. You must try the yummy breakfast quesadillas there. I was very impressed with the staff at this resort. As we walked around the resort, the staff always smiled, gave pleasant greetings, and remembered you. In many of the reviews, people were disappointed with the beach. However, it is nice to sit out there on the beds and/or chairs. The water is not the crystal blue most are used to in the Gulf. However, I don't believe that this factor is deal breaker for this resort. The resort is beautiful and offers many activities like snorkeling, bike riding, kayacking, etc. I was also impressed with the drivers for the transfers and shuttles to Playa. They were friendly and helpful! I thoroughly enjoyed my relaxing stay at Hacienda Tres Rios. My only negative experience was with the concierge. Our point person in concierge was not the most friendly or helpful staff member at the resort. We did not let her ruin our stay. We enjoyed relaxing in the sun and talking with the staff and other guests. Everyone was always friendly! This is a great resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation, beautiful hotel, great food and service!”
Reviews.Author: Tunaslam
Reviews.Content: My wife Sheryl and I had an extremely enjoyable time at the Tres Rios resort, owned by Sunset Vacations? We were so busy we missed many of the All Inclusive activities included in the package, which we hope to take advantage of if we return someday. We did utilize the Jaguar tour which included a visit to the nursery, where they raise exotic plants for this and future resorts, kayaking. and a swim in a smaller Cenote. We missed all the shows provided, as they tended to occur when we were on a tour or having a delightful dinner. We especially enjoyed the Kotori restaurant, also known as the Asian Fusion. The Sushi, sashimi, soups, and fresh seared Ahi Tuna was incredible. Our next favorite was the Hacienda Grill, noted for their tasty Rib Eye steaks, yum, yum, and for breakfast my favorite being Eggs Benedict! The buffets in the main dining room were always full of quality choices for all three meals. We thought the Italian restaurant needed a better menu selection. The Mexican restaurant had the best bar tender, Teo, specializing in an Ameretto Mango Margarita! The drinks and service everywhere were outstanding! Being a Grand Mayan member we were not interested in their fractional interest membership program, however, at the end of the presentation they invited us back with a similar attractive package. We declined because you had to use it within two years and pay up front and we did not want to be in that position to return in such a short time period, with so many other places to travel on our bucket list. Our biggest complaint is the trickery the IRC vacation marketing company used to force us in attending the presentation. After agreeing to the package offered, paying in full up front, and then being told they could not confirm our reservations until we booked our flights and provided them with our itinerary.
