After booking flights, they then sent us a notice to be signed indicating a "Mandatory" attendance to the presentation was required, otherwise our package price would be doubled? I was furious, no mention of this upfront and we were now pregnant with non refundable air fares and for the package price. I wrote a letter to the sales manager, who never replied, nor would any other executive of IRC? Listen I'm not naive, almost all resorts in Mexico have presentations, however, this is almost always optional to attend? To me and my wife this is an extremely poor marketing technique used to get us in to their resort, and certainly leaves you with a negative attitude toward any kind of purchase. Also the so called 90 minute presentation took over four hours, and 53 no's to get excused! They also put down the value of our Grand Mayan Luxxe program which is top of the line, anther turn off. The only other negative was despite making reservations nine months in advance, we got a low level room with a partial view and twin beds rather than a King bed as requested, although the room was spacious, attractive and comfortable. Despite the negatives which exist on all timeshare/fractional interest resorts we had a wonderful time, great food and plenty of drinks. P.S. we took two tours, both lasting most of the day. The Isla Mujeres tour which was fun, and the Chichin Itsa tour which was 13.5 hours long, very tiring, don't do it on your last day, as we did, but a once in a lifetime experience. We do hope to return to the area sometime in the future, and certainly it would be difficult to top this resort for quality and beauty. Cory

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an All-Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: geerdad
Reviews.Content: This trip was our first time to the Carribean. WOW! Beautiful water and sand. Just like the brochures that I thought were all PhotoShop'ed. I've vacationed in Puerto Vallarta three times before (1996, 2003, 2011) and wasn't too impressed with the beaches. I love the ocean, so the beach was just part of the picture frame. At Hacienda Tres Rios, I was blown away by the beauty at the beach. Later in the week, we ventured down to Playa Del Carmen (about a 15 minute cab ride) and discovered that the beach could be even better. Actually, near perfect sand. The beach at Tres Rios actually accumulates a lot of black seaweed and crap that the crews are continuously raking up and carting away in wheelbarrows. The staff at Hacienda Tres Rios were all terrific. Very eager to please (with one exception, but every place has one of them). The restaurants didn't offer a full assortment of what we consider to be traditional Mexican food. There were no burritos, tacos, enchiladas, etc. Our 7 year old daughter could spend every day split between the beach and the pools. Easy to please, that way. It was my first All-Inclusive experience and I loved it. I want every vacation to be All-In now. My wife was done All-In before (El Cid, Mazatlan, about 10 years ago) and she said that Hacienda Tres Rios left a lot to be desired. The resort is quite new so the rooms are still in great condition (although ours had a few maintenance repairs that were not looked after even after we reported them).

Reviews.Title: “Great blend of relaxation,fun and adventure.”
Reviews.Author: drbenson777
Reviews.Content: Tres Rios was the perfect place for a nature lover and avid snorkeler. We kayaked the beautiful rivers and snorkeled the cenotes every day. The resort had a great pool and good service. We entertained ourselves everyday just walking around the resort and watching the iguanas, fish, and snookum bears that habitated the area. I wouldn't necessarily advise this for vacationers looking for the typical beach vacation, but if you want something a little more low key and adventerous then this is a terrific option.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: switzerlanditaly
Reviews.Content: Great time, grounds lovely, pools with plenty of space and great food!! We went with another family who has two boys 10, 11, we have two gilrs 9,11. Never bored, good activites, fun on beach and in pool. Pizza was a hit, kids had alot of independence. We were not hounded by time share vultures. Beach beds and hammocks were outstanding. Service was personal and excellent. Rooms were amazing. Spa was nothing to write home about, would skip it next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations, with great service and beautiful setting and unbelievable service. Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: franced45
Reviews.Content: Great staff - always helpful and very friendly. The food is first class and the service is wonderful. The accommodations are great and every room looks out to the ocean. Can't wait to go back for another week and just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Quiet & Relaxing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: misspriss82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hacienda Tres Rios for a wedding, but stayed a little longer to make a full vacation out of it, as this was our first time to Mexico. Here's what I liked: - The resort was very quiet, there weren't any fights at the pool or beach for a place to sit under an umbrella, like I've seen at other resorts -The beds were super comfy, the shower was nice, and the rooms overall were clean & pretty - I LOVED the beds on the beach! My husband and I took a nap there every afternoon. They were surprisingly sand free and comfy! - The resort staff is super friendly! They were there all the time so you get to know them by name; Gregorio was my favorite, as he always knew which drink I wanted before I even asked for it! Customer service is wonderful! - The wedding they put together was organized, beautiful and they seemed very accommodating to the bride and groom. - The grill out by the pool had excellent food (the ceviche is a must) and the pizza grill was also great! - There is an adult pool and a children's pool. This was fantastic! Plus the pools in general were very nice, also clean. Here's the Bad: - If you're looking for clear beach water, this is not the resort for you. As said in previous reviews, the beach is covered in mangroves which makes it look "dirty". But with just a short walk, it is clear. - The third night we were there, our a/c went out in our room at 3am. (Some of the people we were traveling with also had this happen during their stay a few times). - The food at the buffet leads much to be desired. I actually lost weight on vacation b/c I didn't eat any of the dessert b/c they didn't really have any that was appetizing. I also got food poisoning one evening at the Mexican restaurant. In fact, we ended up ordering room service every evening we were there (chicken quesadilla and chocolate cake) b/c we never got enough at dinner. Overall, we would go back, but I think we'd like to try out a different resort near the area. Not that we didn't like Hacienda, its just that there are so many to choose from! It was a lovely vacation, you can't go wrong with going here, but do your research first!

Reviews.Title: “Lots to Do”
Reviews.Author: Bertiemcl
Reviews.Content: We choose this place largely because of the large selection of activities included in the price of the all inculsive, from sailing to snorkeling in cenotes, to kayaking. It really did deliver in these area. The staff who conducted the activites were really great, especially Maya. We also really liked the beach beds. Very relaxing. The waiting service was not very good on the beach, but there also weren't any bathrooms even remotely close to the beach so you had to hike back to the main hotel area for those anyhow. The mixed drinks were terrible. Created for people who are going to drink 17 margaritas in one day (very low alcohol) and kids who like huge amounts of sugar in their drinks. I suspect they were putting water in their alcohol bc I have never had 4 drinks and not felt even buzzed in my life. The water at part of the beach, as others mentioned, is not very swimable. However, there is an area towards the north end of the beach where you can swim where the centoe empties into the ocean. Is very clear and nice and cool. This part of the beach is really beautiful. The rooms are nice. Clean, modern, comfortable. The double shower was awesome, about 4 feet by 3.5 feet., nice tavertine. The spa is also very nice. Be sure you know ahead of time whats included in your package bc they will not bring it up if you don't. We were supposed to have special honeymoon wine and cheese. We never brought it up bc we didn't care, but they didn't mention it either. And proving that we had a free rental car included in our package was a bit of a headache. The food is mediocre with a couple real stand out dishes. I will eat just about anything, but I expect a lot from restaurants. The coconut ice cream is good:) Bring bug spray and maybe water shoes. Tulum was really cool.

Reviews.Title: “WE loved it and will be back so soon!!”
Reviews.Author: nikkijoduh
Reviews.Content: this yes yet the best vacation i ever had! the food was so good I could not even describe it. Everyone there treated me and my boyfriend like number one! the pool and the beach was out of this world!!! the resort is like a picture you would see from a magazine. only one thing there was not a lot of night activity so the nights were boring, but the day there is so much to do!! love this place and will be back again!! p.s the rooms were so pretty and the beds were AMAZING so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: dhymanga
Reviews.Content: My Wife and i traveled to HTR on May 26th and returned on the 30th. We were attending a wedding on Sunday night and renewing our vows Friday night. We were greeted with a room upgrade to a King suite with a jacuzzi. We were quickly brought a drink as we checked in. The food was great from the poolside pizzeria and grill. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. I recommend tipping the wait staff for a much more enjoyable service. Waiter Oscar was very good to us the entire stay. We enjoyed the pool every day. The massage in the salon was great. We recommend kayaking in the cenote on resort. Maya did a great job with the tour. The restaurant was great. The resort is absolutely beautiful top to bottom. The rooms are the nicest I have seen at a resort. There is alot of wildlife on the resort including fish in the waterway on the resort, iguanas on the pool deck and these awesome marsupials that look like raccoons. They have one named Pecho that hangs around the Pizzeria. Check him out. The only down side was the ocean water. It is not clear on the resort front. This is due to the levies installed to protect the cenote and mangroves. However, you can walk south 300 yards and have gorgeous beaches. The cenote has clear water where it meets the ocean and is accessible and refreshing. Overall we enjoyed our stay at HTR. Staff were great, food was great. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “will never return here”
Reviews.Author: yadiramm
Reviews.Content: my husband and I just came from vacation we were staying from 05-22-2011 to 05-29-2011, this was my second time going to Cancun, last year we stood at another resort wonderful service, i regret not going back to the first place, unfortunately i wanted to try something new wow and do i regret it, the minute we got there the customer service person was not friendly at all did not even smile took a copy of our passports did not even say why he needed them they are very short staff so the service was not as i expected, another thing that they don't advertise is that the beach is not clean or crystal clear, so we couldn't get in the water we only were at the pool, they do have things to do like Unlimited tours at exclusive Tres Rios Natural Park including snorkeling and kayaking in rivers and cenotes, SenseAdventure tour you have to book this a day before and when i did they said they did not have any more tousr available this was on a wed and they said they only had 2 left for friday or sat, for the ladies if you decide to come here for vacation do take a hair drier all though they say the rooms come with it not true, It also advertises a robe and slippers included when in the your room , robe yes slippers no, the drinks were always hot, the beer and mixed drinks, also in the morning the milk was warm and the orange juice tasted more like water, some of the food was not good at all, i must admit the italian food was great and the food from the grill outside and the calsones were really good too, they also advertise this:Exit Lounge - Enjoy a warm farewell in this private area after checkout again not true, another thing that my husband and i also notice is that they have special treatment for the people that have invested in something like time share or real estate investment there was a family there that you were able to see the different treatment they gave him and his family versus the other guest there i found that very wrong and rude because we also spend money at that resort and the majority of waiters were giving vip to his family there is nothing wrong with that but what about the rest of the guest,at the last resort that we stood at everyone was treated as royalty, it did not matter who spend what or how much everyone was treated equally , if you also will like to visit this resort make sure you take allot of singles and fives they ask you for id to change american money even though they have all of your info and keep in mind they take a photo copy of your passport and still ask you at front desk for id to change your money and at the end they tell you they don't have any change available, also look for Juanita or Manuel, Armando and Carlos these are the only waiters that treated us excellent not only my husband and i but they were making sure everyone was taken care of only when they were there,

Reviews.Title: “Three cheers for HTR!”
Reviews.Author: LibbieO
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios and had a fantastic time. The rooms were clean and comfortable, as well as nicely decorated. We spent a lot of time out on the balcony of the room, I don't believe there are any bad views, mostly because of the fact that the grounds of the resort are so lush and beautiful. The customer service was exceptional. We had an activity day planned outside of the resort and and the company with whom we booked it failed to pick us up. We just went to the travel desk near the lobby and told them the situation. The instantly were able to find a couple of empty seats on a similar activity and we left fifteen minutes later. One tip is to bring a watch and set it to the right time zone, there aren't many clocks around the resort and we ended up asking the concierge multiple times what time it was. We went on the Jaguar Tour, which is free with an all inclusive package, and it was a great experience, made even better with an underwater camera....by the beach, there are kayaks that you may take out, and it's definitely worth it to schedule a ride on the Catamaran! It's not difficult to fit in and the guides are all wonderfully polite and personable. We took advantage of the adults-only pools because they were almost always empty and peaceful, while the kids pools were almost always busy. The food was all Great! We went to the buffet everyday for breakfast, the pizza place by the pools, Hacienda Grill, Kotori, El Alebrije, the sports bar, and got room service several times. Some things that stood out were the cheesecake and steak sandwiches on the room service menu, the French toast and fruit at the breakfast buffet and the Margerita pizza from Il Forno. All in all, the entire resort was beautiful and hospitality was definitely the main focus of the staff. Also, you get the opportunity to see iguanas, lizards, birds, and coatis daily. I would highly recommend this resort, based in the exceptional 6 day stay we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sbulldog
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation. Tips that were helpful from TA--bring a hair dryer, and beach is not a swimming beach, but beautiful where rivers meet the ocean. Food was fabulous--check the schedule they give you at check-in, so you know what is open on certain days. They were always willing to change what was available food-wise--we never went hungry--gained a few pounds. If you like to jog/run it is a perfect location--we ran out to the main entrance on a paved sidewalk, and through the nature preserve--very relaxing. Our only negative was check-in. We won our stay on skyauction, and the dude checking us in was trying to force us into paying for an upgrade. A jerk, but the rest of the staff superb. Chef Oscar runs a great operation--very hands-on, and it made for a great experience overall. We had a mangrove view room which was fine for us, the pools and food were great, and we would go back again, given the opportunity. No time share hassle, as others have said--but, because of the way we were treated at check-in--we never would have considered buying.

Reviews.Title: “HAD a great time and will be back”
Reviews.Author: imcaliqt
Reviews.Content: We are having a great time. I am traveling with my family three small children 2 3 and 5. This is a great place. The rooms are huge. The beds are to die for. Food is good. The pizza is great. The ocean in front of the hotel is red, but just take the FREE shuttel to Fishermans village (there sister Hotel) and the beach is great. Make sure to say NO to the time share speech unless you want some free tickets(still not sure if it worth it). Do the horse back riding...my kids loved it and wants to go back. The people are nice. Didn't like the fact it felt like everywhere we went they expected a tip. Would overall rate this a great trip. DO NOT USE www.cancun-transfers.net for your airport transfer please find someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet And Peaceful Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mollymelanie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 20th Anniversary. It was just wonderful. This place is not for partiers. It is quiet, and romantic. The room was spacious and beautiful. We had a jacuzzi tub on our deck, which was fun. The grounds where lovely with foliage, and flowers everywhere. The pool just goes on forever. There are 2 beach areas. The main one has the beach beds on it. I recommend getting up early to snag one. we got up one morning at 6:30, and they where just putting the new sheets on them. we slept peacefully and luxuriously thre rest of the morning! I highly recommend it! The water here is not very clear and beautiful, but the quiet, and the beds make up for it. The other beach is across the bridge, and it is where the 2 rivers come out to thre sea. The water here is gorgeous, and this is where most people swam. It is shallow and calm and would be a good place for small children to get into the water. One day we took a kayak up the main river to the cenote where it originates, and back. That was very fun. One day we took the bicycle tour to see all of the cenotes on the property. One we knew how to get to them, we hiked back later and swam in them. they are beautiful, and refreshing on a hot day. The hotel web site made it sound like they have bikes, and snorkel gear readily available for use, but you can only use them on the tours. so bring your own snorkel gear if you want to do it on your own. The hotel tours are free, but not offered every day. There are basically 3 formal dining rooms, one open each night; Italian, Asian Fusion, and Gourmet Mexican. They are all pretty comparable inquality. I am a foody, and hold a high standard. with that in mind; the food was good. Not great, but we were not disappionted in any way, just didn't knock my socks off. The pizza place outside is very good, as is the poolside restaurant, which was definately better that expected. The property and rooms where very clean and always smelled fresh. One suggestion I have for the management however is that there were several beds on the beach that did not have mattresses or covers on them. Either repair them or remove them, as they make the place look a bit run down. everything else was great! oh, and our package came with 2 half hour massages. Both of our therapists were just wonderful, and the spa is nice, with complimentary use of the steam room, and saunas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week of Relaxation and Fun”
Reviews.Author: RonnyVegas
Reviews.Content: Great food, atmosphere, and adventures. Loved that it was inside a nature park. The Hotel was so clean and the service was tremendous. The All-Inclusive was well worth it. I would recommend going on the free tours and definitely doing some site seeing to see the Mayan Ruins, and Playa de Carmen. The beach is interesting, because you are right where three rivers meet the ocean. Not crystal clear like in Playa and Cancun, but definitely fun if adventuring in the rivers and cenotes. If you want an immaculate beach take the free shuttle to Playa. The only negative that I can mention is the check-in (pushy concierge trying to sell me time-share, although I already own through Sunset World) This is the last thing you want after you already bought through their company and just landed after a long trip departing from Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: niborrobin
Reviews.Content: I arrived here today... Service has been horrible. I had to wait three hours for my room and paid 200 dollars extra to stay in a room you cannot even see the ocean in. It is supposed to be a four star hotel but is not. Save your money and go somewhere else. The only good thing was the very accommodating bell hop Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place for relaxation and having a few (!!!) drinks!”
Reviews.Author: TheDivineMissEm
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived at the Hacienda Tres Rios, we felt happy and relaxed. The beautiful warm oranges and flowers in the huge foyer gave it an elegant yet comfortable feel. The landscaping, pools, restaurants and rooms are gorgeous. The first night we were there they did an outdoor Mexican fiesta with a huge, delicious buffet and Mexican band. Loved this!!! Also loved the fact that during the entire stay, a pina colada was never far away. Bar tenders were so friendly and attentive - topping up my drink the minute it was empty. Big thanks to Carisimo - he was awesome by the pool! The room itself was clean and beautiful. Housekeeping were so great - we needed hypoallergenic pillows and it was no problem at short notice. Bathrooms are lovely despite not having a bath tub in the mangrove view rooms. The resort goes to great lengths to organise activities and make the stay enjoyable for everyone. We didn't end up having time to do these but hear they were lovely. We did, however, attend all the dinners they hosted - including Carribean night on the beach. Go to these - they are great fun and the food is delicious. We had the all-inclusive package so tried almost all of the foods they had on offer. Breakfast buffet was top notch and the quesadilla/omelette station was awesome. Lunch at the wood fired pizza oven was great too. Hacienda Grill offers nice lunches or light dinners. One of the disappointing things was the dinner buffet - it was trying too hard to be American and I probably would have preferred more Mexican options there but I guess they have to cater to everyone. Bad things: Not many. Honest. When we booked we noted that it was our honeymoon and heard that they do 'special' things for you on your honeymoon so we were excited. When we arrived the fellow at the reception desk - who was quite arrogant - made no point of this so I reminded him that it was our honeymoon. He gave a very condescending smile and said 'OK'...and that was all. Nothing special in our room, no treats, etc. I guess I expected a bit more from a 5 star place. All in all, an excellent holiday and a beautiful resort. Would go back again for sure. Oh and while in Playa go to XCARET - don't ask any questions, just GO. It is amazing :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautifull beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: dobie89
Reviews.Content: I actually own a 2 bedroom unit in this resort and traveled here with 10 other individuals. Rooms are spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. The quality of the food and drinks were awesome although some drinks could have been stronger. Service throughout our trip was great. Hopefully this experience will continue for many years to come and not because I just acquired a membership with the resort. The only downfall I can speak of is the beach needs some work. Overall everyone experienced a true luxury vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! I couldn't ask for better service, amenities, food, accommodations, location = everything!”
Reviews.Author: MochaJazz
Reviews.Content: I discovered Tres Rios Resort when I traveled to Playa del Carmen with a friend last year. We had booked a one week stay at a different resort (which was advertised "5-Star") and were headed there when we met a Rep from Tres Rios, who offered us several incentives to go on a tour of the Tres Rios property. What attracted me most to T.R. was learning that it is located on a huge Ecological Preserve. We checked into our so-called "5-Star" destination. We were disappointed! It turned out to be more like 3 Stars. It was noisy and crowded, the food was crappy and service was mediocre. We had pre-paid and there was no way to get out of it. A couple of days later, we went to Tres Rios for our tour/sales presentation. Based on the place where we were staying, I had no interest in buying, but we wanted to see what a different resort was like. Arriving at the gated entry of Tres Rios Resort, we were stopped by Security to be checked in (unlike the "other" place). We then drove through a jungle road for approximately 5 minutes before we actually saw the Resort. Driving up to the entrance, we immediately felt a huge difference. The Valets greeted us with big smiles as they rushed to open the car doors (the "other" resort had Self parking). They spoke English, which was helpful. I noticed the gorgeous, wide mahogany steps and porch as we entered. We were directed to some comfortable sofas and were offered a beverage. Within a few minutes, our Sales Rep, Daniel, came. He was tall, handsome and well-dressed, with a big beautiful smile. It was a pleasure to tour the property with Daniel (who spoke perfect English). He took us to one of the restaurants on the property where we had a delicious lunch. From that point on, we were impressed by everything we saw. The resort was beyond beautiful!! It was quiet and not crowded. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The amenities were so wonderful - lovely landscapes, a "Quiet" pool, beds on the beach, several restaurants, 24-hour room service, the amazing rivers and cenotes and much more. All food, beverages, activities and amenities all-included for a surprisingly affordable rate. We decided to purchase a membership! Unlike a Time Share, you can reserve your time at Tres Rios any week(s) of the year. Skipping ahead, Daniel offered us a special room rate, so we decided to stay a few extra days in Playa del Carmen so that we could check out Tres Rios first hand. It was all we expected and more! Wonderful beds. Amazing food. Friendly and efficient service from every Staff member we encountered. The activities and amenities were so great. I can't say enough, and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk made a bad impression for rest of hotel”
Reviews.Author: skgcdl
Reviews.Content: We had requested 2 rooms close together, 1 to be a King and late check out on our departure day. Our rooms were on opposite ends of the same floor despite the room next door being empty and being cleaned when we were unpacking. Neither room was a king- my husband is 6'4" and a double bed is not comfortable. The hotel had a very low occupancy during our stay. They wanted to charge us $50 per person for a late checkout for 1 room ($200) which was more than we paid for a full day. We are frequent travelers to Mexico and use the same booking agency. We always get our requests fullfilled and the most we have paid for a late ckout is $50 total. The housekeeping staff started early 7 am or so and prevented us from sleeping in No reservations were required at the restaurants, but the restaurants were not all open as advertised due to the low occupancy. The majority of the staff at the bars and eating establishments were great with a little tip. The hotel did not arrange scuba or jet ski rental, but we had a car and went into Puerto Morelos.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice place...”
Reviews.Author: joe321_2
Reviews.Content: Given some of the reviews on here we were bait skeptical of this hotel. But we were very happy with almost all aspects of this hotel. It was very pretty and tastefully decorated. It's a fairly new hotel. The rooms were really nice and very spacious. The food was excellent...buffet wasn't great but all the a la carte restaurants were very good. We took advantage of the all inclusive plan so we didn't worry about the prices. The service was great; odd grumpy person here or there but mostly really friendly and helpful. Alcohol was always flowing (not that I drink much) and they had all the top of the line brands. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel was the timeshare presentation we went on was horrible. Hated it! They were pushy and overbearing and scammers. We didn't sign on for anything but they worked hard at it. They told us it would take 90 minutes but it took 3 hours and then tried to tell us the time started after they took us for breakfast. But other than that everything was great and we had a very relaxing time. Not a party place though so we went to just chill out and relax and it was perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very different than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: paulamdak
Reviews.Content: I am not a beach person & found the cenotes very cool! Plan your hotel activities the minute you get there as they fill up quickly. The teen nightlife is in the sports bar until 10pm. As much as I did not think the restaurants needed to be formal attire they do enforce the rule of long pants need for boys. Tip the pool waiters early on and your day will be very relaxing and fully catered to. Although not a timeshare it does offer Mexican residents memberships which is like a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: trailgirl10
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 children : 7 and 9) had a great 9 night stay at the Hacienda.Due to the size of this resort, including the area containing numerous cenotes/ walkways it never felt too crowded. >Rooms were beautiful (2 double beds plus the option for the sofa bed to be made up) > Pools were great and the side beach (over the bridge) was perfect for the children. It was not stunning like the beach we found at akamal, but attractive all the same. Beach beds were very relaxing ; drinks were brought round to you and it was not very busy. > The free programme of activities round the cenotes (snorkelling, kyaking, cycling and sensory experience) were enjoyed by all the family. > Food was varied and very good. We enjoyed quieter breakfasts outside in the Hacienda Grill and fabulous dinners in the Mexican and Asian Fusion. My son had his 7th birthday and the staff were great in organising a cake and getting all the children in the restaurant to sing happy birthday to him. The coffee and cake shop was very well used! > Car hire. I was glad we had a car so we could explore some other areas of the coast and were not reliant on tour buses. We hired from Easycar rental who had an all inclusive price and seemed to be very reasonably priced. They met us at the airport and drove us 10 minutes to their depot where we picked up the car. All very smooth and easy. We had already spent 2 nights at the hotel Mayaland (beautiful and a great stop off point to allow an early morning visit to Chicen Itza before the crowds arrived) and 3 nights at the Casa del balam in Merida (beautiful oasis in the centre of Merida : great for it's shopping and visits to Celestun/ local cenotes) Down the Yucatan coast I would recommend visits to > Coba - great ruins where you can climb to the top of the main pyramid. It was a good stop off point between Merida and Playa de Carmen. A very friendly guide cycled my 2 children on a tricycle and my husband and I hired bikes. The routes were very shady so even though we were there in the middle of the day it was fine. >Tulum (do get there for opening; even at 9.30am it was so busy with tour buses and very hot). take your swimming costume for a dip in the beautiful turquoise waters at the ruins' beach. It's very small and busy but very refreshing. Lots of iguanas for the children to spot > Akamal : beautiful beach with shady palm trees. Opportunity to swim out and snorkel. my husband saw a turtle here. > Actunchen - peaceful, untouristy nature park where you can swim in a beautiful underground cenote and do zipwires (even hanging upside down). The children loved it and the guides were very attentive. > Porto Morelos - pretty fishing village/ beach. We found all the Mexicans both in the resort and outside very friendly and welcoming and Mexico a beautiful sunny place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sammy & Oscar are the heart and soul of Tres Rios' luxury & relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPilot
Reviews.Content: Just spent two weeks at la Herencia Tres Rios with 3 other couples for first week and just with spouse for second week. Head Chef Oscar sets a high standard for gourmet meals 24/7. His chef's dinner is particularly exquisite. Sammy is head of services and sets to tone with his ever-present smile. Always attentive, he ensures all of the service staff is equally attentive and cordial. By the end of our stay, we knew they were good, but were now also our friends. Sammy & Oscar truly epitomize the grace and comfort of Tres Rios. Tremendous resort: super meals, great facilities, gracious staff, and lots of peaceful spaces to relax and simply get away from it all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CherylDeP
Reviews.Content: Nice facility, our room was wonderfull, very clean and large, the kids loved the night light built into the headboards and room divider, nice touch. Our room was kept immaculate with turn down service every night, room refrigerator was always stocked. Loved the 24/7 room service, quick, convenient and friendly. Not a very "exciting" resort, so if you are looking for music and activities don't stay here. It is a nice calm, quiet, relaxed place, our kids ages 9 and 12 enjoyed themselves, we did enough daily activities and swimming to keep them occupied. Loved the Chichen Itza tour, they even packed us a lunch to take along. It was a 13 hr excursion, but well worth it. Bring $$$ there are lots of souveniers you will want to buy. We enjoyed the Kotori restaraunt the best. The pools were pristine always, great poolside service, drinks and food anytime!! The beach party could have been lots better!! Spa services were wonderfull. The Sports Bar could be soooo much more, that I have to say was disappointing. The timeshare sales group was a PIA, but we held our ground and said no, they got a little pushy, but then left us alone. They didn't bother us until day 2. Kayaking was probably the most fun for our family, really enjoyed that. Will return as a couple for some serious R&R, wouldn't take kids back, in 1 -2 yrs it wouldn't meet their needs. Enjoyed the in room hot tub, used it lots, bring your bath bubbles!! The only thing you really need is bathing suits and some dressy clothes for dinner. P.S. Don't let the people at the airport talk you into anything at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beds on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: brownmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HTR from 4/30-5/7/2011 our first impression that we had that like other resorts we have stayed at this being our 7th trip to Mexico it was a lovely lobby area.We got checked in quickly and we would have to wait for the room which is no problem for us. Right off the bat we were told that we would have to speak with a concierge AKA timeshare shark AARRGGHH! We knew this resort was going to pitch this so we told her that we had a timeshare before and dumped it 3 years ago she left us alone. Our first meal was the buffet which was clean with good service,but not alot of choices compared to other places I have been. Off to the beach beds what a great invention!! you can eat,sleep or just relax they were so comfortable we got one everyday. We ate that night at Portobella aka Italian restaurant food,atmosphere and presentation all were great! We ate lunch most days at the Hacienda Grill which was the only outdoor dining by the pools it was good,however by the end of the week the menu choices dry up and this is the only lunch besides the buffet that is available. I wish they had a regular evening restaurant open some days for variety's sake. We loved the Mexican restaurant and met our favorite waiter Daemo he is great reminicent of cruiseship or fine dining quality of attentiveness we followed him for the rest of our stay. The room was very nice we had 2206 which had a oceanview and was centrally located. The bed was great!! the best ever in Mexico the bathroom also received high marks as well. The overall staff was great always willing to do what you desired with a smile. The one downside is the color of the water at the beach brown due to river runoff I knew this prior to booking,but at the end of the week I missed the clear waters of Playa. Entertainment was a bust lame shows or the sports bar or go to bed early those are your choices. This resort is good to relax the kids will like the pools and the drinks are very good,however if you want to do more you will need to catch a cab to Playa or Cancun for something to do. One thing I noticed I know this is tips prepaid resort but we always tip the hardworking people wherever we go the $200 or so dollars we gave to these people means nothing to me but it goes a long way with them and it's appreciated. I only seen a couple other people doing this besides us that's your choice but I'll always do it wherever I go.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would need in one place”
Reviews.Author: SusieG20
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios is a beautiful resort. The service is excellent. The food is good, better than other resorts. The rooms are beautiful, and the tours they offer like the bicycling, kayaking, and snorkeling tours are really great. You have everything here, the ocean, beach, pools, nature, the cenotes. The service at the restaurants is good. 24Hr room service is also very good, we used it a lot. Another thing I liked about this resort is that it is big and you never feel crowded here, you never have to fight for a chair by the pool or a beach bed. This resort is for families, it is very quiet after 9pm. There is not much happening after 9pm at night- I think there is some room for improvement on that part, but otherwise we are very happy with our vacation and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but...”
Reviews.Author: krudmin
Reviews.Content: We just got back after spenign 10 days at HTR. Very nice place overall with a few things that could be improved. The room we got was probably the best I've ever seen and I have been to numerous all-inclusives before. Large, contemporary furnished, great ocean view from the third floor. The food was pretty good too, especially the specialty restaurants. Great pools for both adults and kids. Can't say anything bad about the staff either - I didn't have too many interactions with them, bur everytime we needed anything they were eager to help. Now - the negatives...The biggest one certainly is the beach. Unusable...I've read the reviews of course, but kept hoping people just were being picky and spoiled. It's not the case. The waves wash ashore this brownish matter that varies from an oil spill -like in some spots to a light brown mess in others. Nobody wants to swim in this, trust me... So, repeating the others - if you really want a nice beach - go somewhere else. Yes, you will have a river to swim in with a crystal clear water, but it's not the same. The beach issue affects other hotels in the area as well - I saw the same thing as I walked up the shore. It improves the furhter you get away from HTR , but it's a long walk... Another minor note. For a "family oriented" resort as they claim themselves to be, it'd be nice if they had a playground for the kids or something like that..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is like very all inclusive hotel with an Eco park.”
Reviews.Author: Duke_tran_97
Reviews.Content: I really love the Eco park but everything else is okay. All of the hotel excursion is the same. The food is good but be careful, alot of people go food poisoning. I think the mix drink cause the added water to it. I got sick 5 days into my vacationing here. I feel uneasy after every meals. After talking with a couple of people , they too realize it. At night, everything is dead. If you want food you have to do room services. The positive side is that the hotel have plenty of outdoor beds and hammocks. The staffs are great and very flexible. There are 2 pools and they are great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: frulka
Reviews.Content: We just arrived to HTR and from beggining I'm very disappointed. This is my 5'th time is Rivera Maya. We usually stay at Dreams or Iberostar hotels. Like always I send them and e-mail befor, requesting king bad with nice view. I received parking view room with double bads. I called and ask them for king size bad and better view and they told me that they are famili frandly resort and they don't have a king size bads. But they Italian restautant, and one of the pools is adult only. Go figure... My request to talk to the manager was left unattendent. I'm stlll wainting, by the way. Now about beach - it stinks and it is dark brown. Pools don't have steps, not easy to access and especially get out. I'm very disappointed. Food is middle core nothing special about it. If you ever been in Dreams Resorts, this one is not for you. Service at the front desk is really bad. They don't care about you, only thing that they care is to sell you time-share. I said NO for this resort, NEVER AGAIN. I have a high expectations, I'm looking for high-end customer servive. This hotel doesn't have this. My next trip will be to Dreams, where they care about me. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: ladybug912
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Mexico and both times we stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios. The resort is beautiful and we particularly love their commitment to being environmentally conscious. The rooms are immaculate, spacious, and comfortable. The bathrooms are amazing!!! We have been so impressed with the staff there. They are happy, friendly, work incredibly hard, and go out of their way to make sure you have everything you could want. The food is excellent at all of their restaurants. We love the outdoor pizza oven and gourmet pizzas! The buffet for breakfast is great, especially the homemade omelets, tortillas, and mimosas! Our favorite evening is the chefs dinner where you can actually sit in the kitchen with the chef serving you a seven course meal, which is incredible. There is snorkeling in the Cenotes, biking, yoga, pilates , cooking classes and many more activities right at the resort. You can walk for miles on the beach or just camp out in a beach bed for the day! Be aware that this resort is a Members Club (similar to a timeshare but more exclusive) and you may be approached to take a tour . The tour is interesting but the 'hard sell' can be annoying, so if you do it, know ahead of time that you may be pressured to buy. But I wouldn't let this stop you from going to this resort. We are looking forward to many more trips here!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl59
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time in 2 years that we have visited our home away from home. HTR is the most amazing resort we have ever had the pleasure to stay at. From the minute we set foot in the lobby we are greeted like family with a welcome drink and quick attention. The Service is impeccable from the concierge to the housekeeping and everyone in between. The head chef Oscar is everywhere all the time. The man never sleeps! His right had is Sammy and is at your beacon call for any thing at anytime. Our favorite waiter is Armondo, who is absolutely delightful and will go out of his way to make sure your every mean is exquisite. Carlos the manager of the Mexican Restaurant is wonderful and what a cook. He made us a special dinner one night of filet and shrimp and then another night he made us a fantastic dessert. The pool bars are wonderful as is the service. The waitstaff at the pools are very attentive and quick. You never want for anything at anytime. The rooms are open spacious and beautiful. There are many on site activities that are all included in your stay which you can take advantage of and I highly recommend that you do. Jennifer in activities is great and a lot of fun. I can go on and on but at this time I suggest you plan your trip and find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “we had a awsome time in fact we bought another week & cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: meme59
Reviews.Content: we thought every thing was just beautiful, clean, we were treated like royalty . The staff was awsome. what a great atmosphere. the food was great oscar you are the bomb . luv ya and cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Don't set our expectations too high for a vacation at this place.”
Reviews.Author: MWDJ
Reviews.Content: Upon entering for the first time you are greeted by a concierge that promised to match what ever I had been given by any timeshare presentation i was offered there and collected my free vouchers I was given by there competition. When I was ready to go to the attraction and get the tickets I actually had to pay $36 each. Their answer was "you just have to pay for the buffet" When I got there I found every hotel offers the same discount and it was impossible for the 3 of us to eat $108 of breakfast and lunch in a Mexican amusement park. I was scammed the moment I walked in the door. The junior suite was quite junior, like a Marriot hotel room. The beach is a mess, it is not polluted but just a swampy mess compared to the other beaches. The explanation they give for this is they are an eco-park. And they must abide by regulations that do not allow for artificial removal of the marine life that live in the floating mess in the surf and on the sand in front of the property. The location is far enough from town (20 min) that it is inconvenient to go into town everyday where you can find the good food and the $25 an hour massages. (I got 6 hours in 3 days) I ate at 4 of the 6 food establishments on the property and they were mediocre at best but the price was like I was in Aspen. It was $17.50 for a hot dog at the pool. $8 -$9 drinks like a Vegas pool. $150 for 3 at the Italian restaurant. The spa has Beverly Hills prices. Although I hung the privacy sign on the door each day, for some reason the maid ignored it and changed the linens and turned the bed down each night. Once we were nude in the tub and 2 other times I was sleeping. I suspect it was to refill the minibar in hopes I would burn through a few hundred in high price mini bar treats. The time share presentation was miserable also, it was supposed to be 90 minutes but as soon as they found out I had an excursion scheduled for 2 hours after the meeting started they canceled it because they new they would trap us there for 5 hours. This was my first time to this area of Mexico, it was quite a bit different than the more primitive trips I have taken in this country and even Cabo. It is a tourist trap, literally. You are bombarded with "representatives" making grandiose offers that are too good to be true, and everyone has their hand out trying to get your money one way or another. My best experience on this trip was the scuba diving in Cozumel, take the ferry over and check that out. Also diving and snorkeling in the Cenotes was not to be missed. Get yourself a Lonely Planet guidebook or similar and see the natural wonders not the Disneyfied man made parks that are not as exciting as the brochures make them out to be not to mention how overpriced they are.

Reviews.Title: “Happy about property unhappy about the agency”
Reviews.Author: Luda203
Reviews.Content: We came to hotel after getting "You can dream again" certificate that they sold us at Time Share presentation at the hotel about a year ago. We liked the hotel for the same reasons other people on this thread did. However, we were very disappointed about the deal. The agency charged us extra fee for the week that we wanted. At the presentation we were promised that the certificate is good for any time of year. The hotel manager refused to grant us drop off back at the Cancun airport. We were told at the presentation that the pickup and drop off is included. At presentation we were told that the certificate gives us the same benefits that we would get if we owned time share at the Hotel. That was not true since transportation to Playa Del Carmen was not granted to us - only for Time Shares. The same apply to tour discounts. Manager explained to us that this is agency's fault. I do not think that this is entirely true since the Hotel is using the Agency to feel the rooms. Speaking about Time Share deals that they have: They offered us a deal for 30 year, no maintenance, flexible week. For 20,000 USD. At best, we would probably visit the property half of the time (15 times). Considering average stock market return of 10% a year, the 20,000 over 30 year period would of return $200,000 inflation adjusted. So the single week at the resort would cost $200,000 / 15 = 13,000 USD!!!!!! So avoid financial prison of the Time Share!

Reviews.Title: “Just mediocre - Could be good, but is not”
Reviews.Author: thxsparrow
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days on the last part of our latest trip to Mexico - with my wife and son - and it certainly does not compare well with some of the places we have been on Riviera Maya. The grounds are attractive, but the layout is a bit daft, and some areas are just unfinished. The restaurants really are an imbarassment - the Asian fusion one is very bad - the chef should be publicly humilated. The Italian was only marginally better, as was the Mexican, but still both are on the verge of inedible. The ingredients were good, but the execution was just so bad. The wood-fired pizza and the evening grill were the only good food aspects. (They really should fix this problem, because they are destoying their return business). The sports bar has two pool tables, but neither have a complete set of balls. The water park has a "river" to snorkel and kayak, some cenotes to hike to, that are fun, and a bit out of the ordinary, but restricted to tours, rather than doing this on your own. We got to know the young "kids" who ran things there and they were very accomodating to us, though. The beach is not all that terrible as some have described. Not a real volleyball crowd at all, and mostly pickup water polo. We didn't get pressured beyond the first 10 minutes about the timeshare (regardless of what they want to call it) offer, but we made it clear we were not there to sit through anything, since it was our vacation - and did not get bothered at all. All in all - just average - and not an experience you need to repeat. I would suggest to the management that they really need to get things fixed on the food level as it is really bad - it just is....You really ought to be able to at least do good Mexican food - right?

Reviews.Title: “Barbie Loved this Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ATLBarbie
Reviews.Content: My best Friend and I took a Girl's getaway. We enjoyed the resort as it had something for everyone to do. My Friend and I were treated very well and really relaxed with plenty of great food and drinks. The Amenities are great Adults and Children as they have a section designated for adults. We enjoyed two days at their Luxurious Spa and the services and Staff (Angeles and Jazmin) were well beyond what we ever expected. Best Massages ever. The food was good but the options offer variety. Miguel Sotelo and Gregory both went above and beyond. They really know how to make you feel welcomed and the Resort was top notch..... We will be visiting this resort again as we are planning my 20th wedding Anniversary and this is a place where I am DEFINITELY considering. I have to lose those 10 pounds I gained before I can begin planning... LOL! Well worth the time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation at a fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: robinhffmn
Reviews.Content: This is the third year we have spent our vacation at Hacienda Tres Rios. We are always treated like we are the most important people at the resort. The resort is very peaceful and never feels crowded even though we were told it was completely sold out for that week. We never had to wait in lines for any of the restaurants and we received excellent service especially by Gregory, Yanira and Ramon in all of the various restaurants. Oscar, the Executive Chef, and his kitchen staff do a fantastic job serving wonderful food and creating great dishes. All of the staff in the hotel are extremely friendly and do everything they can to get you what you want or need. Samuel Vargas is the Food and Beverage Director and he is magnificent! He seeks you out daily to say "hello" and ensures you have everything to make your stay a special one. I cannot say enough great things about Samuel, he makes the vacation special. Hacienda Tres Rios is definitely a five diamond resort!

Reviews.Title: “At all costs - go somewhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: karjugo
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI Exchange - it was easy for us to secure a 2 bedroom for a 2 bedroom. We have been exchanging for all-inclusives since 1989. This place reminded us of the very first few exchanges we made way back then when the concept of all-inclusive was a new one and everyone had to work it out. HTR has a lot to work out!!! 1.) Drinks - advertised international premium brands but even when you asked for Jack Daniel they still gave you the local brand, and that was true at every restaurant and bar. Their failure to produce as advertised caused you to continually confront and get into arguments. 2.) This is an all-inclusive that advertised tips included. But their workers all expect tips per duty performed even miner ones, which again is something we saw way back in the beginning of all-inclusives. Not to say through the years we haven' tipped at all-inclusives but it was for exemplary service, food and drinks. 3.) Food presentations were truly lovely but choices were really out there. My family eats simple meat and potato things. We all went to the Mexican Restaurant and no one could find anything that they wanted to order from the menu. I had to ask what could we have that was just plain simple beef? We were then offered beef fajitas and my kids were happy. We never ate at the Asian Restaurant because my husband and I scoped out the menu ahead of time and found nothing to order as written. The Italian restaurant entrees were our favorite, but we all created our own combos from the menu choices. Their desserts were the best!!!! Ask for Gabriel - he does a great flaubee. The Hacienda Grill was my husbands favorite cause you could dress casual there. 4.) The Mexican, Asian and Italian really make the men and the teenagers dress to eat there....but their flexibility is a little off. They insist on pants but jeans are accepted. As for tops, my guys got in with polo shirts, and even solid v-neck t-shirts. For shoes, dock-siders were allowed but not sandals or sneakers. 5.) The Paris Cafe was a favorite. Xavier could be bribbed to produce a plate of chocolate covered strawberries just for me for a $5 tip nightly. Well that were some highlights - all in all - the hassels that you had to go through all the time were frustrating!!! As for value this was the most expensive time share all inclusive we have ever spent. Definitely not worth the additional amount. Perhaps if it was like a $1,000 dollars cheaper than the others then maybe the shortfalls could be justified. We love the Palace Resorts and have stayed at 3 different ones for a total of 7 times to date. We kind of wanted to try something different and regretted it totally all week long. If you are pleased with the Palace Resorts such as Moon Palace then do not go to HTC - you will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort on the mayan riviera”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_St-Maurice
Reviews.Content: Nice resort, quite new, nestled in the mangrove. The resort's buildings seems big (to my standards) but in the trips from/to airport, stopping at other resorts, we saw that it was definitely not the largest, which is good. The place never felt too crowded, no need to fight to find a lounge chair by one of the pools. The food was good. Staff was very friendly. A good bang for the buck to get some sun and just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand - There are much better resorts”
Reviews.Author: protolific
Reviews.Content: The facilities are very not nice but that's all with this resort. Also, if you're not a member of the resort (time share), you're treated like a 2nd class citizen. FOOD - 1 Star One word HORRIBLE. It would have been better had I brought some canned food on the trip, seriously. There wasn't one meal that tasted really good. The chef needs to be fired or revamp the entire menu. My wife and I stayed at Secrets Capri last year and the food was so much better. One Tip: specialize on one type of cuisine (like mexican) rather than doing a poor job with Italian and Asian dishes. FACILITIES - 4 Stars The resort is well maintained and looks very beautiful. The suites are large and very clean. BEACH - 1 Star Because of the mangroves, the beach is black and smells like rotten eggs. SERVICE - 1 Star None of the waiters know how to take orders and some are RUDE, especially at the Hacienda Grill. Almost every order came back wrong and the service is extremely SLOOOW.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ahensman
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (14 years) and I went on a five night all inclusive trip to this resort. Accommodation, staff, food and the nightly entertainment were excellent. The resort has several activities for young and old. My son was greatly entertained all through the day. There are a few trips that are free with the hotel. i.e. Bicycle Tour, Kayaking and Snorkeling which are great. If you get a chance to visit this hotel, you have to meet Osiris and his staff who are in charge of the entertainment. Fantastic crew. Arul (Joel's Dad)

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Artists”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelingdr
Reviews.Content: Took a time share sales tour of this facility on my last stay in Playa and though I did not buy here, the manager personally came over and offered us the opportunity to purchase a certificate to come back and stay at this resort. Knowing how these sales people are, I specifically asked if it was to stay at this resort (Hacienda Tres Rios) and if there would be any additional charges upon making the reservaction. The Manager said it was for His resort (Hacienda Tres Rios) and there would be no additional charges incurred at time of reservation or checkout. Finding the facilities very nice, we purchased the 5 day four night package, however upon trying to use it, I was informed that the certificate will only allow us to stay at a property of CancunTravelNow in Cancun and if we want to stay at Tres Rios, an additional cost of hundreds of dollars would be incurred. They LIE to you here and try to cheat you. I would never recommend this place to anybody! If they treat prospective guests like this, just think how they must treat you when they already have your money and you are staying there. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “:The Place to stayand”
Reviews.Author: HenchmanUSA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a GREEN HOTEL so they are managing beach reclamation. If you need a larger they gladly bring you to FISHERMEN'S closer to town, BUT why go? Great Pools, cenotes (9). Kayaking, and all the amenities of any great hotel. They also have OSCARS KITCHEN, an upgrade. You name it and it arrives in a seven course meal They had a discount promotion this week so we went. At least a $400 value in NYC or Washington DC. Staff are tops. Martin the perfect server. Sammy and Herman are terrific managers. The people are soooooooooo friendly, we must mention, Luis Alejandro and his crew including Francisco and Trini. The front desk has Helen, Jaquira and several other charming hosts/ When you get there say hi to Hector, consierge.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful warnings to future guests”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds0508
Reviews.Content: Before I begin with my experience please understand that the resort itself is nice, it is what happened that is not. As we arrived our 2 rooms that we requested were neither ready or the ones with the hot tub as planned. We had to wait an hour and during this time were pressured into their timeshare presentation. About an hour later we were told to go to our rooms without the bell boy (who came 40minutes later with luggage) no hot tub rooms and were told they had none available and acted like no big deal. 10hrs of traveling so I was not in the mood to argue and kid's were already upset(what a way to start a vacation) next day we did the timeshare presentation...WARNING!!! DON'T DO IT! it took 4hrs and they bring you to what I call the "Torture room" at the end. We were promised 2 people paid golfing and they even set up the tee time. The next day my husband and son excited to golf find out AFTER they get to the unpromised golf resort that it was going to not only cost them another $100 bucks but also $60 for shoes...now remember they were sent to another course that was not as good. I voiced respectfully my concerns and the resort did not care. I was once proud to be going to HTR but now realized they only want you to buy into them. Beach is horrible and steam hut not working and half the activities not available as they say on website. I am not a hard person to please but this trip was a very special trip for my family and I work hard for my money so when I spend that much I do expect quality and you don't get what you see on website.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lockwoodsam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequest travelers to Mexico and enjoy all-inclusive. We have been to at least 10 resorts through out Mexico and HTR is by far the best. I am not inclined to write lenghty reviews, but if you want a top notch resrt with above average accomadations, food and drink, you will not be disappointed here. Resort is a little thin on entertainment (shows in evening) and they should do a better job informing about included tours and activities. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best place around the playa del Carmen area nothing can beat it”
Reviews.Author: JamesH49
Reviews.Content: Sorry but won't have enough room to write how excellent your stay would be at the Hacienda tres rios. First off I will start with the service it was impeccable and the food was the best compliments to the chef. The whole resorts was clean and well taken care of, the rooms where so nice and also clean and well maintaned. All the staff no matter what area of the resort they work at they made you feel like home a big thanks to all the staff. I would also like to mention a big thanks to Samuel who was always there if you needed something and got it done for you, also a big shout out to the man Pablo that made our stay there very nice and made us feel welcome the whe time we where there. So if was to have rate this place I would have to give it more Than 10 out of 10 thats for sure. Thanks to everone for the beautiful stay at the Hacienda Tres Rios

Reviews.Title: “this was the best hotel for a beach wedding.”
Reviews.Author: jlevymd
Reviews.Content: just returned from hacienda tres rios for my daughters' wedding. we had 150 guests and all felt the experience was the best they have ever had. we are from new jersey, but had guests arrive from all over the world. the staff, in particular luis torres, the banquet manager, and the wedding coordinator, allibe, exceeded our expectations. We had dinner on the beach on thursday, rehearsal dinner by the pool on friday, and a 10 hour wedding, again on the beach, on saturday. Food, drinks, and most importantly staff, were the most hard working and friendly group i have been priviledged to enjoy. This was the first "beach wedding" for them, but the dance floor, tables, and flowers were just what we wanted. Our guests will be returning, bringing their kids and grandchildren, since it is all inclusive, has excellent baby sitters, and even a kids camp. rooms are very comfortable and extremely clean, and the pools are fabulous. I would encourage all size wedding parties, who want a true beach wedding, to contact luis or allibe and get started on the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but warning about presentation!”
Reviews.Author: km67Ontario
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at Tres Rios over Christmas. Great service, nice accomodations, great food! Our teenagers and pre-teens had lots to do and loved the rivers, kayaks and volleyball. Our WARNING is about the presentation we attended as RCI members. We attended a very long presentation/tour, and at the end decided to purchase because the fees were lower than our other timeshare. We were also purchasing with the condition that we could sell them our present timeshare, When it was determined that we had to give our home resort first chance to buy, we were "promised" that the salesman and his supervisor would be able to help us sell our timeshare. HOWEVER, after repeated emails with NO response whatsoever, we are disappointed about the claims made, and regretful that we bought without selling first! Stupidity on our part we admit, but it would have been nice to receive some kind of response, at least acknowledging that they could not help us or something!!! This experience has left us tainted about Tres Rios, which is unfortunate, because we did enjoy the Resort. We would caution anyone going to a presentation to not believe what is being promised, or at least take it with a grain of salt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort truly "Green" with well above average services!”
Reviews.Author: madowl
Reviews.Content: Long. My wife and I went down on a special 5 days, 4 night’s package deal. The service was exceptional. Everyone from the Management to housekeeping was more than friendly and helpful. Rooms were beautiful as was the rest of the resort. Everyone was friendly, personable and very professional. All the different venues for food were also top notch and beautifully presented. Room service was great and we even got a free bottle of good wine for nothing. Outside excursions provide a wealth of information on saving money and getting the best. Many things could be improved upon which is true of every resort or hotel. The difference is that they openly asked for feedback on what to improve. I am an Environmental Specialist and expert on Wetlands. I am always skeptical of "Green" used as a description. This was really a "Green" resort. They have tailored their construction to allow water to move into the huge expanse of Mangrove wetlands that they have miraculously restored after the 2005 Hurricane that devastated the area. Small remnants of non-managed Mangrove looks like it was "nuked" so their efforts have created a rich, diverse ecological zone witnessed by a wide and diverse population of birds, mammals, reptiles and amphibians.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous trip and the resort was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: c18Lubich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a studio suite at the Hacienda Tres Rios and it was plenty big enough for the two of us. He enjoyed the very large walk in shower and I loved the jacuzzi on the deck. Coffee and coffee pot in the room could very well be an upgrade. We did enjoy the coffee shop and the two gentlemen Javier & Ivin where outstanding employee's. Location was alittle too far away from Playa Del Carmen and I feel that more shuttle service would be nice. The best part of the resort was the All Inclusive Dining at the Italian & Grill & Pizza restauraunts. The least thing we liked was that we could not get picked up at the lobby by other tours that we booked outside the resort. We had to walk the very long driveway to meet the bus at the main gate. What was odd they would drop us off at the lobby on our return. At least after a long day out we did not have to make the walk back. My husband and I also took advantage of the Spa and enjoyed that very much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, has flaws.”
Reviews.Author: P00ty
Reviews.Content: *Exhale* ..this is going to be a long one. I will preface this review by telling you the dynamic of our party. I traveled with my wife (I am 31 and my wife is 28) and what was supposed to be another couple but turned out to just be one of them. By no means were we looking for a week long drunk fest but what we found here was not exactly what we were looking for which was a relaxing week in paradise. Rooms: The rooms are top notch. Definitely the highlight of the resort. The resorts website gives a pretty accurate description of the rooms. We had a huge suite (one of the biggest on the resort I believe) and an adjoining room for the other couple. We had a jetted jacuzzi overlooking the ocean literally 3 steps from my side of the California king size bed. The beds are pillow top and very comfortable. The bathrooms were the size of my bedroom at home and it featured a separate toilet area and a huge shower with beautiful tile everywhere. Maid service was excellent and they even come by nightly for turn down service. Unfortunately we didnt come to Mexico to spend a week in our room... Upon arrival we were greeted by Mariana at the front desk. We arrived around 7pm. She got us checked in and gave us our all inclusive bracelets. We immediately went to our room(s) and ordered room service. The room service was fabulous ( I will touch on the food more later) the first night. The next day as we were waiting for the rest of our party we hung out at the pool. There is an adult only pool which no one adhered to the "adult only" part. The other pool is clearly where all the action is. Daily water polo, water volleyball games etc. The pool side service is ok I guess. There is a slew of guys always coming around wanting to get you a drink. As another reviewer posted they use plastic cups that I personally witnessed not being washed. They dip just the rim in a sanitizer solution very briefly. I also witnessed them filter water out of cups with their hands to re-use the ice. I ALSO witnessed the waiters re-use limes that hadnt been squeezed. This became a reoccuring theme. The waiters (not all because I talked to a few and some of them are genuinely sweet and honest hard workers) are sleaze balls. I witnessed several of them just staring at girls in bikinis and giving preferential treatment to "hot" younger girls. In one instance they kept calling one of the ladies in our party "lady" so she responded by calling him "guy". Now I know we are "gringos" and dont know a ton of spanish but I clearly heard him call her a derogatory name. I dont need to know a bunch of spanish to know that it was the equivalent to a "female dog" in english. The timeshare presentation: So we were staying on an RCI exchange. There were no problems booking or exchanging. No issues checking in or different treatment being an exchange so that was good. I was supposed to attend the presentation one day but my wife wanted no part of it. The refused to let me do it because she wouldnt attend. Ok. Fine with me. lol. At this point it was a few days into our trip and I knew there was a zero chance of buying here because it just wasnt for us, so I was ok with this. I dont think they were. Our initial concierge Helen was nice. She greeted us the first day with a bunch of brochures and information about the resort etc. Everything else they did was with the obvious intention of getting us to that presentation. Helen was off for a couple days during our stay and we were helped by Nora. I found Nora to be very "in your face" and borderline rude (sorry Nora). Anyways, they were of no help during our stay. Upon initial meeting with Helen we were given "gold bracelets" on top of our all inclusive bracelets. These were supposed to be so we could experience what owners experience. Special perks etc. They were absolutely worthless. The concierges dont help you experience the area by GENUINELY helping you find the cheapest ways to get around or to go out to see the sites or what not. All they do is try to sell you the "touristy" packages for astronomical prices. For those of you who have been to mexico they are no different than the people that greet you at the airport and try to sell you things. I have a terrible fear of being taken advantage of and had hoped that our "personal concierge" would actually be of help. They were no different than the people that I spoke of. For instance we arranged with the entertainment staff to go out to Playa Del Carmen one night. Osirus was our chaperone from the hotel We went out with a group of people to Coco Bongo (fabuous by the way). The communication was terrible. We got to Playa and some people had bought tickets previously. One of the gentlemen in our group (an older guy, 50 or so) said he didnt realize that this was a loud club as opposed to a bar. He said he would like to return to the hotel. Osirus told him nope, sorry he couldnt take the free shuttle back and that he was on his own until 4am when the shuttle would return for everyone else. He brought no money with him and was just stranded. I honestly dont know what happened to him. We paid 60 dollars each to get in this place. Upon talking to a couple of women who rode into town with us I found out they paid 100 dollars each. Its this kind of lack of communication and that overwhelming sense of being taken advantage of that will prevent me from returning to this resort. Food: The first nights room service was excellent. The next evening we went to the italian restaurant. It was moderate. Every morning for breakfast we had the buffet. It was decent. Lots of fresh fruits but again nothing special. After a day or two we realized that all of the food comes from the same kitchen and to be honest by the end of our trip we couldnt stand the food anymore. None of it was outstanding. It was all just average. For $130/day or whatever the all inclusive works out to it was just not worth it. Not to mention the "late night" room service (after 11pm) was inedible. I wouldnt be surprised if housekeeping or the concierge made it. Of course this has nothing to do with the fact that my wife and her friend got food poisoning from the beef medallions from the grill. Food prep and sanitary practices are not top priority at all. Beach: Everyone else is right, the beach is not the clear blue water you find everywhere else in Cancun/surrounding areas. I think this might have to do with the long dock and rock jetty(?) that kind of creates a cove of sorts for the resort. I think a lot of sediment and rock gets washed up in this area. As a matter of fact I saw a hotel employee removing rocks from the beach one day for safety. It is a short walk down the beach to the next resort to experience a clear blue ocean that is swimable. This really wasnt. The "sports bar" is a joke. A few tvs and one bartender but it needs something. Not quite sure what but I didnt enjoy it. I feel like I have gone on long enough. I wanted to like this place. I really did. Normally I am not picky at all. I just assumed with all these 4 and 5 star reviews that I would be experiencing paradise. The grounds are immaculate. At least I can say that. If you are a young family with children under 15 or so, this may be for you. If you are a young couple or dont want to be tied down to the resort this place is not for you. A cab ride to Playa del Carmen is 200 pesos minimum and to Cancun it is closer to 500 pesos. EACH WAY! They say they have free shuttle service to Playa del Carmen. What they dont tell you is that it is free at designated times no later than like 12:30pm and you have to pay to come back. If you want to venture out, do a day trip to Cozumel or go out at night you will have to pay a pretty penny. One last thing, this place claims to be eco-friendly and "green" but it is far from it. Paper towels everywhere (as opposed to hand dryers). They ask you to hang your towels if you dont want them to be switched out so we did that. They still gave us new ones. We are from Seattle. I mean we know a little bit about this stuff. They didnt recycle or anything that I noticed. I dont know, it wasnt a big deal, just something I thought I should point out. I know this review is kind of sporadic and all over the place but you can see from my other reviews that I am not normally this negative. Please feel free to ask me any questions that you may have about my review.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome kids club BUT service needs work”
Reviews.Author: FEOHIO
Reviews.Content: Was a great trip, my son who is 8 enjoyed every minute at the kids club! We exchanged a week through RCI and found out as I am use to the check in process was very slow and confused the hotel team, even with a pre payment and full paper work. Time share tour encouragement started immediately without water or offer of beverage at check-in. We had better than expected food quality and accommodations. Rooms were extremely clean, comfortable, and new. Service was spotty at best and I found that you had to find the right team member to get the right service and tip heavily even though we were told tips were included in the all inclusive package. Can't say enough about the on property tours, pool activities, and kids club!! Beach was lacking the clear blue waters you may expect from this coast, clearest waters were in the cenotes (spring fed ponds) and rivers. Overall a really great place for family fun!

Reviews.Title: “very restful vacation place”
Reviews.Author: vancouverthoughts
Reviews.Content: What I liked the most was the beauty and tranquilness of this place. I would like to mention the resort clean grounds, beautiful landscape, 90%polite employees ( liked a lot Miquel from the Oscar's team for his very fast and good services), good food, and very good showers. We had an awesome trip to Chichenitza with the very knowledgeable and friendly Orlando (he was probably the only one who indeed deserved a substantial tip!).
