One our way to Chichenitza, we stopped to a very unusual eating place that although was looking shabby, was clean and had real tomatoes and cheese, and lots of very tasty fresh vegetables so I could have a wonderful meal (they had also lots of cooked food, but that was in the resort too); there have been few kids dancing traditional dances while we had lunch and I liked their performance and costumes- that part of Mexico is very poor and it really impressed me to see those kids being so serious about their work ! Now back to the Hacienda resort, it helped me to take my dryer (thanks to the lady who wrote about this on tripadvisor!) and it would have helped me also to have some disposable paper cups because all the drinks outside the building were served in plastic cups which unfortunately were kind of dirty; few times I also noticed that the back of the plates were dirty and once I found a hair in my food ( I showed that to the person who served us without making too much fuss because I know accidents may happen but I didn't give any tip), and one day, as I was looking after a shoe in my room, I saw under a piece of furniture half of an apple that was looking kind of being there for a while, so definitely they have to be more careful with their cleaning and have disposable paper cups( that are recyclable). They should consider that the paper cups would be a better protection for everyone in case of a viral or bacterial infection in the resort (there are lots of kids!). There have been few employees that were far away from elementary politeness (doesn't want to recall those moments again to ruin my day!). In conclusion,I'll go again at Hacienda because overall I had a very good vacation, there have been employees that really made our vacation very enjoyable, I liked a lot Oscar's meals, the restaurants, the beach, the music (sometimes jazz in the afternoon), the cenotes, the river and the pools with ocean water. And I don't want to forget, there were no mosquitoes (we had a protective spray because somebody on tripadvisor complained, but we didn't use it! that was good!)

Reviews.Title: “A great trip overall!”
Reviews.Author: lcorb2626
Reviews.Content: What an amazing trip! Our goal was to go to Mexico for Spring Break without experiencing the Spring Breakers! :) We have 2 girls ages 10 and 13 so we were looking for something a little quieter. We did. This hotel is off the beaten path- about 15 minutes to Playa by cab, about 40 minutes to the airport. I used a transfer service from the airport to the hotel- playadelcarmentransfers.com, and it was cheaper than the $45 pp that BookIt wanted me to pay. It was $130 for an Expedition that met us at the airport and picked us up when we were ready to leave. We had Mauricio- what a great guyy! Anyway, the resort is cool but if you have been to Cancun and are expecting the same beach, it is not like that. The 3 rivers at the resort feed into the ocean here so the water is darker and at some points, stinky. Mind you, the kids still got in the water albeit cold. The red flags were up at the main beach and we did not swim there. The tours offered by the hotel were cool- we did the kayaking/snorkeling and the bike tour- we enjoyed them both. GIovanna was a sweetheart and the guy, I forget his name, well, my daughter's thought he was cute :) Service was awesome- best waiter/pool boy was Ignatio (Nacho) and we became quick friends with him. The gentleman at the cafe/patisserie, Alejandro, was a very pleasant man as well. Vanessa at the front desk was very helpful, Armando at the mexican restaurant upstairs was sweet. He even gave my girls some snails and a swan made from melted stir sticks! We also each got a 30 min massage for free (had to pay $12 in taxes but no biggie)- best massage ever by Jazmin! We truly enjoyed ourselves and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lame 'Resort'”
Reviews.Author: TruePlyr
Reviews.Content: Wow. this place is Lame. staff and valets were all very friendly but the place itself just blows. Did the people who designed this place consider putting a Bar outside? There are no swim up pool bars and not one bar outside where you can sidle up and grab a seat and meet other guests. Yes, you can have a drink outside from a waiter who will go to a makeshift bar (two fold out tables and some coolers where your drink gets made). I was astonished that I couldn't sit at a bar outside while on vacation at a "resort" on the Caribbean sea. it doesn't make any sense to me. the staff will tell you that there's a bar outside at the Grill but there is no bar to sit at. just some crappy tables and waiter service. the whole design of the place seems like non existent. the one actual bat that you can sit at is a crappy 'sports bar'. zero charm. so again, there is no tropical or outdoor bar in the whole place. the dining room and fancy Mexican restaurant are again generic and not romantic in the slightest. who designed this place?? did they run out of money after building the structure and just put zero thought into the design?? other than the water being light blue you might as well be anywhere. our friends were staying at the Grand Mayan just up the road and it was like a different world. absolutely gorgeous lobby and stunning pool areas with swim up bars and amazing settings to enjoy indoors and out. the restaurant del lago was beautiful open air where the buffet is and it's just a stunningly designed space similar to the stunning lobby which is an 80ft high palapa. gorgeous. Hacienda is so generic and does nothing to make you feel like you are in a Caribbean resort. Once you see the other options nearby you would never choose this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ftheron
Reviews.Content: We recently went there for two weeks on an all-inclusive basis. The resort offers a lot and almost all of the people working there were incredible. Going to the resort you NEED TO do it on an all-inclusive basis otherwise you would be paying 5* prices for 3*-4* food. The beach was nothing short of terrible (compared to other resorts on the Riviera). Laundry services is ludicrously expensive and if you take kids with you, the cost for getting a one-piece washed and dried for a 10 month old is the same as a sport shirt for an adult (something they should do better at as someone selling themselves as a “5* family” resort). When I questioned the “concierge” about this and mentioned I am not willing to pay these prices, we were told that they will call in the police and that what I do not pay, will be deducted from the salary of the employee who delivered our laundry to our room. Not really 5* treatment for both customers and employees. Will not return to this resort and in future will rather fly to back to actual 5* resorts such as the ones you find in the Maldives.

Reviews.Title: “It was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Westspanishfork
Reviews.Content: We went with friends to Hacienda Tres Rios March 23, 2011 . I've never done an all inclusive before and wasn't sure what to expect. The grounds were beautiful. The service exceptional. The food was so good I dont know were to start. I asked that we not be approached for time share sales. I was very pleased it was never mentioned to us. I would go back again in a heartbeat. I want to take my children back. It was a very family oriented place also. I was so impressed. It gets 5 stars from us. submitted from Spanish fork, Utah

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully relaxing, spacious and beautiful all - inclusive resort for a Family get-away”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary13
Reviews.Content: Our time at Tres Rios more than met our expectations ! From the solitude and peacefulness of the well layed out location in a Nature Park, to the friendly service we received in all areas, to the many fun and educational activities we participated in, and the great variety of food and restaurant options (without long waits), our family was very impressed. The staff made an effort to get to know you and include you in activites (especially the kids and teenagers), and it was a happy atmosphere all around. The Pool areas are fabulous , with excellent bar service and wonderful drinks for children and adults. Never too busy , even though we were visitng dring spring break We really loved how well spaced everything was to allow some privacy while sitting at the beach or poolside. We viewed several other resorts dowm the way while strolling the beach, and they felt very crowded- row upon row of lounge chairs, and not nearly as attractive for relaxation. The main beach itself was not particularly lovely to swim in (due to the close proximity to the rivers which carried sediment deposits from the Mangroves,) However, the clear river areas and cenotes were amazing - warm and fun to swim and snorkel in. Just need to watch the current going out to the ocean. We also enjoyed sailing on the Hobie Cat a couple of times - lots to do! Very scenic this part of the beach - you felt very away from the rest of the world! Our room was lovely - spacious and modern. The evening shows and events varied nightly, so kept us well entertained .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hospitality and services I was in touch with all nature and be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: linStrait
Reviews.Content: visit the cenotes and the oriental restaurant! it was amazing the personal there its awesome and all the installations are for relax!

Reviews.Title: “All-Inclusives are the way to go and this one is at the top of my list”
Reviews.Author: crumbledcupmosaics
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios was a fabulous all-inclusive resort and one I would definitely recommend. The rooms were very upscale and lived up to their photos on the website, and the pool was very large and meandering, plenty of room for everyone,although there was no swim-up bar&#41. The food was very good and there was a good amount of variety although we would not have wanted to stay more than four nights because I think we would have tired of it a bit after that. The pizza restaurant was particularly good. The buffet was a bit bland but the restaurants were all very good. One thing they don't advertise that we thoroughly enjoyed was a ride in a catamaran that is included in the price of your stay. They are down on the beach every day giving half hour rides, don't miss it, you just have to sign up and wait your turn. We also took the kayak tour which was very enjoyable;although very disorganized. We went on an off-site tour one day and they offered to pack us a box lunch, how nice was that? It was fairly meager but it was free and came in very handy. I would recommend that you tell them what you would like in it if you do this. Another thing we thoroughly enjoyed were the "beds", yes beds they put on the beach for their guests to enjoy. There's a picture of them on the website. They had a canopy on the top. You can't imagine how nice it is to lay on the pillows, shaded from the sun, listening to the ocean crash on the shore. Take a book, take a nap, but don't miss enjoying those beds on the ocean, they were simply marvelous. Even better was the fact that occasionally a waiter would come by and ask if we'd like a drink. Would we like a drink? Of course we would!

Reviews.Title: “They're doing nearly everything right, but here's the thing...”
Reviews.Author: palindroma
Reviews.Content: For the price, I was pretty impressed with the hotel, service, spa, food, and rooms. The beds are heavenly. A lot (though not all) of the food is downright good (the grill, Mexican, and Italian restaurants). They're doing nearly everything right, but here's the thing... the beach is just not nice. I know that doesn't seem like that big of a deal. You're still at a gorgeous resort and there's an absolutely lovely pool, not to mention the fact that you'll also be swimming in unlimited margaritas. But my husband and I have stayed in Playa del Carmen before and now I realize that the insanely, unreasonably beautiful water is the main draw for us. We walked down 5 or so resorts and you're not just a few beaches away from something nice, although it gets nicer the farther away you get from HTR. I would recommend making it a shorter trip or taking a half-step down in hotel quality in order to stay at a hotel on a great beach. The nice beaches in Playa del Carmen are among the best in the world. If you can't? You'll probably enjoy the resort, but avert your eyes from the beach while you're downtown or you'll be heartbroken.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: MLM2011
Reviews.Content: Overall, a wonderful resort. I'll break down our experience for you: Food: We tried all of the restaurants except for the Italian. We ate breakfast at either the International Buffet or the Hacienda Grill each day. Both offered a wide variety of breakfast items. For lunch we enjoyed the Il Forno Pizzeria and the Hacienda Grill, both of which can be delivered to you poolside by one of the very attentive waiters. We ate at a different restaurant each night. On our arrival day there was a Welcoming Party outside that offered a buffet and live entertainment. Food, weather and music were all great! The second night we tried Kotori and were very pleased. The third night we tried the mexican cuisine, El Alebrije. This was the most unimpressive meal we had all week. However, after not eating much of our meal we wandered down to get some snacks from the buffet and were perfectly content. There was another party on the beach our fourth night which offered another buffet outside. The food was ok but the scenery and weather were better. We loved being able to eat outside on the beach and enjoy the warm breeze. Our last night we reserved a special lobster dinner (included in our all inclusive plan) at the Hacienda Grill. Delicous! I recommend doing this when you're there. You can choose which restaurant you want to have the dinner at except for Porto Bello, the Italian restaurant. Also, some late nights we would order room service which had a large selection and was delivered within 30-45 minutes. Service: All of the servers at the resort were timely, attentive and wanting the please the guests. We did not have any trouble getting good service. We did tip throughout the week but it didn't exceed $100. Everyone worked so hard to make sure we had everything we needed. We left very pleased. Spa: This was the only place where the service was not up to par. We had the 30 minute massages that were included in our package. Each person paid $12 that included tax and gratuity and can NOT be paid at the spa. It gets attached to your room and you pay when you check out. If you choose to pay with US Dollars you will receive change in Pesos. Unfortunately for us, our massage therapists whispered to each other throughout the entire massage. We were disappointed since you can't exactly relax when that's going on. This same experience happened to the couple we were traveling with. Cleanliness: The place was spotless. At one point we got into an elevator while the cracks of the floor were being scrubbed. Of course, if you choose to eat outside there will be flies nearby. I didn't notice it bothering me though. Also, keep in mind any food left unattended will be snached up by the birds that watch around the pool area. Room: Our room was just as the pictures looked. We had a Mangrove Junior Suite which included a jacuzzi on our balcony. We were on the corner of the building which looked over the parking lot. However, we also had a second balcony due to being on the corner. Both views were great with one overlooking the entire resort and the other looking over the forest and the ocean in the distance. The beds were so very comfortable and we were able to sleep great every night. We never received the "pillow menu" that the website talks about but found ourselves not needing it. The pillows on the bed were comfortable. Nature Park: We toured the nature park by bicycles one afternoon. We were shown the several cenotes on the property and also the nursery. We went on a short kayaking tour one afternoon which was enoyable. The water is crystal clear. We also took a 30 minute sailboat trip on the ocean where we could see straight to the bottom the whole time. The resort also offers snorkeling. We would recommend the resort to any families or singles that don't mind being around children. There is an adult only pool that is much quieter than the other pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: bnd1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place. Great food. We stayed in July 2009 but the site didn't give me the option to pick that far back. This place has lots to offer. Take advantage of everything! Swimming in the cenotes was a great experience. Everything they offered was fun. The pool was very nice. The beach wasn't so good. It was rocky. Staff members were always a pleasure. Beautiful property. Remember to make reservations early for things to do as well as places to eat so you get the most out of your vacation. The all inclusive was pretty pricey but we went when it was first opening so we got some really good promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Great People & Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ferozeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed early in March at Tres Rios (Three Rivers). We found that all the staff were highly professional and customer service oriented. the hotel is family oriented, lots of kid activities on site. Hotel is located at a unique location with three rivers on site and cenotay where you can swim, snorkel in fresh water, beautiful pool area (for both adults and families with kids) and white sand beach. Most amazing thing we found at the beach were canopied beds. Oh! you can enjoy all day in the amazing backdrop of sea, sub, blue skies, white sand and food. Restaurants on site are amazing. Asian fusion, Italian (the best), Mexican, La Isla Casa - a buffet, and Hacienda Grill. Food choices are abundant. We don't drink so no comments. In Asian restaurant we came across Alfonso - he made us feel very special at the restaurant. Food was so great that we wanted to taste all, he made us a special platter and brought in all we wanted to eat. At italian restaurant Gabriel with his flambe (fires up alcohol and pour it on cake) was a treat to see. The food was just great at the site. Th Mexican restaurant was another treat to be in, Gilberto served us. The cleaning services were amazing, every day they would come in a leave a towelled animal behind it was so cute. The turn down service at night left us some amazing candies. There were two more people that I wanted to write Samuel and Chef Oscar, I will write a separate review. all in all it was an amazing experience. +

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: GGKA2011
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 nights of stay at this resort. All I can tell you we will never ever go back there. The food and service was below average. I got sick there and spent 2 days in bed throwing up!! This resort is nothing as they advertise and brag about. There are flies all around the food in their restaurants and especially around their breakfast buffet food selection!!! Although they claime they have 7 restaurants, they all share the same kitchen and the food tastes the same in all 7!!! The only nice thing about this place is the kids acitivities and the rivers around the hotel. The ocean is dirty and the entire time we were there not one person was in it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "kid friendly" resort, and very overrated!”
Reviews.Author: NakedRealty
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Hacienda Tres Rios, as I went down with my family on a time share presentation deal. When I booked through the representative from Sunset, he told me that this place would "blow me away", as he classed it as a 5 star resort. So of course, I went in with extremely high expectations, which may have been part of the problem, because I was hugely "underwhelmed" by the experience. First, for those wondering about the time share presentation, it did take about 3 hours, but by making it clear at the beginning, that we were not going to purchase anything, and that we had a really bad experience in the past, with over pushy sales people; I would say the whole ordeal was not that bad. As for the resort, there was nothing "grab you" about the place. The entrance, the foyer, the restaurants, were all very average in appearance. Nothing left us with the "wow" factor. The pools were nothing special at all. As for the main beach, it was sandy, and it did have the "King Size Beds", which I suppose was a nice touch . But the swimming was not great, as there was all this "red debris we learned is a result of the mangroves, which the kids when they went into swim, they had it all over them. It went inside their bathing suits, and was a pain to clean off. However, there was a beach, which they don't talk about, and we stumbled across which was very clean. You had to go to the far side of the resort, and cross a small river flowing into the ocean. It was quite isolated, which actually made it quite nice. Yes, I am mentioning a good thing here. My kids acted as though we were on a deserted island. That's how private it was. We were the only people on that beach. Other really good features of the resort would be the 3 rivers, which do flow into the ocean, as well as the 10 Cenotes that are there. The kids had fun in the river where it met the ocean, as you could float and let the current carry you. This was big fun for them. Yes, another positive and new experience. As for the Cenotes, only one was where you could swim. This was also a lot of fun, and a unique experience for us all. This is a big positive for the resort. However, what was disappointing, we were told that there were some very unique caves to see, as well as other Cenotes, which were not actively available to guests, as they were not completed yet??? Of interest, I took my family on a hike in the trails and visited the other Cenotes. Only one other had the clean pristine water for swimming. The others were somewhat darker, and you couldn't see in the water. My kids wanted to go swimming, but I didn't think it was a good idea. And probably a good thought, as at our last dinner, we met with a guest who was a timeshare member, and last year he and his son went for a swim in the second Cenote, and were going to make their way all the way down the river to the ocean. They were on their way, when they looked up, and there was a 7 foot crocodile on the shore of the river. Both the son and father told this story, so I believe it to be true. (Not sure if Crocodiles are in that area, but I thought I should share this story) Okay, let's talk about our room . For the most part, our room was decent. We had the Junior Suite, which had the 2 Queen beds. The beds were fairly comfortable to sleep on. The only complaint about the room was the washroom area was right next to the door entrance to the room. So, whilst I was in the shower, which has a glass door, a maid knocked at the door, and when my wife answered, I looked out, and I could see the maid plain and clear from the shower, which meant she could see me. I hope she liked the surprise! :) So, that is an issue. As well, there is no door to the washroom area for privacy. This is a concern, as my girls are 7 and 9, and we think it not proper that they see Dad in his birthday suit. With the closet complete with glass doors, being right across from the washroom, you really couldn't help but see a person getting dressed in the washroom. May not be a big deal for some, but we felt the room needed more privacy. I'm sure my kids will survive. Okay, let's talk about our ugliest moment. We are from Toronto, Canada, and therefore we were up since 2:00am EST enroute to our holiday. We arrived at the resort at roughly noon hour, Mexican time. We did have a quick bite for lunch when we arrived. But for dinner, we thought as they "bragged" about their excellent room service, and in being that we were all so tired from our travels, that we would order from room service. Hence, I called room service prior to 7:00pm, and was told it would be 45 minutes for the food. It was 8:00pm, and still no food, so I called them again. I was told the food was on the way. Waited another 20 minutes, and still no food. I called again, and was told that they were having issues with their service on this night, but the food would for sure be there within 30 minutes. By this time, my first daughter had fallen to sleep. 30 minutes now passes, and I still don't have anything. And you guessed it, now daughter number 2 has fallen to sleep. Needless to say, both my wife and I were livid, as now our girls had gone to bed with nothing to eat. The food finally arrived at just before 10:00pm. It took 3 hours!!!!! We were both so upset, that we called to speak with a hotel manager, but were politely told that the manager currently on duty couldn't speak English. This experience was horrible. Of course, our girls were going to survive the experience, but this was not necessary. If I had not been told that the food was on the way, I would have just gone to the buffet, and picked up food. Anyway, that was our worst experience. Another thing that I had to complain about, but trust me, we were not the only ones, was the lack of activities during the day around the pool, and especially in the evening. You know, I am not one who enjoys resorts where it is extremely loud, and whistles blowing all the time, and where it is just none stop. But this was the complete opposite. There was very low music playing, and hardly any activities. I would score this resort very poor in this regard. As for the evening entertainment, I should call it lack of entertainment. We met several people who actually complained to management about this. And when entertainment was over, let's say around 8:30, there was absolutely nothing happening. This was not so bad for kids our girl's age, but being 7 and 9, they didn't stay up too late to begin with. But if you had older kids, like several friends we met down there, it was terrible. Pretty much everyone spent their evenings going back to their rooms watching DVD's. Can we all give a collective "fun wow". This is a major problem at this resort. They need someone to teach them what entertaining their guests is all about. It is really a shame. And even with the performances, there was always something lacking. The one night they had what they called a circus. The performers were decent enough, but they were lacking the flair and costumes you will find at other resorts. Actually, all of the uniforms on their staff were lacking. They didn't look as nice and professional as other resorts again we have been too. This was something I noticed as soon as we arrived. On a positive note, the food was quite good. The only complaints that I would agree with, would be that there wasn't enough variety. And it might be nice to have some cold treats somewhere in the resort. Something like ice cream, would have been nice. And they had ice cream, but you had to ask for it. I'm sure most people didn't even know that they had ice cream. Another positive thing to note here was the fact that you could ask for many items not on the menu, and they would get it for you. If you wanted a lobster dinner, they would provide one for you, as long as you gave them some notice. So, this definitely was a perk!!! Anyway, this is my own personal and honest opinion of the resort. The overall sad thing is that they do have a wondeful property, and I believe they could offer so much more, so that they don't have guests writing such negative reports on their stay. Take my comments for what they are!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Puckduck
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. My husband and I brought our children ages 14, 12 and 9. We had so much to do. They loved playing volleyball on the beach and water polo. The rivers were fun to swim in and the food was out of this world. My kids loved the buffet the best but that was not a problem for us. So much to choose from!! I must say that Samuel, Ignacio and Miguel are the hardest working people we met. They really made this trip so special for my family. We will miss them. They go out of their way to make you feel right at home. This resort should feel very lucky that they have found such wonderful people working for them. Only one thing that I would avoid at all cost would be the timeshare meeting. There is a man named Brandon that was one of the rudest, most unprofessional people we have ever come in contact with. My husband and I were not intersted in buying at this time and once he realized this he became very rude and hurtful. Making hurtful and mean comments. I actually left the meeting crying. Never, NEVER go to these meetings!!!!! Overall, you can't go wrong at this resort. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible food, awesome service, not a swimming beach.”
Reviews.Author: ferriswheelboy
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the bad, because there is little. Timeshare sales people are very assertive, but just say no and get out of any meetings. They are very nice, but they have a job to do. Our balcony had no privacy as there was a spiral staircase that was our neighbors and gave them a clear view into our room and balcony (which has a spa on it). A lot of kids, seems like Disneyland on the Riviera. The beach is not your typical Cancun beach, not for swimming. Off the beaten path. If you are looking for shopping or quick jaunt to town, this may not be it. They do provide free shuttle to Playa del Carmen, about 15 minutes away. Now to the good. Food is incredible. Every restaurant, including buffet, is delicious. The service is as good as any we have had anywhere. All inclusive includes tours, food, drink, and tips. But we tip anyway due to the great service and attitudes. Clearly, they do not expect tips. Rooms are well kept, housekeeping is always working. Beds are very comfortable, down pillows, bedspreads, etc. Eco-friendly hotel. Mini bar is always stocked with your favorites. The chef will make just about anything you ask for, but really no need to go off menu. Pools are nice, but we arrived during high season and there are many kids here, maybe a plus or minus for you. Just can't say enough about the friendly staff. The food is what separates Tres Rios from other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mountains1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great service. Claudia the captain from Grill Restaurant was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stl636
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a five night stay at Hacienda Tres Rios. What a beautiful resort! This is a time-share type of resort compared to others that just do all-inclusive. We were not part of the time share membership. When we arrived, we were told our room was ready, but we needed to talk to someone to explain the resort. I told them we were not interested in the time share, but we still had to go through a short dog and pony show (about five minutes) in which I again told them we were not interested. They did not press on. We were then taken to our room which was in building four and on the mangrove side. We could still see and hear the ocean from our room. The room was very nice and the bed was amazing with its feather bed topper. The resort is very laid back and since we went over spring break, we couldn't tell it was spring break! This may not be good for people wanting a more party atmosphere, but we loved it! Very relaxing. The beach is not all that pretty, but we spend most of our time around pools when we vacation, so that was not an issue. As for the food-outstanding! The drinks-sub par. There's some top shelf liquor, but it's hard to find. All of the staff members were very friendly and helpful. The public restrooms were cleaned about every hour, which was really nice, especially in the pool area. I was really looking forward to kayaking and snorkeling in the rivers, but this had to be done through one of the tours (free of charge but you had to sign up in advance). Also wanted to go biking, but again, through a tour and they booked up before we could make a reservation. Not sure with this being an "eco friendly" resort why they don't have bikes ready for people to use at their leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: caparelli
Reviews.Content: this as been my 4 visit to tres rios now! the feeling i have the minute i check in is like visiting family with out the stress... the service provided from all staff members is spectacular! A special Thank you as always to Mr. Samuel Vargas, he is by far the most people caring and it seems that is joy is making sure you experience your dream vacation!!! Samuel makes you feel lik nothing is impossible just the way Las Vegas promotes its city!

Reviews.Title: “A Trip To Paradise”
Reviews.Content: The Haciendas Tres Rios was a vacation to remember. My wife and our friends were treated with high quality service from the time we arrived and met our valet, Orlando. We were introduced to a studio bedroom, the bathroom was huge and the beds luxurious. My wife requested extra pillows and were given orthopedic side sleeping pillows. We had dinner at the Mexican Restaurant with our waiter Armando who was excellent. The three pools were clean and encircled with palm trees and service was not an issue with our servers, Jorge, Cristan, and Ignacious. All were polite and worked hard to provide excellent service. We had breakfast daily at the pool bar cafe and Claudia ensured service was top quality. I recommend everyone take advantage of the on sight tours. Mira and Jennifer provided an educational bike tour of the Cenotes and snorkeling down the pristine river of this nature reserve. We venture to the Mayan Ruins of Tulum which were amazing then off to Playa del Carmen. The Mexican people were friendly and welcoming. The highlight of the vacation was the Secret River Tour, it was an enlightening experience with our guide Pablo. Have dinner at the chef's table with Chef Oscar it will be an event. My wife loved that she was part of the ecosystem were a river flowed right out front of our rooms and we could watch the iguanas and our two buddies Pancho and Mauritizio who area cross between a racoon and anteater. Love it can't wait to return to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Mrmoustash
Reviews.Content: Almost from start to finish this place delivered. From Chef Oscar to the waiters ie: Jesus in the Terrazo sport bar area to Ramon the buffet waiter,to Alphonso the Asian restaurant waiter, to Claudia the pool side restaurant Hostess, everyone was on there game. the service all around in all areas, around the pool, at the wood fired pizza place etc was excellent. Even though they said they were close to full ( hard to believe )there were chairs and umbrellas to be had at any time of day around the pools. The only people that know how to mess up your stay are the time share people. Try to avoid them as much as possible,( believing them is also difficult ) and you will have a great time. My wife and I did. Will return again to see if they are continuing on with there plans.

Reviews.Title: “Best food, best staff, best resort we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Hollands5
Reviews.Content: You really can't complain about anything at Tres Rios. If you're looking for fun, relaxation, good food, quiet rooms with super comfy beds, it's all there. We've had family go for the past three years and wanted to see if it lived up to their compliments! The food was unbelievable, anything you want, any time of the day. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very large and the staff was so accomodating and friendly with everything we did. The resort itself is in such a beautiful location. You can swim/snorkel in the cenotes, ocean or the pools. The beaches are cleaned and combed daily and have the most comfortable beds on them to relax on. The night shows are great and the efficiency to get us to our excursions, the airport etc. was impressive. We will be back with more of our family. Awesome place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but...”
Reviews.Author: soniram
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the Hacienda Tres Rios in Riviera Maya with my 22 year old daughter and another girlfriend. The good: The hotel was immaculate as well as the grounds, the room was clean and very spacious, the pools were also beautiful and we never had a problem getting chairs at any time of the day, We enjoyed all of the restaurants and found the food above the standards of an all inclusive, They also used top shelf liquor. The staff were pleasant and helpful but had some language barriers The bad: The hotel had a beautiful large lobby but did not have a nice lobby bar, just a lot of couches. There was a sports bar that had a small door that led to a very small bar area that was in the corner of the lobby and that was it. A lot of people we spoke to were also disappointed at the small bar area. There was very little entertainment at night. We really had nothing to do at night and ended up in our room at 10 or 11 pm every night. If you are looking for turquoise beach water, this is not the place. The water is a coffee color. We took a cab to the sister hotel The Fisherman in Playa Del Carmen. There the beach was one of the most beautiful I have been to. So to wrap it up, although I thought the hotel was beautiful I would not return for the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Found random underwear beside our bed...”
Reviews.Author: MrCReynolds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for four nights. We had several issues that kept building until our final straw the last night. On the last day of our stay we visited Playa Del Carmen for the day, and upon returning to our cleaned room in the evening my wife discovered a pair of dirty ladies underwear that did not belong to us beside our bed on the floor. We were disgusted and concerned. We did not know how they got there, and thought that perhaps someone had been in our room. I immediately called the front desk to inform them of the situation and they sent someone to the room. Ten minutes later, still no one had arrived. I then received a phone call from the operator informing me that I needed to take the "privacy please" sign off the door knob so that the concierge could knock. Really?!?! I called you to tell you there is a problem, and you came all the way to the room, saw the sign, and turned around and went back to the desk? That is incredibly ridiculous and embarrassing to your service. Finally, the gentlemen came in, "surveyed the situation" and removed the item and apologized. We went to bed, angry, and disgusted. We checked out the following morning, and upon receiving our bill I inquired about what would be done to resolve the issue and what type of compensation the hotel would offer from this glaring problem. The front desk staff looked through the concierge log book from the evening before, and found no indication of the incident. Therefore, there is no proof (beyond my word) that it ever happened. I fought this for a short time, and was asked to fill out a comment card. I did this, and told them that I would never recommend this hotel. I was told I would be contacted about the situation after a manager could review it. Suffice to say - I have not heard from anyone over a week later. My main issue is that I was treated as though I was lying, and that I had to leap through hoops in order to get an apology or even a sniff of compensation (still nothing). Customer service is key in this industry, and you have proved that you hold no value in your customers experience. This situation could have been easily resolved. I felt disrespected and did not appreciate the resistance from your staff to rectify the situation. This will not be the final review I submit, and as a result I hope you appreciate the value of your customers input now.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic Review!”
Reviews.Author: Safariman6262
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the airport you will be directed to purchase either a 95.00 cab ride, or pay 32.00 a piece for the shuttle. We took the shuttle. It was fairly quick, easy, and painless. Upon arrival check-in was interesting. We were told the room was ready, then told to sit in the lobby and wait for the key. Well after an hour of sitting I addressed the situation. Here the entire time we were waiting for someone from the hotel 'time share' staff to come and talk to us. Soon as I figured that out I demanded a key, told them no time share for me, and off we went. The grounds of the resort are pretty nice. All the staff was super friendly. They were always working to clean up or keep things looking nice. Rooms were pretty nice. Bedding, feather bed, was to die for. I especially enjoyed the balcony. TV was decent. AC worked very well. Shower and bath area was very nice. There is a hair dryer and safe in the room. One nice feature is there is FREE wireless internet everywhere. My girlfriend tried doing homework and uploading it, that didn't work well, but simple surfing of the net for emails worked well. Food, well, my experiences with most time shares is that food isn't so great. This was much the same. The breakfast buffet was ok, all other buffet meals were terrible. The Italian restaurant was ok, Asian restaurant was better, the grill out by the pool was pretty fair, pizza place was ok. Sports bar was a total joke. The pools are pretty nice. I liked the layout of the pools. There were lots of spots to relax in the pool away from others. Plenty of lounge chairs, drink service at the pool was good also. Please note there is NO swim up bar. The water at the beach, well, trust me, you'll never get in it. It is NASTY!!! Very dirty, ocean floor is spongy. When I tried walking through this area my feet sank in to above my ankles. We took a 15.00 cab ride to Playa del Carmen. It was a 22.00 cab ride to Xcaret. Would I stay here again, uh, no. There are too many other places out there I'd rather try. I stayed at the Grand Bavaro last year and enjoyed it much better. This resort isn't bad because of lack of effort. The food is terribly disappointed, ocean front water area is terrible, I'd like to have a swim-up bar. I purchased my trip through a bid for site, so I paid only 90.00 per person per night. Had I paid 300 a night a person like I saw on many sites, I'd have been totally irritated!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased”
Reviews.Author: katiekoo_11
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but just had to in acknowledgement of this marvelous resort. I consider myself a bit difficult to please. I like attractive, well appointed resorts and I like them for a good price. Not easy to accomplish. Tres Rios accomplished this and more. I could go on and on about the merits of this resort. THe place is spotless, the grounds are large and it was hard to believe a place could be taken care of so well and with such meticulous care. The mexican staff are friendly and helpful and bend over backwards to be accommodating. And the room! Huge shower (could be a small child's room), balcony with jacuzzi tub, soft cozy bed, down filled pillows (lots of them), just a beautiful room and an absolutely marvelous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible beach - No view from room”
Reviews.Author: Chepper
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort for a friends wedding. As soon as we walked in the issues began. Although I had booked an Ocean View room months earlier, they did not have any available and did not want to tell me so. The room was booked as part of the wedding and all of the guests paid the higher rate for the ocean view, not the Mangrove. Turns out they are one in the same. all of the rooms in the hotel face inward and the hotel is shaped like a U. So only the rooms at the very end get a decent ocean view. For me to see the ocean i had to stick my head out of the balcony and turn it 90 degrees right. I go on many vacations to resorts or beachfront ans am very disappointed. The front desk staff was uncourteous. When i asked to speak with a manager, conveniently every manager was so tied up in a meeting that they couldn't break away to speak with a guest. So much for service. I have been managing restaurants for about a decade and have never been in such an important meeting that a customer had too wait. 30 minutes later and two managers appeared and said that they ha no other rooms which were ocean view. Their solution... get me a cab to take to a different hotel to stay there. How convenient considering I was staying there for a wedding which had about 30 rooms booked, with at least two persons per room. Also, many of the other guest didn't have any view at all nor were our rooms located in a centralized location. This may seem like silly complaining but I have been in the service industry long enough to know bad service when I see it. Our discounted rate shaved about $20 from regular nightly fare, nothing to write home about. I could have booked the Mangrove room directly from there website and saved a significant amount of money. Without getting into too many details, let's just say that the bride and groom were also not too happy when things that the had previously spoken about were not being taken care of. For example the hotel completely changed the menu for the rehearsal dinner. This was set up (at an additional charge to them although the hotel is all inclusive) and we were served the same food that was in the buffet pretty much every other evening. And the beach, well read any other review. It sucks. Specially considering Playa de Carmen it beautiful and only about 15 minutes away. P.S. There are raccoons all over the hotel in the evening and one ran into a friend's room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, included activities, good food, with room to grow.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSAMer
Reviews.Content: WHAT'S GOOD: - New resort. - Spotless. - Free 24/7 room service. - Food was good. We especially liked the Hacienda Grill. Try the tuna ceviche there. - Free activities: biking, snorkelling, kayaking, and other activities in the eco-park are included in the all-inclusive price. - Exceptional staff: From Trinidad, the manager of the Hacienda Grill, who will go out of his way to make sure you get what you want (even if it means he will personally go to another restaurant at the resort to get it) to Vanessa & Ricardo at the front desk. Everyone was fantastic. Housekeeping personnel will greet you as you pass them in hallways, restaurant staff are courteous, and other staff are willing to lend a helping hand whenever they can (even if it meant stopping what they were doing to show you the gym after-hours, simply because you asked where the gym was). - Free Wi-Fi in buildings and by pools. The speed was at times not great, but it was always sufficient. - Not too busy. We visited in February. It was rare to wait at a restaurant. It was easy to find a good spot by the pool or the beach. - Nice sandy beach (but see below for water/swimming in sea). - Nice pools. - Leave housekeeping a tip and get a surprise. Try it. ;-) - For inexpensive trips to/from Cancun and Play del Carmen use the Collectivo (i.e. public transit). Their vans are super-clean and air conditioned. The trip to Playa costs 20 pesos per person. The trip to Cancun costs 35 pesos per person (although you will have to take the bus if you want to go to the hotel district). From Playa, you can also take the Collectivo to Tulum and see the ruins there. We found it very easy to move around between towns on the freeway. WHAT'S NOT SO GOOD: - The beach is short and the water dirty. Not the best place for swimming. - Rooms are not soundproofed. You can easily hear people in the hallways. - Because it's still a small resort, there are few restaurants on site. The master project as was explained to us will include major expansions in the future, but until then, there are few places to eat. This is not to say you can't find good food, but if some traveller may get bored quickly with the selection.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to relax”
Reviews.Author: becky-mn
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed that the pictures on the website were exactly what the resort looked like. The rooms were fantastic and the pools were very nice, too. (Although my room did not have a hairdryer which I missed.) We got talked into the timeshare presentation and they kept telling us there was no pressure, but there really was a lot of pressure. Also, it was 3 hours long and not 1.5 hours like the concierge said it would be. I would only recommend if you're serious about buying. We also went on the kayak/snorkel/swimming tour which was fun. The food wasn't the greatest and the beach wasn't that good either, but we spent most of our time lounging by the pool. It was nice to be able to order drinks and lunch by the pool. The resort was the perfect place for relaxation and a good place for kids. If you want to party, this really isn't the place. The only reason I wouldn't go back is because there are more places I want to see. Maybe when I have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Nekkab5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much! The beds were so comfy! Rooms were great. They have two pools both were super! The food was good to very good, the Cenote and rivers were wonderful! The beach beds and chairs were nice, the activities were great , the only thing that was not top notch was the beach. The beach did have wash up on it. I do know that they are working on this. Over all it was a fantastic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go”
Reviews.Author: Wavi62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room with coffee pot, free internet in room. Fabulous food in all of the restaurants. Free snorkeling and kayaking in the river,.free catamaran rides and bike riding. Great beach with beds and loungers.The only negatives were limited outside washrooms, none near the beach area, and had to keep requesting lotions, shampoos etc. No shuttle to town, $20 cab.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaLandlover
Reviews.Content: By the reviews I read about this resort on Trip Advisor, I admit I was expecting a lot...And I got it! This is a gorgeous resort set back off the highway and right on the beach..Large, beautiful, comfortable (especially the beds), clean rooms. Well landscaped and maintained grounds. Two very large and lovely pools. Friendly personnel. Great weather (but the hotel didn't have anything to do with that-just luck of draw). We arrived on a Thursday, and because of the warnings, were ready for the sales pitch. That was quick and painless since we knew what to expect. The rest of the stay we were not bothered about taking the tour. Though we arrived several hours early, our room was ready. I was surprised at how big it was and from the second floor had a pretty decent view. We were able to try out most of the restaurants while there even though I was confined to our room a couple of days due to a "gift" I believe I received from our grandchildren before we left the States, and not due to the food. Our traveling companions said the Mexican Restaurant was not good and they did not want to go back. From that observation, I believe the Hacienda grill has the best food. Wish we had more time to sample the menu. The resort went to a lot of trouble to set up, on two different evenings, a buffet outdoors complete with linen covered tables, chairs and china place settings. The beach left a little to be desired though the hotel staff was continually trying to keep it clean of debris. The water was not the clear blue you would expect so we didn't venture in at that location..Further down the beach it is much better. We stayed at the "adults only" pool the whole week. My complaint about the pool area is that the three hot tubs are at the "non" adults only pool and the kids monopolized them. It would have been nice to have at least one hot tub for just adults. There are several tours you can take on the property (all free). I would encourage anyone who goes to Hacienda Tres Rios to take at least one of them. They are short. The kayak/snorkel/swim tour was enjoyable and not strenuous. There were a couple small things that could have been improved. The TV in our room had very poor sound and on one of the channels (which happened to be the one we were most interested in) about one fourth of the screen was cut off. We never mentioned it to the front desk so I don't know how quickly (of if) it would have been resolved. The room attendant didn't always restock needed items. Room service was usually a 35-45 minute wait and the food didn't always arrive hot. Be sure to get your free massage. The $12 tax is worth it. I would go again if I could get another great deal as I did on Skyauction.

Reviews.Title: “A truly enjoyable and luxurious vacation”
Reviews.Author: chlovis
Reviews.Content: Aside from one major negative, that being the beach water is black and full of seaweed and silt except for one nice 100 yd. section, everything else was as good as it gets. Food is delicious, drinks not watered down and also lots of veggie drink choices, restaurants don't require reservations and presentations are elegant. The buffet is plentiful but somewhat repetious. Staff is wonderful...hardworking and accomodating. There are plenty of activities but the schedules are too casual and we missed a bunch. Locations and times are very hard to find. The buildings lack directional signs; there were some excellent shows but finding the theater was a real challenge. There are 3 huge heated pools that are delicious and 6 cenotes on the property. We swam in 2 and it was safe, relaxing and full of fish. You can also swim in the river which also has a lot of fish. Be aware that the snorkeling equipment is only provided when you take the free formal tours so if you want to do it on your own, bring your equipment. There are about 270 acres and lots of lounges, seats and beach beds so there are always choices available. One down side is that there aren't enough bathrooms, especially by the beach. Rooms are great, wifi all over. We didn't use the spa but the gym had lots of modern equipment and was lovely. We stayed for a week, Feb 24-Mar 3 and after the 1st it got very HOT. On the premises are adorable coatis, raccoons and iguanas, all begging for handouts and birds galore. Staff did a great job with the kids, all of whom seemed very happy. Very spacious resort, -laid back, peaceful. Great vacation; we had the all-inclusive package....prices are very high and that's the best way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort...not a party place.”
Reviews.Author: Mikmwik
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hacienda and had a wonderful time. I was with my husband and people I work with, the trip was paid for by my company so I can't attest to the "value" because I don't know what it actually cost. As an all-inclusive, we did not have to wear wrist bands, other packages did. We were not approached by a time share person at all. Our trip was booked through Apple Vacations and I've been to resorts where Apple reps were always onsite. This is not the case here, the Apple rep only comes once a day early in the morning. We weren't planning to do any excursions, so that didn't bother us. The room was very clean. We did end up in a room with two queen beds, no jacuzzi, but we survived. I was skeptical that one bed might have or had at one time bed bugs, so we slept in the other bed. (I inspected every inch of both beds/mattresses) We did not have any bed bug bites. There really isn't an "ocean view" room because the hotel is set far back from the beach. Other reviews of the beach are spot on. The Gulf waters were brown and murky but the little river sections were as clear as can be. There were beds and lounge chairs on the beach and it seemed very peaceful. We spent most of our time at the "adult" pool which is by one of the outdoor restaurants. We always had service for drinks, the water was clear and it was very peaceful. This is not a party place. There is no swim up bar, or party music and entertainers. It was truly a place to relax and enjoy the sun. Food: I would describe the food as "eclectic/fusion". If you are expecting tacos or fajitas at the Mexican restaurant or chicken parm at the Italian restaurant, think again. I enjoyed trying other foods, but my husband was a bit more picky. He's a meat and potatoes man and he ended up eating a lot of potatoes. The Italian and Japanese restaurants were fantastic. The Mexican restaurant, not so much. The buffet at lunch was average, breakfast was good. The breakfast offered an omlette station and a quesadilla station. I wished they had the quesadilla station at lunch...they were very yummy. The beach "carribean" buffet on Wed. night was not good. We ordered room service pizza that night and it was very good. In fact, we ordered it a few nights because my husband only ate potatoes for dinner! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel if you want a low key, relaxing vacation. If you want any nightlife or daytime partying, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, but beach not that good! I guess it's still a work-in-progress.”
Reviews.Author: Alina1952
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, with beds from heaven! Variety of restaurants and less formal places to eat. Four-poster beds with sheets and pillows... on the beach! Not enough of those, so there is a race in the morning to grab one! Sand is OK, but the sea bottom is not - lot of "floaties" - I guess it's the price you pay for choosing an ecologically-friendly resort. But the swimming pools make up for that. Also, the water is crystal-clear with fantastic sand where the river enters the sea - that's where we did our swimming. Mangroves all around, sea gulls, pelicans, egrets and fish! Free sailing (catamaran), cycling trips around the resort, also snorkeling, kayaking, games at the pool, beach volley ball, evening shows and parties during suppertime - outdoors. An outdoor pizzeria (uses real oven!) has a couple of guests - four-legged ones, called coati, that look like a cross between a lemur and a raccoon - fun to watch! If you want to go to a fabulous beach, take a free shuttle to Fishermans Village in Playa del Carmen - part of the same resort group, so food is included. Then shuttle back to Tres Rios for more fun! We bought a timeshare, as we plan on coming here quite often!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: NancyinMichigan
Reviews.Content: As owners at the Royal Sunset, we had been given several opportunities to visit Hacienda Tres Rios, but had turned them down. We decided to use one of our timeshare weeks there and are glad we did. We had spent the week before in Akumal, so we arrived at HTR around noon. Our room wasn't ready (check-in isn't until 3:00), so we wandered, had lunch, and went to the pool. We were told the room would be ready in about 30 minutes, but we were told that several times. Eventually (after checking and checking and checking) our room was ready around 3:00. It would be good if they could come up with a system to notify you when your room is ready so you don't have to keep going to the desk and asking. Maybe a pager system? The hotel grounds are gorgeous with beautiful landscaping and a large pool area that feels smaller than it is because of the wandering shape of the pools. We spent our week lounging by the adult pool, so I can't speak to the activity staff at the busier pool. But it was lovely to walk out to the pool in the mornings and have the chairs ready with towels waiting and smiling faces at the grill restaurant for breakfast. We ate breakfast there and at the buffet and both were fine--lots of good food. We had lunch there every day--the shrimp was great, and they brought us more when we asked for it. I enjoyed the chilled fruit soup, too. Both of us were glad that the gym is so well-equipped--even two bikes which can be rare in hotel gyms. The equipment was all in working order--another rarity! It was extremely busy in the mornings. We took the bike tour one morning to see the eco-park. It would have been nice to be able to check out a bike to ride on our own, but I'm guessing insurance liability prevents that. The park is impressive--but we had fun seeing a coati around the pool. That was all the wildlife we saw during the week. Our room was gorgeous with a view out across the property to the ocean. It was immaculate. We had to ask for foam pillows since we have an allergy to feathers. They showed up quickly, but somehow disappeared our last night. The walk-in shower was big enough for two which is always fun! It was nice to get up in the morning and sit on the balcony and watch the resort "wake up". Food--it was great! We enjoyed the Italian, Asian and Mexican restaurants at night. Didn't try the pool grill at night but heard they do terrific rib-eye steaks, so maybe on our next trip there we'll try that. We asked for extra sushi at the Asian restaurant and were given all we wanted. It was nice not to have to make a reservation. My husband had closed-toed dress Merrell sandals but had to go put on his gym shoes to eat in the Asian and Italian restaurants. He did, but it seemed a bit silly to see the women in flip-flops. Maybe they can rethink that part of the dress code? Drinks were very good with top-shelf liquor openly available. At other AI resorts we have had to ask for top-shelf liquor since it is often hidden from view. We were there for Super Bowl Sunday. The staff worked hard to put on a Super Bowl party in the Sports Bar. They set up lots of chairs and tables and provided plates of appetizer/snack foods. I imagine room service was busy after the game! The highlight was the Chef's Table. We had reserved before we arrived at the HTR. Chef Oscar cooked and served our seven course dinner, and it was possibly the best meal I've had any where. He is a gem. When you purchase the AI for the week you receive a free 30 minute massage. We upped it to an hour, and wound up have two hour-long massages during the week. The spa was well-managed and the massages were excellent. I'd recommend it. We are returning to the HTR for a few nights in April and looking forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre food, gorgeous rooms, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: belleview9480
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HTR during the first week of February. Our desires when traveling abroad are safety, cleanliness, quiet environment, good food, and beautiful weather. The hotel had most of these, thus the four star rating. Pros: the grounds are gorgeous. You will really feel like you are in heaven. The staff are generally pleasant and accomodating, but waitstaff hover waiting for tips; it was very passively pushy. The tours are great and it's awesome to swim in the cenotes. We were not pressured at all about the timeshare presentation. Major props to the hotel for including room service in the all inclusive price. It is wonderfully quiet and the pools are great. Cons: The sheets were not changed at all while we were there, but I didn't realize it until later in the week when it was too late to complain. Money was taken from our room. The beach is not gorgeous. The food is really not good, but we have rarely found an all inclusive with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Most spectacular hotel, superb service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marinka77
Reviews.Content: Guys at tres rios did great job with hiring chefs..best tuna steaks, fantastic sea bass and tuna ceviche in the grill bar, mouthwatering pizza from the authentic brick oven... Bedsheets were changed everyday!!!! Loved the snorkeling in the cenotes. We are coming back next year....for sure. One happy client Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place and people”
Reviews.Author: jackwong48
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent , except for the little ants. We have a nice 2 bedroom at this place . Everything is beautiful at the resort . People was very very nice !!!!!! Everybody was very helpful to your needs. A little tips goes a long way at this resort !!! And it is nice to give !!! The food was good ,but could be better . the drinks was top grade !!!! Would definitely come back .

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to spend time there!”
Reviews.Author: GoHiking_7
Reviews.Content: We've not yet been to a resort in Mexico's Riviera Maya where the people who work there clearly are the most kind, happy, courteous and hard-working that we've seen so far. We can name so many, but the stand-outs are: Samuel (he moves so fast, so don't blink), Cori, Motega, Giovanna, Jennifer (she's such a good egg), Juan Carlos in the Asian restaurant, Ignacio, at the Grill bar, Israel (the go-to guy for catamaran sailing), Javier at the coffee shop. The list of people is endless. The facilities are superb, restaurants, pools. You cannot have a bad time at this resort. If you do, it's your own fault. I repeat, it's your own fault. We will say one more thing, though. We took the Hacienda Andulacia horseback riding tour twice. This place is so underrated! The gentlemen who take you on the horseback riding tour, Hector and Joel work so hard so that you can have a wonderful experience. They deserve many, many thanks. They truly love these animals and they really love having fun taking you out on horseback. Kudos to them!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: tootsConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The HTR is beautiful. The grounds, the service, the pools, the beach, the rooms, you could not ask for anything more. There are all these walk ways and bridges that lead you to hide away places to just relax on a lounge chair or a hammock or just walk around towards the beach. Very easy to find your way around. The HRT was full the week we were there and you would have never known it. There is always a place to sit at the pools. There are also beach beds, but there are people that go down early in the morning and put there towels and books there to save there special bed. They do ask you not to do it, but some people just don't care. But, by the afternoon, we always found a few empty ones. They do need more umbrellas at the pools, but that was not a deal breaker. As for the restaurants, this is one of our complaints. The service was great, everyone was willing to help you. But the problem was in the speciality restaurants. The buffet was great, as so the Mexican and Italian, and the food was good, but it was fancy. If you are picky, you might not like all the choices. But as we found out, they will make you something that is not on the menu, so that is were the great service comes in, they are so willing to please you. One more thing, Ladies take your own hair dryer. The ones in the rooms are the worst. They do have regular ones, that you can ask for, but I don't know how many they have, so bring your own. As for entertainment at night, it is quiet. They have a Mexican and a beach party night, where they have a band, and yes it is nice and you can dance and enjoy your self, but other than that it is quite there. There is a sports bar, where after 10:00 it gets lively, but that is it. And yes they do have a gambling night on Thursday night, which is fun. But if you like the sun and just want to lay back this is the place to go. Also sign up for the bike, and kayak tour. You are on the bike for 5 minutes and then you kayak for 2 hours, then you can also snorkle. The kayak ride is beautiful, and very relaxing. Over all I would go back. The people really try to make it a very nice vacation for you and your family. And no you don't have to take the timeshare tour. We got in and had to wait for our room for 10 minutes and they wanted us to talk to someone, but we said no thank you and that was it, no pressure. So go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “What can I Say!!!”
Reviews.Author: stevie3264
Reviews.Content: Once again we had a great time at our 3 bedroom Condo @ Tres Rios. We were very happy to join the private residential club the La Hariencia . It is awesome! The Butler Concierge service is so convenient and the warm welcoming we receive consistently from all staff is great! We have been to Tres Rios 9 times since we purchased in the last 2 years. The food is always up to par and Oscar the Chef comes up w new ideas for us everytime we visit! We had a special anniversary dinner on the Terrace of our condo it was a breath taking experience overlooking the Carribean lights of the Cozumel coastline and our lighted resort! Sammy & Miguel!! We cannot express enough about their consistent quality of service they provide our family. We belong to the Yacht club and take a trip on every visit , Sammy & Miguel put a Lunch together along w beverages both alcohol & non for our day on the Yacht. We travel to Isla Mujeres, dock off shore about 100 yards and swim to the white sandy beach for a cold drink and relax in the beautiful sun.We just love the different shades of Blue water and how crystal clear it is to an all white sand bottom! Our girls love to go and hate to leave! A typical day for us starts at sitting on our balcony watching the sunrise w a coffee & fruit tray , we then head to the gym for an hour. Then it is time for breakfast as usual! From there it is to the Poolside where we have our comfortable lounge chairs . Reading , swimming, cocktails , walk on the beach, or a swim at the Cenote is always fun. Come 4 pm we finish off the day on the quiet terrace of our condo for a jacuzzi, cocktail & snack. Being a member of the La Hariencia has its advantages we have a Butler that overlooks all your needs throughout your entire stay, The staff has always and consistenly treated us first class! We will be back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: ret47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at HTR for a week and had a great itme. The all inclusive part is really what it says. It covers all meals, drinks, and most extras. I could not believe the great service where everyone knows your name. Enjoy the pools, the beach cabanas, drinks on the beach, swimming, touring, great meals and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved HTR!”
Reviews.Author: raytoy310
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Mexico for our 5th time. This resort by far is our best trip. We stayed at other 5 star all inclusives including Royal Hideaway and my husband and myself both agree with had the best time at HTR. Not that we did not enjoy the others. We never lost power and always had hot water. Pros: I want to point out that I disagree on others posts that the employees of HTR are not friendly. I NEVER once met and employee from and part of the resort who did not have a great smile and a Hola everytime we met. Check in was a breeze with Ricardo. He is such a friendly, ready to please employee. Our bell hop was prompt with our bags and explained things about the room. All of the servers in all of the restaurants were great and knowledgeable about the menus. We NEVER had to wait to be seated. We especially loved the Mexican Restaurant. The employees go out of their way to please the guests. We loved our servers especially the ones that we had everyday - Ignacio, Imelda, and Ramon. They quickly got to know our likes and were there almost without asking. They (and all the other HTR employees) are truly an asset to the hotel. Chef Oscar was everywhere! He was hands on and making sure everyone was happy. He even moved our umbrella so that it was shading my husband. There is no way you will not be able to find food to your liking. They have everything you can think of. If you don't see it ask more than likely they will be able to make it for you. My husbands favorite lunch was grilled shrimp with garlic butter at the Grill. Also, the beef medallions are fantastic at the grill for lunch (or dinner). My husband tried the cricket empanadas and said they were good. I am not that adventurous. Rooms are very large and comfortable beds. The shower is huge. Great oceanview. The grounds are beautiful! They are ALWAYS working on keeping the resort in spic and span shape. There is a running/walking trail that goes through the jungle and past the nursery. My husband and I would walk the length of it each morning before breakfast. it was beautiful walking the trail so peaceful. The cenotes and rivers are beautiful take a ride kayak down the river it is a great experience. The resorts bathrooms, public areas, restaurants, lobby area are kept in immaculate condition. The area around the pool and beach are always kept clean. The servers pick up the dishes, cups, etc. so that the area is never messy. The guest rooms are cleaned better than any hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. They pull out the dressers and clean behind them everyday. Bathrooms sparkle! Don't forget to say hello to "Poncho" the resorts friendly Coati. I love that this is truly an "Eco" friendly resort. This resort is a little bit of heaven on earth. Cons: The door latch's on the public restroom doors. They are very small and I have trouble turning the latch since I have arthritis in my fingers. But that does not distract from the hotel at all. I don't know of any other resort that we stayed in throughout the US, Mexico, caribbean and some of Europe that I could honestly say I only had such a small complaint. Wait Anguilla and the Cuisinart and Cap Juluca resorts were also top on my list. But they are not all inclusive and should not be compared. Also, we were married on Anguilla and have a passion for the Island. But HTR will now become up there with Anguilla resorts.

Reviews.Title: “top shelf place and the place to be spoiled”
Reviews.Author: heklstevens
Reviews.Content: you would be hard pressed to find a more complete resort than this and they have done it with the eco-system in mind. you never have to leave their grounds, and if you do they have the transportation for you. if you want to be pampered with service see Carlos at the Grill, Armando at the mexican restaurant upstairs or Christian at poolside. you are going to love it!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service and Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: SheriLaidley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the neighboring Hotel 2 years ago and took a walk up the beach - there we saw Haciebda Tres Rios being build and fell in love with the look, the feel and the location. We were delighted to find this hotel! We read reviews about the "time share" sharks - our experience was great with respect to the time share talk, we never felt pressure, once we said "no, thank you" they left us to enjoy the Resort in peace. Our room backed onto the Mangroves, corner Jacuzzi suite on the bottom floor. At first I was truly disappointed (our view was of a concrete slab with the Mangroves behind) upon using the Jacuzzi tub located ON the balcony I was in heaven - no walkers by...complete privacy! The staff!!! WOW!!! We had incredible service in every restaurant, excursion and location (pool and beach). The staff talks of their love of the resort, the pride they take in their work and make you feel right at home. Notable staff include: Alberto, Waiter in the Buffet and Celebration nights; Geo, Cenote and Snorkel tour as well as Bike tour guide through the Mangroves; Eddy, pool and beach waiter – always a smile and a cold drink in a flash; Samuel, "quality control" as we labeled him <3 ; Miguel, Assistant Food and Beverage Manager extraordinaire (try his wine pairings!)! And Chef Oscar, this man was EVERYWHERE at all hours, he always had time to stop and make you feel that you were a guest in his home. These staff member, among many others made this Resort one that we will return to time and time again. Highly recommend every aspect of this fantastic resort! If you are looking for "nigh life" you may not be 100% satisfied though I think the staff is really making an effort to liv'en up the evenings.- the Sports Bar was the place to be at night. The location, the atmosphere and the natural beauty – WOW. Please take the time to explore the Resort! You will be astonished to find within the Eco Park: 10 Cenotes, 3 Rivers and the Reforestation Nursery ~ “Respect the Fauna” Best Vacation we have had, hands down! Thank you HTR 

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thrillstream
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Great food. Great service. Great location. Great activities. Great rooms. It is the people who make this resort so special: Miguel Sotelo - He treated us with respect and friendship. He is truely a professional. We enjoyed his knowledge of wine and food. Most of all he made us feel special. We will go back to this resort because of Miguel. Eddie - Our beach waiter. He is a fun guy. Always smiling. He is a very hard worker. Getting food and drink all the way down to the beach for us time and time again. Samuel - We never figured out what his tittle was. Amazing to watch. He seems to be in charge of quality control. No detail is missed by him. Always a smile. You see him everywhere. He truly cares about the resort and your experience. He must burn 20000 calories per day!! Gio - Memory making team - We ended up on two of the resort tours with her. A joy to be around. Great knowledge of the animals and plants. She was also an angel for the valentine events. She is truly an angel!! And of course the "ROCK STAR"!!!!!!!! Chef Oscar is the Hacienda Tres Rios. He over sees every detail. A great leader. I think the reason the staff cares about the resport is because he is so passionate. I'd love to see a TV crew follow this guy around , you would have a hit show (I am not joking). Hire this guy and send him to Hollywood. WARNING - He will pour tequila down your throat when your not looking!!! The resort is relaxing. Take some time and make sure you enjoy the eco park. Don't expect wild parties lasting until 5am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: chicagofamof6
Reviews.Content: First of all, we want to go on record as stating that after traveling door to door 9 hours to get to our resort, the LAST thing we want to do is to sit in front of a pretend concierge and listen to him speak about the "wonderful opportunity" to participate in their time share experience. If we wanted that, we would have sought them out. We call these people and those that show the time share, "Land Sharks!" Beware the land sharks!! Our "concierge" even told us that we couldn't even take the free shuttle to downtown Playa unless we signed up for the presentation! This is a beautiful resort! Rooms are amazing! Grounds are wonderfully kept. If you want constant service you will need to hang out by the pool. Down at the beach you will see staff at 10 a.m. but then they concentrate up by the pool area and infrequently by the beach. We even would give a tip and service was still spotty at best...we were down by the beach every day. Considering other all-inclusives we've stayed at, this one lacked in the number of people taking beverage and food orders around the pool and beach and this hotel was far from capacity the week we stayed. The rooms are amazing and well kept. Everyday they were cleaned. Sometimes lotion or shampoo wasn't replenished or bath mats were taken and not replaced, but overall, they did a wonderful job. "Turn down" services happened infrequently, with a knock at the door one night past 9 o'clock. For the cost of the All Inclusive, you do get some wonderful opportunities on the resort.
