Be sure to take advantage of them. Swimming in the cenote is refreshing. DO NOT MISS taking the bike or kayak trip with Cori! She is adorable! She has a constant smile and a true desire to interact with her guests! Israel out by the sail boats will give you a wonderful ride! He is also one of those employees with a constant smile and a genuine interest in you as a guest. Food: this seems to be quite the topic for discussion at this resort. We Chicagoans love our pizza and quality restaurants! After having visited a true culinary resort last year that was also All-Inclusive, for the money, we were disappointed in the food at Hacienda Tres Rios. Nothing horrible, but not at a level we expected...again, because of the overall cost of the All-Inclusive. Some of the best meals we ate (breakfast, lunch or dinner) were had at the Hacienda Grill and the brick oven pizza. You also will be entertained at the Brick oven pizza by the coatis! They love pizza! One huge word or warning: We have been to many resorts and read that proper attire is expected in the restaurants. At this one, the information sheet suggested men to wear closed toed shoes. MEN: BE AWARE you will be denied access to some of the restaurants no matter how nicely you are dressed if you aren't wearing close toed shoes! Not just nice dress sandals, but CLOSE TOED SHOES. Crazy...We saw people dressed in sloppy clothing but because they had "the right shoes" they were allowed in. You can always eat at the buffet or Hacienda or the Brick oven pizza restaurants dressed just about anyway you like! We are beach, not pool, people. The beds down by the beach are wonderful. Even though the hotel says not to reserve them, people get up at 6:30 to lay their towels and books out on the beds right in front of the hotel. There are more beds on the other side of the small river, but we never saw service offered over there, hence the rush to get these beds early in the morning. And, "yes" the beach isn't quite the beautiful blue Caribbean waters you may think. But then again, you are at a beach where 3 rivers spill into the ocean! It is still a great beach! Again, this is an amazing place. There is a lot to see and do at this beautiful resort, but we felt the All-Inclusive fees were too high especially when the quality of the food didn't meet the expectations for the money paid. If you are looking for a wonderful horseback riding experience, check out Baaxal. They offer fantastic guided rides through the jungle and onto the beach for all ages!

Reviews.Title: “Our trip with friends to Tres Rios was a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Pack47
Reviews.Content: We have such great memories of our vacation at Tres Rios! Not only do you have a beautiful resort, your attention to "details" in landscaping, maintainence of the pools, gardens and buildings was outstanding. What an impressive place! I wish we could mention all the staff members we met because everyone was so nice.Here are a few people: Mario Garcia was the perfect person to meet new guests at the airport!(Do you still have your PACKER hat?) Thank you again to Yanira & Luis...our attentive servers at the breakfast buffet. Yanira, "I will miss your great smile and personality": Eliezer, the "special coffee" you made for us at the Mexican Restaurant was unbelievable...an artistic production! Also, the gentlemen that provided the evening music were great musicians & entertainers...did you find the song El Paso? Nicolas, at the Asian Restaurant, was very thoughtful and also a good server. The food at the restaurants was excellent...and a nice presentation on the dinner plate. It looked as good as it tasted! We had a very interesting and informative tour of the main gardens and a few cenotes. Motega, your knowledge of native plants was impressive...thanks for taking the time to share that information with us. And last , but not least was our Spanish Lesson Instructor, Guil...sorry, I misplaced my notes with your name. We enjoyed our lesson and appreciated your patience. Our memories of Tres Rios are very special. Wish we could have stayed another week! Thank you from the 4 PACKER FANS

Reviews.Title: “Under staffed, poorly managed. Food is just ok.”
Reviews.Author: KibbyBulldog88
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a travel snob. I have been to the cancun/playa del Carmen area about 10 times and have stayed in other all inclusive resorts in the area such Secrets, Dreams, and the Royal (both cancun & Playa). My review here is relative to these other resorts in the same hotel class. I mean really, you can't compare the Sleep Inn to the Ritz. What's good: Small resort set close to the beach. Easy Access to all facilities. Room service is great. My favorite item on the menu: beef skirt sandwich on a baquette. Free Wi-fi. What's bad: Not enough staff. Be prepared to wait in line for everything. From checking in, getting served in a restaurant, to getting drinks at a bar. Also, very few bars - no stools by the bars. Not enough public restrooms. Kids club is a plastic table next to the kiddie pool. Overall, I was really annoyed at how long it takes to get any kind of service in this place. There are a bunch of timeshare salespeople hanging out in the lobby doing nothing- while there is a line 20 people deep at the concierge desk. I wont be coming back to this place. Is it better than the Sleep Inn? Of course! But it's not in the same category as Dreams.....

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: t3ddy
Reviews.Content: I'll break this down into a short review followed by a more detailed review. First, what everyone says about the service is true! The staff aims to please and please they do! We were always asked if we needed anything, drinks were brought to us frequently, often without asking. Guac/salsa at the pool is the BEST. Add a pizza and it was lunch every day! The beds are soft and cozy, the rooms are large, there are activities for the adventurous and good times are had by all! In a nutshell – excellent! As with any vacation, there are minor annoyances, but hey, you’re on vacation….why let those little things ruin an otherwise great time?! Where to begin with the detail?? How about the beginning? Check-in was a little trying. We arrived just before 3pm, so I thought we’d be ok. We were greeted at the front door by a waiter asking if we wanted anything….he prompted brought us tasty margaritas! The front desk said our rooms (3) weren’t ready yet, so we opted to visit the buffet for some much needed food. I’d guess we ate for around an hour and by then only one of our three rooms was ready. It took another 2 hours for the others to become available. They may have been available sooner, but we waited in the lobby and no one came to get us so we only knew they were ready because we finally asked. Annoying – yes, did it ruin my vacation, absolutely not! Check-out was very simple and they front desk was otherwise very helpful. I chalked it up to a Saturday check-in. We were never once approached by the timeshare folk, guess we musta looked poor! Our rooms were just as in the pictures. Very spacious and the beds are fluffy and comfortable. The pillows were fine with us, so we didn’t even try the pillow menu (didn’t even look for it). The information center never worked for any of us, so I can’t comment on it. Our bellboy said it rarely works, so I’m not really sure why it’s there. Frig in the room is stocked with water, sodas and beer, which was fine for us. We did have a slight leak from somewhere (possibly the air conditioner) but we just put a towel on the floor and went on. The rooms are very nice! Overall, I’d say that the food is good. We’re not gourmet folk, but we don’t want low end either. I thought the food was tasty and well presented. The portions are smaller than in the US, but this is by design. They try to reduce wasted food, so start with small portions and if you want more, they bring you more! We liked the Mexican restaurant best; the others were good too, but when in Rome…… Breakfast at the buffet offers something for everyone. The omelet station also has breakfast quesadillas which are yummy. I took some things off the buffet to add to my omelet and they more than obliged! Lunch was always guac/salsa and a pizza pool-side. That is my definition of Heaven! The only comment that I’ll make is that the website says that reservations are required for dinner at some places. This is NOT the case! We tried to make reservations with the concierge and were told none were necessary. Since we were a party of 6, we usually had a wait of around 30 minutes, but we sat under the stars and relaxed; hey, I’m on vacation! We did discover that around 8 was a good time for us to eat. I will make a quick comment here about food. What they do, they do well; but try not to deviate from the menus – that throws them a bit. You can’t order HGrill French Fries off room service; you get Caribbean Fries instead and each bartender makes the same drink differently, don’t try to order a drink they’ve never heard of, you never know what you’ll get! The activities are fun. Definitely do the tours that they offer. We did the Jaguar tour and enjoyed it immensely! The Senses Tour is a MUST – a very spiritual experience. Go into it with an open mind and enjoy! The guy that leads the tour is great! We did a ‘quickie’ hobie trip. You DO need reservations for that (which we didn’t know, but could have guessed). The Sunday Welcome party and the Wednesday buffet on the beach were fun. Music and food under the stars – I must be dreaming! I am not a gambler, but the casino night was fun. They give you resort cash to gamble with and an auction at the end. It was good fun. I will say that I was really looking forward to the Fire Show and the Mayan Show, but both have been replaced!! Not sure why, but I was bummed about that! The pools were beautiful – but chilly! Not sure how they can be hit all day by the sun and still be ice cold, but the beach water was warmer than the pools! There is a separate adult’s pool and a family pool. The biggest problem was that all three hot tubs were in the family area, so they were overrun by kids most of the time; we were able to enjoy them later in the evening tho, but by then the beach bar was closed! A hot tub in the adult’s area would have been nice. As with any resort, there are some areas of improvement. Somewhere I read a review saying that it was pretty beat up for only being 2 years old. I did notice a lot of structural cracks and broken floor tiles. Not sure if this was due to poor/quick building or because it is built on a marshy foundation. It didn’t ruin my vacation, but it was something I noticed. The flipside was the vegetation – which was spectacular! Lots of quiet places where you could be alone if you wanted to. All in all, I’d say it was a wonderful week, enough to do to keep you from being bored, but quiet enough to make sure you are totally relaxed. Thanks to the HTR staff for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Janice0723
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been members for a few years and recently upgraded to La Herencia. The staff at Tres Rios (and Fisherman's) are excellent. You can't complain about the food or service especially at Portabello's (Oscar rules) . I would especially like to thank Helen and Nelliana our conciereges and Magnus our represenative for all of their help in always making our stay excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay, peaceful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Kaivalagi
Reviews.Content: I went to Cancun with a friend for a relaxing trip and that is exactly what I received. My stay at Tres Rios was superb. The surroundings were beautiful, the food was phenomenol, and the service was the best. Despite there being a lot of people, you did not even know it because of the expansive property. The pools and areas around it were neat and clean and very inviting. The day beds on the beach were very relaxing and afforded a beautiful view of the sea. My stay at Tres Rios was most impressive, and I have recommended it to my friends, and would come back and stay here again. The grilled shrimp at the Patio Grill were the best I have ever had. I asked for Grey Goose vodka only once for my OJ at breakfast, and I never had to ask for it again. It always came and with impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories,great accommodations, great service, great great great!!”
Reviews.Author: cherijohnsonmn
Reviews.Content: Close enough to everything that you can get out and do everything that you want to like shopping, sight seeing, swim with the dolphins pretty much anything you can think of yet you can let yourself get so secluded that you feel lost in another world. The grounds are so expansive that even when the resort is full it doesn't fell crowded. The food and service are top notch and the employees are always working and always have a smile and a greeting for you when you pass by. The beds are to die for, I have never slept better in a hotel bed than in my own bed., I wanted to pack it in mt suitcase and take it home with me. When the maids come to clean your room they don't just do a minimal job either, they pull the beds away from the wall and sweep and clean behind them each day, mop the entire floor each day. I have never seen a harder working group of people ever

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, pampered week!"”
Reviews.Author: sonjatkinson
Reviews.Content: A beautiful setting in the midst of an ecological park. The hotel presents a high standard of excellence. The food, especially, is outstanding, thanks to Chef Oscar. The main overseer, Samuel, has a passion to make sure every detail is taken care of, and that full service has been rendered. Good travel services to nearby attraction such as Chichen-Itza or Xel-Ha.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GGWEST
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Location, wonderful restaurants, amazingly comfortable beds and the service - phenomenal! (Especially a lovely lady - Claudia who works at the Grill Bar by the pool!) Enjoy your trip! This one is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: Anna59843
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this resort because of its marketing of great food, great service, and eco-tourism. Do not go to this resort if you are looking for culinary delights--it is about Perkins quality at best. I am so disappointed, that this is the first time I have ever taken steps to review a facility. We arrived late Sat night and had a full 15 hours of traveling behind us. Instead of being given our room keys, we were told to sit and wait for the concierge. The concierge turned out to be nothing more than a time share sell and a little info that they could (but don't) provide in a map. BTW- we paid full price, all-inclusive for this...no discount for the timeshare pitch deals. We finally said "Enough" and requested keys to our room. By the time we got unpacked and settled, there were not many dinner options. We requested a menu at the restaurant and were told buffet only. After eating an awful meal, we learned there were menus available but the server wanted us in his buffet section. The Asian fusion restaurant was OK, but not any better than the sushi we can get here in Wisconsin. We were treated rudely at the Mexican Restaurant. The Grill by the pool had by far the best food and the best service. The buffet was awful. They "French bakery and coffee" was nescafe with some frozen pastries heated up. Not kidding. If you aren't all inclusive, expect to pay a ridiculous amount of money for the food. We had to order breakfast room service one morning because we were leaving for a tour early before the restaurants opened. We ordered an $80 (US) breakfast, and were served 2 lousy scrambled eggs, refried beans, toast, coffee, and juice. It was ridiculous. The facility itself is beautiful, but to make it clear- it is set back into the mangroves. We loved the eco-friendly culture. We were very disappointed with some of the staff and the lousy food--2 or 3 star quality food. 4 star building.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOLIDAY! Beautiful setting, lovely staff. 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: Xanthopolous
Reviews.Content: Wonderful combination of 5* luxury, yet ecologically friendly resort. The perfect place to combine Adventure and Activity with Rest and Recreation. Not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “after purchasing a timeshare, cannot get any return calls regarding untrue statements made during the presentation”
Reviews.Author: mandymclendon
Reviews.Content: Please know that the customer service is great while you are there. Do not purchase a timeshare because there is no concern once they have your money.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...”
Reviews.Author: kr1sty18
Reviews.Content: Beautiful in every way. The people, the atmosphere, and the rooms were amazing. We started the trip off with leaving our Iphones in the hotel transportation and then having them both returned. Wow... not too often you would hear that! We were shown great service by ALL who worked there. The drinks were all top shelf, great food... when I say great I mean it! Try them all and make sure you ask for your lobster dinner which you only get by request before hand. The room service never took more than 20 minutes, no matter the time of day. Spending the day at the pool with CONSTANT service was more than we could have dreamed. Guillermo at the pool was amazing! The beach is still nice but not the crystal blue waters that you think of when thinking of Mexico. Make sure you walk across the bridge to the hammocks. The water is crystal blue there! The kayaking trips were so much fun and the guides were fun and knowledgeable. Don't forget the classes they offer for some excitement. We did take the tour of the property, got some nice stuff from it but it did take up a lot of time. If you are looking for a party place this is not it...the evening shows and entertainment were all good but after its over most find a nice spot for the night to relax. We loved this hotel and everything it offered. We would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MonicaFQ
Reviews.Content: I can believe how accomodating the hotel staff were and how full the vacation was not having left the hotel at all during our stay in PDC. The hotel is beautiful, the food was delicious, the service was first class and the nature park puts this hotel over the top. I would not usually have the intention to visit the same hotel more than 1X since there are so many to see but when I visit the Mayan Riviera again, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great time,wonderfull location ,extraordinary service and staff with very good food”
Reviews.Author: charlesH42
Reviews.Content: In short great stay and highly recommended. We are a family of 4.Our two boys are 2 and 4. We got picked up at the airport ,the driver was very curtious and drove very responsibly. The staff at reception was great and the quality of service continued to be excellant.A very helpful and friendly group. Our room was a studio suite.It is a spacious room with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch(trundle type).The louvred wooden divider between the beds and the bathroom was very nice touch which allowed us to put our kids to sleep and after draping a sheet over the divider gave us the parents a sense of privacy.The bathroom is nicely appointed and spacious but no bath.We upgraded to a studio room with a jettub on the balcony after two days.Which was worth it for us and our kids as they love their baths. The room has a dvd player and complimentary wirelss which was great as our spanish is not the greatest and most of the TV programming was spanish.We brought our own dvd's for the kids. Bring your laptop as the public wired computers has a fee. The location was ideal.Well done,new but not overly pretentious.This was not just another hotel packed in on a strip of hotels.On a protected nature area.Grounds are immaculate with beautiful little rivers exciting to the ocean.they were crystal clear with lots of fish and bird life.Our kids loved exploring and my four year old had a great time in it snorkeling for the first time. Very nice compliment of pools .Kid friendly areas.Volleyball area between beach and pools.As it was in a bit of a lower area it was protected from the wind when there was a breeze.someone obviously put some thought into the design! The beach has soft sand and is quite safe.They have big beds on the beach with many palm trees.Way nicer than many other resorts i have been to.There is some soft coral like matter underfoot a couple of meters into the ocean and it remains fairly shallow for a bit.I prefeered to swim in the clear little river mouth where you could swim against the flow and get your exercise in that way.The gym is not very big but had adequate space and exercise machines with free weights.I had a twenty minute message at the Spa which was included and it was excellent . The food was great and always fresh.Liked the reastaurant at the pool and the asian restaurant best.The staff was fantastic and service was quick. Our child had a little fall requiring a hospital visit The transport was taken of by the hotel and it was a very positive experience.We had the same quality driver and transport.These were quite different from the private taxi we took on another occasion. Dont have anything bad to say about the resort.Liked that it practises sound environmental principles and recycling practices.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review by a normal person”
Reviews.Author: Terry2006
Reviews.Content: Just back from 10 days at Hacienda Tres Rios -- this is our 7th all inclusive resort in Cancun area, and likely our 30th resort globally, so we have seen a few places. The short story is that this is an outstanding resort; clean, great food, amazing service and a great location. I put 'normal' in my title since after reading many reviews and then going to the resort, I wonder about some of the complaints -- my trip isn't ruined if there isn't a moist towel at check-in...or if they had a line of 2 people a head of me at the front desk. And yes, the resort is in the middle of a jungle -- ALL of them our there are in the jungle - that's the point of the 'eco park' theme! The key question is this the right type of resort for you -- they are not a lout-music-party-all night type of place. They do have fun events and live music, but not over the top type stuff that you see down-town cancun. There were a kids, but not crawling with them (but had a nice kids club). Great tours to swim in the cenotes and down the rivers, biking, etc. In short, better for folks not looking for the party scene. The big thing is service -- if you want it, they will get it for you. Resturant is closed? The waiter will find one that is open to get what you want. Need a bottle of water for a trip but none at the bar? They run to find a cold one for you. I've been all over and not found service to compare with this place (thanks to Claudia at the grill - great, great service!). Food is very good, and they will customize to your liking...don't want breaded shrimp that is on the menu? They will grill it for you...want extra shrimp? Just ask. Every employee had a smile and an a hello - far friendlier than some of the guests! We met some great people, but noticed more than a few with pretty bad manners - I suspect they are the source of some of the reviews that I read. The resort is in the jungle and you get to see coatimundi, racoons and the like crusing around the resort. They are really an eco-resort; I noticed the staff carefully separating trash and they compose the uneaten food as well. The tours from Memory Makers(?) were lots of fun, esp enjoyed the SenseAdventure tour -- they blindfold you and provide interesting experiences - definitely a must-do. All in all, a great place and we are planning to return with our kids in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but no substance”
Reviews.Author: TaylorDylan
Reviews.Content: Food is horrible, good thing hotel is clean and that they have excellent staff. The food tries to take a modern twist on recipes but is horrible!! Not worth the extra cost of this resort. They should check out there compatition and change their executive chef.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort, great for a romantic couple or even a family!”
Reviews.Author: beachbaba
Reviews.Content: Upscale, quiet, great food, fabulous rooms! The staff gave you all their attention in what ever the matters were , very polite and trained to please. Nice little Canoe ride around the hotel, the eco tour, so so, the hot tubs between the pools were cool, and the horse shoe activities aimed to please, the cultural show was excellent. The buffet was huge but the food in the restaurant was top notch, there is booze in the drinks unlike most places, this IS a first class place!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit........slipping a little, structural issues”
Reviews.Author: Saltydogcafe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the week of Jan 14-21. This was our second time to HTR-we were there March 2010 as well. With some 1-200 resorts in the area and our goal to try them all, we were so impressed last March that we decided to try this one for a second time. As before we were put in a very nice ocean view room with a private jacuzzi on our balcony. Again we passed on the sales presentation-the "sharks" were hard at it and most people told us the 90 minute presentation was more like 2-4 hours. Some had to get angry with the sales people just to end the sales show. While a lovely resort, we noticed some flaws (for a place barely 2 yrs old) The concrete around the pools and restaurants is showing some major cracking and heaving. The buildings also had many stress cracks. The was shocking to me and I can only fear what the long term effect could be. The place is built on a swamp so perhaps this will be a continuing problem. Also the adult pool is 3 ft deep. There are no hot tubs, no bar and no premium loungers at it. The family pool on the other hand is 4-5 feet deep, has 3 hot tubs, a bar and all the nicer padded loung chairs. Only resort I have ever been to in Mexico with no swim-up bar. Still no night life and while the resort was 50% full most nights by midnight there were only a handful of people out and about. The service and staff are amazing. Teo the bartender in the Mex restaurant is great. Gregory in the breakfast buffet and then working at the pool bar is great as well. You really could not ask for better. That being said, because the beach area is so dirty because of the outflow from the rivers, it is not good for those who want to swim or enjoy the ocean. Food quality was fine and you could have lobster every night if you wanted at no extra cost. Most of us agreed it is a very nice place but not likely to return. If you want a very quiet time with good food and a nice modern room, this place may be for you. However avoid the sales people at all costs. They may spoil your vacation. Was shocked that some people were still buying memberships. Members after spending a ton of cash, still pay more for the mandatory all-inclusive fees than non-members like me.

Reviews.Title: “The best on the Myan Riviera!Beautiful, staff helpful, and caring. The beach &Cenotes awesome. Food extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: lyneotto
Reviews.Content: A true find! The best on The Myan Reviera. The food in the restaurants is extrordnary! We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “everything is about aggravation”
Reviews.Author: Doc4249
Reviews.Content: The service is awfull Staff is not friendly Awfull food swamp instead of the ocean terrible sharks literally "raping you" in order to get a time share sold. waisted 5 hours from my vacation time I was ready to cry Please do not go there

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN”
Reviews.Author: SamiaBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at Haciendo Tres Rios, the food, the rooms, the view...the staff was absolutely wonderful, we spent days and days around the Hacienda Grill where we had our friends Claudia (the captain) taking good care of us and Luis making the most amazing Piñas Coladas. We will be back for sure:) Samia

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, luxurious, accomodating, beautiful, i just had the best vacation of my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: smokeyadams99
Reviews.Content: Hello i am just getting back to Indianapolis from a week in Mexico and i am truly lucky to have stayed at the Tres Rios Resort. I had an amazing time this luxurious resort was full of great accomodations and friendly people. The weather was perfect for an entire week and everything about my stay was pretty fantastic. I especially want to thank some friends that helped me have this wonderful vacation. Jennifer and Osiris, really showed us a great time at plya del carmen!!! The food was amazing. The activities were fun. The drinks were great. The pool and beach area was really nice. All the employees were truly nice and helpful. I would return for sure. Jeremy Adams

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - still working out some kinks”
Reviews.Author: PKK42
Reviews.Content: Had problems with our first room - ants took over and we had no hot water in 2 of the 3 bathrooms in our suite. We asked to be moved and they accomodated us. While the ant problem when away, we still had difficulty with hot water. Had to wait up to 10 minutes for warm water, and other times we did not have it at all. Also, as Tres Rios is "green" running the water seems a waste of resources. Overall, the rooms were comfortable and the views were spectacular. The resort is beautiful and we feel good about their concern for the environment. The beach is nice - some days the seaweed was worse than others. But it was a lovely place to relax. The food is great -and there are 8 restaurants to choose from, although not all of them were open every night. We had a great time, and felt that the service was exceptional. People remembered us from day to day and did their best to ensure our happiness. I would be happy to return to Tres Rios.

Reviews.Title: “the best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: rudyrod1
Reviews.Content: I'm not that good at writing reviews...but I must for this place. We stayed at HTR for 10 days last summer and we could have stayed 10 more. The service at the pool was outstanding! The service in the whole resort was amazing. The people that work there treat you like a King. The food...wow was great, every day there was somthing going on at HTR. If you just want to relax by the pool or beach...perfect! Be careful of the beach beds they have...you'll fall asleep with the sound of the Golf and next thing you know you missed dinner! But that's ok because you can have a chocolate fix at the coffee bar. Don't forget to check out the Kayaking on the Cenote they have all around the resort...amazing mangrove, ecosystems.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff- they made our stay a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JANK_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios 2 years in a row and have booked for next year. While we are Sunset members and have been to Playa Del Carmen for the last 6 years, this last trip to Hacienda Tres Rios made us feel at home. We travel with an extended family from ages 12 to 76 and with 11 of us, coming together is special and we want to thank Hacienda Tres Rios for their warm and welcoming hospitality. We have to thank the incredible restaurant staff who are terrific- starting with Chef Oscar, Sammy who seems to make sure every restaurant is running smoothly but always has time to handle the Miller Family's special requests, Claudia at the outside grill, Armando in the buffet restaurant and Juanito who books outside activities and excursions. This does not begin to cover the staff who shines every day to make your stay a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusVacaygirl
Reviews.Content: Wish I had written this review as soon as I had returned so that I could actually name the many hard working staff who were absolutely wonderful ! Though this is an all-inclusive resort and tips are included , I did tip because the service was so exceptional. My friend and I went for relaxation and pampering and that's exactly what we got ! The resort's decor and grounds were breath taking and very clean. The rooms were spacious and the housekeepers kept our room immaculate. The food was excellent , with our favorites being the Italian restaurant and the Hacienda Grille. All the food was really very good, including the buffets. Chef Oscar does a fine job ! We especially loved the canopy beds on the beach and spent a great deal of time on them, reading, relaxing and napping. The wait staff who provided beach service was so nice and attended to our every need. We further indulged ourselves at their spa which was tranquil and beautiful and the massages were exceptional ! The drinks were great at all the bars, particularly at the beach bar. The nightly shows were good but our favorite was listening to Fito Raygoza, a fabulous saxophonist, who we were lucky to hear two nights during our evening meals at the outdoor Hacienda Grille. What a great memory ! We loved the staff there and had so much fun with them. The pool areas were clean and never felt crowded. The huge couch-like chairs were so comfy ! I guess you could say that the beach was somewhat of a minor drawback as there was a murkiness (staff worked hard cleaning it daily)close to the shore due to storms, however if you walked further down, it was much better. I also enjoyed dipping in the crystal clear, cool cenotes. One of the staff took us out on a catamaran and the water just a little further out was a clear aqua blue. Just as enjoyable were the most interesting stories that the gentleman who took us out, shared about life in Playa Del Carmen. The resort is eco-friendly and has very interesting features. The nursery tour and kayaking is a must. I hated to leave and my friend and I would definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation- absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kinghram
Reviews.Content: From the accomodations to the service to the food. We could not have asked for a better resort. Still many months later we crave Chef Oscar's Pumpkin Poblano soup and Chiliquiles. The service was extraordinary and we were made to feel like family during our visit. This eco friendly resort is exactly that. You will see no plastic cups or dinnerware. The activities staff will also tell you in detail about the environmental aspects of the land and rivers. I haven't even mentioned the beach beds - heavenly! We will definitely visit Hacienda Tres Rios in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: oma89
Reviews.Content: Spent a relaxing week at Hacienda Tres Rios with my family. The rooms are lovely and spacious, with ample closet and drawer space; bathrooms are beautiful, with large showers. We found the staff to be attentive and responsive. Service in the restaurants and poolside was very efficient. Food was very good, although the variety offered at the buffet was not up to what we have enjoyed at other all-inclusives. It was very nice, though, to be able to eat at a number of full-service restaurants without having to make reservations. We especially enjoyed the Asian restaurant, where our server Armando could not do enough for us. Complimentary wi-fi in rooms and access to computers in the lounge was a nice feature. The pool areas are beautiful and usually quite peaceful. The beach is a negative, though. It's not at all conducive to swimming and actually has an unpleasant odor. I would recommend walking through the nature preserve...it is absolutely beautiful and very tranquil. The cenotes are lovely. I definitely would recommend this resort if an active nightlife is not important to you. Tres Rios does not have the lavish shows many of the all-inclusives offer. But for a more quiet and private experience this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “great visit, would not rush back”
Reviews.Author: smlparis
Reviews.Content: While the grounds of the resort itself were lovely, I was very disappointed in the food- particularly the buffets offered- particularly breakfast. We loved the Mexican restaurant and went there twice and strongly recommend it. IMPORTANT HINT- if you go there- they excel in cooking beef- every beef dish was amaxzing- the others were soso. Re desserts, that if you had a great dessert one night and then tried it again another nite, it didn't taste the same. The staff were super accommodating but on the entertainment side, it was very disappointing- one show was just amateurish to the point of embarrassing and the others were OK. The casino nite was ridiculous with its 4 tables. We also found the walls in the rooms to be paper thin- and the lack of daytime activities a real detriment. I didn't care about the beach issues as I am more interested in the swimming pool. I found it very refreshing that the staff would not only bring you drinks to your chair, but also meals from hotel restaurants. The timeshare presentation, which was mandatory for us, was agonizingly long- every time you thought you were done, you would be sent to another person who would lower the price even more. By the time we reached the last person, who really brought everything down to a reasonable price, we were so ticked that we could have been taken with some of the earlier offers, that we just walked out. That was not impressive. I also found that for a hotel so far from the shopping area, the gift shop was a real disappointment. Very overpriced on unimpressive jewelery and gifts. I would not go back- only because there are many other places to try. We have a time share at the Moon palace so we would prefer that resort hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Owners at this resort. Can't ask for better service.”
Reviews.Author: Jennie52
Reviews.Content: We had a great time very relaxing. We have traveled the world and this is the finest resort we have every stayed at. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the area and activities. The resort is very clean and beautiful. I can't say enough about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “on a recent trip to Tres Rios, Dec 3rd thru the 7th”
Reviews.Author: JimMurphy_11
Reviews.Content: my family had the pleasure of being introduced to staffer Jennifer Flores Diaz. Jennifer is an enthusiastic part of the Tres Rios Team and quite volleyball player. She is an asset to the resort and displays all the good qualities we enjoy on every trip. Jim Murphy/ Meisinger Family

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2010”
Reviews.Author: sylvelinc
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write to you about one of your servers. Sergio was the first employee that greeted my son in the lobby upon arrival. From that first moment and throughout our 6 day stay, Sergio always had time to say hello to my son John or ask about his day. He made my 5yr old feel very special and I was very impressed with how he remembered John’s name, spoke to him with friendliness and respect. He went above and beyond. I wanted the hotel and Sergio’s manager to know how much we appreciated his outstanding level of service.

Reviews.Title: “DISSAPOINTED! WITH A FEW THINGS....”
Reviews.Author: travelthetruth
Reviews.Content: Let me start with saying were still staying at the hotel as I write this review. We've been in the Riviera Maya for a couple of weeks now, our last week here. We've been coming to this area for years. Our first introduction to this hotel was through a timeshare we attended. We, as some stated otherwise in their reviews, we did not find the timeshare to be too pressured... and we've been to a few...but it was not 90 min as stated, about 5hrs. I'll break the resort down with the positive first then move on to the negatives. Hotel overall appearance: Clean & Neat Rooms: Spacious rooms and comfortable soft beds. Beach Beds: Lots available and comfortable. Pizza Oven: Good Pizza Sorry that's about it.... Activities: Little to none....very quiet..great if you like to go to bed at 8:00pm. Service: Has been very, very dissapointing...lack of, as other reviews state...feels like your on your own for everything...were not high maintenance by any means but we've been to probably 50 resorts over the years in the Riviera Maya and this by far the worst for service base...sorry but true...if you like to be pampered or even thought of it won't happen here, has an isolated, no one around feeling... Staff Friendliness: Some staff say hi others pass you and clearly don't want to talk, period....no problem...but it does leave you with thinking about the negatives of this resort....."don't ask me" feeling...so sad really... Food: By far the worst even out of the 3 stars we've visited...no variety, very poor setup for buffet service. Management better step up if this hotel is to survive it's critics and listen to what the reviews are telling you...the food is terrible...what little you have is wierd stuff...keep it simple and variety..this might make up for the lack of beach that clearly everyone is in agreeance on... All Inclusive: Well like other reviews, outrageous all inclusive price...they need to re-adjust this due to the terrible food offered....makes sense....again they need something to make up for that lack of beach...you'd think they'd compensate for this by offering something reasonable so you wouldn't really care to nit pick so much...but when all the negatives add up, it's not good, period... Beach: The sand is fine, the water is horrible...my niece got a rash and she just quickly went in and out, bad smell...ya, ya there's not much you can do with nature but you know what there is something your resort should offer to make up for it, lower your all inclusive plan and bring in better food, then maybe people can overlook the fact that you cant swim at your resort, no one swam in the ocean here, we've been here 6 dys...we haven't thats for sure... Small touches: Not that this is critical so much, but in every resort we've ever stayed in our little daughter loves the towel surprises the maids do when we come back to the room...every day she looked and hoped for some little made up surprise etc...nothing not 1 day...it's the small touches that this hotel lacks.... Overall we have been let down....again were not hard to please and go out of our way to find the positives...but really they're overpriced, the swamp part of the water sucks..Food is not that great and they lack organization all over...I think this is an outlet for timeshares and that's about it...Please get it together and save your resort....listen to your reviews instead of masking your return remarks...you need to compensate for what it lacks...this could be, even with the black water, a great resort.....GET ORGANIZED!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AZ_RN_2011
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Cancun, stayed here with spouse, teenager and elderly aunt Christmas week 2010. The "all-inclusive" is a rip-off; food choices are limited (especially the buffet breakfast-UGH) and the "beach" is muddy and horrible for swimming. Everything related to this place is WAY overpriced (hotel-sponsored tours, car rentals, etc.). The resort does not have snorkel equipment or bikes you can use unless you go on their "tours." The rooms were modern, clean, spacious and nicely furnished. But it took 20 minutes for the water to heat up enough to take a shower (no exaggeration) and the walls are PAPER THIN! If you are a light sleeper, this resort will be your worst nightmare. Every night someone in the room above us was moving something around, scraping the floor, and I could hear every word said in the next room, and people walking down the hallway echoed loudly into our room. The swimming pools were ice cold, and the spa closed every night @ 9pm for cleaning, so forget about that relaxing late-night soak. The service was good (not outstanding); but once again, the food was surprisingly mediocre and I am by no means a food snob. I will give them thumbs up for the generous amounts of alcohol (you have to beg for the good tequila). We had one server, Gregorio, who was exceptional; quick to refill drinks and suggest food choices that were available but not on the menu (otherwise, how would you know?) He always remembered what we liked and was quick to help us. Another thing we were not aware of is this resort is very isolated, no shopping or local restaurants close by. You have to take the resort shuttle or a taxi to get anywhere, and the shuttle does not run very often. Overall, the resort itself and the grounds are beautiful, but if you like spending time on the beach (why else would you even go to Cancun?) then this is not the resort to choose. We spent our last day at the sister resort, Sunset Fishermen, in Playa Del Carmen. It was much better, steps from the beautiful white sand beach, within walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc. Too bad we only had one day at Sunset Fishermen :(

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh! The best family vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lettobee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to Hacienda Tres Rios and again are thrilled with the resort and the experience. The staff make you feel like a member of the family. Many of the staff remembered us from our trip last year. One waiter even remembered that my son liked chocolate milk! Astounding! The food is outstanding and they definately cater to families. Can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: daisyMT
Reviews.Content: Great resort, very beautiful. Best beach in the area. Nature park is great, although we wished we had known we could walk around to the cenotes by ourselves, got some mixed info from the concierge. Food in restaurants was very good, the brick oven pizza was a favorite of the group, also the asian restaurant. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially Sergio M and Pascual C. Very funny and helpful guys, we tended to visit the parts of the resort where they worked! Rooms were great, all inclusive was well worth it. We did think there should have been a hotel shuttle to and from Playa daily.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall resort experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: georgecostanzo56
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending Christmas and New Years at the Hacienda Tres Rios. We traveled with our three teen-aged children and another family. I have been in Cancun close to 20 times, on cruises and on many Caribbean islands. We do adventure vacations and relax in a resort trips as well. As far as a resort vacation goes this stay was the best we have experienced. To start the setting is some what remote but in a beautiful setting amongst mangroves and not tucked between other high rise buildings. The facility is large enough to never feel crowded but not so you need a cart to get around. The rooms were spacious and immaculate. The food was good and the menu changed enough for a week's worth of variety. The four restaurants and two outdoor grills were enough to keep me interested in the menu all week. The service was tremendous, my drink was replaced at the 1/3 full stage without asking. I hardly touched a door handle. The one feature that sticks in my mind is the staff and how attentive they were. Not to stereotype but when I go to Mexico I expect the service to be slow, to wait a long time for everything and then sometimes get something other than what I wanted. Not here, our bags were brought to our room immediately, the bell hop was well informed. Room service was incredibly quick. The wait staff was there for our every need. The concierge new us by name by day two and was able to arrange anything we needed and immediately. While on the topic of staff accolades should be given to the sports and entertainment staff. They started with volleyball at 11:00 AM daily and kept us, but mostly the teens, busy until dinner. After volleyball it was soccer(football) and they kept it open and fun to everyone. They filled in with kayak, snorkeling and bicycle tours through the mangroves and rivers. Our children felt at home like playing with old friends right from the first day. Special thanks to Mariana, Carlos and Giovanna for working night and day to keep us all entertained and for the special way they have with the teens. The wait staff we ran into the most and who we appreciate deserve recognition as well, thanks to Yanira ( las Islas), Francisco (Rest. Alebrije), and Miguel. Our concierge was Dara and she was superb. Thank you to all the support staff and people who we did not get to know better, without a combined effort our stay would not be what it was. Nothing is perfect and to be honest there are a few things I would add or change. This resort is fairly isolated so to keep guests busy I would add tennis courts and a basketball court, maybe shuffle board, boccie. The beach is nice but there are no waves, a draw back from Cancun. There are plans for a marina and that will help. The only other improvement is the way the amenities are introduced. When we arrived we were early, no problem, we were made comfortable. We were approached by our "personal concierge" who would tell us all about the resort and arrange everything we need. Instead of doing this while we had time, and at the start of our stay, so we could take advantage of all the activities she put it off for two days. Then what we got was a few minutes on what the resort had to offer, which now we had to squeeze into 5 days, and a long expose on what we would receive for attending a presentation about the converting to ownership in the resort. After we made the appointment our "personal concierge" was done with us, we couldn't find her. The "not a time share presentation" time share presentation took 4 hours instead of 1 1/2, was typical time share and the couple we traveled with were not given what they were told they would receive. My recommendation, grab a schedule of events from the front desk concierge and get on with the fun. If you go to the presentation get up at the 1 1/2 hour mark, they won't be close to done and you preserved your precious time. Would I go back, yes, in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hacienda!”
Reviews.Author: drewkat
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed a week at Hacienda Tres Rios this Christmas. The staff and accommodations were outstanding. Food was good. The drinks were good as well, but did vary depending on what bartender made the drinks. We were traveling with our two teenagers so keeping them engaged was a challenge. Motega the activity director did an awesome job in keeping both our kids busy and feeling just as much as guest as we were. He was great at getting to know you and we enjoyed spending time with him. We also asked about the kitchen tour which is not on the activities list, you just have to ask. It was really cool to go on a behind the scenes tour with Chef Oscar. The excursions were great and right on the property so we could do something together as a family and still have plenty of down time on the beach or by the pool. The Grill staff/cooks/servers rock! It was great to order food while on the beach and having it delivered to you by Eddie & Francisco and all the other guys!! The spa was also a welcome retreat! Thanks for a great vacation HTR!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Derek69
Reviews.Content: Just return Dec.31 st.. ... Before going there I read the good reviews on Tripadvisor , it was very helpful.. Our stay was extremely pleasurable .. the front desk was very efficient and helpful , the rooms was impeccably clean and spacious..tours offered was enjoyable ,all the staff was very attentative to services required. The property was well kept , coconut trees every where , lots of pool chairs available , the beach supplies was great , the actual swim area at the beach need vast improvement . International drinks offered was amazing..restaurant food was tasty and well presented . Advise , to have full value , do book all inclusive at this Resort and please stay away from theTime Share invitation. Thanks to staff like Samuel (assistant manager ) who work like a extremely hard, Corie ( nature tour guide and sports assistant ) , and many others..we would surely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like loyalty”
Reviews.Author: pauljoyce1234
Reviews.Content: Most relexed holiday. Resort was fantastic. Food was fabulous, best tasting We've ever had. Class 1 resturants. Staff was wonderful. Beds on beach were awesome. It was hard to leave when the time came. Going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service in two first rate sister resorts”
Reviews.Author: hombregrande
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of any of the resorts we have visited over the years but after leaving Hacienda Tres Rios and its sister resort, Sunset Fishermen last week, I am compelled to share with you what I believe to be the 2 best kept secrets in the Playa area. We have been coming to this area for 10 years and originally purchased a time share in Fishermans. From the first day we bought we cannot wait to go back each year. We are now up to four weeks and would spend the entire winter there if I could get my husband to fully retire. Several years ago when Tres Rios was being built we visited the resort and were overwhelmed with the beauty of the facility. Fishermen is small, quaint and the most breath taking view of the beach I have ever seen when walking out of the lobby. However, the two resorts are very different in size and proximity to the beach but the one thing that is consistent in both is the service and kindness of the staff in both. To start with Jose Luis Castenada, the member services representative has become like a part of our family and is always there to greet us and makes certain that our every need is met. I cannot imagine the hours he puts in and words alone cannot express how grateful we are to the way he has accomodated us over the years. At Fishermens, Luis, Marcial, Miguel the Capitain, MIguel the bartender, Elisio Gerinimo the waiter , Henry of the maintenance staff and Sandy in the spa have been there consistently, and wait on you hand and foot. They all deserve a raise and alot more tips from all of us who are fortunate enough to be guests in their resort. As for Tres Rios, there are more staff but no less attentive. The list could go on forever but specifically, Samuel, Miguel (now capitain and formerly ran the Mexican restaurant), and Francisco and Trini our concierge, and Chef Oscar are the best. All of the staff worked together to accomodate our every wish including a romantic lobster dinner for 2 on Christmas Eve which was no easy feat and much appreciated by us. From the wait staff Javier, Gregorio, Francisco, Justino, Imelda, Rigoroberto in the Pizza Restaurant,and Alfredo and Pedro in the Mexican Restaurant were super. Gorge of the bell staff is wonderful as well. The new addition to the resort is the sommelier, Manuel who is a delightful young man and very knowledgeable of all the wines. The wine tasting was superb and go prepared to drink a few glasses. The most amazing thing is how Sammy and Miguel seem to know where you are at any given moment anywhere in the Tres Rios resort and just pop in to see if you need anything. At Fishermens they know we will always be in our two favorite lobby chairs each day around 3 for a solara manhattan and a margarita and have them waiting when we get there. What more could one ask for?

Reviews.Title: “they treated us like gold!”
Reviews.Author: happyfamily20105
Reviews.Content: We love everything about the Tres Rios! All of the staff are so polite and helpful, from the mini-bar attendants, right up to the head hauncho! We enjoyed 2 weeks of paradise, lazying around the beach and pool, which, by the way, needs some heat! There were cooking demos, beach volleyball, kayaking and snorkling, bike toours, games around the pool - something for everyone! This was our 2nd stay here and can't say enough about the wonderful people working here! A huge thanks to Osi, Carlos, Jennifer, Carlos, Oscar, Samuel, Fransisco, Jesus, Santiago, and so many others that we appreciated. The evening shows and activities were, for the most part, entertaining. The Tres Rios holds a special place in our hearts!

Reviews.Title: “If you are not all inclusive, it's not worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara1979_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we were expecting something amazing and relaxing. Although we had a wonderful time we were disppointed with several of the services and the food. We did not have an all inclusive package because they wanted to charge us $150US per person, per day. This was ridiculous for us because I'm a vegetarian and we don't drink that much. We were really surprised by prices for food and drinks at the resort. (read more under negatives) Positives: The beach was quiet and in good condition because there are no resorts close on either side. They are working on extending the beach and hopefully cleaning up the sandy water. Our room was beautiful, clean and well stocked. We did leave a $5 tip daily, which some of the other guests seemed to think was too much but the cleaning staff worked hard. The shower was amazing and the jacuzzi on the patio was a nice touch. The grounds were really well kept and we enjoyed exploring the grounds. There are several paths to take and cenotes (swimming holes) on the property. Some of the cenotes are a little smelly but really neat to see. The adult pool was pretty quiet and the service was good at the pool. There are lots of seats and it was fairly empty. The one positive for food was the pizza cafe by the pool. Fresh oven roasted pizza that was very yummy. Negatives...where do I start... We seemed to be one of the only couples on the resort who were not all inclusive and felt that because of that we were treated differently. We did attend the free mexican buffet on Sunday but everything else cost us way too much money. We felt the food portions were very small ($35US for a steak, with 3 potato wedges and a bun and $14US for a starter size salad, I could go on) Drinks were $10US for a pina colada and $4US for a coke without free refills. After the first day and our unexpected $75US buffet breakfast we decided we were going to try and avoid breakfast and only eat lunch and dinner. The food wasn't even that good, we were very disappointed and felt like we were being taken advantage of because we can get better meals with bigger portions and for less money back home. We ended up taking a cab to Playa Del Carmen ($15US one way) to eat because the prices and the food was much better. Kids are everywhere. We did not realize how many families were there, which is fine but kids were running down the hotel hallways at 7am and waking us up. The kids pool had 3 hot tubs in it and none at the adult pool. We really wanted to go into the hot tub but there were always kids and families in there. We never did go into the hot tubs. At the beach people would go and put their stuff on the cabanas early in the morning so if you wanted to sit at the beach you had to go early. This was a little frustrating because we went to the beach one morning at 10am and there was no where for us to sit, so we went to the pool. The sports bar was a joke, 4 tables in a very large and empty lounge. No food, only drinks. 5 TV all showing soccer. Not our ideas of a typical sports bar. Because we were not all inclusive, they also wanted to charge us for activities on the resort. For example, $29US per person to use the Kayaks and $29US per day to use the gym. We would recommend this resort for families but if you want to relax and also have a good time this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: lis62
Reviews.Content: I can not even begin to describe my experience at this resort. Everything exceeded my expectations and I would recommend a stay here absolutely. Staff, service, scenery, food and beverage were exquisite. This resort is only 2 years old and already state of the art, still expanding, I can not wait to see it again in the future. Thanks Chef Oscar, Leonardo, Samual, Fransisco, Gregorio and all our other new friends for making this wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, overall. Good food and facilities. Service is not as promised. Restaurant hours not kept. Tips expected.”
Reviews.Author: TheodoreBuford
Reviews.Content: Disappointing, overall. Good food and facilities. Service is not as promised. Restaurant hours not kept. Tips expected. The resort claims that tips are included in the all-inclusive package. But if you follow that guideline, you're shunned by the wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “This was an incredible vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bradandlinda
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a special offer over the phone for this vacation package for my family. Not typically the way I do business since I am skeptical of promotions such as this. But be assured that participating in this offer was an incredible opportunity for me and my family. We had a wonderful trip, an absolutely beautiful location and the Hacienda Tres Rios is an incredible resort offering endless luxury and a wealth of nature. Our family will remember this vacation for many years to come and the kids are screaming to go back. If you want to experience Mexico, this is the place to go. You'll have nature , culture and luxury at your fingertips. There are endless activities on site since the resort is situated on a 326 acre nature park. So much to do for everyone!!! Food was incredible, service was out of this world and our room was incredibly spacious with all the amenties you'll want. If you truly want an incredibly vacation for your family, choose the Hacienda Tres Rios, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Quality & Service”
Reviews.Author: Kelrod
Reviews.Content: Fantastic all inclusive. Outstanding service with a smile! The most impressive staff person in the entire resort was Captain Claudia; supervisor of the pool side bar and grill. Room cleanliness was impeccable each day. Room service was the best I've ever experienced and we have traveled the world. The only negative I could find was the cleanliness of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Team Building Adventure”
Reviews.Author: carrietx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios for our 2010 Leasership Team Retreat. When we arrived we were welcomed with big smiles and refreshing drinks. It was clear from the start that the customer service is second to none. The staff treats guests like royalty. We were then shown to our room overlooking the pool/beach area..... Breathtaking! I know this is an all inclusive and they say you don't need to tip, but bring lots of tip money (US is fine). Clearly it would be wrong not to tip this excellent service every chance you get. The food for the entire trip was amazing and we ate at the resort for all but one meal. Chef Oscar treated our group to a special 7 course dinner on our second night. This was the best food and pairings I've ever had. My husband and I will never forget the magical experince of Hacienda Tres Rios. Things to remember: Bring bills for tipping. We brought cash and credit cards and never traded for pesos. Remember to call you credit card company and let them know what days you will be in Mexico. Make arrangments for all activities with the Concierge well in advance. Our group tried several services such as Spa, Senses Tour (Higly Recommend!), Jaguar Tour, Yacht. All were arranged in advance and confirmed on arrival. The beach is great, but you may want to bring swim socks.... some areas in the water feel gummy. I enjoyed the beach. HTR's Beach beds are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Delicious!”
Reviews.Author: Caramia1313
Reviews.Content: We toured Hacienda Tres Rios Earlier this year while staying in Cozumel. We became members and just took our first trip to familiarize ourselves with the resort. We had such a lovely week! The food here is really great! My favorite was doing the private chefs table 7 course meal! You pay extra for it, but TOTALLY worth it! Each night we ate at a different restaurant on site or took part in the group events the resort holds. As for activities, I look forward to going back to take advantage of more that the resort offers! We got a big case of the lazies and spent most of our time either in the hammocks reading or the beach side beds! How can you resist staying in bed all day having pina coladas and snacks brought to you?!? We did enjoy the bike tour and tequila tasting also ;) I even had a minor emergency with an eye infection, the concierge staff promptly got me an appointment with an eye doctor in Playa del Carmen and the issue was resolved in a day. Will we go back to Tres Rios? Most Definitely! Membership has some pretty great benefits at this gorgeous resort!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: JReese55
Reviews.Content: The staff at Tres Rios make this an unforgetable place. The Executive Chef, Oscar, is a friendly and talented professional. Service staff -- Gregoria, Carlos, OC, Cori -- and others make this a magical place to vacation. Even the sales staff -- Milton and Brendon -- are fanastic people to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great service and fantastic food.”
Reviews.Author: ricktoro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been vacationing in this area for over 30 years and this trip we just wanted to relax and be pampered with good food, good drink, and nice surroundings. Hacienda Tres Rios filled the bill perfectly. The food is excellent - if there is something you want, just ask! We wanted veal scallapini one night at the Italian restauran and asked our waiter (Sr Osbaldo) if they had it. He went to the chef and came back and asked if veal chops would be ok - no problem and they were great. Osbaldo remembered us when we ate in the restauranr 3 days later and even remembered our favorite drinks. We met the Chef (Oscar) by chance in the herb garden -we chatted and were invited for a tour of the kitchen. Quite impressive, exceptionally clean with all areas segregated by duties performed thus no chance of cross contamination. When checking into the hotel guests are assigned a "main" concierge - ours was Letty and she was very helpful all week. We never had to reserve chairs by the pool and the service was always excellent. Host/translator Motego from Maryland was everywhere and very accomadating. Especially enjoyed the wine tasting and tequilla tasting! The rooms are beautiful - great beds, lots of marble, flat screen tv with US channels and good wifi in the room. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to accomdate your evey wish. Lastly, if you do want to leave this hotel for any excursion, I recommend contacting Luis Enrique Cifuentes (cell 984 130 80 75), an honest cab driver who speaks english well and will take good care of you. We look forward to returning to this stunning property.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Food and Service of All-Inclusives We Have Been To”
Reviews.Author: TravelPhotoWriter
Reviews.Content: We came Dec 1-5, 2010 with travel club members of about 40 people. I cannot really address price because we did not pay what most would - as members, we receive DEEP discounts on vacations, under wholesale. First Impression - At first we were not "wowed," as it is a low-key place, they don't do some of the hype that others do (like as one mentioned, you can help yourself to the moist towels, they don't put one in your hand, you can order a drink, they don't put a fruity cheap-booze one in your hand upon arrival). This is not a hyped-up place, it is not a place where people are playing silly games at the pool, no party music blaring there either, nor is there a wild disco at night (there are activities and even karaoke, just no wild and crazy anything). That’s good for some, not so for others, know your own tastes. This place is more of a relaxing, wonderful easy-going time with incredible food and drinks and kind, genuine service. As time passed, ALL 40 OF US became more and more impressed... Resort Design - One in our group took a walk past many other resorts along the beach, and noted the others cram in the beach chairs & tables, the grounds are far more tightly packed to fit in more people. Tres Rios is roomy and plush, spread out, you never feel cramped by other guests. Food - The food at many higher-end all-inclusives looks great, but in our experience, it's often a bit bland, looking MUCH better than it tastes. Here, even the breads and pastries were actually wonderful! The meals in the restaurants were very gourmet, almost "weird" in description. But when we took a risk and ordered some things recommended, they were amazing in combo of tastes. Lime cream soup in the Mexican restaurant, mmm. We were perfectly happy with availability of food, there was always something somewhere, and room service 24/7. The PIZZA, oh wow, I do not even really like pizza. Do yourself a favor, go TO the pizza oven cafe (tables tucked under huge trees with big blue umbrellas and an open fire oven, it is as delightful an outdoor pizza cafe as we could find in any city) so it is fresh and hot when you eat it. It was light, thin dough with deliciously fresh and original ingredients. The raccoon and coatis beg there, which was a free show in itself. Pancho (a coati) steals pizza dough when he can right from the kitchen. More Food - The Pastry Shop off the lobby was a blast! It's espresso drinks to order, and pastries that rotate throughout the day. To have espresso, cappuccino, mochas etc available all day and evening was wonderful! Every time you stop in there's new pastries to try, and they really are tasty, which again is unusual. Booze - I am picky, I don't bother drinking cheap booze – bad taste and bad hangovers. All other all trips to Mexico all-inclusives I actually do not drink much because the quality of alcohol is so cheap, suspect the few brand-name bottles are replenished with cheaper booze, and drinks are notoriously weak. Here they have the real thing and no cheap brands to be found anywhere - Don Julio Reposado, 1800 Anejo, Grand Marnier, Jack Daniels, Crown, Chivas 12-year, Absolut in various flavors, Barcardi, actually GOOD red wine (never had that before at a resort in Mexico), etc etc. A review here mentions no Corona, but ironically, Corona in Mexico is like Bud in the states - it's known to be cheap not very good beer by the Mexicans. The have Tecate (great with lime) and one other in a green can, Coors Light, maybe more, I didn’t order any. Room – We were first on the bottom floor Mangrove Jr. Suite. We really didn’t like the view at all, so we asked NICELY for a change, and they accommodated at no extra charge since they had room. All rooms are huge, VERY clean, and classy. Loved the big glassed walk-in shower. Water was hot and plentiful, towels fluffy. The beds very comfortable, some sort of pillow top mattress. Fluffy pillows, crisp white sheets with a duvet cover, no old-style bed spreads! Flat screen TVs, a couple of English channels, HBO in English, in-room free wifi that worked fine for us. Turn-down service in the evening. We saw the cleaning lady early every morning in the halls, and our room was done each day when we were for breakfast. When we had a question about the a/c and also the safe, the staff came promptly, always with a wonderful, helpful attitude. Beach - WONDERFUL beds on the beach!!! The service there was lovely, they would bring whatever we wanted, and would warn us if it was an item that would take a long time to cook and deliver. Grounds - immaculate. Do take a walk down to the river end of the property along the beach, over the bridge, it's just beautiful over there. The staff is out early clearing debris to be sure if you feel like walking into the river water area, it is clean and safe on your bare feet. There is a hammock dock there that is picture-perfect for a photo with which to taunt your friends at home. Actually, there are great little seemingly private places to sit with various gorgeous views all over the property… Service - they have done a great job of training everyone to not only say hola, but to do so genuinely. Many places in the US clearly force employees to say hello, but here it did not ever feel forced. We loved that they act with friendliness and service, but do not act subservient. For example, on more than one occasion, we noted that a few of the the house keeping staff would walk through the hall giggling and having fun together, clearly having a good time at work, and then would of course all say hello as we passed. Other places they look solemn then say hello because they have been told to. Anything we asked for the staff seemed to take responsibility for and would pursue it, whether information, or cream for my coffee. One night a large table of us wanted to eat Italian - they told us it would be a long time to create a big table. At other places, that would be the end of it. But here they offered to seat us immediately in the main dining room, yet have us order off the same Italian menu. How delightful! Emmanuel at the front seemed to always be bustling about, from taking luggage, to making sure we were booked for a tour when the travel agency rep could not be found. Emmanuel then followed up with a voice mail to our room to verify completion of the task. NOTE: Saturday is their big check out/check in day, so expect a bit less attention if you are arriving that day. We came in on Wed and left on Sun, so we experienced great service and attention. Biz Service - We had arranged for 1 group dinner that was going to be outside. But we then decided it would be too cool at 7 pm. Most places would have balked at less than one day's notice. We thought at least we could have a conference room somewhere. With no fuss or push-back, they instead merely set us up in one of the restaurants that was closed for the evening - a much nicer option than we expected! The eco-friendly aspect of the resort is nice, yet not in-your-face; you do not feel you must be a tree hugger to be there. We did not do the cenote snorkeling and property tour but our son did, and he said it was amazing to see how deep and clear the cenotes are, with underwater cavernous areas that extend underground from what looks like a small river. Spa - We got a couples massage, very well done. Enjoyed both the sauna and steam before. The manager told us they would use a heated cinnamon rub, but I do not like that scent. So she insisted on bringing to me all their oils to decide what we wanted instead. I could tell she really wanted us to have a wonderful experience. In summary, we were not sure about the place when we arrived, as USA tourists have come to expect a lot of sizzle from a nice resort. This place was more of a warm, slow melting that left us ALL quite sad to leave by day 6, and realizing there was still so much more to taste and see, so many more places around the property to relax into, restaurants to try, free bikes to ride, kayaks to paddle, sailboats to sail, beach walks to take, hammocks to swing in, etc....! At least we MAY have tried all the rotation of pastries and coffee drinks ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good for the most part!!!”
Reviews.Author: campedout
Reviews.Content: hacienda itself is a beautiful resort the rooms are excellent, the grounds are beautiful. the food was ok but still reminicent of your average all american all inclusive buffet. for being a 5 star resort i would have liked to have better service especially from the concierges. i was quite taken aback when i made a request with marvin and his response was rude and arrogant. also one of the female concierges cant remember her name, rolled her eyes at me when i asked for a better description of what the chefs dinner entailed. not impressed. the beach was ok but for playa standards it needs a lot of work. the drinks are probably the best thing about the all inclusive theyre not watered down like in other places, and the pools are kept nice and clean except there are almost always kids in the adult pool. overall it was enjoyable but id rather stay at the ritz for that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “This will be a great resort”
Reviews.Author: Spboss
Reviews.Content: The resorts greatest asset is definitely the staff. Extremly friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and well equiped. Several restaurants with delicious food but the list of beverages included in the all-inclusive package is not that impressive. They do not serve Coronas as an example. The pool area is nice with à separate area for adults. The beach needs more work and the waterloo quality must be improved. If you go there try to avlid the sales presentations by the timeshare people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facilities, great service, helpful staff and good food.”
Reviews.Author: curiousrover
Reviews.Content: Twelve of us stayed at this resort from November 13-21, 2010. It was a family reunion and a birthday celebration for one of the members. All of us had a fantastic time. The staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful. Customer Relations Manager Robert, our concierge Letty and the golf pro Sean went out of their way to make our vacation a memorable one. Every dinner we had in the formal restaurants was special. Attentive service and good food combined with cocktails and wine of our choice made our dining very enjoyable indeed. Seating all of us together was always a challenge, but the staff always found a way to seat us together. There were a lot of fun activities on the resort. In spite of our longish stay, we were not able to take advantage of every activity. Our sincere thanks to the management and staff of this excellent resort for making our stay so enjoyable. These folks definitely know what good customer service is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: coloradoKC_2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Hacienda Tres Rios after attending a wedding. We did not choose your hotel but the Wedding was taking place at your resort and the entire group was staying there and it was convenient to be in the same location as everyone. The positive about Hacienda Tres Rios is the beauty and cleanliness of the outdoor locations available to the guests. The pool area and the lounging beds on the beach were wonderful and the beachfront was kept clean and debris free. The bed in our hotel room, even though we did not receive a king bed was comfortable and provided a nice place to lay our head at night. The steps the management is taking to keep the hotel green and environmentally friendly are commendable and the staff was always quick with a “hola” wherever you went. Unfortunately, that’s where my positive comments end and my challenges begin. The remainder of our stay was very disappointing. I must first preface my comments with the fact that my husband and I returned from a trip to The Dreams Resort in Puerto Vallarta in February. The two hotels are on opposite ends of the spectrum which is certainly not what we expected, given the price we paid was comparable. That was the only thing Hacienda Tres Rios had in common with Dreams Puerto Vallarta. It all began at check-in when there was only one person at the front desk checking in guests when they should have been aware of the arrivals for the day and been staffed appropriately.
