For example there is only one area to get towels for the pools. They have the Hacienda Grill by the first pool but nothing including bathrooms by the other pool There is an area coming off the beach to shower the sand off, but no bathhouse to change in. Waiters have to go back and forth a very long way to bring food and drinks. Drinks tend to melt very fast, usually before you get them. If you don't drink alcohol they offer limited choices for refreshment. I know they had some great fruit drinks but it was difficult to find out what they had unless you had the right waitress or waiter. Concerns or complaints: Watch out for head concierge, run for your life. She will batter you daily to sign up for the "tour" which is a sales presentation. If you do not comply she will do her best to make you feel threatened, you are not welcome to come back, you are not allowed to use the services such as the shuttle or tours without charge. We found her attitude unacceptable and threatening. I do not believe this is the attitude of the resort, they are a separate entity, I hope. The owners of the Hacienda need to reel them in before they run off more people. Complaints are common about the sales pressure, other guests shared their horror stories. It took us a few days (wasted) to find out our all inclusive fee did in fact include these services. Would I go back? I'm not sure, there a so many resorts to chose from in that area that offer the same cenote experience with out the negative side. Vacations are to relax not to be battered and threatened.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort (all good, but watch out for Car Rental at Hotel!)”
Reviews.Author: akatti
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of the reviews on this site and they are largely true. Won't go into detail on all the good stuff and there is a lot of it. Accommodations, cleanliness, friendliness, value for money, good restaurants - all of that is written exclusively about and I concur. I will take one star away however for a couple of things that can be improved upon. There were some of their "concierge" staff that did not have good information on their own tours (for example the difference between the tigrillo tour and the jaguar tour was not explained well to us, even after repeated inquiries). My peeve during the stay though was the shabbiness of their on-premise car rental operation. They were friendly enough, but beyond that I am hard pressed to find good things to write about them. They were clueless about nearby attractions and were not much help at all. The car we rented from them was a pretty shabbily put together car that had markings both of Dodge and Hyundai, almost as if they assembled it from spare parts in somebody's garage. It also turned out to have a whole army of ants nestled in the back seat buckle holders and half way through our one-day trip, they swarmed out and we had to pull off the road and spend 30 minutes trying to get rid of as many of them as possible. I even took photos and a video of them. When we went back however, they treated us very poorly, and instead concentrated on 5 gallons of gas that we were "low on". In any other situation with some semblance of good customer service, I would have expected them to apologize to me and waive any "low gas" charges, especially because the gas station near the resort had closed for the night when we were coming back. Instead, they treated us like we were lying about the ants and trying to get those 5 gallons of gas free. They went and inspected the car and came back and said "we don't see any ants in there". Well of course they didn't see any critters - we had spent the time getting rid of them! In any case, steer clear of the on-premise car rental operation and save yourself any such headaches.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible vacation”
Reviews.Author: RHassan
Reviews.Content: This resort was the best I have ever visited, hands down. The facility is immaculate and every detail is attended to. Service was incredible. There was never a request that wasn't handled quickly and cheerfully. And the room was the largest one-bedroom unit I have ever been in--larger than my last apartment. And the food quality, quantity, and appearance was outstanding. Nice variety of restaurants to suit diverse tastes and excellent food. I highly recommend the Chef's Table. For the cost of a bottle of wine over and above the all-inclusive fee, you get an incredible experience and the best food I've ever eaten. Having seen their plans for expansion, I can't wait to go back and see what they have done in a few years. I highly recommend Hacienda Tres Rios.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!”
Reviews.Author: faithd58
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I was concerned about some of the reviews that I had previously read. My concerns were all allayed upon my arrival to HTR. I will start with the concierge desk. We were greeted by Hector who was helpful, informative and wonderful. Eric also was of great assistance. Thank you to both of these gentlemen and the other staff who are so gracious and helpful. Special thanks to Francisco who assisted me on one evening of my stay when I really needed some additional help. His kindness will not be long forgotten. He went above and beyond the call of duty. Truly, he was a gentleman. There were so many wonderful staff at this resort, that it was impossible for me to get all of their names. Customer service, customer service, customer service. Tres Rios has this in platinum. The food and beverage staff were wonderful. EVERY single meal was excellent. From the buffet, to room service, to the Mexican restaurant and the pizzaria. They were all noteworthy. The service was beyond reproach, the food beautifully presented and above all delicious to the palate. We enjoyed a private dinner twice while at Tres Rios. Once was a romantic dinner set beachside with a private Mariachi Band. It was both beautiful and romantic. The second dinner was provided by Chef Oscar due to a scheduling snafu. It was also fabulous and was held in the Mexican Restaurant. Chef Oscar definitely knows what he is doing...and he does it well. His staff are the hardest working, kindest and friendliest staff that I have met in the whole Caribbean..and I travel frequently. Special thanks to the following Food and Beverage Staff: Angel, Samuel (what a hard working man!) , Elba, Gregorio...these people were absolutely unbelievable. There were many others who also served us with excellence. Alas, I did not get everyone's names. However, Chef Oscar is a definite asset at Tres Rios and I hope that they keep him happy as his talent is definitely noticed and appreciated. The housekeeping staff were equally excellent. Aleesa decorated our room with such flair and natural talent. Thank you again! Our room was always spotless and we never had to request anything additional. We enjoyed a couples massage at the Spa, and were equally relaxed and refreshed. This had come after our Jaquar tour down one of Tres Rios rivers, whereby we swam in a cenote, visited the nursery and kayaked both up and down the river under the guidance of our patient and informative guide ( I am sorry, but I forgot his name, however he was wonderful). The beach water is brown colored from the mangroves as stated in other reviews, however the pools and the pool service were so beautiful that one couldn't complain. Besides, the hotel is working on removal of the mangrove roots which remained after Hurricane Wilma and are leaking dye into the water...and furthermore...it is a new resort which is very concerned about the environment, so these issues demand time and patience. The resort itself is beautiful. The grounds are impeccably manicured and presented in a subtle and beautiful manner. Even the valets were friendly and informative. Jorge was helpful to us on several occassions. I don't know what else to say about this resort. It is beautiful. The food is great. The service is unbelievable. I will return to Tres Rios hopefully sooner than later. We met some wonderful people, both guests and staff at this resort and had an absolutely fabulous time. Thank you again for a wonderful getaway.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: mclaguna
Reviews.Content: was one of the best trips ever. staff was great. food excellent. accomodations were amazing and very clean. would recommend this hotel for all to stay there. found it on traveltv.com.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vic2ria66
Reviews.Content: Wow! I like to travel "mucho grande" and this was it! Just walking into the lobby you knew it was total elegance. We were pampered the minute we checked in! The rooms were spacious and clean! The shower big enough for a party of four! Though I went single with five friends, this would be a very romantic place to stay as a couple. The food was exceptional (try the grilled shrimp with garlic butter at the Hacienda Bar and Grille by the pool, yummy!!!) or request steak and lobster at the buffet...all was good. The service exceptional! Would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Polish”
Reviews.Author: piman
Reviews.Content: Wife and I are enjoying our seventh trip to this area. We like to visit and experience different AIs and have our own opions regarding this resort: Pro: Clean rooms, comfortable beds. Resor itself very clean and spotless. Unlike other AI resorts, had tons of help during all hours. Loved all the pool side staff who was always ready to help you with moving umbrellas, drinks, etc. unlike other AI who does not staff them adequately. Food: Unlike other large AIs, the variety is limited but what they do have is very good. Oscar, the executive chef of the resort: had his Chef's table dinner and it was outstanding. Wife and I are NYC food snobs at heart (own multiple restaurants in NYC) and thoroughly enjoyed Chef Oscar's tasting menu. Highly recommended. It would cost you probably more than $120. pp without the wine and for cost of bottle of wine, you can enjoy his delightful menu presented with style and flair. HIs tasting menu is worth the visit. Con: Not enough activity to keep you busy. Wish they had aerobic exercise each morning and afternoon in the pool to work off all the food. They need more comfortable pool chairs. They should provide at least one pen for the room with a writing stationary. Beach; not swimmable due to three rivers flowing into it and bringing down all the decayed vegetation with the flow especially after a heavy rainfall. Just this fact does not rate 5 star rating. Pool or beach towels: One towel per customer is not enough. Resort should look into changing this policy. Summary: if you like the beach and ocean swimming, this is not for you. Pool, yes. Food is very acceptable not limited in variety. Need to schedule more activities. Gets boring real quick. Surrounding mangrove jungle is conducive to insects especially mosquitoes in the evening. The resort's ecological mission statement is to be lauded but it can be a turnoff to the guests who do not really care for its mission and just want to be pampered in their vacation. F

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kenvir47
Reviews.Content: Very nice suites, even had a jacuzzi. Housekeeping suprised us everyday with towels folded into different animal shapes. Service was exceptional and the food was very good. In fact better than most all inclusive resorts. With the exception of the brown water on the beach, the property is beautiful. The biggest problem with this trip was all of the people in the airport trying to sell time shares. They act as if they are there to help with directions, etc but they main goal is to get you to sign up for a sales presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but boring”
Reviews.Author: Alelni
Reviews.Content: We spent just over two weeks here in August 2010. It's a very beautiful hotel but it's far from everything and there's a minimal amount to do on site. Top tip Enjoy your room but book cabs for day trips to break the monotony. $100 a day if more than 1 day booked, for 4 passengers. Cab drivers will take you to good beaches, towns, sites and fantastic activity centres. Fraction of the cost of organised trips booked with an agent. There's load of things to do, but at a cost. The best bits - very beautiful, spacious rooms (we had a 2 bedroom suite with sea views and a roof top jacuzzi). - lovely, friendly, attentive day-to-day staff who really want your stay to be special (cleaners, waiting staff, reception desk, activity hosts) - beautiful, uncrowded pools - very well maintained grounds - very clean - range of places to eat - we like Hacienda Grill and Italian best of all The not so good bits - food is beautifully presented but the menus don't change, so it does get monotonous. - with exception of canned dosxx larger, alcoholic drinks very watered down! - very inflated prices, and impossible to get value from AI ( which is not quite AI), especially if you leave the site for day trips. Horrendous prices for trips, in the shop and beauty salon - always empty as a result. Chef's table sounded fantastic but you have to buy a bottle of wine for 2 people - even if children - and cheapest bottle $80 for plonk! - nothing to do and advertised activities don't happen apart from beach volley ball twice daily, if enough people want to play. Cycle trip, cenote swim, canoes on site - very nice but can only be done as booked 1 hour sessions with same spiel each time. Souless evenings - most people eat in half full restaurants then watch dvds in their rooms. - Can't go anywhere without transport - hotel is on a highway, 35 minutes from nearest town. Hotel does 3 free daily shuttles for 13 passengers, which has to be booked at least a day in advance. Last return journey 5pm! - terrible beach - we felt controlled - you constantly have to give your room number to eat, go out in a taxi, return in a taxi...felt like hotel california "you can check out anytime you like but you can never leave". Lots of can't do's which staff manage through passive aggression - rude management and concierge staff who make false promises, then hide. - timeshare hard sell - awful experience, avoid at all costs. They say it's 90 minutes - after you've had breakfast and yet another ground tour with them. Gifts for time - valued at their inflated prices. Price came down from $32000 to $3000 - sounds great - beware and read the stories online of failure to deliver, dodgy contracts and struggles to get money back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place To Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Danzadoo
Reviews.Content: We returned on June 4, 2010 from 10 days at the lovely Hacienda Tres Rios. We had a great time. It's slated to be a 5 star property, but I'd give it a solid 4 stars right now. It was wonderful, but could stand some improvements. Pros: incredible food in all restaurants Breakfast staff was incredible Location is ideal, close to playa del carmen Lots of activities to do straight on-site with very few limitations Cons: Service stellar by some, nonexistant by others. Poor drinks made by most bartenders Mosquitos, Moths, Other Bugs and creepy crawlies ROOMS We were first given a room with two queen beds, a shower that refused to train, and a water stained couch. We asked for a room with one king bed, and in 2 days our request was granted. My cousin, however, who stayed for a few days during our stay, received a king bed, and a jacuzzi on her balcony. The bathroom is beautiful and well appointed. The toilet is in a separate room from the sink and shower. The shower itself is spacious and has a glass door instead of a gross curtain. The room is very spacious with lots of areas to put your belongings. There is a fully stocked mini bar and fridge, as well as a coffee maker and teas. The beds are quite comfortable and the pillow menu is great for getting the type of pillow that would help you get the best night's sleep possible. The balcony has a table and two chairs, and is just big enough, not large and expansive though. ACTIVITIES We are adventurous and always rent a car and do activities independently outside of our resorts, but the great thing about Tres Rios is, if you don't want to leave the resort, you truly do not have to. There are a lot of on-site activities to be had. Snorkeling, Sailing, Kayaking, Swimming, in the cenotes and the rivers is right on site, and has no additional fee. All equipment is provided if you do not have your own. There are also tastings, and how-to type shows. You will not be bored here. As others have stated, the beach itself is not good water-wise, but the sand is cleaned and the beach beds are always clean and somehow were always dry! The cenote that feeds into the beach has 2 very clear areas for you to swim in if you prefer that to the pool. The pools were clean and not overcrowded which was nice. We always found a nice seat and often found a couch available. FOOD As all other reviews have stated the food here is incredible. Excellent! We are foodies and can be critical at times, but we had no food complaints at Hacienda Tres Rios. There is no wait at any of the restaurants or the buffet. There is excellent service in all restaurants and lots of variety. The buffets always had very hot hot food and very cold cold food, and were constantly being replenished. Dinner service at the restaurants could be a tiny bit slow at times, but the restaurants were always filled to capacity so it's to be understood and expected. What I really appreciated was that my random food requests, and picky little changes were honored with ease. It made my day. GROUNDS The grounds here are fabulous. Very beautiful and well appointed. The only negative to me was the amount of bugs, but it's to be expected on a natural reserve type area. The walks were beautiful, the pathways so well designed. The area is easily walkable and always something pretty to look at. The place is practically spotless. SERVICE From some staff we received 5 star service, from others, 2 star. No one was ever rude or ignored us, but some just seemed a bit frazzled or stressed. Most staff members were great and accommodating. Our requests were granted quickly. Service around the pool was fast, my annoying food requests were granted with no problem. We tip for good service and are unsure if we continued getting great service because we tipped or if the service would be the same had we not. We DID do the timeshare presentation. In return we got a $100 gift card, a sunset lobster dinner for 2 outside with a private waiter, and an hour long couples massage with champagne hot tub time after the massage. It was worth 2 hours of our time. The total price of that was about $500+ We just said no no no all the way through and got lovely gifts for our time. All in all we loved this resort and would come back in a second. We recommend it to everyone we know. Feel free to contact me here for more information.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: DocX
Reviews.Content: Prior to our arrival to the resort I had communicated with Hacienda Tres Rios via: Facebook and I must thank the responder for all of her help with answering questions and personal touch with our reservation. Our stay at this incredible resort was August 12-19. We had a good flight down and our Cancun Transfer VIP driver was waiting with cold drinks in the vehicle for our 45 min. ride to the resort. Turning into the resort off the highway and clearing security, you immediately notice the extensive work that has been done to maintain the eco-friendly environment with construction of the long road back to the resort complex. We were greeted by the bellman, our luggage taken and escorted into the beautiful large lobby for registration. We had the pleasure of meeting with our receptionist Vanessa; she has the most beautiful smile that never seems to leave her face. Our assigned room was not ready and she suggested that we go grab a drink and some lunch and check back later. On our return to the desk the room wasn’t ready yet but we meant Anim our concierge; she went over everything about the resort explaining the in’s and out’s very well. After receiving our room keys and towel cards (more on that later) we headed off to our Ceiba Junior Suite ocean-view room 1315. The resort room numbering system is 1st. # is building, 2nd is floor and 3rd is room. Although there are four stories the ground level is called PB, then 1 -2 &3 floors, so 3rd floor is actually the top floor. The room was fabulous, great view, well appointed and comfortable. After getting settled and reading the resort book, we realized that there was no resort map to show the locations of anything, restaurants, bars, etc. I mentioned this on Facebook and magically a resort map appeared in our room the next day. Including a map in the resort book would be a great help to the guests. Tired from our long day we ordered room service which was delivered promptly with a follow-up call to check on the service; nice touch. The beds are very comfortable so sleep was restful. We did experience a problem with our AC unit flooding the floor on nights 2&3 so we were moved to a Ceiba Junior Suite Jacuzzi. This is the same room only it has a Jacuzzi on the balcony. Thank you to Vanessa and her supervisor (sorry I can’t remember his name) for the seamless move to our new room. They arranged to have the bellman transfer everything from one room to the other plus sent a beautiful fresh fruit-plate for our trouble. We spent most of our time at the “Relax” pool; there was never an issue with lounge chairs or shade umbrellas. This is where we meant Imelda, our server that took very good care of us our entire trip. She was always there to bring drinks, water or food and worked tirelessly throughout the day. There is also a larger “Activity” pool nearer the beach where different activity’s happened throughout the day. There is only one location to get towels and you are allowed only one per person. There is a policy that if you don’t return the towels you will be charged $80.00 for the loss. This is not a one star resort and personally I find the whole towel card and policy thing offensive. On our first day at the pool we noticed Chef Oscar strolling through the resort checking on each of the restaurants and staff he over-sees; he does this daily and multiple times. This man seems to be everywhere and takes time to be personal with the resorts guests too. I applaud his work and team from service, food prep and presentation all phases are outstanding! We had the pleasure meeting him one night at the Martini Terrace and dining at all of his theme restaurants, truly enjoying them all. They are like dining at an Iron Chef’s table, ingenious blends of ingredients and flavors! Don’t forget to try the deserts!!!! The grounds at this resort a beautiful, everything is green with blooming flowers throughout and all well maintained. The beach itself is very nice with plenty of beach-beds and lounges; the water, not so much! We hear that in time the cloudiness will clear. Our trip could not have been better and we encourage all to give this well organized and beautiful resort consideration. Please remember to tip your servers, they really deserve it. Here is a link to a photo-show of our trip: Copy & paste to your browser; enlarge the viewer and turn up the volume! http://www.photoshow.com/watch/Wx9IU7pD

Reviews.Title: “Best ALL-INCLUSIVE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaz73
Reviews.Content: The food was phenominal and the service was just as good!! Staff was cleaning every second of the day, and it seemed like there was over 1,000 employees there!!!! The Marble floor in the rooms and throughout the lobby added that extra special touch!!! The only thing that was negative about the resort was the Sports Bar that needs some help with the music and there was NO A/C in there!!!! Other than that, 2 thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great green hotel, will continue to grow.”
Reviews.Author: Metonnauset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early August 2010. Resort: nice layout, traditional u-shape with a little over 250 rooms. Bonus is the 300 acre Eco park. Swam in the cenotes. Kayak and excellent nursery area. Great to se a resort working on so many green initiatives. Beach: eh, not my favorite in the area, there are workers that work extremely hard to keep the area weed free but there is a slight build up in the water. Bali beds were semi shaded in the afternoon which was fantastic. Pool: adults only area had lots of children by the tail end of the day, appeared child free most of the time. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas available. Meeting space: clean new area with ability to do several configurations and set ups, great for a large Corp or incentive meeting. Separate from hotel but close enough that you can still run back to your room or for a bite to eat. Food: lunch at the buffet was good, dinner not so good. Pizza was ok, cheese had a different flavor than US pizza. Lots of luck with room service, made up our own dishes and they were delivered with a smile and tasted great. Overall very clean and spacious rooms. Ability to have king bed suite tied to a two bedded queen room, great for a family or large group traveling together. No pool bar which was disappointing. No real bar to meet friends or your group for an evening cocktail, there is a game room with a bar attached but didn't go out in the evening to se the scene there. Recommended for families looking to introduce green concepts to their children, water conservation, recycling, flora and fauna nursery and Eco park within the resort. Would not recommend to couples or groups looking for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful place”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaReens
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios in PLaya del Carmen. What a wonderful place. Food is superb. The Suites are super comfortable and the staff is very friendly. We traveled with our children and extended family. Among all of us we had like 11 children. They all enjoyed the kids club. My daughter was so happy because they even celebrated her birthday with special decorations and a delicious cake for the the kids at the club. My children got to enjoy swiming in the cenote and tha kayaks with the kids club while the aduls were enjoying drinks at the pool. We just loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great activities staff”
Reviews.Author: Htresrios10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort in July and had a great experience. One big thing that stuck out to me were the activities staff. They work all day long which is hard enough. But when the night rolls around, and you want to go out to the city, they go out with you so that you are not alone and get you great tables at the local clubs. We are out till 3 or 4 in the morning and they are with you every second of it to make you feel safe and make sure you have the best time possible. If you are planning on going to this resort, definitely look for Jennifer, Gina, and Cori. They are GREAT! And last but not least, when you are out at the pool, look for Erick to make you a drink. He is a fantastic bartender!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family all-inlusive!”
Reviews.Author: spetretich
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 1/2 yr. old son and I jus got back from a week at the Hacienda Tres Rios. We had the best time! The hotel was awesome, staff was so friendly, service was great. We've stayed at quite a few all-inclusives and this was one of our favorites. The pool was my son's favorite place (actually, there are two). Great shallow areas for young kids. Drink/food service at the pool is excellent. The food is SO good!(thanks Chef Oscar) Every day we had the best seafood for lunch and dinner (breakfast buffet is good too). The Mexican restaurant was our favorite. Good children's menu, too. One day my husband went fishing and the chef cooked the red snapper that he caught and it was so amazing! The shows at night were my son's favorite part. One night they had a wonderful circus in the theatre. The other nights were great shows out by the pool. The only complaint i heard was about the beach(brown water). The beach right outside the hotel is not great b/c of recent storms, but you can walk just a bit up to the right to find clear water. To the left is nice cold water from where the cenotes dump into the ocean. It wasn't a big deal to us. Do not miss the Jaguar tour! Touring the hotel's nursery and kayaking in the cenotes was such a great adventure! Truly enjoyed this hotel and it's staff. Thanks for a great week!!

Reviews.Title: “Confort, Service and Fun are the ways to describe Hacienda Tres Rios”
Reviews.Author: Nica33
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Tres Rios has the perfect location in Playa del Carmen, MX. We went for two weeks with our 9yrs old daughther and had a blast. The resort all inclusive package is the best way to go. The food is exellence as well as the rooms, service, the facilities, entertaiment, and tours withing the hotel. The "Five Senses" tour has a unique way to get in tune with yourself. The kids club has a well and safe organize program for all the children staying at the hotel. You might read some negative reviews about the beach at the hotel but honestly is hard to find a place with all the good things mention above with a beautiful beach for a great price. The beach at the hotel is just "mother nature being mother nature". If you drive 10 min you would find Playa del Carmen beaches waiting for you were is totally safe to walk around and enjoy the beach. Just to conclude "Hacienda Tres Rios" is a great place to enjoy your summer vacations or have your next special event.

Reviews.Title: “Endless Luxury with very hospitable and knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: hook_em_travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at HTR for one week with my mother and our two young children the first week of July. For the purposes of transparency, I will disclose that we are owners of this time-share resort. However, our experience with the time-share presentation was not heavy-handed, nor was it uncomfortable in any way. The resort sold itself. For those who complain about the presentations, I would suggest that perhaps they should not have attended the presentation in the first place. If you can't afford to purchase, then please don't waste the time of the salespeople to get your free tickets to area attractions. Pros: 1. The grounds are immaculate. It makes relaxing so much easier when the entire resort is bright and clean. 2. The green building is a nice change. The resort captures rain water on the roof for use on the grounds. It also has a desalinazation plant to use ocean water for the grounds, rather than using drinking water. It was nice to see the trash receptacles have two sides, one side for trash, and one side for compostable products. 3. The nightly shows were well-done and tasteful. Our entire family enjoyed the Caribbean beach party, and the Mayan show was great. My husband and I enjoyed kareoke night as well. 4. Although the spa was a little small, compared to other resorts of the same level, the services were dreamy. The resort is currently in the process of building a 3000 sq. ft. new spa facility, so this will be a nice addition. 5. On-site cenotes, kayaks, snorkeling was fun and adventurous. 6. free wireless access in our suite 7. The service was very friendly. I was sad to see that most who were vacationing did not tip their servers. Just because this is an all-inclusive resort does not mean that you should not tip those who bring your food and drinks! My husband and I made sure to tip on all services, and we were well taken care of. 8. location. The resort is about a 15 minute ride to 5th Avenue- the major retail and restaurant strip in Playa del Carmen. Neutral: 1. The cuisine was hit or miss at this resort. The Pizzaria near the pool was amazing. The fire-burning brick oven made the best crust ever! The poolside grill was very good also. The grilled shrimp were huge and cooked perfectly. My children enjoyed the self-serve ice cream poolside and the pastry shop greatly, especially the chocolate fountain with fresh strawberries daily. The asian fusion grill was probably my favorite, followed by the Italian and the Mexican restaurants, which were both tasty. The servers were very knowledgeable regarding the menu. The room service menu, although limited in choices, had tasty options as well. The only food that I thought was lacking was the daily breakfast buffet. The items on the menu never changed, thus by day seven, breakfast was getting really boring. We never ate the lunch buffet, but we heard the lunch buffet was similar to breakfast... same thing every day. Cons: 1. Beach, or lack thereof. The beach area is nice if you want to lounge in the covered cabanas with a good book. However, if you want to get in the water, this is NOT the place. The beaches were very poor compared to others I have been to in the area. However, we were able to take the shuttle to the sister resort about 20 minutes away (Fisherman's Village), and that resort had a breathtaking beach. We were also able to take advantage of their all-incusive with our visit. Thus, if you are willing to take the free transportation to the sister resort, you will have access to pristine beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! One of the best trips of my life”
Reviews.Author: beacher29
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic. Samuel one of the managers was incredible. He made our stay worth evey penney. Without him our week would not have been so wonderful. He and his staff were on top of eveything we needed before we had to ask. I would recomend this resort to everyone I talk to. The food was fabulous, pool was awesome, and the nature park was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tres Rios is a great place”
Reviews.Author: marilina02
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hacienda 3 Rios for a week in June. What a wonderful place! The personnel, the hotel, the amenities, the cenotes, everything was great and we enjoyed it tremendously. So much so that we are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Married at HTR with all our friends and family was one of the best weeks of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Sarachi
Reviews.Content: We got married at HTR in November of 2009. It was great. Luis was our wedding coordinator and he took care of everything. We truly didn't have to worry about anything, flowers, DJ, or photographer. We stayed a full week with all our friends and family, 50 total guests. Food was exceptional, service and friendliness of all employees was first class. We recommend checking out all HTR offers, including kayak trip, cooking class by the pool and the bike trips. The evening shows were quite impressive for all ages. Not one of our wedding guests complained about service or food. We highly recommend HTR for a wedding and we can't wait to go back. One last thing, a shout out to Andy, an activities staffer, who really impressed all of us. Thanks for being awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome week”
Reviews.Author: Wera20
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios with a large group. The staff there is extremely professional and willing to help. There are a few staff members that really stand out. Erik the bartender outside by the pool--he made getting drinks more than just an order, he made very aspect fun, he would even create a drink especially for you. Juan with activities made laying around the pool a blast, you had to dance and do water aerobics with him. Gina,also with activities always wanting you have fun and willing to go the extra mile to make sure it happens. The option to go out to the nightclubs was a great added benefit. The staff stays with you to make sure you are safe and continue to have everything you need. All three of these became part of our extended family. The resort is very clean, the food is great, they would make food for you even if it wasn't on the menu. Eat at the pastry shop, they change the menu there everyday. The buffet has the best breakfast options. The pizzeria just amazing. The Hacienda grill, great for lunch or dinner. We had a wonderful time and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great activities, SubPar Food”
Reviews.Author: GringoLoco_2010
Reviews.Content: The location, hotel activities and pools were all great. Unfortunately, one of the big perks of an all-inclusive resort is the food and at Hacienda Tres Rios it was SubPar.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time was had by All!!!”
Reviews.Author: HavingFuninOK
Reviews.Content: At the end of June, my fiancee and our friends spent a week at HTR and we had a very enjoyable stay. After checking in, we were introduced to Helen our concierge for the week. Helen was so sweet and patient as we immediately took advantage of the helpful staff and began our vacation with Tequila shots and Margaritas. Helen helped us arrange dinner with the Chef, reservations for the Italian restaraunt and told us all about the activities available to us during the week. After enjoying our drinks, we had a snack in the Mexican restaurant and the soup and fish were very tasty. Our rooms were so comfortable, the bed was great, the balcony view was relaxing, the bathroom spacious and the in room safe comforting. I really enjoyed the coolness of the floors and in the morning the thickness of the curtians. While Oscar was on vacation, our meal with the Chef was wonderfully handled by Martin and he truly made the meal a trip highlight. We enjoyed the Italian restaurant so much we went twice, the meal was wonderful and the wine selected to pair with the meal was so good!! Our only comment that is not fully positive was the lack of an adult area in the pool area - we would select an area to spend the day away from the children and while none were at the chairs anywhere near us, they seemed to congregate in our area for marco polo, I love kids, but not when dropping the kind of coin it takes to stay at a place as nice as the HTR and anticipating nothing more than a relaxing time at poolside, designate a kids area and enforce it, no one should mind. The beach beds are fantastic for a mid-day nap and while the water was not much to see (Hurricane Alex had just skirted the area), the sound of the water lapping on the beach looks wonderful when your eyes are closed drifting off for a nap. Snorkel the cenote on the Jaguar tour, it is wonderful, the others, not so much (red mangrove water is not that clear). To wrap up, we loved our stay, the staff was so friendly and helpful, the restaurants were great and the rooms very comfortable. Helen, have the Don Julio Blanco iced down, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - heavy handed sales practices w attempts of humiliation”
Reviews.Author: smalltowntraveler329
Reviews.Content: Be on guard if you stay here. They try very hard to get you to buy time shares. Even though it was apparent that we did not have any interest, a salesman still ushered us into a sales room with about 30 other couples getting worked over. I was trying to stay polite and informed the salesman that we were not interested, and again 30 minutes later as he still kept going on. Then an older guy came to our table and tried scaring us that the Mexico was full of undesireables waiting to swoop down and steal our babies. Although I amnot hispanic, I was offended by such comments. He also made some derogatory comments about the kind of car we drive likening it to the level of a scooter. He bristled when I told him that we just want to get out of here. He then took us to the back room where a mafia style guy berated us for not buying and made a few more snide comments about our refusal before finally letting us go. We were then treated like less than 2nd class citizens thereafter for our stay. These resort is nothing more than a ruse to get you to buy time shares. STAY AWAY!!!! It is most certainly not worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dakensian
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the resort as the staff was incredible. They were happy to be of service and did not shy away from serving you. I have stayed at other hotels like the Ritz and this far exceeded that. The restaurant manager Samuel Vargos was fantastic. Our son has several of food allergies, Gluten, eggs, chicken and nuts. He was able to get any food item for us and did it with pleasure. It made our trip much easier to handle. Even the other servers were eager to be of assistant. They even took the time to remember our names and interact with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: pgeiger2000
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to coming to this resort, but, all in all, was a little disappointed. With this place, I've concluded that your experience will be dictated by what your expectations are. With this review, I will try to point out who is likely to enjoy (or not enjoy) this resort, because I definitely think some will love this place and some won't. I happen to fall somewhere in the middle. First, the positivies. The grounds and buildings are spectacular! Everything was clean and "easy on the eyes." The rooms were spacious, had large showers, and our room had a nice hot tub on the balcony. The pools were also very nice and clean, though it did feel a little crowded at times, but not too bad. The "common areas," like the lobby, entrance, etc. were very well-done, too. It was also very easy to get around the resort--the layout was designed well. The free excursions were a lot of fun, too. Swimming in the cenotes, kayaking, biking, etc. were well worth the time. Now, the "neutrals." The food was hit or miss. I thought the Italian restaurant was very good, as was the Caribbean Night buffet by the beach. The Parisian cafe was a nice treat. The breakfast buffet was hit or miss and the Asian and Mexican restaurants were below average. The grill by the pool was decent and the pizza oven was very good. As you can see, I'm all over the board on the quality of the food. However, in reading others' reviews, I feel like this is a pretty accurate description. The service was also average. At times, it was very good, but when a waiter loses your order ticket for a pizza and you have to wait two hours to get your lunch, that was a bit of a disappointment. Also disappointing was the fact that there was no steakhouse. Being a "meat and potatoes" person, I was disappointed in that. In fact, I actually lost weight on this trip! The negatives. By far the biggest negative of this resort is the beach. Very big disappointment. We found out why, though, on one of the excursions. The mangrove trees in the area release a reddish-brown "ink" into the water as a defense mechanism against predators. As one person in my group said, it's like looking at chocolate milk wash onto shore. So, if you want crystal clear blue water to swim in, do not come to this resort. I had heard from another guest (and have read in these reviews) that there was a shuttle that would take you to one of their sister resorts in Playa del Carmen, where the beaches were a lot nicer. When I asked someone at the concierge desk, they said that was only for people who were interested in taking the "timeshare tour." So much for that. Another big disappointment was the spa/gym area. They were basically in retrofitted guest rooms. It was very odd. In summary, the following people will probably really like this resort: --People who mostly want to lounge by the pool (and not the beach) while on-site. --Those who want to explore nature nearby. --Those who like a more laid-back, quiet atmosphere (i.e. not a lot of loud music and drunks carousing around in the middle of the night like at other resorts I've been to) --Those who like a more compact layout (i.e. not having to walk a mile to get from Point A to Point B). Those who may be disappointed: --People who want to have a beautiful beach on-site. --Those who like to use spa/gym facilities. --Those who want a lot of nightlife on-site. --Those who are "picky" eaters. Would I recommend this place? I'll go with a tentative "yes." But like I've said, it really depends on what you're looking for. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LSU-HOUSTON
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We will come back for sure as long as the prices do not jump through the roof.

Reviews.Title: “12 times to Mexico- HTR ranks #1”
Reviews.Author: Good2go2Mexico
Reviews.Content: Wow! What can I say? This resort blew us away! First off, I have posted on TA for many years and base my reviews on reality, humility, a bit of humor, and with the thought of helping my fellow travelers without a cookie-cutter review. We also use Trip Advisor extensively before booking our yearly travel plans as well. My family and I (my spouse of Mexican American heritage and my two daughters 17, 21) and my brother in law, wife, and two children, spent 11 days 10 nights at the Hacienda Tres Rios resort from June 2nd to June 12th. We purposefully travel the first week of June to eclipse the pending hurricane season, the relatively sparse occupancy, and the resorts are a bit more affordable. We usually stay in mega-resorts such as Iberostar, RIU, Barcelo, Bahia Principe, and many others in Cancun and Riviera Maya which we thoroughly enjoy. We also have been to Ixtapa, Cabo San Lucas, and twice to Puerto Vallarta. Outside of Mexico we have been to Jamaica and Dominican Republic. I realize that each traveler's experience is unique and what is important to us may not be to others and vice versa. However, there are common experiences and expectations that we share by choosing the same resort. I will try not to duplicate other traveler's reviews, but instead post our experience to TA readers. Also, having realistic expectations that- just like home- inconveniences and small problems do occur, do not detract from our overall experience. A quick thank you to the resort for responding to complaints on TA and also for its Facebook page in which I have posted during and after my trip. We booked our package through Coupons.com. which offered a great price on HTR through Travelocity. I normally book direct hotels and flights, Apple or Funjet vacations. We are not Eco people and this did not enter into our decision though we were very impressed by the dedication to replenishing the mangroves throughout the Riviera Maya after hurricane Wilma. I will relate a unique experience relating to the airline- only as a warning to purchase travel insurance (I almost never do, but did this year). We flew American Airlines into Miami from Chicago and connected to Cancun via Mexicana. Upon arrival at Cancun airport, our luggage was missing. We were told it was not on the flight. After filling out a lost baggage claim with Mexicana, although leery about leaving, we had no choice but to head to our hotel. I called Travelocity as I purchased insurance to start a delayed baggage claim. I was told our bags would be tracked and may not arrive until the following day and to purchase incidentals we needed. So, the next day we needed toiletries and swimsuits (we usually pack on carry on, but did not this time). We took a cab to Wal-Mart in PDC so we could start our vacation. A couple of hours later and we were at the pool. As it panned out, the luggage did arrive later that afternoon. Problem was that our luggage had been rifled through and items stolen- cologne/perfume, iPod speakers, hair care products and accessories, and costume jewelry. After the initial shock and anger, I called and added lost/stolen to my claim. Again I relate this experience (1st time this has happened to us) to help others. Moral of the story? Insist on finding your baggage at Cancun airport as it turns out it made if from Miami after all. We got scammed. Now, to the fun! This resort is stunningly beautiful in its architecture, layout, and impeccable maintenance. With only 270 current rooms, I consider this a boutique hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted with the eco welcome drink and friendly people at the desk. We were given adjoining rooms with a partial ocean view room even though I only paid for garden view. I purposely book the least expensive room since we only use to sleep and shower. We were assigned a concierge who gave us our activity sheet and timeshare proposal. We said we would think about it but never committed and only receive one follow up phone call. The resort is listening to concerns and complaints from guests about the high pressure initial timeshare push. We talked to others whom attended the supposed 90 minute meeting that lasted 3 hours and another said 6 hours. The list of gifts showered upon you have strings attached; such as transportation to tours is not included, and in one case we were told that unless you purchase a timeshare, you don’t receive all the items listed. To each his own if you want to endure the gauntlet for a few trinkets. Over the years I have resisted and refrained from the stress of these high pressure sales tactics. Of note, we were so impressed with this resort that of all 12 times I have visited Mexico, I would consider future ownership in this complex- which is saying allot as we seek variety when traveling and enjoy different resorts. It is far and away the best service and complete experience we have ever had, bar none. HTR is equal to the best Mexican resort we have stayed at- The Westin Regina in Cabo San Lucas. But, I will not consider ownership until the resort expands or builds a lobby bar for adults to congregate. Currently, only the sports bar is available even though there is a 6 seat bar on the opposite side of the sports bar wall. But that is not staffed and there is no ambience to it at all. The resort also needs a disco as an alternative to the sports bar. Also, a permanent beach or pool bar will need to be installed. I'm ok with no swim up bar as it mostly attracts people whom have no stop sign. However, that being said the wait staff will need to be increased to handle poolside service. Others have posted that a bathroom is needed closer to the beach and I concur. The rooms are modern, clean, large, and the beds are the best I have slept on in 12 years of going to Mexico. I ordered from the pillow menu on the ICE machine and they were promptly delivered. The shower is big enough for two as others have stated. I emailed the resort months in advance to let them know we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and in our room was a bottle of wine, fresh fruit, and cheese & crackers on our table. Other posters related stories of the wristbands. Since we did not have wristbands even though we paid for the AI, one day I asked at reception when I saw several different colored bands on the counter. I was told that only the timeshare guests wear them and the colors represent various meal plans, AI, and children's bands. I never noticed a service standard better or worse if you had a band on or not. If you think people from other hotels can sneak onto the HTR property through the beach area, guess again. The hotel know the "tells" of these crashers- they ask allot of questions, ask where things are, always seem to be watching out for security or management, and look lost. I did see people from other resorts on the HTR beach property on the other side of the river taking pics and swimming, but not on the hotel grounds. The first week we were there the resort was only 30% full, but near 80% when we left. I understand previous posters who mentioned varying levels of service based on occupancy. This is unavoidable but even at 80% the staff increased their sense of urgency to maintain a superior level of service. But you can increase your frequency of service visits to your pool or beach seats by building a rapport with one or several of the servers and tipping (but not necessary). The hotel pools tips based on occupancy from the AI price paid, but minimum wage is only $4 a day regardless of hours worked (sometimes 6am to 4am). The servers obviously make a higher wage and can make $50-100 a day in tips. We always get to know as many of the staff as possible: servers, bartenders, managers, desk personnel, activity people, and even the old man who is in charge of the workers who dredge the ocean of mud. I know that tipping is part of the all-inclusive package we purchased, but individual outstanding service deserves reward. We tipped $3-4 at breakfast and lunch, and $5-10 at dinner. We also tipped our pool server $10 for the afternoon. The restaurants were better than we expected though we are not big fans of gourmet plating. Give me a fat steak, baked potato (that we didn’t find) and some sides and I am good! That said, we often ordered off the menu such as flautas and tostadas at the grill for lunch, I created my own calzone at the pizza pit- very good pizzas as well. The buffet had plenty of variety for us and here is a secret: since the resort is in the "yes" business, I asked for the menu to the Italian while at the buffet and ordered some pasta that I had eaten there prior and it was served with a smile on the same plates used in the Italian. Can't beat that for service! We enjoyed the Italian and the Mexican- did not like the cricket appetizer though! The mariachi at the Mexican were very entertaining and interacted with the patrons along with the decor and indigenous artist paintings on the wall and a great view of the resort from its second floor window made for a wonderful dinner. Again we ordered off the menu to our palate. We did not partake in the chef's table as the ambience of a kitchen didn't appeal to us. The after dinner shows were done well with outside talent being brought in for the fire show, the welcome night, Mayan show, and others. We have seen many variations of these over the years and are probably spoiled but they were a nice addition along with casino night. But you have only once choice for Monday: The Milissa show. The 24 hour Milissa channel (29) showcases a loop of videos for the Monday show. Unfortunately, the buffet show I must say was disappointing. The show was sparsely attended and the buffet and Hacienda Grill restaurants are closed which forces you purposefully to the Milissa buffet to increase attendance. I have seen quality shows in the past 15 years, and though I was hoping, this was not one of them. We felt embarrassed for her and the dancers were out of sync- then had to work the crowd afterword peddling her CD. We confirmed what others have stated that Milissa is not somebody famous in Mexico as we have not heard of her. She is related resort ownership. The hotel will need to upgrade the offering and also should have all restaurants open and let the patrons choose their dinner preference. The onsite activities we enjoyed were the jungle tour that ended in swimming/snorkeling in a cenote and kayaking from the cenote through the mangrove to the ocean and back. We enjoyed this so much that later in our vacation we went to the beach where the ocean meets the river. There you can take the kayak up the river and swim in the cenote at your leisure. This was great- we spent two hours on our own doing this. We also did the bicycle tour which was fun, informative, and we were able to swim in another cenote surrounded by thick mangrove. The water temp in this cenote was warmer than the one in the jungle tour. We skipped the sensory tour as we are not into being blindfolded, and having to sense different smells. To each his own, I guess. I did for the first time let my two daughters parasail- down by the Ocean by H10 resort. Though not sanctioned by any hotel and without recourse if anything should go wrong, I relented. First, I asked one of the head lifeguards at our hotel what a fair price was before I bargained with them. He stated 2 people for 15 minutes for $100 US dollars. When I asked the beachcombers how much they wanted they stated $130. I purposely only brought $100 and stated that I had $1200 pesos cash and they wanted $110. I walked away. Then the "manager" of the hut raced over to me and I waved my pesos and he accepted. Needless to say my kids had a blast. The beach itself is fine as others have said. But if you want to know when the water will clear, talk to the old man who oversees the dredging. We spent some time talking to him and he states that in about a year it will clear up. Hurricane Wilma devastated that area and the mangroves and rivers are still recovering (fully in 25 years). However, with the daily dredging of mud- though it seems unending- will clear up and the Caribbean Sea of layers of blue will return. He also said that when you swim in the cenote or river, don’t shower it off right away. He said that the minerals in the water were good for the skin. The pools were outstanding, saltwater, and were rarely crowded and cleaned daily. Again, the first week we were there you could have any beach bed or papasan at the pool as late as 10 am. The second week the resort filled up more and one could still find plenty of chairs, and a bed or two at any time. No need to play the towel game here. We did charter a family photo shoot and purchased 7 of the photos for $75. A bit steep but they really did a nice job and we were very happy with the results. We were given the photos on a HTR DVD. I saved the best for last. Several TA posters have singled out their favorites- we have ours. Hector- head and shoulders above the rest at serving us at the pool. From the daily cold "agua con limon" when we get to the pool, to the continuous drinks, to the chocolate covered strawberries and fresh fruit delivered to our pool spot, to getting us our towels, getting us new pillows for our papasan and moving our umbrella to keep it in the shade- sometimes adding a second umbrella, to bringing us lunch menus to serving us the food, to the necklaces you bought for my wife and daughter- you are truly one of a kind. Elias at the pool and Hacienda grill bartending- another "will do anything that you need" and getting to know you personally- a class act. Francisco and Ambrocio at the pool- always hustling with a smile. Victor at "Caribbean Night" and the Milissa show (more on that later) who brought us a platter of assorted meats and fish to our table on day one, knowing that we didn’t have our luggage yet and only the clothes on our backs, pouring A1 sauce on my wife's steak (who does that?)- you are truly a fine gentleman and a fantastic server. Roberto- the manager at the pool and sometimes the buffet- arranging private meals, bringing us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to the pool with glasses to toast our 25th wedding anniversary, to giving me a copy of the Costco (my employer) Connection magazine in Spanish, and the great service and conversation- you are a manager cut from a mold that I myself follow- we create hero moments and outstanding service for our guests. Javier at the coffee shop (the best little retreat) and buffet- always a smile and offering Kahula or Bailey's for my coffee, your candid conversation (good luck to your son in medical school in Canada!)- I can't say enough about your outstanding service. So many others- Jorge that introduced us to our room, our amenities, our interactive ICE machine, and how to change our thermostat to Fahrenheit. Santiago- who cooked us our breakfast and several times brought it to our table. Gregorio- went out of his way by going to the store and buying us two jars of peanut butter for my daughters to spread on their toast- with his own money! Juan- the pool activity coordinator/DJ (whom I gave a CD of country music/beach music that he plays each morning), Cori- who took us on an exclusive bike tour, the front desk staff who handled all our requests from our ICE machine. One request that stands out was on Caribbean Night (BBQ by the beach where they encourage everyone to wear white). One hour before the start I asked for 3 white flowers for my wife and daughter's hair. Within 30 minutes there was a knock at the door with three white flowers! My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary- 6 months early- and asked for a semi-private location at Kotori (Asian-fusion restaurant). We told our server that we were celebrating and he displayed no reaction. We mentioned it again with the same result. My wife also told him in Spanish thinking he may not have understood. Still no reaction. Well, after dessert, I gave my wife a ring and the wooden box was on the table. The manager of the restaurant that night, Gustavo, noticed the box and asked if we were celebrating something. We told him what transpired and he asked the server if he gave us the anniversary cake. He said no and Gustavo seemed embarrassed. He said he would bring one out (though we had already eaten dessert) but we were impressed by his concern. Not only did he bring out a cake, he had the servers come over and applaud, as well as telling the entire restaurant that what we were celebrating. Then several couples shouted out their length of marriages and that created a special moment. I will not name the server as his indifference didn't not spoil our celebration, but it could have been that much better if he had been into it. I must also commend Gustavo for going above and beyond to make our anniversary dinner special! Oscar Orbe- the head chef- a true rock star. When people posted that he is everywhere and must work 18 hours a day- they're not kidding. Let me tell you about our experiences with Oscar. Every time he saw us he asked how we were, how we liked everything, and if we needed anything. One day at the buffet for breakfast I asked for chorizo for my eggs. The cook went in back and got it. The next day a different cook told me no- only what was offered at the omelets station (rare indifference by a staff member). Coincidentally, Oscar came out of the kitchen and asked how everything was. I asked if he had chorizo and was told they did. When I told him that the cook said no, he immediately went to the cook and told her that when a guest asks for something, you don’t say no and to get it. He was firm with her but fair and from then on chorizo was part of the omelet station. One day we saw Oscar handing out towels as people came over the bridge from the pool when it was raining to dry off as they entered the lobby. Oscar also conducted the tequila tasting and was extremely knowledgeable and we learned allot about tequila- how to pick and drink it (I thought I already did). But that’s not the topper. One day my wife was remembering the TA reviews in which people stated that if the resort didn't have something you wanted to eat at any meal, they would get it or make it for you off the menu. Oscar and Samuel (probably the highest energy manager at HTR) were standing out front of the sports bar when my wife commented that she would like some authentic Mexican food (not gourmet) and she and Oscar began to talk about pozole- an authentic Mexican soup that we love. He said he would make it special for us (all 8) at the Mexican restaurant on Wednesday. We told him that we were attending Caribbean Night and could we go on another day. Oscar suggested that he serve it to us at Caribbean Night. We agreed. Well, talk about feeling like royalty. After receiving our drinks a succession of waiters promptly began this experience- that’s what it was. First the bowls of condiments- oregano, limes, chopped radishes, chopped lettuce, chopped onions, and bowls of chicharones (pork skins) were placed on our banquet table. Then several chefs delivered fine ceramic square soup bowls in front of each of us and then served us the most amazing pozole that we have ever eaten. It was as good as or better than my mother-in-law's. Oscar himself oversaw the entire process as they had to bring this all the way from the restaurant to the edge of the beach. He had to plan this not knowing precisely when we would arrive and then have it fresh. He had enough for all of us to have seconds and he even told us he made some for his wife who came to the hotel to have some as well. Now that’s service! It truly was an amazing experience! Later in the week I gave Oscar a Cubs hat and t-shirt as a gift and he told me that he lives in Playa Del Carmen and someday he is going to open his own restaurant and he will have a wall and display all the gifts tat guests give him. He was so genuine in his remarks and very appreciative of the gifts. Well, you have endured a lengthy review as I am never at a loss for words. Understanding once again that small inconveniences and things go wrong here, just as they do at home, this hotel will blossom into a world class resort. We keep our expectations reasonable and thoroughly enjoyed this exceptional resort. The resort is responding to feedback and in time when completed will be an amazing complex. The challenge will be to keep the intimate feel and ambience so not to become a mega resort. We will return to the Hacienda Tres Rios and will consider ownership in the future. The hardest part about leaving such a paradise is leaving behind the incredible resort staff we have met. Thank you Hacienda Tres Rios and we will see you down the road…

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 quality...5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: LKolasinski
Reviews.Content: Pros: >Nice looking, clean rooms >Free WiFi >Staff was nice (there's a "but" later) Cons: >rooms are nice but the AC went out all the time and the toilets malfunctioned frequently. also, the bathroom doesnt have a door. i was traveling with my dad and we had to stay on our beds if either of us wanted to shower. i also found the beds to be a little uncomfortable. i always woke up with neck and back aches that i dont get at home. >Staff may be nice, but they are the least helpful people. My dad went 30 min early for the bike tour of the grounds and asked several staff members, including a concierge, where to go. They all said to wait where he was. He asked several times as time went by but they said to wait. after an hour he asked again and they said the tour left and it was his fault he wasnt on it. Also, we rented a car but ended up returning it a day early with a full tank of gas (they gave it to us with barely a quarter tank). They refused to give any type of refund for the day we didnt use. Then dad went to the ATM and no ATM anywhere nearby was working. >The food is AWFUL! The buffet has limited selections and the food is basically microwaved lean cuisines. I'm a diver so when I go on vacation i bring wetsuits, bathing suits and sandals. For the rest of the restaurants there's a dress code that dad and i hadn't packed for. I hate that. You also have to make reservations which is ridiculous for an all inclusive hotel. the room service menu has the least desirable food that i've ever seen on a menu. i ordered a veggie sandwich once and it came on soggy bread with one slice of tomato, one piece of lettuce and 2 carrot slices. really? >you cannot get any type of cash from the front desk despite the lack of working ATMs >we booked a dive with Dos Ojos dive shop. We really liked them so we called them direct the next day instead of going thru the hotel. the hotel people FLIPPED OUT because they wanted a 20% cut of what we paid the dive shop. then they kept trying to send us to another place we couldnt call direct. >there was NO info available about the grounds once we got to the hotel. we read about all the cenotes and wildlife that were apart of the grounds but when we got there youd think it didnt exist. we never saw any of it. I work with animals for a living and the wildlife was the main reason we chose this hotel. we didnt see so much as an iguana. Also, the water in the ocean is brown there. >dad and i get up early and dive all day and when we get back we crash pretty early. people party went into the night and its very loud. people were constantly going up and down the halls very loudly and they had some kind of loud party with drums outside every night that kept us up until after 10pm. it sounded like maybe it was fun if thats what you're into but it was annoying for us. >my dad is an alcoholic and has been sober for many years. he was offered a drink and asked for one with no alcohol. when he tasted the drink it tasted of alcohol. he told the bartender, but he swore up and down he put no alcohol in the drink and told my dad the contents of the drink. dad finished the drink and a few minutes later was pretty buzzed and sick and knew he had had alcohol. if you know anything about alcoholism, you know how upsetting something like that is for an alcoholic. dad was pretty devastated. he told a manager, and that manager proceeded to come to our room and check for alcohol and said that my dad drank alcohol somewhere else because the drink did not have alcohol. >i went to the spa to get a facial. it was the least expensive one at $140 (USD). Basically it was an hour long face massage with lotion. ive paid a little more than half that at "The Spa" at South Coast Plaza in California (a VERY nice spa) and gotten the works. I could go on. Pretty much this was the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. The rest of the trip was good...Chichen Itza, Cenote Diving, Whale Shark Diving...all great. But Tres Rios is a terrible hotel and and i definitely would NOT recommend staying there if you are looking for a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RoseMary129
Reviews.Content: We experienced the vacation of a lifetime at this wonderful resort. We were treated like royalty and everything from the room to the food was first class. The facility was gorgeous and immaculate. Everyone from the wait staff to the executive chef picked up glasses and tidied anything that was out of place. This showed us how proud they were to be working there and that they cared that the image was untarnished.The staff joyfully attended to all our needs. The staff is hard working and always have a smile on their faces. We look forward to spending many vacations at this resort with the wonderful friends we made there. We would like to acknowledge the wonderful people we met there: Maurisimo who was the first person we met from the resort went out of his way to assure we were taken care of. He provided us with expert guidance to make sure we had the best experience. Sammy was always visible and provided us with special food, drinks, and advice for selecting our incredible dinners at the restaurant Kotori. You only had to ask for him and he was right there to help. He was so available to his staff and handled everythig with ease and grace. On our first night, we met Alfonzo at the resturant Kotori. Every night we were treated to unbelievable dinners and amazing service. We looked forward each night to not only our meal but also seeing Alfonso. Alfonzo's service was the best we have ever received and he made us feel like he is very happy to serve us. We extend the same hospitality to our family and friends who visit our home and we now understand how important it is to make people feel this way. Raul took care of us every day at the pool. We enjoyed marvelous drinks and everyday he served us tasty lunches and delicious snacks. He had impeccable timing, always sensing exactly when we needed our drinks refilled. His sunny smile made every day a pleasurable experience. Shane, the activities director, made sure everyone was aware of the activites of the day. I especially enjoyed Tequila class with Chef Oscar. I will never look at Tequila the same way again. I honor it for the special drink it is and will enjoy drinking it the way Oscar taught us. Jacqueline, the Kotori hostess, and Gladys, hostess in the buffet resturant, always made you feel like they were happy to see you and made sure your table was ready and in the right spot. Jasmine and Mila , who attended to us in the spa were excellent. I enjoyed a wonderful manicure and pedicure and both of us were treated to massages that were remarkable. We also were treated very well by Jorge and Alfredo in restaurant Kotori, Rene at the towel hut, Angelica at the beach, Omar at the pool, Santiago who made our omelets very morning,and Keren at the front desk. It has been over a month since our visit to this wonderful vacation paradise and we still talk almost every day about our experience. Many times we will be at a local restaurant and say to each other we are no longer in Mexico at the Hacienda Tres Rios. We are looking forward to visiting again in May and wish our wonderful family there good health and happiness until we meet again.

Reviews.Title: “Best week ever”
Reviews.Author: acsmith99202
Reviews.Content: We spent our fantastic honeymoon at Tres Rios. The rooms were very well done, and we loved the walk-in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hannahon
Reviews.Content: HTR is an amazing resort!!! We were a little hesitant about some earlier reviews, but were blown away by everything. Not really sure where these bad reviews came from as I can't imagine anyone who has done their research not loving this place. The service in all areas of this resort is top notch!!! We don't expect a lot, and were blown away by the level of service. Check in was a breeze with no mention of the timeshare presentation. Service at all of the restaurants was phenomonal. Pool side and beach service was incredible. There were times we weren't even finished with our drinks and we all ready had a new one waiting for us. They would also bring us menus around lunch time, so we ate poolside everyday. A little side story on service, our second to last day I arrived at the bakery early hoping to find chocolate covered strawberries, which I hadn't had all week, and was so excited to find a few out. Roberto, one of the managers, was surprised that this was the first time I had them the whole week and when I returned to our room later that day, I found a platter of strawberries. Then the next day he saw us by the pool, and delivered yet another platter of strawberries. Excellent service!!!! Rooms were wonderul!!! We were in a 2 bedroom suite with a rooftop hot tub, which was a nice surprise!!! The views of the ocean, pools and jungle were amazing!!! The only thing that would have been nice to have was a microwave, but other that that no complaints. We did take advantage of some of the tours on site. We did the Jaguar tour, which included a trip to the nursery, snorkeling in a cenote and kayaking up and down one of the three rivers. It was definitely worth the 2 hours. Our group also did the bike tour, which was again amazing. It was great to ride through the jungle and see the many cenotes on property, even swam in one. The bikes definitely could use an upgrade, but they did the job. We also did the Trugrillo tour, which was snorkeling in a cenote and kayaking again in a river. Also, took advantage of the catamaran ride which was amazing!!! I was nervous about this one, but Miguel was wonderful!!! Restaurants were amazing!!! We visited all of them and would have to say the Mexican was our least favorite, not that is was bad, it just wasn't our favorite. The Asian and Italian were wonderful, but we really enjoyed the Hacienda Grill in the evenings. The only time we visited the buffet was for breakfast, and it was wonderful with a great selection. Entertainment in the evenings was very quiet. The Fire Show is a must see, in fact we watched that twice!!!! Caribbean night was also a lot of fun!!!! If you are looking for a resort with a lot of night life this isn't for you, but they do a Coco Bongo tour every night, so this might help. The pools were amazing and huge!!! We loved how they were laid out. For the most part they were very quiet, except over the weekend when a very big graduation group was at the resort. They also advertise an adult pool, but that was not enforced, but really was not a big deal. The couple of days it did get loud, we just moved down to the beach and enjoyed the loungers and beach beds. Speaking of the beach, as other reviewers have noted, the water is not the wonderful caribbean water that you would expect, but a short walk south and there is plenty. Also if you go north to the second river and float down it to the ocean, the water is amazing!!!!! We will definitely return to HTR!!! The location was great, we loved being away from town where it was quieter, but close enough for a quick ride into town for some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “We were pampered more on this stay than anywhere I have ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: catpeddler
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful fun vacation for us all. My crew has traveled to many locations from NYC to the Gold coast to the southern part of Central America and many stops in between, we were waited on hand an foot 24-7, literally. My husband says he has never been so pain free after a massage. My 30 yr old daughter always looks for something to complain about and found nothing. The food is too good. We gained five pounds and I never eat much on trips, I carry a week of add water meals on all our trips but this trip I didn't need them. The A/C is ice cold, the daily shuttle takes you anywhere for tips, the jungle surroundings are beautiful, the reforrest is going great, the cenotes (caved in underground spring fed rivers) are not to be missed, even the 2 & 8 yr olds love laying on the beach beds, the pools are lovely. I have sat through on site sales pitches for a free lunch and a clock radio, so I knew going in there would be a sales pitch, it isn't as bad as a car lot salesman and everyone has put up with those. A vacation that will for many years will be "remember when we were at Tres Rios, and we did....."

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff, very relaxing, amazing pools but not ocean”
Reviews.Author: sporty9xterra
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. I'm fairly confused by reviews about it being in the middle of no-where since it is located on the main highway by many other resorts. Very easy to find. I recommend taking the shuttle from cancun airports. we rented a car for a day and had no issues either. We stayed 6 nights- we booked all inclusive- We had a top floor room with a king bed and jacuzzi on the balcony with an ocean view. Beds were very soft, shower was huge, about 50 channels on the tv, also includes a dvd player. The A/C was random with a mind of its own we'd set it at 60 but the temperature hovered around 75. the computer dining system doesnt work- service was outstanding however you had to call your order it. Think of it as an electronic menu. Dont expect too many customizations though unless you can translate. also over hte phone chicken is mistaken for chips- so its better if you say "pollo" etc Food-all inclusive is the only way to go- otherwise you'll spend about $100 per meal. my favorite was the pool side grill/cafe- dinners were outstanding. Buffet wasnt very good esp lunch/dinner. Chinese was a joke-- the sushi was more rice than seafood. Deserts were basically ice creams in the shape of a cake- i.e tirimisu was not a fluffy cake pudding like expected but it was tasty. Strawberry cheesecake was aweful and is rasberry. the free lobster dinner was also outstanding. I chose lobster, steak and salmon trio and it was my favorite meal. Waiters/staff are more than attentive- please tip them as they work really hard and do not make much. Luz (lucy) was our favorite worker- she worked so hard often running between patrons to get food/drinks. The days she was not our attendant we had to get our own food and drink constantly which was a pain after her service.
