PLEASE TIP if its good service as they make peanuts per day compared to the effort. Tours- We took the snorkelling tour- it is what it is. Dont expect to see an aquarium of fish. They also require you to wear life vests so you cant dive down even if you feel the urge. one lady in our group kept asking where the fish were.. if that means much. Wine tasting was fun you get to try "shots" everything from white to merlots. Rainbow shots at the bar were outstanding. They dont taste very alcoholish but will sneak up on you. The beach was great sand but the water wasnt very pretty due to the mangroves. It was turquois about 100 yds out but the sand felt gross even in the clear water. I'm not sure why they having rented a large pump to pull out the gross colored mangrove residue and allow the water to be pretty. I understand the eco-ness but its slight excessive. We had a beach bed everyday except our excursion day in tulum. we rented a car and drove down spent $65 on a car $12 on gas and had a great day snorkeling in dos ojos and visiting the beautiful ruins/beaches in tulum. My biggest complaint with the influx of mexican nationals. They are far more demanding and pushy and made the "relaxed" feeling dissipated over the weekend. The staff was more on edge during that time too. I would suggest trying to stay not on the weekends to avoid the "locals" since they're just pushy and dont have courtesy to wait in line etc. Often one person was ahead then all of a sudden six others joined and had very specific demands. it was just annoying but its their culture. I recommend this place if you want to relax and feel like your at a half empty resort. It was really nice and did the trick for what it was. There was no nightlife so if you want to party all night its not for you. we were in bed before 11 every day but that tends to happen if you drink from noon-10pm and have been enjoying hte weather. Recommendations if you visit- pack koosies- we found it kept our drinks cold- otherwise ice melts quickly in the heat Straws- they arent very good at mixing and if you prefer well mixed and sipping via straw pack your own. Candy- the staff absolutely loves skittles/peanut m&ms/starbursts etc- they cannot get those things and our "resort" friends taught us that trick.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING..PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE YOU GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel0310
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hacienda Tres Rios on our honeymoon through someone else's timeshare. We were reserved an entire week, but we only ended up staying ONE night because we could not take it anymore!!! First of all, you drive to the hotel in the middle of nowhere!!!! You are literally in a jungle and 20 minutes from playa del carmen and anything!!! As far as the ocean, its black. It is nowhere close to being the beautiful caribbean blue. We tried to walk down the beach to find the beautiful clear water, no luck. If you are going for the clear caribbean water, dont even think about going to this swamp. We were treated as second class citizens the minute we said no to the all-inclusive. As we tried to eat without the all-inclusive, we ended up paying $63 US Dollars for breakfast...ARE YOU KIDDING? There is no way you can go here and not pay the all-inclusive and eat for a reasonable price. The comments on here about timeshare sharks are true. They were going to try to sell to us but then when they were aware of our age, they backed off. And all of the sudden we were not able to get our "welcome package" and take our free shuttle to playa del carmen because we were no longer possible buyers. This place is seriously a joke....Enter the long dirt road into the jungle at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: bighairtexan02
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd already submitted a review so am doing it again. This is the nicest place I've stayed at in Mexico. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, well appointed and the views are luscious. The food at the various restaurants was EXCELLENT and I was surprised at the quality of the wines included w/ meals. Not merely "Red or White Table Wine." Service was flawless. The workers took such pride in the place and it really showed. The drinks were potent and top shelf. One of the better spas I've been to. I like the eco friendly activities and educational trips around the property. My boyfriend just kept saying "wow" at each restaurant and each view. In all my travels around the world, I'm pretty sure this is the highest ranking I've ever given a facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, food, service.....Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bre_egan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from our one week stay at H3R. Simply put, we had an unbelievably relaxing vacation. We were very curious how our vacation would turnout, due to the mixed reviews that we had read. We however had very few if any complaints. We were warmly welcomed at check in, and our shuttle service (provided by the resort) had no trouble finding the place. The shuttle service however was a little disappointing, we waited about 30 minutes at the airport for our vehicle, and on the way back to the airport we had to pickup another couple from a different resort, which doubled the amount of time it should have to get to the airport. (Its typically a 30 minute drive). I believe a taxi would have been cheaper, and less time consuming. Those were about the only negative experiences we encountered. Our concierge was nice and explained everything to us, she did try to get us to go to breakfast with her and "tour" the premises, but we declined because we knew this involved a time share presentation, and she accepted our no thank you. She let us know if we needed anything at all to not hesitate to ask. That is where the great service started. The pools were amazing, as were the pool servers, especially Alfredo. Anyone who goes must try to find him, not that he's hard to miss, he's there pretty much daily. Anytime we needed anything he graciously granted our request whether it was a drink, pizza from the grill (which was great), chips and guacamole, you name it. Alfredo definitely gets two thumbs up!!! Room service and housekeeping were also spectacular, as were the restaurant hostesses and servers. There were plenty of activities if someone is worried about being bored, such as water polo, beach volleyball and kayaking. Also, the evening shows/events were also entertaining. The sports bar was more of a lounge, but it did the job, especially during the first game of the world cup, great atmosphere! The restaurants were good, a lot of variety, and the breakfast buffet was a good start to the day. Never really ran out of options. The beach as everyone seems to mention wasn't the greatest, but it was a beach! We spent most of our time at the pool. You can however take a free shuttle to a sister resort in Playa del Carmen where the beach is absolutely gorgeous. Overall we had a great relaxing time and cannot wait to go back! If you want an unbelievable vacation filled with daily smiles and great service you will not be disappointed! We certainly weren't!

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Trip I have ever Taken”
Reviews.Author: Jana321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I pride ourselves in the travel opporutunities we have taken throughout our marriage. We have been to many countries and many resorts. Hacienda Tres Rios is the Best Resort experience we have ever had. The food, The staff, and The location were well above our expectations. I have never felt so relaxed after leaving vacation than I did when I left Tres Rios. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TylerF_10
Reviews.Content: I went to Tres Rios for winter break last year, and I had a great time. It was not the crazy/party setting that I am used to in Cancun, but the hotel had great food, shows, scenery, and a helpful staff. It is also a very unique place because there are rivers that you can snorkel and boat on. If you go to Tres Rios, ask for Gina. She is a great staff member there, and she is really sweet and helpful! The trip would not have been the same without her.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Skepical turned into a tremendous time.”
Reviews.Author: NCC1701CM
Reviews.Content: We happened upon Tres Rios as we are already owners in Royal Sunset in Cancun. Well, despite the negative things you read, we did upgrade our membership and are now members of Tres Rios. A new hotel in the early stages of its development with great potential. Food is fantastic - sea bass, steak, shrimp at the poolside restaurant - I have never experienced that before. Sure beats hot dogs, hamburgers and nachos with warmed up cheese wiz but you could get those if that is your preference. Desserts to die for. An outdoor pizza oven for made to order pizzas only a short walk from the pool or Hector or one of the other waiters will be happy to get it for you along with your drinks. Kudos to Chef Oscar and his staff. Two swimming pools with loungers around one and beds on the beach. The only negative is that the water is not as nice as Cancun or Playa del Carmen because, as the name of the resort says, three rivers run through the property into the ocean. Great location with its ecopark to explore or to access the ruins, Xel-Ha, Xcarat, Xplor, Cozumel, Playa del Carmen, Cancun and much more. Looking forward to our next visit this November.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Beauty, Impeccable Service, Incredible Food @ Haceinda Tres Rios”
Reviews.Author: lawkitty007
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios Resort in Playa Del Carmen. The resort was only about a 30 minute ride from the Cancun airport, yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Cancun (but still close enough to go if you wanted too.) We decided to get married and worked out details with our own personal wedding coordinator who saw to the details of obtaining the minister, flowers, and sound arrangements. (Thanks Luis!) Even though we made arrangements to get married on the beach we soon found it was way too hot to get married in the Mexican Sun even though we are from Florida. I advised Luis of my concerns the morning of the wedding and we were quickly accommodated by being offered a private room (so nicely air conditioned!) wherein we had our ceremony and dinner. We had a special visit by a mariachi band and a personal visit from the chef and staff manager. Although I had ordered the steak for all of us, I found out on the trip that one of friends had recently stopped eating red meat. My friend's request to change his meal was accommodated without question and with a smile. I also had the opportunity to visit the Spa. I received a wonderfully relaxing massage and manicure on the Big Day!! How many brides actually get to relax on their wedding day!? It was wonderful! Finally, while out of the big city, Playa Del Carmen is only 15 minutes away if you must get some nightlife in while you are there! We went to CocoBongo which has an amazing show that is surely not to be missed!! If you are looking for an affordable, all-inclusive destination that caters to your every whim and need Hacienda Tres Rios is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Food and Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: 50inMaui
Reviews.Content: The resort was very beautiful. They had 3-5 different pools so it never seemed crowded at any given time. The best part of the whole trip was the outstanding service given by the staff and the exceptional food. We tried the different resturants that were available but out favorite was the buffet, the food was exceptional and always looked very inviting. The staff in the resturants were very friendly and entertaining as well as accomodating. The rooms very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We took a cab into Playa del Carmen and was able to explore the city. If you are a golfer just contact any of the courses and they will have someone come and pick you and take you back at no charge. This is definitely a place we would visit again in the near future. The all inclusive is the way to go not to mention there is 24hr room service.

Reviews.Title: “Unique vacation in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: LUV3TRAVEL_10
Reviews.Content: The most outstanding part of our experience is the service, There literally is nothing the staff says no to, especiall Manuel in Abenojar Restaurant, manager and the rest of his staff...all very enthusiastic and ready to serve without hesitation. The minor drawbacks is the mosquitos, wished i would have been more prepared knowing that the resort is in the middle of an ecopark, which was the most unique experience we've had in our 7th trip to Mexico. For swimming, we preferred the beaches in Playacar where we stayed the previous week. But the rivers flowing into the ocean was a beautiful sight and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Me... Better places out there”
Reviews.Author: turningleft16
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Rivera May quite a bit and found great hotels, this unfortunatly was not one of them. Pro's Very clean! Most of the staff were friendly and ready to serve! Concierge were very helpful! Food was good Steak House, Italian, Japanese were all good ! But buffet-see con's Bed was comforatable! Good matress with thick pillowtop Con's Buffet- not much there- very limited selection. breakfast lunch and dinner. staff- most were really great some were not. there is always bad apples... get rid of them 95% Good 5% Not ocean water not pretty - but what can you do? they tried to keep it clean. one cenote was pretty nice others not so much. Shows at night were not good... buffet and a show. horrible, one night the show was karoke in the sports bar. this place is nice, don't get me wrong, but no where near a place you'll come home from and say WOW what a trip. I was bummed, but I live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: normans2
Reviews.Content: Are you kidding me!!! Ive done the all inclusive thing so trust me this place is a WOW!!!! The food is a major part of the enthusiasm as I stayed at 2 four stars and 1 five star previously and this HOTEL far exceeded the expectations in dining. Lovely rooms plenty of ROOM! lol... But all kidding aside, from the moment you arrive you are treated like royalty and the hotel is something fit for a king and/or queen. I loved the lobby huge ceilings and beautifull decor. The staff waited on us hand and foot. The hotel just ROCKS its that simple. No armbands needed frankly who wants to be tagged like an escaped DOG. This place won't only exceed expectations it will blow you away! The room service may have been my favorite part.... Ok lets be honest , it was! LOL. Great food delivered in 20 minutes of your ordering. I loved it. Gained some pounds and never left the room. The beach was nice and the BALI beds with the drapes were amazing. The wife and I had a couple margaritas and a shot of JOSE and were fast asleep on the BALIS . After the hour long nap we cruised over to the pizza place which no kidding is something to brag about ... We shared a veggie calzone (I hate anything called veggie give me meat!!!) and let me tell ya, we ordered another one after the first bite AMAZING!!!!!! Good quality in the food also that pizza joint used a real fire BRICK OVEN. The nightime cuisine was comparable to a 4 diamond RESTRAUNT(youll see) Couples massage in the spa gave me chills just downright perfect. Go and ENJOY yourself pay the extra buck or two and you won't regret it!!!!! Happy travels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: ewymer
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days here with my husband and two other couples. The property is very new and sparkling clean. The first few days of our stay they had occupancy of about 30% and the service was Outstanding. By the end of the week I would say the population had doubled and service definitely slid. Food options are limited and get to be monotonous. The Mexican restaurant upstairs was far too "haute cuisine" for any of our group's taste. They need to improve their refrigeration capacity. The six of us routinely drank them out of cold beer. They seemed to only be able to stock it by the six-pack and then would have to run to the warehouse for more, which was lukewarm. While the pools on site are large and interesting, the ocean is unswimmable. There is a nature preserve on site for bike riding, snorkeling and kayaking, all recommended. The resort is otherwise secluded. It is impossible to get off property with out hiring a cab or signing up for an excursion. We did spend two days off site shopping and sightseeing, which was nice, but not a very good use of our all-inclusive fee. Be prepared for a hard sell on buying a time share or one of the Phase 2 beach houses. 90 minutes will easily turn into 3 hours. The staff were all extremely friendly, and eager to please. There is an entertainment department who schedules activities throughout the day and various events in the evening. There is a “kids club” which runs until 6 pm., essentially a day-care. There really are very few things for children at this resort. They do stock a few kid board games in the bar, which I thought was weird.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations, A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilabners5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HTR the first week of May. After reading the reviews from earlier in the spring, I was a little apprehensive. However, after spending the week there, I can honestly say that if anyone stays at this resort and does not have a good time, they must be trying really hard not to have a good time! Check in went very smoothly for us. It did take about 30 mins to check in and speak with our concierge. We were escorted to our room and given instructions on how to use the computer system, thermostat, etc. There was some pressure to attend what I assume was a time share presentation. It was referred to as a "Tour of the property," and we were offerred tickets to nearby attrations and other incentives to attend. We were assured that there would be no high pressure. Initially, we said we would go, but in the end, My husband and I decided we didn't want to spend any of our vacation time in a sales presentation. We called and cancelled, and we were not approached again. The rooms were wonderful! They are very spacious, the furniture is nice and the beds were so comfortable. The jacuzzi tub was a nice touch. We could not have been more pleased with the accomodations. I have seen a lot of commentary about the food. The buffet does become old after a couple of times. I am the first to admit that we do not normally eat fancy fare at all, and the items and combinations on the menu can seem a little intimidating. However, everything that we ordered was excellent. Also, the staff is very accomodating, and is willing to make special items not on the menu, if you prefer. The Hacienda Grill and the pizza place are wonderful for lunches. Also, order room service and get the Mexican breakfast sometime...yummy. The room service menu is somewhat limited, but service is prompt. Drinks may have been a little light on the alcohol, but were fine for us. We did not have intentions of going on vacation to get plastered, anyway. The tours and activities that we participated in were great. We did the Jaguar tour, and tequila tasting, which I would highly recommend. We also did the Sense of Adventure which was a little different, but okay. Definitely worth experiencing. The beach is...well, not so pretty. And initially, I was disappointed about that. However, The pools are great. There is a beautiful area to the left of the resort that has beautiful water and a couple of sweet spots for swimming. Also, the cenotes are wonderful to swim in! It was not a far walk, and they felt so refreshing! The resort has a very family friendly atmosphere. This is not a big party place. The activities in the evenings were nice, we attended a couple of them. The Fire show and the Mayan show were great. The thing that makes the resort stand out, is the staff. Everyone there seemed happy to see us all the time. Everyone was very accomodating, and they must work 16-18 hour days. Oscar, Shawn and Tony were especially friendly. I would highly recommend this resort. Also, If you are looking for something interesting to do while in the area, I would recommend The Jungle Place and Edventure Tours. They made our vacation great. And the ruins at Tulum and Coba were awesome! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: traveler20106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 days and had a great time. We purposely stayed outside of Cancun because we came purely for relaxation and not for nightlife. The resort itself had a small selection of nightly activities (a dance show, a fire show, karaoke, etc.), but for the most part it was pretty quiet. Since I wasn't vacationing with the expectation of being entertained every night this really didn't bother me, but if you want more of a party atmosphere then this is not the place for you. One thing I was very impressed with was how clean the rooms were. Granted, the hotel is only about a year old so everything still feels very new, but I still feel this is worth mentioning. When I travel for my job I stay almost exclusively at the Four Seasons, and I'm also a neat freak, so for the room to feel clean to me is saying a lot. Also, every room has an ocean view and a balcony. Another thing worth mentioning is the staff. I felt that every single person that worked there went out of their way to get us exactly what we wanted even if it wasn't advertised or on the menu. Not only that, but they'll remember what each person likes and make sure that it's available to them throughout the week. Speaking of this, make sure to note that telling them things ahead of time helps a lot. For example, on the all inclusive program lobster isn't necessarily on the menu, but if you tell them beforehand they'll have it ready for dinner at the restaurant of your choice. When you arrive at the hotel it's nice that they allow you to choose either all inclusive OR a la carte because a lot of all inclusives won't give you the choice. My husband and I don't drink, so we don't necessarily feel like we get our money's worth doing the all inclusive. I do have to say that if you choose a la carte they definitely hike the prices up a lot (like $45 dollars for a steak dinner), but if you eat light the rest of the day and you're not big drinkers you'll still save money. I haven't stayed at many all inclusives, but I do have to say that I thought the quality of the food was very good. It wasn't like some of these places that just throw out a huge buffet of mass-produced food. (Having said that, I'm also a person that travels without expecting other countries to bend over backwards for me. I pretty much go with what their culture and food is. You can't expect the croissants at the breakfast buffet to taste like those in Paris. I went with the mentality that I was going to eat eggs and tortillas for breakfast and it was delicious!) The menus had gourmet food which was all very good, but like I said before, you can always ask for something that's not on the menu. A quick note on the "chef's table" dinner: I would definitely recommend it as the food is very good and unique, but don't expect a moody, romantic atmosphere. You're literally sitting in a section of the kitchen under bright lights, surrounded by white walls and stainless steel, listening to the clanking of pots and pans. This isn't a bad thing, but just go into the experience expecting this. Also, for some reason I was under the impression that a bunch of people would all be sitting at a communal table and was pleased to arrive and find that each couple or party did get their own table. I spent almost every day out by the pools or the beach. The beach right in front of the hotel is not that nice! The reason is that there are 3 freshwater rivers that empty out into the ocean on the resort's property. This is kind of cool in itself because it's fairly rare, and you can snorkel or kayak down the rivers. However, the bad side of this is that the rivers churn up the sand where they meet the sea, so the water and beach right in front of the resort are not that enticing for swimming. If you want that postcard perfect turquoise water and white sand beach you can take the shuttle or a taxi (for about $15 one way) into Playa del Carmen, hang out at the beach for the day,and come back to the resort when you please. (I actually think you're totally missing out if you don't do that at least one time during your stay here) However, if you just want to relax or read, the beds on the beach are amazing (made up daily with fresh white covers and pillows) and I never had a problem getting one at any time of day. The waiters will serve you down on the beach or at the pool. There were two pools (one kids one with volleyball, etc. and one grown up one) that were both very clean and the perfect temperature. Most afternoons I would head over to the gym, which wasn't that big but had nice equipment (3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 2 bikes, and weights). It was always pretty empty so I never had trouble getting on a machine I wanted. My husband and I also both did spa treatments and were happy, although considering what workers in Mexico must make compared to workers in the states, the prices on the treatments were definitely not discounted at all. I can get a cheaper facial at the place I go to in Beverly HIlls than I could at the resort! Overall we had a wonderful time. We relaxed, ate good food, and came home with great tans! Everyone there did a wonderful job trying to meet our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: umass123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda Tres Rios for 7 nights the first week of May. Excellent choice if you are looking for rest and relaxation with plenty of options available for daily activities. Check in was a breeze after which you meet with a concierge agent who explains the resort and everything it has to offer. The concierge also tries to talk you into going to a time share presentation. We initially declined and we were not pressed. Our concierge then led us to our 1 Bedroom suite which was on the 4th floor (unit 4328). This was a corner unit facing the cenotes and the end of the beach (no pool view). In the unit, there was a living/dining room (with a large dining room table on which we enjoyed room service on almost daily) and a master bedroom with a master bathroom. The unit was very spacious, had 2 balconies, one overlooking the cenote/beach and the other overlooking the mangrove forest. The added surprise of this unit was that the master bedroom had a spiral staircase leading to the roof and a private Jacuzzi tub outside on the roof, very nice. This was our first experience with all-inclusive and I was a little concerned after reading reviews regarding bracelets and how we would be treated, but I expected that if we tipped as we normally would we would be okay. We came in through RCI, and had what I guess was an RCI bracelet and, although we noticed many different colored bracelets on other people and some people with no bracelet, it appeared that everyone was treated the same, regardless of tipping. The bracelet that we were given to wear unfortunately had to be worn for the entire week and is not comfortable. The service at the pool area was very good. We generally tipped in accordance with the service, which was outstanding all week and regardless of tipping, the service appeared just as good for everyone around us all week. We ate at the Mexican, Italian and Asian restaurants as well as the Hacienda grille. The wait staff was good throughout, however the food was average and only occasionally above average. The alcoholic beverages lacked alcohol so Tecate (Mexican beer, although other choices are available) is the way to go. Room service was always timely and brought us what we wanted, regardless of whether or not it was on the room service menu. The timeshare presentation: Let me start by saying that on the Saturday of our arrival, it was very windy out. We woke up the next morning and it was still windy and slightly overcast which made us think it would be a bad weather day. We decided to call the concierge and see if we could go to the presentation that morning. The two factors in deciding to attend were the weather and well over $300 in savings with gifts for attending the presentation. Although the salespeople will tell you otherwise, it definitely turns into a high pressure sales pitch. I actually thought the final offer they gave us was a really good deal, but we ended up no-ing our way out in about 3 hours. For this we ended up getting two tickets for a day trip to Xel Ha and Tulum (which I would recommend doing if you have the time), a ½ hour massage for the two of us and free transportation for the week to Playa del Carmen. Recommendations: I would recommend once you have settled in, take a look at the weekly activity schedule and then go to the concierge and book the activities you would like to participate in. Many of the tours fill up fast. They have a bicycle tour, snorkeling (down the cenote to the beach area) and kayaking (up and down the cenote). You can also use the equipment and do these activities on your own, but it was nice to have the activities staff guide us and give us a narrative about the resort and Mexico in general. The pool area is very nice with 2 large pools and 3 or 4 hot tubs. The beach area is okay, however, as most of these reviews will note, the water is somewhat murky and I did not see anyone swimming in the ocean in front of the resort’s beach area all week. If you are looking to relax on the beach all week with blue water in front of you, this resort is probable not for you. However, you can get a good beach experience walking several hundred yards up the beach or by going to the sister resort, Fisherman’s, in Playa Del Carmen. The all-inclusive extends to Fisherman’s, so we did enjoy a day walking through the shops on 5th avenue in Playa Del Carmen as well as the beach, pool and all-inclusive at Fisherman’s. If you are looking for nightlife and a party atmosphere, this resort is probably not for you. There are very few people out past 11 pm and only once during our stay did the sports bar have more than 10 guests after this time. However if you do stay here and happen to be in the mood to party one night, Tony from the activities staff, rounds up anyone interested in going out at night and guides them into Playa Del Carmen’s bars and clubs at the end of his shift (around 10PM). The employees at this resort work hard and are very friendly and outgoing. By the end of our weeks stay, we knew many of them on a first name basis, knew a little bit about them and appreciated all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort-pretty close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: bmort
Reviews.Content: First let me Preface that we stayed here through our Worldmark/RCI time share, so we didn't pay the full room price, we noticed on check out that the regular rates for just the junior sweets (where we stayed) were 350 p/person, p/night. We paid around 50.00 a night- so the bang for the buck value for us was AMAZING! Tres Rios is about 30 minutes to the west of Cancun, so there is a little bit of driving that needs to be done to actually get to the resort. My wife and I decided we would try out a rental car and it worked great! Just make sure you book a rental car through the corporate website before you go down there because there are scammers all over the place that will "give you a free rental" if you attend their timeshare. Anyway, we got an 8 day rental from National for about 140.00, it was a four dour Jetta and did a great job of getting us around. I'd never been to mexico so I was worried about driving there, but it was a breeze. There is only one road out of the airport, and all you do is follow the signs to Playa Del Carmen on the 307 interstate, and about 25-35 minutes later you'll see big white letters (like 10 ft. tall) on the left that say Tres Rios-you then check in at the entrance guard shack and in you go. When you get to the resort you notice all the jungle, it was straight up Jungle Book, or Jurassic Park, it was beautiful. Then when you get to actual building the valet comes out and checks your bags with the bellboy and then takes your car and the bellboy takes your bags. We walked in and the lobby was just amazing! Thats really all you could say, just beautiful (and air conditioned extremely well). After we checked in at the desk we were introduced to our own Concierge, her name was Fer (fernanda), she was excellent. Her english was fantastic as she explained to us all of the features of the resort and then answered any questions we had. She really was great! We were then shown to our room where we met the bellboy with our bags. The room was on the 3rd and had an amazing view of the beach, pools, hotel, jungle, just anything you can imagine on a postcard could be scene from our balcony. And the room was great, it had marble and granite everywhere, absolutley beautiful. We attended a timeshare presentation and got a free trip to Chichen Itza (a must see, one of the 7 wonders) and the presentation wasn't that bad, it came with free big breakfast and tour of the grounds, plus it was pretty easy to say no to a 208,000.00 package. There are like 6 restaraunts at the resort, we like the brick oven pizza and hacienda grill the most, but as far as price goes we found that room service was the most inexspensive way to go (we opted out of the all inclusive, too pricey for us). Great food though. The staff provided excellent entertainment, there was a big welcome dinner with a mexican mariachi(?) band, there was a fire dance show, a mayan native show and a whole bunch of other great activities. The only complaint about the resort itself was the beach was not the best. The beach had great lounge stuff set up, which was great, but the water was brown and was washing a lot of black gunk up on the shore so if you wanted to swim it was better to walk down the beach about 100 yards to next resort where the water was blue and the sand was white. Still really great though. Playa Del Carmen is the closest city, about a five to ten minute drive to west, really easy with a rental car, its a smaller version of Cancun, with lots of places to eat, beautiful beaches and lots to do. A must see on the your trip is the Alux restraunt and lounge. Its on Juarez Ave. (resort staff can give you a map) but its a restraunt in a cave, the prices are actually cheaper than the resort food prices and the food is wonderful! There is a website if you google Alux, playa del carmen. Anyway, we also went to Cozumel and did snorkeling, which was great and we also went swimming in the natural pools they have at the resort, called Cenotes, all around just a beautiful area. And despite and what the negative people say, the water at this resort was safe to drink, we would fill up water bottles and keep them in our fridge, it was great and we never got sick. I would recommend this resort for sure! Also, I've read reviews that some say the resort is for older people, my wife and I are 24, no kids, and we had a blast. The resort only fills a certain number of rooms so it never seems really crowded, its great and unless you want to be in walking distance to night clubs, I would really recommend this place cause it has it all!

Reviews.Title: “I will return.”
Reviews.Author: sandlady65
Reviews.Content: I visited Hacienda Tres Rios with a friend for a 3 nights stay. If not for the continuous rain, it would have been a great girls' trip! We only had seven hours of sunshine the entire time we were there and still managed to enjoy the resort and the hotel. Negatives: Front desk doesn't make American change. Concierge was not there the first afternoon we were there and the front desk couldn't find a map of the resort. Our room was missing the dust ruffle and other colorful accessories that make it not "white" and boring. In room coffee maker supplies were not restocked. Entertainment options very minimal when it rains--and remember it rained all but 7 hours of 3.5 days... The sports bar is central to the lobby but has no real ambience...a little too lit and a not exciting enough to draw a fun crowd. Not enough services poolside. Spa doesn't have a restroom--you have to go the gym around the corner. Internet was spotty -- they blamed it on the rain. Positives: Friendly staff. Better food than other all--inclusives I've visited. Nice pool and outdoor cafe. Spa massage choices are decent and they had good promo prices when we were there. Clean rooms. The rooms were nice and our balcony overlooking the pool was great. We could see the beach and the water. The beach seemed fairly clear of seaweed. The beach beds...! Karaoke was fun. If it hadn't rained so much I believe the resort would have had many more pluses...there are plenty of outdoor sitting areas, the nature reserve looked fantastic including the natural river which you can snorkel and/or kayak, there's a man-made river going through the resort and you can grab a canoe and paddle around, hammocks. I will absolutely consider another trip to HTR with my husband and children....I think the rain was just bad luck and the staff would have made it go away if they could have. They have big expansion plans for this resort. Right now, being only 1 1/2 years open, they're still getting the kinks worked out but all in all a nice, quick vacation for me.

Reviews.Title: “a solid 3 star hotel that realllllly wants to be a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: benjaminwah
Reviews.Content: A very clean, sterile new hotel on the peninsula, unfortunately, too sterile for me. Pros- Very clean Great service Cons- Food is good, unfortunately the restaurants try too hard, just about everything has too many tastes, ingredients, fancy words, etc. Luckily at the mexican restaurant they will make you basic mexican food thats not on the menu, because most of the stuff on the menu was gross. What I ended up getting was awesome, steak fajitas one night and mole chicken enchilladas the next. The staff was 5 star definitely. The "Asian" food was terrible. One of the restaurants is a pizza stand. Make it a taco-burrito stand. I am in mexico because I want mexican food, not pizza. The whole timeshare thing, when you check in they immediately try to get you to do the time share thing, we opted out and were not pestered again because of it. The thing that sucks is I paid for the ALL INCLUSIVE! Totally annoying to speak with other people at the hotel who got free lobster dinners, free access to their sister hotel in Playa Del Carmen and all of it's amenities, and shuttles into and back from playa del carmen for free because they had TIMESHARE BRACELETS! So much for ALL INCLUSIVE! How much would it really put them out to offer this stuff to people they sell a service thats supposed to be ALL INCLUSIVE! The last place I stayed was Xpu Ha, an animal sanctuary turned hotel that is part of a chain that includes hotel giants like the Adventura and Moon Palace. It was an all inclusive that was very secluded, had great pools, great food and tons of wildlife. At hacienda tres rios I went walking everyday and kayaked two rivers and saw a total of 5 iguanas and some crabs. With Xpu Ha we got free excursions and access to all of the hotels in their chain, and all of those hotels amenities for free. Now that's ALL INCLUSIVE! If and when I return to the Yucatan Peninsula I will not roll the dice again, Xpu Ha was amazing, a very clean hotel with a very unique layout and great everything. All in all not a terrible hotel, but definitely not a 5 star. Lots of energy was put into making it a clean sterile hotel, not enough was put into giving it personality. We brought our 6 month old, she was treated awesome, got a great crib for our room and a highchair, no problem. Like I mentioned previously the staff was absolutely the best. The beach was getting worked on and was pure mud, but the beds on the beach were very clean and relaxing. Maybe when they work out their kinks this place will be worth a higher rating, but do not be fooled into paying for a 4 or 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never been to the same resort twice. I'LL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJeffery
Reviews.Content: Tres Rios is truely green...and green never felt so good! Built three years ago, off site and erected on pilings, the rivers, for which it is named, remain unmolested. The water is heated by risidual heat from air-conditioners and recycled. They have cultivated and replanted 90,000 mangrove trees. Herbs are grown on the spot and expertly used by Chef Oscar to spice up his gourmet fare. (learn more. It's quite fascinating) Let's talk about the experience.....Broad, sincere smiles are quick on the faces of the staff and old world charm and courtesy are the attitude-de-jour at every turn. The grounds are designed in graceful harmony with the natural surroundings and the staff is proud to show you around. The eco adventure first thing in the mourning, will delight you with photo opps of Coati ambling thru the mangroves, Spider monkies making their way thru the trees to forage in the jungle and Iguanas basking in the warm tropical sun or vying for territory with jaws agape, hissing threats back and forth like cartoon miniatures of their gigantic prehistoric ancesters. The sense adventure is a must. Gerardo will ease you through a labyranth of textures, smells and climate changes. In the end, you will be transformed by a "sense" that you have a much closer relationship with our planet, it's people and all within it. The experience will be uniquely yours. Chef Oscar will delight you with his food, his enthusiasm and his charm. If you're as adventurous as I, you should sample one of his cricket tacos!...absolutely delicious! But beware...the legs may tickle. More common fare is gourmet indeed in any one of the three indoor resturaunts, or outside, at the pizza oven by the wandering swimming pools, which mimic the rivers, in majestic search of the sea and sunset. Indulge me please, in a short story. Sub-Manager of entertainment, Cesar Rodriguez, tells of a young girl visiting with her family. She is mentally challanged and spent her time in shy recluse behind the protection of her parents. One of the staff of the "Moments Creation team", as the entertainment staff is called, was drawn to her. The friendship grew and soon the little girl was smilling, dancing and excitedly chatting with guests and staff alike. Her father came to the staff and said; "In all our years of psychologists and psychiatrists, none have been able to do what you have done in a few days." The heart of Hacienda Tres Rios is expressed and sheltered in the people. In the company of this spirit of consideration, it's easy to see why so many return year after year.

Reviews.Title: “A week of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: patti409
Reviews.Content: While I wouldn't claim to be a worldly traveler, my husband and I do love to vacation in Mexico. We've vacationed in Acapulco (one of our favorite places), Puerto Vallarta, Cabo, Manzanillo, Cancun and Riviera Maya (last year during the Swine Flu outbreak). We love to try new places and even though we loved where we stayed last year (RIU Palace Riviera Maya) we wanted to try something different. We spent a lot (and I mean A LOT) of time researching resorts in Riviera Maya and reading reviews on Trip Advisor. When we first booked our trip we did read some bad reviews, but mostly related to Time Share pressure. The majority of the reviews were very favorable. So, we booked it. Then in late March, early April we saw quite a few really bad reviews and started to get a little nervous. We booked our trip as a relaxing escape from reality....and that is exactly what we received. I have to say that our trip was excellent. We arrived at HTR around 5pm after a long day of traveling. We were greated at check-in with a smile a refreshing glass of green juice, which my husband just "loves." We were quickly seated with our concierge who explained all about the restaurants, tours, etc....She mentioned the timeshare presentations and just asked that we let her know if we were interested in attending a presentation. That was it.....absolutely no pressure and we were never approached again during our entire week's stay. Our room was really nice. We had a Mangrove Suite, which overlooked the mangroves, ceynotes and a distant ocean view. It's very private on that side of the building....no other hotels, walls, or other obstacles....just nature. Not for everyone, but we enjoyed the serenity. Remember, we were on a break from reality. The beds....to die for. Very comfortable with a wide variety of pillows available. By far the best beds we've ever slept in while in Mexico, and we've stayed at some pretty pricey hotels. The bathroom was nicely appointed. The toilet had a door so you could use it in private while someone else was showering. The shower was a large walk-in shower, perfectly sized for two. I would love to have had a small bench in the shower....it would have come in handy when shaving the legs. HTR does generate their own electricity and we did have a few blackouts while there, but they were very short and uneventful. The pools were beautiful and the landscaping was too. Loved the beach beds and especially the day beds by the activities pool. Perfect for curling up and reading a book. I cannot say enough about the service....OUTSTANDING. We have never received this level of service at a hotel in Mexico before. We've always had a good experience, but the staff the HTR goes above and beyond. Kudos to our favorites, Gregorio, Carlos and Raul. Also, while we don't know his name, the gentleman that mad my husband's espresso in the coffe shop. I will say this...if you have to swim in the ocean or look out at the beautiful blue sea, HTR probably isn't for you. We did know this before we arriving, so we were not disappointed, however, I must admit that I did miss blue view. I did find a little piece of it by the ceynotes, which were a refreshing change from the pools.....literally. The pool water was warm, so when we really wanted to be refreshed we'd walk over to the cenotes for a swim. They were great. We enjoyed the food too. Having stayed an several all-inclusives I can say that I tend to get buffeted out after a week. The nice change at HTR is that you have the Grill and Pizza options for lunch.....and they'll even deliver to you at the pool or the beach. They have a nice menu, but you can order pretty much anything you want. The one day my husband ordered a ribeye steak for lunch. I ordered grilled shrimp and Gregorio also gave me a little steak to go with it....great! The pizza was also really good too. The one thing that I missed is a place to sit outdoors and listen to live music, have a drink and maybe some slow dancing before and after dinner. This would be a nice touch to add. Overall, we had a great time. We de-stressed, had great food, wonderful service, a good night's sleep and beautiful surroundings. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “could be a 5 star resort, but it is not!”
Reviews.Author: bev014
Reviews.Content: I visited resort as a secrete travel agent, so I looked for details. Check- in is easy and uncomplicated, greeted with a smile at front desk. Only complaint about front desk is they refuse to give out change in US currency, this should be a welcomed service based on the volume of American guest. Concierge is very accommodating until you don't purchase at the owners presentation! 90min. presentation is actually 5 hours, beware, much pressure!! Rooms are very clean and acceptable except for two major concerns, the air conditioner system in master bedrm went out almost daily and temps were in 90's all week. Resort power went out several times during the week for brief periods but caused air circulation throughout the resort to suffer for several hours afterwards. Beds are comfy but pillows are horrible and sheets have a strange odor even after nightly changes. Room designs and layout are awesome! All restaurant food is very average but waiters are very accommodating. Major PROBLEM in the indoor international buffet restaurant is the FLIES! They are everywhere and on all the food. The resort did not have this problem under control! The best waiter in the entire resort was Carlos Alberto, he is excellent at what he does and is very humble! He would be an asset to any resort. We will be recommending him in the travel industry! You can appreciate this after paying the all inclusive fees. The restaurant manager, Samuel Vargas, on the other hand was horrible!!!!! He only catered to certain guest and did not make all guest feel welcomed and appreciated. We even saw him take tips off the table that were clearly left for the hard working waiters but maybe he distributes their tips to them??? That is when we decided if we were going to leave an extra tip for our waiter we put it in their hand. Samuel's social skills were zero depending on who you were, but Samuel you never know who is in your restaurant and it pays to treat all guest with kindness and respect. Tony in activities, keep up the great job! Resort activities are well planned. Shuttle drivers are great. Resort has a very good security system in place to keep up with the comings and goings of all guest. We felt very safe. Beach lovers there is no access to the resort beach area at this time but the views are wonderful. Resort location is about 15 min to downtown Playa ($14 cab fare each way) and to ferry to Cozumel. 30min to Cancun($40 each way in cab). Gardeners are doing a fantastic job with resort landscaping!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MTRTMom
Reviews.Content: Hotel- Clean and the rooms are well appointed. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite with a roof top balcony. The beds were super comfortable and the showers are fantastic. Food- The food was 5 star quality. We enjoyed the Chef's Dinner, it was the best meal I have ever had. The service at all restaurants and by the pool were fast and they would bring us anything we would ask for. Oscar and his staff are everywhere. Pools/Beach/Cenotes- There are 3 pools to select from and there was always plenty of room. In fact we felt like we had the place to ourselves several days. As has been mentioned the beach in front of the hotel is not what you would expect in Cancun but you can walk a short distance to see the clear blue water but what they do have our crystal clear cenotes that you can snorkel in. In summary- this hotel is the best I have stayed in Mexico and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “To good to be true!!!”
Reviews.Author: tat2tlav
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying for the price I paid to stay here I really cant complain about any thing. My wife and I booked a 7 night stay at the h3r along with 9 of our friends, the trip was about 950 per person and that included the honey moon package and the flight .We arrived at the resort around 5pm and was never once asked about time shares like I read in other reviews. Are check -in was pretty easy,"I ask to try and get all of our rooms close together which 4 out of the 6 were but the other 2 were jacuzzi rooms so no one really cared. My parties age group are from late 20's to early 30's and can do some serious drinking and eating but were not like out of control spring breakers, if you love to eat and drink there is no disappointment here. From the do it yourself bloody mary and mimosa bar to the 80 plus different shots that we took, they really had it all and it was top shelf stuff. The pool was pretty rad we played a ton of water volleyball. No swim up bar but the pool waiters were pretty much on point , the brick oven pizza place was awesome we probably ate about 10 pizzas a day and they all were killer. The restaurants were all great , we would basically have 3 hour dinners every night but that was by choice after bottles of wine and martinis and appetizers,main course, desert, more wine by the third day we were thinking to ourselves there is no way this hotel is making any money off of us. Mostly all of the food was outstanding, especially the soups!!, wed night was caribbean night which they basically have a bbq out side and you can order any type of meat and they cook it for you right there. We hit the sports bar a few nights they had the laker game on one night so we watched and played pool and drank every type of drink and shot you could think of. All the bartenders are awesome!!. Granted the beach is not that great but oh well thats nature. The service at this resort was pretty much class 1, any thing at anytime we needed something we got it!!! One day are group was going to visit the coba and tulum ruins, so the night before we asked if we could get a cooler filled with beer, water and fruit and sure enough the next morning there it was in the lobby waiting for us!! It was great. All of the staff were awesome always smiling and saying hello and working. They had a fire show one night that was cool we missed the mayan show though, some nights we would just sit outside by the patio or in the lobby talking and drinking pretty late and no one ever complained about noise or anything it was great. The rooms were nice and clean and the hotel ground were very nice. I would recommend some mosquito repellent if your going to hang out at night outside, but really had no problems in the day. Only complaint we had is we had an issue with one of the employees that I wont get into any detail about but the hotel insured us that employee is no longer with them.. 'I hope". So for about 950 bucks for 7 nights, flight , ground transportation, all you can eat, all you can drink , great service, great staff, great rooms, great friends, this place was to good to be true!!! I seriously cant understand how some one could have had a bad time here... If anyone has any questions feel free to ask I will tell the honest to God truth.. This place was Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wished I could have stayed for a month...”
Reviews.Author: FREEquentFlyerJake
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, relaxation, nightlife, sports/adventure, pampering, luxury, excellent food and staff. This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. The location is far from anything else, but is a perfect place to check into and not leave at all until it's time to check out. The rooms are modern, comfortable, and high tech. The grounds are simple, elegant and beautiful. The amenities are everything you could want, pools, Jacuzzis, full service spa, motorized and non-motorized water sports, diversified restaurants, and more. I accidentally booked a honeymoon package, which included everything but the deed to the building. I loved every bit of it and would book the package again. This is easily the best hotel I have ever stayed at and I wish I could have stayed for a month. If the honeymoon package is too rich for your blood, I do recommend all inclusive at a minimum. Also, tip an extra $20 pesos per person for food, room service, bar, etc and the staff will treat you like you own the place.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like the King & Queen of the Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: KeaKo
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I was EXTREMELY worried about how this trip would turn out due to the many negative reviews received in March and early April. Perhaps my husband and I are easy to please.. perhaps we're not well traveled or perhaps our palettes are not as sophisticated as some.. but in our honest opinion.. Hacienda Tres Rios was truly a special place that we hope to return to at some point soon. Check In: We arrived in Cancun via JetBlue direct from JFK (highly recommended) and used USA Transfers ($80 RT) arriving at the Front Desk roughly around 2:30. We were greeted by a refreshing glass of Green Juice (yummy) which was a mixture of Pineapple juice, celery and parsley. We checked in without a problem and given our room key all within about 10 minutes. We then met with our Concierge who gave us a brief overview of the resort including the activities and restaurant schedules. She briefly mentioned the Timeshare tour.. We declined and it was not brought up again. Room: The room was amazing. The beds were super comfortable and the pillows plush and abundant. The bathroom was very nice.. and YES there is a door on the toilet room. The two-person shower is a dream. The I.C.E. system worked everyday of our trip except for a few hours on the first day. It was interactive and very unique. Our view was very nice.. second floor.. left wing of the "old" building. Staff: This is where HTR really shines. My husband and I have traveled pretty extensively over the past 15 years and never have we received such attentive service. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met. We never had a problem being served regardless of where we were. We ordered off of the menu many times and never were we given a look or hint of an attitude. They remember how you liked things the day before and make every attempt to serve the same way. One day, while sitting out on the Martini Lounge, we saw the entire wait staff meeting outside of the Buffet Restaurant. There was a brief inspection.. then they all pulled out their pads and wrote down important information like food allergies of specific guests and they finished it off with an all hands in the middle team Hacienda chant. It was impressive to see their professionalism and camaraderie. We were told they do this everyday prior to opening La Casa Islas for dinner. Room Service was on point and we always received our orders within 20-30 minutes of ordering. Some of our orders were pretty complicated but the staff took good care of us and got our orders right. Shout outs to Raul by the Pool and Yanira and Angel at the Buffet. Over our 5 night stay, we tipped about $110 not to receive special treatment but because the staff truly deserved it. Food/Drinks: The food was very good. We found out early on that it made sense to customize our dishes if they weren't exactly what we wanted. For example, the brick oven pizza was good but we chose to order it with extra cheese and big chunks of grilled chicken (not on the menu). After that slight adjustment it was AMAZING. The Ceviche at the Grill was to die for and the Nachos w/chicken and cheese from the grill was a nice snack during the day. My husband found the drinks to be a little light so be sure to ask for them to put an extra shot in if you swing that way. All in all the food was delicious and the presentation was very creative. Activities: The staff tries really hard to get people into the activities but the majority of the guests are a bit reserved and just came to relax. We attended Karaoke.. did a few numbers and had a good time... Cesar, Gina and Motega did a great job and the singers all did very well. We also took the Jaguar tour which consisted of a Nursery Tour, Snorkeling in the Cenote and Kayaking.. it might be a good idea to get a few Kayaking lessons before actually attempting to do it because it did take quite a bit of coordination and strength. Also make sure to bring "green" bug repellent. I used a brand called REPEL that I picked up at a local Target. The Cenote was cool and a non-swimmer like myself felt really safe when I put on my vest. People pay money for these kind of tours and HTR includes them as part of the package. A real treat. Be sure to bring an underwater camera as the Photo Shop charges $15 per 6x8 for each photo taken on the tours at the Cenotes (big rip-off).. however, they are a separate entity and not part of the resort. Grounds: This place is BEAUTIFULLY landscaped. The designer did a great job of creating a feast for the eyes. Nature was at the fore and they preserved many of the original details. The grounds were impeccably clean and inviting and b/c of the layout, it never felt crowded. Pools/Beach: The pools were relaxing and inviting and there were always enough loungers/umbrellas. I spent most of my time in the 3.9' pool and the water was WARM. .. felt like a nice bath. The beach is what it is.. the sand is pristine, the beach is clean and the beds are comfortable.. I feel really bad for HTR because they try so hard to clean it up.. fighting an insurmountable task against nature. I've included pics in my review of of the beach and the staff hard at work to resolve the problem. However, i would NOT.. and i repeat NOT allow this to deter me from visiting this resort as there are SOOOOO many positives. BTW, to get out beach fix in, we took a taxi to Playa Del Carmen (fifth Avenue) and it was great. The strip feels like South Beach Miami. We rented chairs at a beach club named Playa Maya and received two beach front massages for $50 (one hour). The massages were heavenly and by far the best massage I've ever received at a fraction of the price. In terms of improvements, it would've been nice to have some kind of guide channel on the Television or guide in the room for watching tv late nights. Also, I would've liked the option to have bottled juice in the room instead of soda. Also, the theater should be used as a club at night. I know the hotel doesn't want to attract a certain type of crowd.. (trust me I understand) but it would've been nice to have an adult option for entertainment after 10:00 and the theater appeared to be unused space). All in all, Hacienda Tres Rios is a wonderful hotel. We will definitely return as the resort has sooo much to offer including a wide array of delicious and gourmet food, a dedicated, polite and hardworking staff, eco-friendly practices, impeccably clean and landscaped grounds and a laid back atmosphere. Never have we visited a resort/destination that we wanted to return to, however, this hotel is a gem and we can't wait until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “This place was amazing”
Reviews.Author: denmon1
Reviews.Content: make sure to book your dinner with the chef. best meal ever. 7 courses and Oscar, the chef explained it all! Also, order your lobster, bc, they will get that for you too. Very clean, very friendly, beautiful resort. If the beach access is your thing, don't recommend this, bc the beach was not so great, but the pools were great and the wait staff was too.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RubiadeYolanda
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay. We traveled with a large group of 12 adults and 11 children (ages 7-13). The resort was beautiful, the lobby enchanting. The food was pretty good. Some of the people in our group tried the Mexican Restaurant but felt very disappointed by the limited choices. They wanted more authenticity. However, we soon learned that sometimes when something wasn't in the menu, if you asked, they would still make it for you. We mainly eat at the fabulous buffet. It was heaven for the various taste and eating needs of our children. We tried the Italian restaurant and were very happy with the food there. In terms of the beach, well there wasn't one to swim in. However, they had done an amazing job at providing relaxing furniture (beds, etc) by the water so it was divine to sit there and enjoy the view. The children LOVED swimming and snorkeling in the cenotes. The whole place felt very relaxing and safe at all times. The one negative thing that I will mention is the fact that they advertise a daily schedule. I was excited when I saw the joga classes. The teacher showed up one day and didn't show up for the next three days. So each day I went and waited (with about 7 other guests) and no one in the hotel had any idea were the teacher was.

Reviews.Title: “A fun and memorable honeymoon-”
Reviews.Author: SWesFisher
Reviews.Content: First of all, to air it out a bit- I'm a little annoyed by the poorly worded 5 star reviews that were clearly written by interested parties. I think this Jennifer girl that seems to get alot of positive press ("jennifer is best of all worker at resort. I come Chicago from so I know a thing or some about services of people") must be angling for a promotion or something. My (now) wife and I stayed a week, I don't remember meeting any jennifers- What we did experience, however, was very, very, very agreeable. In no particular order: (1) Food- Italian Restaurant- get the Eggplant. Holy crap. I don't know if it was the sun or the Chardonnay and bread/olive oil combination (excellent), but I wanted to molest that Eggplant it was so good. Mexican Restaurant- Lamp Chops were so imprssive I had them two nights in a row. Bartender at this restaurant can mix a caucasian. Pizza spot- Very good, dough was light. Breakfast buffet- Wonderful breads and fruits, omelet bar on point, great overall variety of local flair and American Breakfast favorites. Didn't try the Asian Grill. Lunch grill at the pool was very good, and the food hit the spot after sunning yourself all morning. (2) Service- Waiters at meals were tremendous. Can't say it enough, we were very pleased with meal-service. Pool drink waiters were hit or miss, sometimes great, other times they were straight-MIA. (3) Drinks by the pool- Inconsistent, often light on alcoholic content. I had to drink like 40 Pinacoladas to get a buzz. I wanted to get drunk, instead I got a sugar high and had to take a nap. I recommend you order beer, or make very clear to the waiter/bartender that you want it heavy on alcohol. If you are an alcoholic, avoid the mixed drinks because you will get diabetes trying to service your disease. I also heard someone say that he just ordered a shot of rum with every drink and topped it off himself. That gentleman was smarter than I was, I just kept drinking the Pina smoothies none the wiser. (4) Beach- Beach canopy beds were great, although there was some of that, "I put my flip-flop on the bed so I wil hold it all day and visit it once" bullcrap. Oh well, heavy New Jersey crowd. (Just kidding, kind of.) Water was not attractive, but it was actually kind of relaxing watching the workers trying to fix it- They even had a mud fight one day. (5) Rivers- WOW. So much fun to snorkel and kayak. BRING YOUR OWN GOGGLES. I didn't and was limited heavily. The rivers more than make up for the beach. They are awesome, the fish are fun, they aren't scared of humans at all. I recommend taking the snorkel tour, and then just walking to the cenote and swimming down the river in the afternoon/evening yourself. It was a reaaly special experience. Kayak yourselves, it was better than the tour. (6) Rooms- Immaculate. Marble everywhere, open and clean. Beds were plush and comfortable. Bathrooms were big, and the two-man showers were top-shelf. In resonse to the guy who complained that the bathrooms had no doors... that's a dirty lie- there was a door to a little toilet room so pooping could be privately enjoyed. As a newly wed, i appreciated the gesture. As an aside, they accidentally gave us two double-beds on our honeymoon after we'd requested a king, they offered to change us, but we refused the change because our view was so great we didn't care. (7) Pools- Huge, pretty. The only thing grinding my gears here was that the kid's pool/ adults only pool rule was not enforced, and we had this total dillweed 4 year-old doing avergae to below-average cannonballs next to us on our final morning. Thankfully, he came too close and I gave him the dirtiest, most aggresive look I could- and it worked: he got so scared he literally ran to his mother (what a baby). It was hard to pretend I'd been innocantly reading because I was laughing so hard inside. We chuckled about that all the way until we landed in Miami. We also decided to wait a few years to have children and to always obey the adults only pool rule because kids poolside are just annoying unless they are yours- (8) Room Service- Mixed Bag: Midnight, the chicken fingers with french fries came in a zap and were hot, salty, and wonderful. I tried to order us breakfast one morning, and had been impressed with the ability to "order anything, even if not on the menu" according to other reviews. So I ordered "Steak and Eggs"- the confused waiter on the other end of the phone answered my order with, "Amuricun Breakfust?" (one of the two breakfast options ON the menu) Trying not to laugh, I said, "Sure, Amuricun breakfust" which is eggs, bacon, toast and fruit. (not bad, but certainly not Steak and Eggs) After being told about 30 minutes, I called 40 minutes later to be told my Amuricun Breakfust would arrive in 30 minutes. I politely cancelled the order, and went to the buffet to have another delightful breakfast which was again, top notch. I think breakfast is their busiest time. All in all, if the breakfast debacle was the worst thing, I'd say we had a great time. I highly recommend it (4.75 out of 5)- and hope my stories and tips will help other honeymooners plan and execute their best week possible. Good luck, God bless, and order a shot with each mixed drink.

Reviews.Title: “relax and good”
Reviews.Author: jeep33
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice the food is very good service are very good THE STAFF is very good p-s:you have very good guide like Jenifer Flores, she is a very nice person!!! Tony is very good too!!! tks

Reviews.Title: “A true Blessing of relaxation”
Reviews.Author: royboy31
Reviews.Content: i had the most fun last week, bike riding and kayaking and playing volleyball and water polo, the staff there was Great my Guide Jennifer was amazing. that was the highlight of my trip. even though it was raining out, her smile and her willingness to keep my group happy even though it wasn't the weather we where hoping for, made it that much better thank u guys for firing such a great group people to represent ur Hotel. me and my group will be coming back, sooner than later. thank u again. i have already told my family and friend about my trip and they look forward to staying there and getting to know the staff. and i told them to ask for Jennifer, cause she'll have them laughing with jokes and humor and her warm spirit.

Reviews.Title: “We visited this resort, we did not actually stay there..........my observations”
Reviews.Author: mortgagechick
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying we visted this resort of our own volition, to check it out for a future trip we have planned for dec 2010/jan 2011. We did not spend the night , and we have decided not to stay here in the future. On April 12 we were staying at the delightful resort of Ceiba Del Mar in Puerto Morelos ( Heaven on Earth) when I suggested to my husband that we take a taxi ride to visit a new resort I had heard of, Hacienda Tres Rios. For our upcming trip we are bringing our 26 year old daughter and we felt she may be a bit bored in the quiet atmosphere of a small spa resort that we have stayed at the past 2 years( Ceiba Del Mar) So we call a taxi and headed down the highway 25 mins. First off, the taxi driver had no idea where it was, and he had been a driver fro many years. We found it, as it does have a big sign out on the highway. It took us 5 mintues to convince the guards on the gates we were not terrorists, seems no one just shows up there on their own to look at the place ( we didn't realize at the time that this place is notorious for trying to sell timeshares to its paying guests and anyone who will take a free brakfast , cab ride etc) It is a long driveway from the highway, so if you were to want to take a collectivo to town, it would be quite a walk, but enjoyable. WHen we arrived at the front door of the resort, it was a beautiful building, very high end service from the doormen and concierge, I observed some guests having their rental cars retrieved and parked for them and very friendly staff. We were taken inside and asked to wait in the lobby, where their are numerous seating areas set up with sofa and chairs in a cosy arrangement. We were approached by a lady named Shakira, who I immediately pegged as a time share rep , being a veteran of presentations myself( always resisted :)) I explained to her that we had just taked a taxi from Puerto Morelos to see their resort as we were intersted in staying there in December. She looked at me like she had just got a bad taste in her mouth ( I almost laughed) and declared that staying at Tres Rios would not be possible as it was a "Private Club". I smiled and advised her that I didn't think that was the case since I had seen rooms available for bidding on on line auction sites for very favorable prices and winning bids in the vicinity of 50 pp All inc plus tax a night. Now the gloves were off (LOL). She tells me to take a taxi back to my hotel and they will send a free taxi to get me int he morning. I say NO, I am already here and I want to see the place, I have plans for the next day, Then she starts offering me $$, massages and free meals. I tell her, you don't understand I am already here and I am not looking for anything free, I just want to see the resort. She says this is not possible. I smile sweetly. My husband is getting flustered, he does not like uncomfortable situations. After about 25 mins standoff, she waves her had at me in disgust and says okay go and see the resort...I don't care. I say thank you and off we go to see the grounds and visit the public areas on our own. I already knew I had no intention of staying at a place where people talk to you in this way... The grounds are immpeccably maintained, the pools were clean and the grass manicured beautifully. There were a lot of staff gardening, cleaning etc. In fact there were as many staff as guests, the place was pretty dead. It was around 11am, in the morning. THere is a pizza restaurant with a large oven to cook wood fired pizza, YUM. We walked down to the beach, now this is where I really have to say the place falls down. The beach appears to have been created to some extent.The sand is not the same as other sand on that stretch of coast ( I have stayed in the area on the beach 9 times) and appears to have been brought in from elsewhere. The water was calm, but was a brown brackish color (yuck), not the beutiful turquoise of many beaches in the area. No one was on the beach or in the water,( any guests we saw were in or at the pool) and I personally would not go in the ocean at this resort. I understand it is probably a dense sea grass that causes this appearance, but it was really uninviting. Now for the rivers and canoes and eco experience, we saw one river winding through the resort ,it was greenish slimy looking water and although it didn;t smell bad, I think the potential was there, and I am guessing the mosquitos may enjoy that environment also. Back to the lobby. I cannot tell you again how beautiful the lobby is ( Of course that is not why one goes to a resortLOL) Off the lobby there is a sports bar, a pastry cafe(both deserted) an ATM machine( thumbs up) and a car rental counter ( also great idea) I did not get to see the rooms, but at a new resort like this i am sure they are beautiful. Overall I personally would not stay here due to the snotty ":private club" attitude and the poor quality of the beach and the ocean. If you are not a beach person and you can get a smoking deal on this place , maybe at an on line auction, and are okay renting a car, I think it would be good value.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME”
Reviews.Author: chloe1644
Reviews.Content: wow i had such a good time i love the staff there especially jennifer flores diaz...she made me feel sooo welcome and i love her shes so into the kids there and always soo helpful she also so into her job and will do whatever she can to make you feel welcome..i hope she is there for many many many more years

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: kotila
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip @ HTR because of the good reviews it received. Although there were many negative reviews in March causing us some skepticism, we were pleased with our stay. We were first greeted by Emmanuel with our baggage, Bronson and Mario checked us in rapidly, and Anim told us of the resort activities and amenities. Check in was very fast and efficient, and no hard selling of timeshares, which was greatly appreciated after a full days travel to get there. One of our travelers did take the timeshare presentation and was gifted kindly for it. The rest of us were not even asked twice. The resort is beautiful with its river, foliage, beds on the beach and hammocks to relax, and is immaculately clean. The rooms are spacious, beds are soft with what seems like a feather topper, the shower is one I hope to duplicate in my next house, and appreciated the plush robes. We had one of our party injured and on crutches (they provided a wheelchair for his use) and helped us out with that several times. In fact, big Oscar gave him a piggy back ride after taking the snorkel tour and we didn’t have his crutches, and of course the wheelchair didn’t work in sand. Now that’s service! On the note of handicap accessibility, the resort does have many ramps to use, but the wooden bridges over the river are tough. Even with someone pushing, it’s difficult, but it’s better than some I’ve seen. The pool area is supposed to have adults, and one for kids. That isn’t enforced. I will say that the kids we saw were well behaved, and it should be said that this is a couple or family resort. Not meant for the hoopla-college kids. Went thru that before… won’t do that again. The resort has just over 200 rooms, and they said there was over 600 guests. The only time it felt crowded in the least was at breakfast buffet and that was minimal. There are 5 places to eat; the Grill and Stone Fired Pizzaria at the pool, the buffet, and 2 fine dining; one Mexican, the other alternated daily between Asian and Italian. The food was good, and could even be described as exotic, but I’m from rural MN, so anything other than beef, fish or venison is exotic (haha). We ran into 3 gals that actually left the resort because the food was bad! We didn’t find any bad food. One resort will never please everyone’s taste buds, and certainly can’t imagine anyone making food their priority to the resort.. but to each their own. The breakfast buffet did get a little “old” after so many days, but how much variety can you have feeding 600 people for breakfast? They did change some of the main entrees daily, so it’s not like it was exactly the same each day. We found ourselves eating at the Grill or the pizzeria during the day because we stayed at the pool most of the time. Their food was very good. There is always some things that one would wish better, such as the beer at the resort was tap beer (except room service), and the liquor choices were a bit limited. Because of the ecological management of the resort, there were no straws, no pretty umbrellas or coconut shells for your drinks. Oh, and they could use one more garbage can in the room! The one thing that made our stay so memorable was the staff. I can’t say enough about them. Emmanuel and Anim mentioned above, and Cristobel, our favorite pool waiter who was a bundle of laughs, Carlos at the dinner buffet… they were all so wonderful about wanting to make our stay enjoyable and had infectious smiles constantly. We even shared a few drinks with Emmanuel and Anim in Playa one night. Let me not forget Oscar at the spa… I received the best massage ever.
