Patisserie offered desserts and finger foods at tea time in the afternoon. They also served wonderful espresso and cappuccinos. Coffee at the resort was rather poor and found that not all the espressos and cappuccinos were made with the same method so they were a bit hit or miss. Bars- Room occupancy was low while we were here so the bars were fairly quiet. The Victory Sports bar with pool table and multiple flat screen TV's seemed the most popular. There is a tequila bar at the Mexican restaurant, but I did not visit it as tequila is not my favorite. There also is a Outdoor Martini bar area in the evenings just outside the Cafe Islas buffet restaurant. There was never ANY problem getting a drink at any time, anywhere. Pool areas- Were very nice although not overly large and they were working on a portion of the upper pool area that I think is or will be the adult pool area. Plenty of chaises available and no "towel cards" needed. Really liked the 2 person circular beds with an adjustable covering that they had. Very comfy and nice if you did not want to be in the full sun. Pools had a couple of areas built in them some you could sit or lie in half a foot of water or even a couple of inches. Staff was ever present around the pool to refresh drinks. Spa- My wife and I had a couples massage at the Ya'ax Che Spa. Very nice spa area that also had the Beauty Salon. Room used was very nice and the masseuses were very good. After the massage there was a terrace with a filled jacuzzi and glasses of wine and fruit tray. Cost was $180USD total for two. Tours- The resort offers a number of tours run by the resort staff. We did the Senses tour and El Tigrillo. The Senses tour is very good and completely unique and I would highly recommend it. Because it is so different, with a mystical quality, I don't want to give any details- just do it! We also took the El Tigrillo tour which went to the nurseries where the resort grows flora to replenish the area, cenote snorkeling in some cool waters, and then kayaking back to the resort through the mangrove forest. This was a nice experience although but I think it might have been our nursery guide's first tour as she did not seem to know anything but the "driver", Osiris, was plenty knowledgeable. Had an interesting moment on the return kayak trip as we saw a small crocodile of about 5 feet. Osiris said it was the first time anyone had seen one but it might make me think twice about snorkeling back to the resort, which is an option. Beach- Man made, rather small and just okay sand. Waters were fairly uninviting and I did not swim in the ocean. Could walk down the beach to another area that was better on one side but the other side is where one of the rivers empties to the ocean. This is a negative but the resort had about a dozen large beds on the beach to use which were very nice. Staff- Absolutely fantastic, can't say enough good things about all of the staff members. Always a smile, and a buenos dias from every single person that worked at the resort. If one of the lizards said "Hola" I would not have been surprised! All in all a very nice, new family resort that would make a nice vacation spot if you just want to chill out and have some great food and service. I had looked into this resort for a family with 4 adults and 2 younger kids and they do have a guaranteed connecting room option that would accommodate this size of family which is hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DanLisah1998
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Tres Rios. In and out of the Airport in less than 30 minutes. That's right 30 minutes. No one in Immigration, Just a few in Customs and out the door in the Van and onto the Resort. Check in went quickly with a cool towel and drink and on to our room - a Ceiba Junior Suite with Jacuzzi. The resort in my view was only about 40% occupied. The room was very nice and clean. The decorations are a bit sparse but the linens are great, the beds comfortable and the bathroom was very nice, functional and lots of room. We had great maid service and great results with room service. In fact the overall service quality at this hotel was some of the best we have experienced anywhere in the world. We are frequent travelers having been previously to various resorts in Mexico (both coast), the Carribean and many destinations in the US. From the pool servers to the waiters to the maids to the concierge to the activity directors, everyone was exceptional, friendly and made our stay memorable. We dined in all restaurants and found all great. The beverage selections are first class and the menus varied enough to no doubt serve any taste. We experienced some very nice extras while at Tres Rios - A dinner by the pool with private entertainment, a chef's table tasting dinner and breakfast in bed one morning. These were simply first class, fun and very creative. We also had spa massages that were very relaxing and well done. The spa is not what you might see at say a Canyon Ranch but it's fine. We did notice construction ongoing but didn't really notice any exceptional amount of distraction. Special thanks to Chef (the Rock Star as we started calling him as he is a true ambassador fo the Tres Rios) and Hector our wonderful concierge for all they did to make our stay exceptional. I would not only recommend this hotel to others but would if planning a return trip highly consider this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ange0907
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful and the grounds were well maintained. There was not a lot of organized activity during the day, but the resort did not have a lot of guests when we were there. I can't say that we'd find this a negative, we liked that it was very quiet and relaxing. The food was great. The staff was very accomodating to our son's peanut allergy and were thoughtful of that wherever we went to eat. The night entertainment was also good, nice variety. We look forward to returning again some day!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort - few kinks”
Reviews.Author: honeypup
Reviews.Content: Resort was very nice. During our stay I would say the resort was not even quite at 1/2 capactiy which made for a very quiet intimate time for our large group of 21 with children ranging in age from 2 - 18 year. There was much building still going on..which was never a problem or inconvenience during our stay. There were 3 resturants and the buffet open. When the hotel is at capacity this will be a problem as the resturants/buffet are not large. Service and food in the resturants and at the pools was excellent. They really do need to add a rest room facility at the pool area closest to the beach along with a permanent bar (the rolling bar would often run out of things). The beach area was quiet and we were always able to get a bed on the beach I think this is because no one was in the water as the water is not the carribean blue you would hope for but it is clean. One of the main improvements I feel the hotel needs is more activities. If they want to continue to market this hotel as a family resort. Our kids basically entertained themselves for the most part (fortunately there was alot of them.. had we been at this resort alone I know I would have been hearing..."I'm bored") . We need take advantage of the day time tours.. Ceynote and kayaking. and everyone did enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip, small kinks still need to be worked out”
Reviews.Author: tngirl888
Reviews.Content: We traveled to HTR in July for our summer vacation. It was wonderful and many of the comments others have made we would definitely agree with. It is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the beauty of this part of the world! Not a party hotel at all. Our rooms were very clean and well stocked throughout the week. The service was impeccable-especially Carlos by the pool and of course Oscar! Definitely take advantage of the onsite tours of the cenotes. They were amazing. The only real negative experience we had here was the dining options. While the food was very good everywhere we ate, we never knew what was going to be open that night. One night, we planned to have a casual dinner buffet because we had been out all day and were exhausted. We went downstairs to find the buffet was closed. So we went to the Mexican restuarant, but they wouldn't let us eat there because my boyfriend was in khaki shorts (which were nicer than some of the other clothes I saw in the restuarant). Our only meal option that night was the grill outside. So we had to eat outside amongst the heat and swarm of mosquitos. We ended up rushing through our meal so we wouldn't get eaten alive my the mosquitos. A couple tips I found helpful: Bring bug spray (all natural if possible because you cannot get in the cenotes if you have on bugspray), when you get off the plane in Cancun do not stop an talk to the people that approach you in ties they are just trying to sell you timeshares, ask for a clear schedule of night time activites when you arrive, sign up for cenote tours early because they fill up

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel & look 10 years younger this is the place to vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thereeses1047
Reviews.Content: Wow this place was WONDERFUL!!! The food, service, staff, salt water pools, spa, most comfortable beds, snorkeling, kayaking, live entertainment , educational activities ( we learned how to carve fruit and how to know if your drinking the right Tequila) as well as fun celebrations!!!I’ve never felt better, my hair and skin are so soft. Thank s to the environment, energy and skin drinks great food and just a relaxing and fun time!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mkirdzik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at Tres Rios for our honey moon, Everything couldn't have been more perfect! I've never felt more pampered in my life. The service was excellent from check in to check out. The staff truly made us feel like royalty. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was absolutely beautiful. Everything was brand new and the room had to be close to 1300 square feet!! You truly have to see it to believe it. While on the 300 acre resort my wife and I had the opportunity to swim in a fresh water cenote, snorkel down one of the resorts three fresh water rivers and spend hours relaxing on a mile of white sandy beach. My favorite thing about the resort besides it's beauty and cuisine would have to be the friendliness of the staff. My wife and I couldn't believe how great the service was, everyone went above and beyond anything we have ever experienced. Mike K , CT

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and probably the friendliest staff ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: LakeTahoeHeather33
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Still a little work being done but did not interfere in any way. The pools are amazing. The staff basically meets any needs or wants and are very friendly. We traveled with our 5 year old daughter and we had no intentions of taking her to Kids Club but she went one afternoon and loved it. Silvia was amazing with the children. One afternoon they had a Spanish class and she came out with more words than my husband. This place has activities to offer so you don't even need to leave if you don't want to. We will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall we loved it and would go back”
Reviews.Author: travelmarkCA
Reviews.Content: We spent a family vacation at Hacienda Tres Rios (HTR) the second week of Aug 2009. HTR is a quiet serene place. If you are looking for a big raging party and a singles seen this is not the place for you. The property, pool, rooms and all of the facilities are beautiful and spotless clean. Many people have commented on the beach not being so nice but it is not that bad. The beach is fine and the beds are an interesting touch. The water is not the “blue” Cancun water and has some plant life in it. If you want to go into the water you can find places with sand. My wife had read about the “bad” beach and didn’t go for the first 5 days. When she finally made it to the beach she was pleasantly surprised. The beach was almost always empty, with less then 10 people every time we went. Some of the biggest advantages of HTR are the cenote, river and grounds. We really enjoyed going to the cenote for a cool swim and using the kayaks. This is not something many resorts have and you must take advantage of this. One day my daughter and I kayaked from the ocean up stream to the cenote with our own snorkeling equipment. We left the kayak at the cenote and then snorkeled back down the river effortlessly with the current. A very unique experience! They also have a sail boat that you can take out or they will take you out at no charge. I found the food to range from ok to very good depending on the meal, restaurant and what you ordered. We felt that the specialty restaurants like the Asian Fusion and the Italian to be the best. Don’t be afraid to go off menu and ask for whatever you want not just what is on the menu. Off Menu examples we had included; surf and turf at the grill, salmon at the grill, fettuccine with shrimp at the Italian. In general we thought the seafood to be some of the best food. We did tip many of the staff especially if they went out of their way to help us. Getting food and drinks at the pool was not difficult. Our drinks were rarely empty. I have read many comments about the price and value. Some people transferred their time share and then spent $150 a day pp for the all inclusive. We paid less then half of that including the room. I would consider this an incredible value for what we paid. I don’t think we could find a better deal anywhere. Overall we loved it and would go back. I would like to point out some areas of improvement and how HTR could make some simple changes that would make guests stays better. It is very difficult to know what activities are going on each day and what the nightly show or event is going to be. They should have a board on the lobby of “Today’s activities”. The staff doesn’t even know and often needs to find out and get back to you. We had an issue with the lack of detail on the menu. We do not eat pork and my daughter ordered the lobster salad. The lobster came wrapped in bacon. They made her a new one without the bacon and we pointed out that the menu did not include the bacon much to their surprise. They need to somehow add a bathroom by the far pool near the beach. It is a long walk to the bath by the grill. (not sure how to solve that one) Some of the extras need more extras like the free DVD rental that has only 20 DVD’s or the video game rental that has only 1 game. I was told that the games were stolen by someone who signed them out a month ago? Charge them and buy new ones, it shouldn’t take a month if they want to be a 4-5 star resort. Overall we loved it and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST vacation I've been on... EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jrserrn
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel more than 5 stars I would. My friends and I were so well taken care by each and every member of the staff! There was never a dull moment our week vacation. There was an amazing selection of activities to do, which were free might I add. I would like to suggest the Jaguar Tour with Ismael, snorkling and catamaran tour with Jorge, the Senses Tour (I was not able to do this one but people in my group loved it!) I would also suggest the tequila and wine tastings! Oscar the head chef has a wonderful talent for exotic food. There is an amazing staff as well, we felt so well cared for, thanks to Carlos for the special waffles (made by Santiago) at breakfast with fresh strawberries! Our poolside waiters Moises and Santiago were amazing! So quick and accommodating. By the second day many of the staff had taken the extra step to remember our first names. We wanted to say a special thanks to Osiris, Luis (tours), Jacqueline (front desk), Santiago (amazing breakfast!), Samuel, Sergio, Jose (wine tasting), Roberto (entertainment/tours), Mariana (Bar tender), Jorge (Catamarans), Carlos (waiter), Santiago (waiter), Moises (waiter), Ismael (tours), Antonio (for making us our "fancy" coffee)! I'm sure that there were many others which we forgot to mention however, each of the staff did an amazing job caring for us! Thanks so much, we can't wait to return! - Jen from Chicago, IL (One of the loud nurses!)

Reviews.Title: “We had the time of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: risanoah
Reviews.Content: We Loved this resort and have been to Mexico 4 times already. The food was delicious and the service was impeccable.We enjoyed every meal. it was beyond or expectations! My 4 kids ages 13, 11, 9 and 6 spent most of their time during the day with Silvia at THE KIDS CLUB. My kids always want to be with us and here they could not wait till they opened their doors @ 10 AM. They met other children --went on the Kayaks, went to the pool, beach -arts and crafts. They had so much fun. Silvia is the best! It gave my husband and I some alone time to enjoy the beautiful pool,Cenotes, catamaran, beach, food and drinks. I almost forgot...the beautiful white beds on the beach !!!! 5 stars +---KUDOS to theThe whole staff- Thank you again----Efraim, Samuel, Silvia, Fernando, Claudia and Patricia---just to name a few of the wonderful people that helped make our stay so wonderful. Mucho Gracias!!! -----The Noah family- New York

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfulx100! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: robotdog
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first all-inclusive vacation at HTR and loved it. Before going, I spent many hours reading all the reviews here on TripAdvisor, so I wanted to make sure I added my comments to help future travelers. We booked our trip via Bookit.com and found a great deal including airfare. We used Besttransfers.com for our roundtrip shuttle from the airport. Everything worked out great. We arrived on a Monday and were greeted at the front desk by name, along with a couple glasses of refreshing juice and towels. We were told the resort was at about 50% occupancy, but we didn't see more than 10-12 other people for a few days, owing to the fact that we arrived on a Monday in low season. We were quickly led to our room. All rooms have an ocean view. We stayed in the junior suite and it was quite spacious, with a king bed, sofas, Philips flat screen tv, large bathroom with separate toilet and a large walk-in shower. There is a digital safe in each room. Air conditioning was strong and our room was quite cold. The room was immaculate and very very comfortable. Outside, there are two large and shapely pools. There is a grill restaurant and also a pizza oven near the first pool. You can walk up and order something to eat. Most likely though, someone will come to your pool chair and take your order and deliver it. Here we have to give a special shout-out to Santiago, one of the servers who seemed to be EVERYWHERE and always asking how things were and if you needed anything. We saw him early in the morning and late in the evening. There are also beds on the beach, and these were wonderful for just spending the afternoon reading and enjoying the ocean breeze. The beds and beach are a bit of a walk to the grill/pizza, but Santiago popped up so we never moved a muscle. We saw the Mayan show and the Fire show and both were great. For dinner, your options are the grill and pizza place if you are outside, and the two indoor restaurants. One is the Mexican restaurant, and the other alternates between an Asian-type and Italian-type restaurant. Note that there is a dress code for the indoor dinners for the men: Pants with covered shoes. I did get away with a t-shirt and flip-flops though. Dinner was a la carte (order from about 8 entree items, plus appetizers) and each dish was presented beautifully. The quality of the ingredients were all very good, very fresh, very flavorful. Breakfast at the international restaurant was our favorite. There was a wide variety of foods and all were tasty. We never felt like any of the dishes were mass-produced--rather smaller portions were set out and constantly replenished so nothing sat out cold. Considering the low occupancy, I think they managed the food rather well and we never felt like we missed out on anything. To sum up, food was our favorite part of HTR, and everything was so full of flavor. We stayed four days, and on our second day we planned to drive out to the Coba ruins. I had done some stressing out regarding renting a car and getting the right required insurance. I was planning to take a taxi to Avis in Playa del Carmen and renting car from there. In the end, however, we ended up renting from the hotel itself (rental car office located on first floor near gift shop). We rented the smallest car with insurance, for a total of $60. Stress free. I agree with all the positive reviews this place has earned, they are well-deserved. * * * * * To address some of the concerns I've read about: -The resort is still new and in progress. Everything you need to enjoy your stay is finished (rooms, gym, restaurants, pools, etc.). However there is construction going on throughout the day and you do hear the sounds of hammers and power saws. It didn't bother us. -The beach directly in front of the resort is not your "white sand/blue-green water" beach. We understood this, since the freshwater rivers flow out directly next to the resort. The water isn't clear, but it's certainly not disgusting. Yes, you can walk 5 minutes to the south and get your nice beach. -Sales Presentation: we declined, and were glad we did. Our concierge Lety was very nice, and told us the presentation was not the hard-sell, and would take just two hours over breakfast. We were also offered many tempting gifts in return (private dinner on beach, or tours, etc.). However, we saw other couples who apparently decided to attend the presentation, and hours later still saw them following a rep around the resort, looking a bit wilted. NOT just a two hour breakfast. So, if you want the gifts, fine, but understand you will use up quite a few hours of a day to get them. We declined with no pressure or "guilt trip" and that was that. -As first-time AI'ers, we wondered about tipping. However, in the end we just tried to tip those who gave us personal service such as our dinner waiter and poolside servers. We also left a tip in our room for our maids. Why not?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time, people and resort!”
Reviews.Author: nataliemay
Reviews.Content: i recommend this holiday to people of all ages. We stayed in Cancun for a week and came over to Tres Rios for our final week. Its been the best holiday ive had! the staff are so so friendly and welcoming it really made the difference. Everyone goes out of their to make it a truly amazing exprienance. the whole complex is amazing. We will be returning! thanks everyone xxx

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE-SENSE Adventure and STAFF-MUCH BETTER”
Reviews.Author: baseballtraveler22
Reviews.Content: This trip was an amazing trip for my family and I. The first trip we took in January 2009 and the resort was absolutely not ready for opening. Although we did not write on trip advisor in January 2009, mainly because we didn't know about it. This resort positively is now ready for primetime. The rooms were again very beautiful and slight changes, like the door mechanism system was changed and the cold/hot shower control was corrected so the kids couldn't get burned. Made a difference. We didn't have to go up to the room, and then walk back to front desk to get a new key this time at all. The food was amazing and the staff was SPECTACULAR. Starting with Pilar Gomez who is an amazing person and great manager of her people. They work together so beautifully that as a guest you see this daily at the resort, it makes you feel very comfortable. The Steinberg's arrived with seeing Pablo and Jesus at the front desk, very accomodating and informative without all the bull. We then got to our room where we found again a beautiful room. The pool was warm and the staff was ready to serve, except for one day on our trip did we not get the expected service at the pool. Only four people working the entire pool and beach area. Not a biggie though! Every other day was amazing. We went to the beach and found canopy beds sprawled over the beach. These were the highlight of the upgrades they did. Actually a place for you relax on the beach. A really awesome experience. Hector and Diana set us up on the tours for the week. Another two of the great MVP's at Hacienda. We got to meet Sergio, Andy, David, Carlos and Roberto of the activities division and they were all amazing. We went on the Cenotes tour and the bike tour which were both unbelievable experiences for your family. We recommend bringing BUG Spray on the tours. The CENOTE tour now incorporates the natural life and the nursery tour, which shows the kids how they used the devistation of the mangroves and put the wood to good uses. The designer plants and all the plant life throughout the resort. Truly Beautiful. The Steinberg's went on the HAcienda Tres Rios SENSES ADVENTURE, (you are blind folded) this should make people come from everywhere to experience. As this is like Kingda Ka at Great Adventure without the roller coaster. An amazing deep spiritual attraction that will leave you in a spiritual place like none before. THIS WAS TRULY AMAZING!!! The Mexican pizza at the pool is really good and the mai-tais, the kids drinks and the Mojito's are great. They now have pool water polo nets and volleyball games going on throughout the week. At 4PM each day the father's got to play adult soccer with the employees, and this was something we looked forward to each day. One day we took out the new hobie sailboats they have and went out to the ocean, the kids loved it. The kids club for my son and daughter was so much better this time than in January. Sylvia, Marcela and Marianna were awesome counselors. Talking about another MVP Most Valuable Player at Hacienda Tres RIOS besides Pilar, and staff is Oscar "the executive Chef". This guy is truly an awesome fixture at Hacienda. His staff of Samuel, Yvonne, Yanira, Carlos (2), Luis totally compliment the experience you are looking for. My son wanted to eat something different one evening and Oscar, Samuel, and Jose made sure that they made what he wanted. He was amazed that they can do this. The asian fusion restaurant and the italian restaurant were amazing. A different one opens every other night. They have the outside grill, which we chose to eat their with a night of little to no breeze and very hot. Everyone was soaked but the food was great. I told Jose to recommend putting fans outside on hot nights, that do not make noise. The mexican restaurant upstairs, the italian restaurant, the asian fusion, the outside grill and the buffet give you many choices. The casino night I took 500,000 and double down on the blackjack table and ended up with over a million dollars. The ending of the night they do an auction for prizes like tequila, shirts and bags. It is alot of fun. I was lending money to Sam from England who was very happy to get a shirt. We also had Karoake night which was alot of fun for all of us. We brought Neil Diamond to Mexico and the kids got a chane to sing Dancing Queen 3 times this night. Sergio and Marcella were great. They really let the kids do their thing. On another night they had the Mayan Fire Dance, which we thought was really cool being up and close to the dancers. Xcaret is much more elaborate, but they are really far away from your family. This was very nice. The welcome dinner was also nice to meet all the staff and get to guess Oscar's (the executive chef'sage) age which is 51. He will kill us for that one. It was an amazing trip and we never left the resort this time. I look forward to the next one soon. The Steinberg's

Reviews.Title: “Too Much”
Reviews.Author: Jock52
Reviews.Content: Everything you read from reviews is right. I found the service is too much, waiters queue up to remove plates before you've finished eating, coffee is refilled before you've finished drinking, couldn't move without someone trying to help. The tipping culture is so developed that you feel intimidated into giving money, constantly reminded that wages are low and tipping is required. The hotel is very nice but so far away from anywhere of interest that taxis are always needed, you can't walk into town for a diversion. I felt claustrophobic, almost like a barracks with a beach. Buffet restaurant (for that quick meal) was closed at random and without prior warning so palns made had to be changed at the last minute. If you like lying on the beach or by a pool and then being ferried around in taxis on a tourist agenda then fine. It might be what most people like but not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shm3000
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at this wonderful resort. The staff, Samuel, Gustavo and Luis, just to name a few, are true professionals. During our stay I wondered if Samuel had twin brothers because everywhere we went at the resort we saw...well, Samuel! The resort is about a 40 minute drive from the Cancun airport. The drivers are very pleasant and hard-working. I've traveled all around the world and I must say that this place has the best service of any other place I have stayed. The food is great and plentiful and the drinks are top-shelf. You want for nothing while poolside or on the beach. We felt like royalty and our family/group had an absolute wonderful time. The rooms were very spaceous, comfortable and included everything you needed to make your stay a great one. The all-inclusive package is truly worth it, especially if you like to eat and drink. No cheap food or liquor here...trust me! You want Lobster delivered to your room? Done! You want a bottle of wine delivered to your room? Done! The kids want some cookies delivered to the room? Done! Tres Rios is a little pricey but you will not be disappointed at all because it is truly worth it. I would suggest before going to this resort that you bring enough singles (depending on your length of stay) to cover tips because this staff works extremely hard and is dedicated to ensuring that your stay is a wonderful one. Please tip, and more importantly, if you struggle with your spanish be patient because there is a slight language barrier with most of the staff. That language barrier contributed to some confusion surrounded some laundry we dropped off to get done. After misplacing over 2/3 of our laundry, we were surprised to find out that the resort charges by the "item" and not by weight. This led to a $450.00 laundry bill. We contacted our hotel rep (Steve), who is the man plain and simple, and the issue was resolved and the missing clothes were located. We accepted responsibility for not inquring in greater detail and the hotel accepted fault for the language barrier. Long story short, we agreed to split the cost and call it a day. The next day...Tres Rios arranged for our entire group (11 people) a free ride on a private Yacht. Now that's how you say "I'm sorry and we want to make it up to you." This place is truly the best and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Looking good”
Reviews.Author: TOSEEORNOTTOSEE
Reviews.Content: I was here for about 5 days and thought it was wonderful! About 40 min form Cancun airport and only 25 min to adorable downtown Playa del Carmen. The rooms were clean, the food was great and the staff was great as well! Although it was all-inclusive, we did tip and it went a long way....having drinks at our pool side table just as we arrived! I am excited to see what will become of this resort. It is supposed to be top-notch with a world class spa and gym. I hope they have many unique spa treatments like the spas in Vegas. I also hope that when the hotel is complete and they have more guests that they will still be able to accommodate and treat us with the same attention they did during this stay. The positives: good food, top shelf alcohol, clean and beautiful rooms all with water views, friendly staff, upscale clientele The negatives: no swim-up bar, only one bathroom in the pool area, the music in the pool area sounded like we were watching a Broadway show. Also, the spa is limited in their services (it could be because they are waiting to build their world class spa)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Service - Beach needs work...”
Reviews.Author: SkyWalkerPA
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hacienda Tres Rios. The activities, food, and service were great. We were only disappointed that they were still working on cleaning up the beach of seaweed, which made the view of the ocean not as nice as it could be. I walked 5 minutes towards the right of the resort and saw how beautiful the waters became when the seaweed was no longer there. I hope the resort fixes its beach soon. Once they do it, we'll be looking forward to getting back there. We've stayed in other places in the Riviera Maya, and Hacienda Tres Rios is better than them. They just need to fix the beach and they will have one of the best resorts in the Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but have some kinks to work out.”
Reviews.Author: travelingalTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tres Rios for a week long honeymoon trip. The resort itself is beautiful. My room was very nice, the pool is wonderful, and the beach beds are heaven. I spent most of my time laying by the pool or beach, and received great service. It was rare for me to have an empty drink. It's not a great beach for swimming, but it is very quiet and often only a handful of people are out there. Two cenotes meet the ocean here, so it makes for a more interesting ecosystem than just a normal beach. I was confused at the start of the trip about what exactly all of the activities and tours were, and the hotel itself can be difficult to navigate and confusing at times. The food was OK but kind of disappointing. I got a great deal on the trip so I can't really complain, but if I would have paid the $400 usd or so a night that they advertise I think I would have been furious because it is certainly not up to that quality. Much of it was bland and if something was good and I ordered it again the next day it would be completely different. BUT they will make you pretty much anything you ask for. Great tacos, ceviche, guac. We took one day trip into Playa del Carmen, which is a nice little town, a 10 minute and $12 usd cab ride away. Another day trip to Mayan ruins at Tulum about 40 min away was also fun. Overall the trip was great, but I might wait a couple years to go to this resort until they get all of the kinks worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelingcoco
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, even with the construction which really wasn't an issue. We stayed in the smallest of the suites. For a suite I found the bathroom a little small. The vanity mirror was also so high up I could use it, I know I'm petite but it would've even been too high up for my boyfriend. Other than that I thought the room was very nice and the room attendants did an awesome job. The pool areas were also beautiful, very clean and chic looking. I read some reviews on how the water wasn't heated- its Mexico :) The water in the pools wasn't cold. The beach is what everyone said, disappointing. The ocean is covered in seaweed, we didn't even go in. The food was alright. The themed restaurants seemed to have nothing to do with the food. For example, there was nothing Mexican about the Mexican restaurant. My boyfriend ordered lamb, from the Mexican restaurant, and it was awful. The staff also had a hard time with English, so I spent a lot of time ordering and translating for my boyfriend. In the buffet area, we were asked several times by several different people what our room number was and one woman was very rude about it. The pool side food was pretty good. The drinks were also made well :) I also was confused by the wrist band system. Some people don't have them, those without all inclusive have one, people with day passes have a different color, and those with time shares have a wrist band depending on whatever. Maybe if everyone had a wrist band or if they made it all inclusive they wouldn't need to have a wrist band system and prices on the menu. I also noticed people with some wrist bands were paid better attention to, etc. I think considering how expensive this resort is, everyone should be treated well. I would recommend for someone to go in two years or so, when everything flows better and staff works better together. All in all its a beautiful resort and once they iron everything out I think it will make for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: barkmr
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying absolutely we would stay here again. Now for the pros and cons of the trip. The Blueline shuttle was unclear to us. I thought our ride from the airport to HTR was payed for but it was not. $20.00 US per person and the guy pockets the money so we were not sure if we were getting ripped off. Turns out, the ride from HTR to the airport, as we were later told at the resort later is covered. But... we were told that it would be 58.00 US when we checked out. I explained the situation that had occurred to us and the fee was waved. When you check in you are immediately approached about setting up a time share tour. We always do the tours because we like the free gifts and it makes it worth it to us. I wish that it we weren't hit so early after our arrival however. At the airport we were also corraled by a time share tour. As we looked for our shuttle, the shuttle rep led us to the time share appointment maker to a different resort. We'll know to avoid that problem next time. Our room was exceptional. Marble tile floors throughout, three bathrooms, great views etc. The staff was very, very helpfull and friendly. The ground are very clean and fesh looking. The resort, we were told, is not really even officially open. We felt as the we had the whole place to our self!! Never did we have to search for a pool chair, towel, bed on the beach. What ever we wanted we had. The waiters had our drinks ready for us as we entered the pool or beach area! We rarely had to ask! They knew! Tipping is not required but as hard as the people worked I felt compelled at the end of the trip to sporadically leave tips. The food was good and changed frequently. Honestly though it was a little too gourmet for our liking. I guess the "Gringo" in us came out as we anticipated more tacos, burritos, fajitas and the like. If you wanted something not on a menu, all you had to do was ask. They would do their best to get it to you. The water at the beach is not at all like the photos on the web site. But they are working hard to beautify it. Never stopped us from swimming in it however.Speaking spanish is not needed but it does help. (Thank you Rosetta Stone) Overall, we will be returning to HTR. We had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RELAXATION- first class service, amenities, food, accomodations”
Reviews.Author: monalawyer
Reviews.Content: I went alone (single female, 50+) to totally relax and not have to adhere to any routine. This was the best ever. I'm well traveled and can say that this was the best resort that I've ever been to. I didn't find the need to leave it for anything. If something wasn't on menu --you could request and it would be brought out --i.e., lobster--every night. Room service was superb. Full bar in suite was included. Travertine marble bathroom--fluffy bathrobe provided. Queen size canopy beds on beach so that you can read and relax or whatever in luxury. Nature preserve--beautiful flora--guided tour of grounds; kayaking also included; I did take the 90 min sales pitch because I arranged ahead for free massage, pedicure, and $50 in gifts to bring back from their shop. All day strawberries dipped in chocolate. After dinner shows were educational and entertaining-Mayan dancers, history included. You will not want for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, hardworking staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerfam
Reviews.Content: I wanted to let the resort know how we felt about some things and when I asked at the front desk for a comment card they told me they do not have them and to go to Trip Advisor- so here I am. I will start by saying that everyone on staff was wonderful. Front desk check in went nicely until we got a call about an hour later that they put us in the wrong room- we said we were fine and they still wanted to move us- we had already unpacked- they went to put us in the same room on a different floor but ended up giving us another room which had a hot tub- nice touch, but it didn't really come in handy in 90 degree weather. The all inclusive when you trade is about $149 pp/per day and comes to $170 when they add 12% tax. This really was too much especially if you compare it to other places in the area. We have stayed at many different all inclusives and this was by far the most expensive. We knew this but felt that there would be enough to warrant it - lots of restaurants, things to do... What you actually get really did not justify the cost. There are some on site "tours" included. Book right away. We stayed Sat. to Sat. We went to book the bicycle tour on Sunday and were unable to get in until Friday. (The resort was about 30-50% booked and has 6-8 bicycles). We met another couple who went to book on Wed. and was unable to get on a tour. You cannot take the bicycles on your own until you've gone on the tour. We did the kayaking tour which was a lot of fun- You can snorkel or ride in the kayak. There is another interesting tour which is an adventure for the senses- they should tell you that you should watch what you wear as some of the things used stained my clothes- the tour itself was worth doing- very different. The rooms are lovely and spacious. They have robes, blow dryers, irons, and small refrigerators they stock with some soda, water, and beer. They do nothing special in the rooms- We had a 2 bedroom- no cute little towel animals or decorations on the beds- they did not replenish conditioner, or even take the dirty towels on the floor one day. One bedroom did get a treat on the bed one night. These are small things and were not an issue for us, but at the price they ask, should not have occurred. As far as food, it is very good and there is nice presentation, but it really was very limited, especially for the cost. They have a buffet, a grill, a mexican restaurant, and an asian-fusion/italian (these two are in the same location on alternate nights but are both closed on Friday), a brick oven pizza place open during the day, and a small place to get little desserts or some finger food and coffee/espresso. The grill and buffet are open during the day- the grill is only open on Monday, Wed., and Fri. nights. Breakfast buffet was very good and staff was attentive. Lunch buffet was also good. Dinner buffet was okay- desserts were plentiful. There is one bathroom by the pool, but it is a little ways from certain pool sections. There is one bar by the pool closest to the hotel and one at the other end. There is one bar inside. During lunch hour, the people working around the pool must also work at the restaurant so drinks don't come as often. Although there weren't a lot of people at the resort, it did feel understaffed. Lots of umbrellas and chairs around the pool, but it did get dirty by the end of the week- bark and sand in the pool. This was evident by Thursday. It was nice that you always had towels available and didn't have to sign them out or in. Evening entertainment was good when they had shows. There was an outdoor gathering with a buffet. Service was very very slow- 25 min. to get water or any drinks- They had a great fire show. You can go down by the beach, but, as they will tell you, the water is brackish. Don't expect a typical caribbean beach. We knew this when we came and were fine with it. There were no real walking tours which would have been nice. We had a nice time with family but, for the money, they really need to do more - add some things to do during they day - there is not much for the kids to do at the pool but swim, unless you bring some pool toys- For the cost, they still need to step it up a bit- they definitely have potential but are just not there. I wrote I would recommend to a friend- if they were a Sunset owner and paying $99 pp/per day yes, but not for the $170.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: jatwood44
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at HCR July 7-12, and we loved it! Most of the time we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves -- the resort is large and well laid out for privacy. This is not the resort you choose for all-night drunken parties -- I would label this resort quiet luxury. The members of the staff were, without an exception, wonderful -- special needs and assistance requests were handled quickly and always with a smile. The food was amazing, and be sure to find the Mexican restaurant at least once. Italian and Oriental nights a la carte were lovely as well -- entertainment in the restaurants was a lot of fun. The buffet is gorgeous, too, and well-stocked for family members of all ages. Be sure to go on the cenote tour, which is magical. Overall, a lovely experience which I would do again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: pettysf
Reviews.Content: I chose Hacienda Tres Rios after spending quite a bit of time going through reviews. Since we hadn't ever been to Mexico, we were flying blind, so we depended on the reviews that we read mainly here on Trip Advisor. I have to say that we were extremely pleased with our choice. Although this resort isn't completely finished, it was very beautiful and the staff was excellent. Checking in was very easy, and there was no crowd whatsoever. We were introduced to our personal concierge, and we were able to schedule some activities for the week, all part of the all-inclusive package. Additionally, she asked us if we would be willing to listen to a sales presentation. While we initially didn't want to do this, she offered us a $140 Mastercard debit card and a complimentary 75-minute couples massage for attending the presentation. We agreed to do so on our second day there. The presentation was grueling, and I truly don't understand why people would agree to do time shares. We said no from the beginning, but still were subjected to 2 hours of the presentation. Nonetheless, it was what we had agreed to do, and they fulfilled their promise, so we were on our way to our massage and soon the memory of the presentation was behind us. Our room was very elegant and clean - the bed was wonderfully comfortable. There is a small sitting area and a table, and the bathroom was perfect. Robes are provided, and the hairdryer was strange, as has been noted in many other reviews, but I brought my own. The minibar in the room is kept stocked and they are happy to bring whatever you want whenever you request it. The balcony overlooked the pools and the ocean, as they all do in this u-configuration. The pools are beautiful, and there is never any trouble getting a spot. The waitstaff constantly come around and bring whatever you request, both food and drink. The outdoor pizza oven provides delicious pizzas, and the other outdoor restaurant has excellent salads, shrimp, sandwiches, etc. They also make a killer guacamole. The chefs from the kitchen also circle with delicious appetizers throughout the day. The staff is always so happy to serve you, and go out of their way to get you all that you want and more. They would often bring two of everything, declaring, "happy hour!" The beds out on the beach are also great and luxurious, and always available. The staff is always changing the linens so that it is always fresh for the next guest. One of the most fascinating aspects of the resort is the rivers that feed into the ocean. There are a series of cenotes, which are spring-fed and cool, which then branch into rivers which flow to the ocean. It is worthwhile to do the cenote tours - both the one on bicycle and the kayak tour. The water in the cenotes is clear and beautiful, and the marine life is different than that in the ocean. It is an easy kayak trip down the river to the ocean, and it affords the opportunity to see the mangroves and enjoy some different scenery. The food is excellent. Both at the buffet and at the a la carte restaurants, the presentation is beautiful and the goal is to please. They will make things off the menu and bring them happily. Sometimes our waiters would surprise us with something special that they made for us. The head chef, Oscar, is a force to be reckoned with. I often thought that he must have a twin brother, as he was everywhere all of the time. He would breeze by the pool areas wearing his black pants and long-sleeved shirt and black head-wrap, never once sweating a bit. He had full command of the place, and always had time to stop and visit, and he would even take time if there was an empty glass to go himself and get a refill and bring it back to the table. We never had a bad meal. Just be sure to bring dressier attire (long pants and closed-toe shoes for men) to eat at the a la carte restaurants. Overall, it was a great trip. This is a resort for those who are looking for a quiet, romantic place that is not particularly a "party" spot. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: BIGHAIRTEXAN
Reviews.Content: We just got back from HTR last night. It was nothing less than fantastic. I am fairly well traveled and a very hard person to please (yes I've been called High Maintenance). So for me to give a 100% positive review is unheard of. We arrived in the late evening, were asked to be seated and then offered any kind of beverage we wanted while we waited. Check in was quick and it was suggested to us that we might want to eat first before seeing our room as it was well after 9PM. We went to Kotari, the Asian Fusion restaurant, were seated immediately and had a wonderful dinner.... very artfully presented. It was accompanied by some very nice wines. We then were escorted to our room which was very spacious and I'd call it elegant rather than opulent. The bathroom space is almost like 3 separate rooms. A shower room (great water pressure), a sink with the funny hair dryer, and the toilet room. Great towels and Teva bath and hair products. The room was kept stocked w/ sodas, water and beer and there was fruit in the room. We tried room service several times, seems we were always told "Forty minutes" but it always took less. Nice range of selections from sandwiches, pizza and pasta to grilled salmon, beef or chicken. Soups, salads and appetizers. Our room overlooked the river, the pool and had a view of the Caribbean which it seems pretty much all the rooms would have. We spent quite a bit of time on the balcony relaxing. The staff said they were at 80 percent occupancy. My daughter who is an exec w/ a boutique hotel company says that if they are at low occupancy, most hotels are told to exaggerate so I am a bit doubtful. I say that because at any given time there were more than ample chairs and umbrellas at the pools, and often I was the only person in a specific pool. Also the lovely king sized beds w/ the big pillows at beachside were always available. And YES the ocean is not very "swimmable." Since the river flows into the sea on property the ocean water is full of debris from the trees/plants that are along the river. It's NOT disgusting trash or anything. It's natural plant materials. If you want to stay on the beach, the river that flows there is clear and much more refreshing anyway... and I am not a lake/river fan in general. The pools are on the warm side but not hot. While there, you can order from the bars, the wood fire pizza restaurant or the pool side grill. And it's not just burgers and dogs. It's shrimp and hot soups and cold soups and the BEST fries and salads. Sometimes we wrapped a towel around us and went for sit down service and other times we flagged down one of the wait staff and were served poolside. That brings me to another positive. Not ONCE did I ever make a request from anyone to be told "Oh I'll get you a waiter... or Oh that's not my job." It seems as if you make a request and they'll do their best to accomodate you. For instance, at the fine Mexican restaurant, I asked if they recommended the deer or the lamb and I was told, "Why don't you let me prepare for you a wonderful combination of both." And they did. I'd call for a wake up call and was asked "Could we send something to you with your wake up? Some coffee? Some breakfast?" Everywhere I went it was the same type of service. The staff seems to honestly be proud of the facility. I can't remember what I said to someone, but the waiter that overheard me said "yes but it isn't as good as the hotel here." And I had to agree. Everyone smiles and says HOLA as they pass. We didn't participate in the Mexican Fiesta, but did catch part of the Mayan show and the Fire show. Yes there WERE mosquitoes. HELLOOO I was in the middle of the jungle w/ bodies of water all over. I brought some mosquito repellant wipes with me which I feel is much better than having an eco friendly resort going around spraying for insects all the time. Other than that, however, insects were not a problem. The cenote tours were fun and informative. Our group elected to float/swim down the river from the cenote to the beach, rather than kayak. I kind of felt like a scene from Jurassic Park, but it was refreshing and fun and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. The Italian restaurant was outstanding, the buffet a step above the average all inclusive buffet, and the patisserie was a nice break in the afternoon. The spa services were reasonably priced, the spa was attractive and the services quite good. I've never had better service or a more pleasant staff in anyplace I've stayed in any country. The facility is just gorgeous, the food excellent and the work they've done to keep from making a negative impact on the environment is commendable. We'll most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Phenonmenal!!!”
Reviews.Author: eres998
Reviews.Content: Best vacation I have taken! Manager Samuel V. Nieto and all employees worked non-stop to make sure everyone was comfortable and satisfied. Never have I seen such hard working people! We were treated like kings and queens. All of Chef Oscar's dishes were out of this world! Mario in the Sportsbar made dancing fun! Carlos, pool bartender made a mean margarita, Julio Ceasar Dela Cruz was the best waiter in the resort. Muchisimas garcias Ivan, Trinidad, Abenamar, Pablo, Efrain, Javier, Veronica, Ambrocio for everything you did for us. All of you made our stay a great one. You made us feel like family. We miss you all. Hope to see you all there the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MMagnolia22
Reviews.Content: I appreciated all of the reviews I read before our trip to Hacienda Tres Rios, so I thought I should add my own thoughts after returning home. We spent a wonderful week at this resort with my husband's family (five of us total) in two beautiful connecting suites. Other reviewers were right on about the quality of the rooms! The beds are wonderful, the furniture is upscale and every room has a balcony overlooking the resort. The staff told us that there was 50 percent occupancy when we were there, but we guessed it was probably closer to 30 percent, which was very nice. We never had to worry about not getting the spot we wanted by the pool or waiting for meals. There were a lot of people in and out during the day on condo-buying tours, but it really wasn't a bother for us. The food was a true highlight of the trip. We ordered straight from the grill menu the first night, but once we got to know the wait staff (who were all so nice!) we would just ask them to bring us what they thought was good that night. As a result, we got a wonderful array of tasting plates, with five different salads, desserts, etc., and chef's pick on the main courses wherever we were eating. If you're looking for something in particular (for me it was scallops, for my father-in-law it was lobster) just ask, and if they have it, they'll bring it. We really enjoyed the outdoor grill, as well as the Italian and Asian fusion nights at the main indoor restaurant. Tip well and engage the wait staff, and you'll be treated supremely! I will say that brushing up on your Spanish would be a good idea before heading to Hacienda Tres Rios. It's not that you can't get by just speaking English, but both my husband and mother-in-law are fluent, and the staff seemed to appreciate even my poor attempts at speaking the language. Finally, as other reviewers have mentioned, the ocean is not the best, but I'm glad they've chosen to stay committed to their eco-conscious moto. We really liked the cenotes (the water up stream was clear and beautiful) and the pools were so pristine and refreshing that we didn't miss the ocean at all. If you like to try new things, with plenty of relaxing, eating and drinking in between, you'll have a wonderful time at this homey-yet-elegant resort!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, Wonderful Vacation! Highly Recommended!!!!”
Reviews.Author: psg_chicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from fantastic week at Hacienda Tres Rios where we celebrated our 20th Wedding Anniversary. For this trip, we also brought along our two sons (ages 17 and 10). We booked our trip through American Express Vacations and everything went flawlessly. The hotel is beautiful – everything is new. Spectacular marble floors throughout the resort…and the guest rooms are magnificent. The food was outstanding and plentiful, and there was always something new. We were never bored with the food. But what stands out the most was the OUTSTANDING STAFF. WE HAVE NEVER HAD BETTER SERVICE IN ALL OUR LIVES. EVERYONE was warm, friendly and extremely helpful. On the second day of our trip, Samuel, the food and beverage manager introduced himself to me. I mentioned to him that we were celebrating a special anniversary…Once Samuel heard this, he was on a mission to make our stay the greatest week of our lives. There were surprises everyday… Most memorable was Saxophonist Fito Raygoza coming right to our room and playing the most beautiful music (what an amazing talent!!!), and having our special anniversary dinner alone at a table outside on the martini deck surrounded by such beauty. We were always treated like royalty. Other staff members that made our stay EXTRAORDINARY were the following: Alfredo, Julio, Gener, Yanira, Ivan, Samuel, Hector, Trinidad, Efrain, Ivana, Laura and Angelice. Gustavo was a great chef. Hector and Diana at the concierge went out of their way for us, and Pablo and Dina at the front desk were wonderful. The resort is still under construction; however, it was always quiet and never bothered us. The cenotes were amazing to kayak and swim in, pool was wonderful…Beds on the beach were a highlight… We thank everyone at the resort for a wonderful time…and hope to return some day. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation at a beautiful place with amazing service, we would highly recommend Hacienda Tres Rios. …and by the way, bring extra money and PLEASE TIP. The staff works so hard and appreciates it tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: willksc
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am a hotel snob. I am very picky about my hotel selections and read every review of every hotel that I am researching. We just got home from a 5-night stay .... my sister, niece, and daughter and I enjoyed this resort so very much. It was a wonderful experience! I give the Hacienda Tres Rios an A+++!!! We were waited on hand and foot at the pool by Javier. He never let our drinks empty, brought us menus and food to us at the pool and took care of our every need. I have been to several all-inclusives and I never received this treatment...EVER! I I honestly don't know how some people could say such bad things about it! The beach is not great.....but this is because they are doing it the eco-friendly way. It may take a couple of years to get the beach "like the other resorts" in the Rivera Maya. They have to replant the correct plants to change the beach. They do not have straws in the outside bars and restaurants because they are not eco friendly. They do have them in the indoor restaurants! The food at the specialty restaurants is some of the best I have ever had.....every single dish is presented like a piece of art and taste heavenly! Another plus.....no draft beer! All drinks were canned Dos Equios and Tecate, great wine list and top shelf liquors. The hotel was not terribly crowed probably due to the economy, so this will change in the next year. They didn't have a whole lot of daytime pool activities but they didn't have enough people to have any major activities. They did have pool and beach volleyball everyday. I don't like to have a whole lot of activity when I am relaxing at the pool anyway, so this didn't bother me at all. They do have great tours.....the Jaguar tour is beautiful and we had a great time kayaking through the rivers. Don't miss it! The sports bar at night was great fun! Mario was fabulous......do go to the dance class! This was the highlight of our trip. Thank-you Carlos and Rudy for putting up with the crazy sisters! Even though there were not a lot of teenagers ... our girls had a great time! The activities director and others bent over backwards to give everyone a good time. The girls didn't want to come home! I honestly don't understand the negative comments...I guess there are just some people that can't be pleased! We did not go on the 90 minute time share tour.....I think many that did go were unhappy due to the pressure, but we were very insistant that we did not want to go. Just say no, if you are not interested. We have a beach home, so this wasn't an option, but it would be a great resort to have a time share if you are looking for one. The staff is just wonderful, take care of your every need and make the hotel above the rest. Thanks again to Carlos, Rudy, Mario, Oscar, and Javier....you made the trip for us! Don't miss the Mayan show....excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: USA5
Reviews.Content: Quoted by their staff as a 6 star resort i would struggle to give it a 3 star. The beach is not bad it is disgusting There is no swim up bar The all inclusive fee is a rip off since the menus and food are terrible There are no water sport activities available Do not go on the membership tour it is high pressure sales for 2 hrs. The resort is in the middle of forest so watch out for the mozzy's Hair dryers are a waste of time so plan to go out with wet hair at night No straws, sodas out of a big bottle only so always flat Pizza man is very rude and we waited over an hour for a pizza You can't get a drink before 11:30 around the pool BUT..... Rooms are very nice Gym is great with good equipment Yoga instructor is very nice Pools are great Most of the staff are very helpful and friendly But, I will never return!

Reviews.Title: “We had a relaxing time, met great people and wish the hotel success”
Reviews.Author: luckylluke
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, the hotel was not crowded. The service was excellent and everyone tries to make your stay the best. I must say the hair dryers are horrible, I had wet hair everynight. I would have enjoyed more pool activites but that may come when there are more people at the resort. The tours were amazing we loved Rudy and Sergio they were so good with our boys. Casino night, the Mayan Show, and the Fire show were lots of fun. We did not do a timeshare tour, but loved hearing all the stories and options from other guests. Mario in the sports bar was great fun and we enjoyed our evenings there. The week was what we wanted it to be relaxing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “HACIENDA TRES RIOS CONTINUATION....”
Reviews.Author: katrina_dituri
Reviews.Content: I only write this review on the Hacienda Tres Rios with much thought and consideration. Through RCI we made our reservations for June 13-20th. The cost for my family of 4 was $3000. We usually stay at the Grand Velas or Velas throughout Mexico. These Resorts really are 5 star and are truly dedicated to making our vacations amazing. We read up on HTR and thought we’d give it a shot being it was compared to the Velas. Hacienda Tres Rooms are one of the nicest we have stayed in. Our two bedroom suite was as amazing as any Mexico Resort can provide. I’m still in awe over the beauty. There is only 1 bathroom for ALL 3 pool areas and the woman’s bathroom does have its issues. There is no swim up bar only a “push” bar with 1 Bartender/server providing service . The poor man was over worked. There needs to be bartenders (plural) and servers for food. The pizza took over an hour to receive and we had to eventually go get it ourselves. Activities are advertised on a weekly calendar for Bocci Ball, Volley Ball, Soccer etc…the first 3 days not one activity person showed up. There is no music, competitions, or poolside games. It’s really more of a sunbathing atmosphere. Needless to say my husband and two boys were bored and decided to go snorkeling at Akumal Beach. The Sports Bar is fun in the evenings…Joel the bartender isn’t very nice. One evening we ordered 5 shots and I was told to collect all the shots glasses myself if I wanted them. I didn’t expect that from a 5 star Resort. We told Mario our server about it and he made sure to take care of us for the rest of our stay!!! Ask for Mario and he’ll give you the 5 star treatment!! Thanks Mario!! The Internet Cafe is fun and savy. There are two laptop computers available to use , Xbox 360 games and dvds to check out . In the adjoining room is coffee, hot chocolate and snacks served daily. The Foyer is grand and cool. Very relaxing, If there were a bar inside it would make it even better. The Sports Bar Bartender was never available during the day to order drinks from. The complimentary 30 min. massages do cost $12. I did receive a complimentary 1 hour massage. This really was the best massage ever! The gym facility is state of the art. The food is Gourmet. Don’t expect big portions, but you can always order more if you want. Order the ice cream it’s AMAZING. Don’t be afraid to ask for the Surf n Turf, which is lobster and shrimp! At the pool ask for anything you want, you don’t have to order what is on The Grill menu. Also, if you’re a vegetarian there is a special menu for that as well. Room service is also another way to go. They always delivered within 20-25 minutes tops. The beach is not what you would want for this region of Mexico. Though they are trying to clean it up. If you walk over to the left across the bridge and past the cenote you’ll come to a GORGEOUS beach! We snorkeled there to a reef and saw some amazing fish. The cenote tour was fun and would def recommend this. We couldn’t do the bike tour because our son was to short for the bike. The cenote across the bridge is breathtaking. We saw crab, eel, and many other types of fish. Don’t be afraid to adventure over there. You’ll miss out if you don’t!! They handed out a questionnaire for us to fill out on our third morning. It consisted of ratings and comments of our opinions on HTR. I addressed every concern we had and am pleased to write the next day the poolside service, activities and drinks/food were top notch. It was great to have management truly dedicated to customer service and address the problems needed. We met some incredible families during our stay at HTR. Their company and laughs made our stay an enjoyable one! Maybe one day we will come back to stay. I believe once this Resort is fully operating, all buildings are complete and additional staff is hired this will be the what they advertise it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: judi666
Reviews.Content: I really can't add much to the already superlative things many people have said! We just came home from a 7 day stay, and I really hated to leave and am still missing HTR. The staff is just wonderful in every way, That is something truly unique about this hotel. Everyone from the concierge, waiters, activity staff, to the construction workers who are working on another building have a big smile and Hola! to you. The food is generally very good, but sometimes a little hit or miss. I could have done without the cricket empanadas. We never did see the mythical Oscar, perhaps he was vacationing elsewhere? The nightly entertainment was very nice and fun. Much better than expected. The Mayan show and the fire show were standouts. The included tours are not to be missed and are fun and low key. We loved snorkeling down the Rio Selva and another day Kayaking it both ways. Our room was huge and had a great view and jacuzzi on the large balcony. Everything was perfect and new and clean. My only tiny complaint is the pool bathroom is a big hike from any of the pools. It is small and for some reason the women's houses something that looks like a mainframe computer behind glass. Consequently it is usually about 150 degrees in the bathroom and not the pleasantness experience after the long hike. My feeling is there will be a nicer and closer pool bathroom in the seafood restaurant (which is not yet open). Also there is no real pool bar, although a cart is rolled out everyday and there is certainly no problem in getting a drink. It seems odd that one wasn't included in the initial plans. Other than those tiny things, all the facilitiy and ground are beautiful and spectacular. During our stay there may have been 50 people at the resort and the it was very much like having some fabulous multimillionaires estate to yourself. Don't hesitate to give yourself a wonderful vacation at HTR!!

Reviews.Title: “Muy bueno again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Doryfun
Reviews.Content: Last year at this time, we stayed at their sister property - Fisherman's Resort- and were so impressed with the "service with a smile" attitude, that we bought a timeshare wk. at Tres Rios- sight unseen! We were a bit anxious as we read in TA about our "new" resort but have just returned with nothing but praise! The rooms, as well as the lobby are clean and beautiful-all with ocean views. The restaurants are comfortable and the food beautifully presented. If there is something special that you want- the staff will gladly prepare it for you. Being on the all-inclusive plan makes it so easy to relax and order whatever and whenever you want. Our daughter ordered room service twice and it was prompt and the food was great! The 2 pools are beautiful, crystal clean and comfortably warm. Poolside drink and "pizza service" is outstanding and yummy! After the first day- our favorite drinks, guacamole and ceviche were practically waiting for us before we layed out our towels! The beautiful turquoise ocean is not here and that is a disappointment.But there is plenty of clean white sand and comfortable beach "beds" to satisfy. The ECO tours are a must- you will learn why the water isn't clear and understand the incredible work that has gone into making this resort "green certified"- and snorkeling + kayaking the cenotes are fun! But none of this would matter if it wasn't for the wonderful staff!!! Service is ALWAYS with a smile and they all give 110%! Thanks to Jose Luise, Manuel, William, Sergio, Ingrid, Veronica, Magnus,and many others whose names I didn't list, for new friendships and making our stay memorable! This resort is still young- but they are doing everything right and we are looking forward to returning as it continues to grow!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: HEATHERANDJD
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this resort is the nicest, cleanest, and most accomadating resorts that I have ever stayed in! We stayed at this resort for five nights at the beginning of June and there was 13 in our group. From the time that we arrived to the time we left, everyone had great service from the staff that would tend to every need and help with anything they possibly could. The food was excellent at every restaurant and the waiters all had great attitudes the entire time! No one in our entire group had any problems and not one person had anything negative to say about the staff, food, etc. We even got the pleasure of asking for a volleyball to play beach volleyball and promptly two activity staff members showed up with a volleyball and ready to ref. and play a couple of games with us. Everyone in our group agreed that this is a resort that we would all love to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Follow Up - Sunset Member - Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly386
Reviews.Content: Shortly after writing my review below I was contacted directly by the management staff due to my concerns. They seemed genuinely concerned and wanted to ensure that prior to leaving I was completely happy with my stay. This type of customer service has always been the norm for any of the Sunset properties and was good to see that they are still continuing their dedication. After addressing the other concerns with them, I along with others could easily identify the changes that were made for the better. It’s good to see establishments that truly are dedicated to customer service and I would definitely recommend this property along with their other properties to my friends and family. Each one of them has a little something different. If you do happen to go there look for Alfredo in the restaurant(s) or Mario in the sports bar. They will ensure you are taken care of really well. Thank you Hacienda Tres Rios, my family will be soon enjoying your company again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Bueno, Muy Bueno, Excelente - Two Fantastic Weeks”
Reviews.Author: BLNDC
Reviews.Content: The Buildings and Surroundings are beautiful. The pools and beach are clean, refreshing and relaxing. The food and drinks are delicious well maybe except for the crickets. What makes HTR Excelente is the staff they are terrific. As so many others have said from the moment we arrived everyone was so friendly and helpful. First and the main reason I am writing this review is to compliment and thank the Activities Team especially Berenice, Roberto, Osiris and Silvia for taking such great care of our 6 and 7 year old daughters. The girls got to experience so many more things than if we just kept them with us the whole time. And when Roberto would see us anywhere on the property he always fussed over the girls to make them feel special. As most other reviews have mentioned all of the Restaurant Hostesses and Servers are great always greeting you with a big smile and friendly service. I would like to thank a few first there is Ms Veronica I think she was everywhere and always with that big smile. Speaking of smiles we met William our first night and he always went out of his way to say Hola. Raul, Evan, and Bonifacio served us many times with smiles and extra efforts. When we first arrived we were welcomed by Ingrid the Sunset VIP Concierge and throughout our two week stay we relied on her to answer all of our questions. Of course it took us a few days to realize that some of the time it was her twin sister Astrid. They were both Great – Thanks. We also spent a pleasant day with Magnus at breakfast and the sales center and please note I meant it when I started by saying it was a Pleasant Day. I have not heard if Angelina has arrived yet but Magnus and his wife and daughter are in our thoughts and prayers. Can’t close this review without mentioning Chef Oscar what a professional I am not impressed easily but when the special guest was on-site the first week of June he was everywhere it is a pleasure to see someone that is so good at what they do. Thanks to everyone at HTR we plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Best People You Will Ever Meet!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia_Haro
Reviews.Content: My mom, my aunt, and myself, just came back from a week long vacation at Tres Rios! We were amazed and in love with the service and the beauty of this resort. We were sad to say goodbye to all the beautiful people who we lived with for a week! The service is excellent. Everyone is there whenever you need them. They are very attentive with whatever you need! They are all so very friendly and treat you more than comforty. I felt safe and felt like home when I was with them. I was able to to get to know a little bit more about some of the workers there. From the entertainment team, we met Sergio and Franco! Sergio was just so kind and made us laugh. The lifegaurd, Fermin, was kindly to take a bit of his time to show us and to tell us a bit about the rivers and the oceans. It was just so sweet of him! The waiters, Marco, William, Ivan, Bonifacio, and Julio were just so sweet! I have to say everyone were so kind. But once, they meet you, they cannot forget your face! You will always see everyone with such a great smile and always greeting you! It would make you feel so comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: joanne1120
Reviews.Content: We bought into this timeshare last year and could not wait for it to open- All I can say is it was well worth it. Everything about this resort is great. Relaxing, being waited on hand and foot, the Spa and the food at the outdoor grill was teriffic- The only complaint I would have is not everything is completed yet-The seafood restarant is not open yet- Hours are still sporatic ( but we went with all the Swine Flu hype and it was slow) for some of the restaurants. Beach is brackish, but it was so hot we ende up in the pool anyway. I am anticipating it to be wonderful when completed. The service is just great- but then we have been going to Sunset Group Resorts 2x's a year for the past 5 years and I think all of the then have great workers.We have made many friends over the years and look forward to going back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the service”
Reviews.Author: allsportsspirit
Reviews.Content: We chose Tres Rios looking for a quiet relaxing vacation. We got a gorgeous relaxing vacation with the most wonderful service. The hotel and pool are beautiful, the food amazing and the staff so eager to serve that it was the most relaxing vacation ever. Thank you to our new friends Super Mario, Iavn, Julio, the ever smiling WIlliam, Alfredo, Kareme David and Pablo, and Letty and Diana Thank you so much for a wonderful wek.

Reviews.Title: “Super-relaxing vacation at HTR!”
Reviews.Author: rika99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from seven days at Hacienda Tres Rios, and we were sad to leave. We're pretty familiar with the Riviera Maya (we honeymooned in Tulum a few years ago), but we've never stayed at an AI--we usually stay at hip boutique hotels. We were drawn to HTR due to the combo of modern/new decor, a great deal on Orbitz, the good reviews, and the fact that we could do outdoorsy things (kayaking, snorkeling) without leaving the grounds. We have a toddler that we left at home with my folks, so we wanted a stress-free non-schleppy vacation, and this is exactly what we found at HTR.
