The beauty of the place is that it's blissfully empty. The concierge claimed they were at 50% capacity, but we estimated about 100 people were there when we were (if that). We never had to wait for anything. There were tons of lounge chairs, umbrellas, and gorgeous beach beds--no lines, reserving chairs, or reservations for dinner. Often my husband and I were the only people in or around any one of the pools, and we felt like we were millionaires with our own private resort. There are two gorgeous pools--one saltwater (that's more of an activities pool), and one freshwater that's more of a grownup pool (and has shaded alcoves). The beach is actually seaweed-free (the staff rakes it religiously), and is lovely to look at from the beach beds--the water (as everyone has said) is not so fab to swim in as it's murky, and the whole week we were there the shore was red-flagged. We walked to the right, and the beaches weren't much better at the Blue Bay or any of the other resorts (some of which were closed and piled with mountains of seaweed). We did a kayaking tour of one of the cenotes and one of the rivers, and the cenote was lovely to swim in--clear and cold--and we took the kayaks out on multiple days on our own to explore a bit. Definitely do at least one of the tours! The resort gives out masks, but if you really want to snorkel, you should bring your own snorkel, as they don't have these to give out (hygiene issues maybe?). We had wanted to take bikes out too, but it was just too hot. The gym is beautiful, and has tons of brand new machines (cardio and weight), and is air conditioned. The food: the presentation was very luxe (in the restaurants our food was always built into towers with various artfully drizzled sauces) and the service at the a la carte places was always outstanding (and the waiters were super-nice). The actual food was good overall, though a bit hit-or-miss from dish to dish. We had many really incredible dishes, and also some that were just "eh" or even super-bland (especially when it came to desserts). It really depended on what you ordered from meal to meal. The best bets were usually the fish or seafood/shrimp (the pork and chicken I tried were generally tough/over-cooked). I had some wonderful shrimp in the fancy Mexican place, and also in the Italian place (with squid ink risotto). Also the beef fajitas and fish tacos at the grill outside (at night) were excellent. We never saw or met the mythical chef Oscar that everyone talks about in their reviews, nor was there ever lobster. We did discover by the second day, though, that if you wanted something that wasn't on the menu they would happily make it for you (so we often ordered chips and guacamole, or fajitas and quesadillas for lunch instead of the mediocre pizzas or burgers). The breakfast buffet was fine, though not outstanding. We ate really well though, and often would order 3 appetizers or an extra entree in the first few days just to see what was good. Our least favorite restaurant was the Asian for dinner. The best (for dinner) were the fancy Mexican place, the Italian, and the outdoor grill. The ground of this place are lush and amazing. Our room was spotlessly clean, brand new, and gorgeous. The beds were great. They claim to have a pillow menu, but when I called they just offered me a memory foam pillow (as opposed to a feather one on the beds). The staff always, always greeted us with smiles. There is still some construction going on, but we never ever heard it and it didn't bother us at all. The few downsides and/or weird things: The crowd at the resort was sort of random--couples on romantic vacations, giant families with kids, groups of college kids, a large contingent of Mexican grandmothers, etc. It wasn't entirely clear who they were catering to (or maybe this just made it diverse?), but combined with the constantly touring groups of timeshare folks (who never bothered us, but brought groups to look around pretty regularly), it made the vibe at the resort a little weird. The college kids were a huge disappointment--each night my husband came out of the lobby bathroom to tell me that there was someone throwing up in there--and they sort of commandeered the sports bar. At a resort of this caliber, I didn't expect that. The staff rolled a martini bar out to the terrace for two nights when we were there (which was awesome), but it was never clear to us when it would be there, or how long it would be out for (and it got rolled back in the second night before we managed to get there). Which brings me to one issue we had--we were never entirely clear on what was going on (e.g. restaurants would be open on nights that weren't on the schedule, or tours would be moved by a few hours, etc.). There's also not much to do at night (except for the nights there are shows, like the fire show). The second issue was with our room--the rooms are pretty soundproof, except in the place where there's a door to connect it to the next room. We had a junior suite. All the junior suites are connected to other rooms so they can be joined to make two-room suites. We were fine in our suite when there was no one next door to us, but on our fifth day we got a really loud group of 4 next door and we could hear them really clearly through the door. Luckily Pablo at the front desk was amazing, and was able to move us to a room with no one next door to us. Thanks Pablo! I wonder if this would be such a neat place for a romantic getaway, though, if it were more crowded? It does seem to be an excellent place for groups or families for the very same reason though. Overall, we had a great and relaxing time, mostly due to the excellent staff at HTR. I'm curious to see how the resort shapes up as it's completed....

Reviews.Title: “I think maybe a B rating, possibly B plus”
Reviews.Author: clvndrocks
Reviews.Content: Mini trip report.... Still undecided on this place. Do not get me wrong everything was wonderful. The food was good. The buffets were okay, but we love to cook. If you eat fast food a lot you may think it is better than good. You must try the speciality dining ( be sure to bring long pants). The food in those was exceptional. Try the fried crickets in the Mexican. The pool is awesome, the cenotes are mucho fun. The grounds are very beautiful and well taking care of. The staff is very good. Nothing at all to complain about EXCEPT... The ocean in front of the resort is not really the colors that one hopes for in this part of the world. About 2 hundres yards offshore the colors are nice, but i believe due to the mangroves around the resort you get a dark runoff into the water. It was fine to swin in and some days were better than others, but not the true azzure waters that we travel to Playa for. We did spand a day in Play and Coz and the water there is very impressive. The kids were blown away by the blues... Again I must say the beach is fantastic and they just planted a jungle of trees that in a year or so will be even more impressive. I just love the blue waters and swimming in the surf... The is no surf here. The other thing we talked about is how the service was so good everywhere. But that may have been due to the fact that there were only 17 families in the resort for most of the week. Not sure they could maintain that as the resort fills up. Be sure to enjoy the tours and everything the place has to offer. The kids painted their own pottery which was fun for them, but a bit expensive. Some families had the little kids and the kids club appeared to be well run and a lot of fun for the little ones. If this is a vacation to just relax and just be waited on , this is the palce for you... Oh by the way the rooms are A plus,plus ..along with the room service feature. A few other points... You do not have to take the timeshare presentation. Book your tours yourself, online or on at the destination. The hotel concierge had us booked for snorkeling for $59 each and we cancelled and found the tour for $20 in Playa. I am sure a bit of that is also do to the low occupancy at ALL the resorts. I think I agree with the previous review about Oscar, nice guy. But always running around smoozing. Asked us if he could get us anything on the first day and my wife asked for diet Sprite and 5 days later we got 8 cans in our room. We wanted it at the beach bar, you know the place were the drinking takes place!!!

Reviews.Title: “I traded my Gold Resort Week for this? Huge Mistake.”
Reviews.Author: flyingartgal
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling through my timeshare company for the past 5 years, and I have never had such poor service at an all-inclusive resort. I took a couple college friends for a get away, and they were absolutely not impressed and I was very embarassed. We paid a normal rate for the top-shelf all inclusive yet so much was NOT available to us. We kept being told that is extra, or not for you???? I am a person who takes trips that provide luxury and relaxation. I take 2 trips a year and they need to be amazing. This was far from it in reagrds to food quality, service and assistance in general. The food quality was very poor, except for the grill nights which we only were able to enjoy 2 times due to restaurants not being open for meals and a truly awful buffet selection. We basically ate breakfast and all of us lost over 5 pounds while we were there...which isn't half bad for us 40 something gals who are already a size 8. I spoke with every one I could get my hands on to fix the issues that we were having. I spoke with the resort developer Dallas, who was pitching the resort that week to RCI members to purchase. Dallas was pleasant enough but did nothing to ensure our vacation was improved. In fact, after I had the on site car rental company extract money from my credit card this past week 9 which is a month AFTER my vacation ) I still have not heard from him. My bank is pursuing charges. Then I spoke with Jose, the customer service rep. who also promised to comp us a vehicle so we could take a day trip to Tulum and I had to call him at home on the day of the "promised" free vehicle to insist that he keep his word. He never followed through with leaving word, or attended to my guests dissatisfaction. Oscar the "Head Chef" was more into smoozing the guests than providing quality food. At one point we asked for a simple order of Calimari and we were given a rubbery pile of sauce covered over cooked yuk. Now let me say, that one of my guests is a Chef herself- and we all cook well in our home lives, so this was a complete flop. I was tempted to go back and cook myself. I mean seriously, we are next to the ocean.... I will say that the rooms and beds were dreamy. We had a 2 bdrm suit and we all rested well. Breakfast each day was very nice because of the excellent gal chef preparing our omlette/egg (s). I am so dissapointed by this experience, I am demanding a refund from RCI. We paid over a thousand dollars for the week and it was terrible. I will pay for quality and comfort while on vacation- but this is NOT QUAILITY OR COMFORT.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT WORK IN PROGRESS”
Reviews.Author: LUVCHOWZ
Reviews.Content: My wife And I stayed here March26-April 02,2009. Although the resort is still being constructed ,we were never bothered by construction. This resort is a great work in progress. The room was nice but not outstanding, however the staff,service and food were.My wife and I travel in Mexico extensively,and this was by far the cream of the crop! The beach needs a lot of work,but there are other activities to do. If you are looking for a nice relaxing vacation,this resort is worth the money. My wife and I already have reservations here for January 2010 and will updated further then.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: beanie89
Reviews.Content: Took a last minute solo trip for some much needed R&R and found a great deal through Orbitz. From the moment I checked-in and was given a glass of champagne while I awaited my room key, I knew that I had found paradise. The rooms were spacious, modern and meticulous - complete with flat screen TV, DVD player and iPod-integrated clock/radio. The shower was massive with beautiful marble tiling. The restaurants served fantastic gourmet meals - far better than any all-inclusive resort that I've visited. The pool area was large and beautiful. The drinks were plentiful. I fell in love with the four poster beds on the beach - never want to use a beach chair again :) I also loved the fitness center which was beautiful and had everything one needs to get a complete workout. Each member of the staff that I encountered was extremely pleasant and helpful. Since returning I highly recommended the Tres Rios to everyone I know. From the beautiful accomodations to the great food and service, it was the most relaxing vacation I have ever taken. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best vacations ever, What a top notch place.”
Reviews.Author: CJS2009
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, you kind of go through a maze of roads, and it seemed like there we're many different ways that you could go through. We came in and we were greeted with champagne, and apple juice for the kids. Everyone was such a help, waited on us hand and foot. We had the all inclusive so we didnt reallllly pay attention to prices. It was beautiful, nice scenery. Oscar is the "head chef" and will do all he can to please you. If you are looking to have a good time, the victory sports bar is the place to be! Lopez is the bartender and what a great guy. He is there for anything and is a lot of fun! But unless you like sweet caroline, or sweet carolina as he called it, by neil diamond, i would suggest picking the music yourself. Just ask, and give him your iPod, and all will be well! The Crickets aren't really that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice escape enjoyable experience will return soon”
Reviews.Author: BeulahTraveler44
Reviews.Content: My goal was to relax and I achieved it, a great experience overall. The service was impeccable and attention to detail was consistent. The staff was very helpful and so nice. The food was excellent, a true culinary experience. Multiple restaurants to choose from all excellent. Chef Oscar was such a delight with wonderful suggestions and taking the time to share samples was a treat. Swimming in the various cenotes on the property and kayaking to the beach was lots of fun. Syliva and Sergio were a wealth of knowlege and so pleasnant. We took a day trip to Cozumel to snorkel that too was a fun experience. The Ferry is about a 10 min drive into Playa Del Carmen. It was very relaxing trip overall and I would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort - Gorgeous rooms - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoHi2009
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful week at Tres Rios where we were treated like royalty. The hotel just opened in November and not all the amenities are available yet. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are gorgeous with marble tile, cedar furniture, and luxurious linens. Restaurants are outstanding == food is delicious, well-presented; tamarind margaritas are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyesIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Tres Rios Resort for 5 days, arriving on April 26th. It is about a 30-40 minute ride from the airport to the resort. For a little background, in the Cancun area we have stayed at the Moon Palace and the Excellence Playa. Tres Rios is in the same class as those and there are things I liked more at other places, more at Tres Rios. The resort is operating with only 175 rooms open (out of 275) we were told, and any construction that was still going on was not noticeable. There were maybe 200 people staying at the resort. Most were without kids – there were maybe 10 children at the resort who seemed to be having fun. We were there during the initial reports of the Swine Flu outbreak which may have been while more people weren’t at the resort. Upon arriving at the resort around 1:00, we were told our room wouldn’t be available until 3:00, which we were expecting. We went to the outside grill and had a very nice lunch and beers. At 3:00 our room was ready and the bags arrived shortly afterwards. The rooms are just like the pictures. We had a basic room without a Jacuzzi – all rooms have a balcony. The tiled shower was nice. The bed was very comfortable along with the linens. Every room, from what I could tell would have a view of the ocean. Ours was on the top floor and we could see all pools and had a great view of the ocean. We enjoyed all of the restaurants except we didn’t have the opportunity to eat at the Italian Restaurant. Our favorite was probably the Asian Restaurant. For lunch, we usually had one of the fabulous pizza and then later grabbed a few snacks at the Grill. I normally don’t like guacamole but it was great there and we had it everyday. The spa was ok – the massages were great but I think they still are in a temporary location. We always went to the pool closest to the ocean. You didn’t need to worry about getting down there early to put a towel out. There were empty chairs and umbrellas everywhere. It was definitely a relaxing atmosphere. They had a temporary bar setup by this pool (the Grill was the bar by the other pool) and servers were walking around. Most of the time, the service at the pool was good. We were told they would eventually be putting in a pool bar which would be an excellent addition. They had nightly entertainment….a casino night, fire show, Mayan night, etc. They were entertaining. The Cenotes, Kayaking, and other activities are worth the time and something you would normally pay for at other resorts. They had Absolute, Absolute Mandarin and Stolichnaya Vodka, Crown Royal, Jack Daniels, and many brands of Tequila to drink. Dos Equis and Tecate were the beers I had. I didn’t see any Captain Morgan’s but they had Jamaican Rum. It wasn’t a “party” spot so if that is what you want I wouldn’t recommend the place, but if you want a relaxing resort, very good food for an AI, nice rooms with the best service, you can’t go wrong with Tres Rios. As others said, Oscar the head chef is everywhere all the time. The staff picks up on his service and seems to feed off of him.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vlakvark
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed in this hotel one night. We stayed in Blue Bay Grand Esmeralda, Blue Bay messed up our conference room reservations so we all had to move out of the hotel for our last night. From the moment you walk into this hotel it is pure luxury. I love the rooms, the food, the pools, the waitstaff, everything. Check-in was a breeze and pleasant. My only complaint that I had is the hairdryer in the room - it does not have enough power to do a good blow dry. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Tres Rios is a very good place to holiday.”
Reviews.Author: weknowitall
Reviews.Content: If you are adventurous and love to eat well then Hacienda Tres Rios is a very good place to holiday. We got a very good promotional rate through orbits.com for ten days and loved everything the hotel Hacienda had to offer with a few exceptions. Before we took our trip the question for us and many travelers how is the beach by the hotel, by the reviews I could not understand if it was swimmable. The beach in the front of the hotel is very upsetting it has a reef which brings in lots of seaweed and other debris and is not pleasant at all for swimming. There where people cleaning all this dirt all day long. But if you walk along the beach coast line for about five minutes the water is great to swim with blue water and white sand. One of the impressing parts of the beach is the beds they have situated along the property; they are the best looking beds in all of Riviera Maya stretch and very luxurious and comfortable. I am not a big lover of tanning but I laid out every morning enjoyed the sun and fresh wind. We arrived at the hotel late and our room that we requested a suite with a king size bed was not available, my husband was upset do to he had called a day prior to confirm the reservation. The front desk was so accommodating they gave us an upgrade without any questions, our room a suite was on the third floor with a Jacuzzi on the balcony and an amazing view which every morning we watched the sun come up. The next day we meet Hector the hotels PR who is great he sent us a bottle of champagne and was very accommodating with any question we had, but the main man in Tres Rios is Oscar the head chef I think he works 24 hours we saw him morning and night socializing and preparing great dishes for the hotel guests. The food is very good from the morning breakfast to lunch and dinner we enjoyed every meal. We live in NYC and are very spoiled with the variety of gourmet food we have, but for an all inclusive I was very surprised; everything is fresh with quality and good variety. Try the rib eye steak on Mondays barbecue and the Italian black ink risotto in the main restaurant. They also have seafood barbecue on Thursday; we had lobster and big shrimp for which my husband enjoyed but a bit dry for me. The Mexican food was just OK a bit boring. There are a great variety of drinks, frozen or on the rocks everything is good you won’t be disappointed. The staff is superb anything we asked of they accommodated, very friendly and well trained from the hotel on service and professionalism Hacienda offers fun tours on their property with your stay, like the jaguar tour, it includes kayaking, snorkeling in the senotes and sightseeing either with bikes or walking. My husband swam in the senotes which he described amazing life in the water below, while I enjoyed the scenery. We rented a car right from the property (bargain the price) and went to see the ruins of the Mayans in Tulum, beautiful torques beaches in Cancun and the fifth avenue of Playa del Carmen all in a day’s trip and had an amazing time shopping sightseeing and swimming. Hacienda Tres Rios is a private place with evening shows like the Sunday welcome party with Mexican food and music, nicely set up with lots of margaritas and entertainment. Do not miss the Mayan show on Monday, very well done and the OK fire show on Tuesday. Wednesday they have casino night which you play with funny money and have an auction for bottles of tequila for which my husband had won. HURRAY!! Overall Great Service, Good food, Good location, Good entertainment, Bad beach. We would stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: frdva
Reviews.Content: Beatiful beach, very good rooms, clean, staff is always helpful, the food is marvelous and the ecopark great. The pizzas at the pool are more than great. Go there and enjoy yourself! Also had a good shop with good cigars

Reviews.Title: “Loved it soo much, we committed to returning in 2010!!”
Reviews.Author: nnjtriguy
Reviews.Content: First to set conext, we live in the NY metro area and are a well-traveled family with kids, 11, 8 and 6; we've been to Cabo, AZ, FL, CA, NY, IL, NH and so on. All in all, this is a first class resort that deserves 5 stars but is a few minor tweaks and months from getting there. The property: beautiful and sprawling with the perfect balance of resort accomodations and eco-friendly preservation. The hotel features are grand yet tasteful, the rooms are large and well appointed with flat screen TV, DVD player, well-stocked fridge and wonderful linens! All with a beautiful ocean view. My only comment is with the beach, which we had read about before visiting. Yes, the ocean is murky and needs some serious care to restore the true blue tropical lustre that you have in Cabo, Playa Del Carmen and Cancun. The sand itself is gorgeous and well maintained with the big comfy beds on the beach. Over the 7 days, we never went in the ocean at the resort but did go in at Tulum and while visiting the Sunset Fisherman in PDC. The people: Head Chef Oscar runs the show; charming, personable and in command, he is a real treat! It's his staff and service that is solid and makes the resort a real gem! Everyone went out of their way to answer questions, accomodate our requests and make us feel at home. While service is slower than US standards, remember you are on vacation in Mexico, so just go with the flow and order two drinks at a time. The food: Back to Oscar; he exceeded our expectations!! A solid line up of options throughout the day including a gourmet Mexican and Italian restaurant, buffet, poolside grill, wood fire pizza oven and 24/7 room service! We ate at every location, tried practically everything and were extremely statisifed with each meal. . . you may want to prepare yourself for the crickets though. Entertainment: While the property is still young, less than 6 months old and only about 60% complete the property was quiet and tranquil during the day and the evening entertainment was well planned and wonderfully executed. With a Sunday evening Mexican Dinner show, Monday Mayan History show, strolling Maraichis, Kareoke and Magician there was always something going on. We can't wait to see how much better it will be next year!

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable getaway for all ages”
Reviews.Author: amyk525
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the lovely Hacienda Tres Rios. I wasn't sure what it would be like traveling with my mom, two 15 year olds and a 5 year old, but everyone loved their version of the trip. Mom and I enjoyed a few quiet moments by the incredible pools while my 5 year old son had an absolute blast at the kids club. The girls caught many rays on the beach beds and wandered in and out of the internet cafe to see what their friends were up to back home. The food was great, but we all liked the breakfast buffet the best. Dinner at the Mexican themed restaurant was great and the 7 piece mariachi band made it even more special. Mom and I both enjoyed the cenote swim/ kayak experience, and everyone was incredibly gracious. We all had a massage that would rival any we've had a five star resorts in the US. Concierge service was easy; they arranged several activities for us as well as a trip into the town, Playa Del Carmen. The only improvements I can suggest are more entertainment for teens and more night time live music. I know that as the resort's reputation spreads they will increase their activities. Can't wait to find time to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week in a very special place”
Reviews.Author: evergreenbeachlover
Reviews.Content: LIke many others writing recent reviews, we had our reservations for months (since before they opened, in our case), and have been avidly reading the reviews since last fall. This was our first time taking our kids to Mexico, and we were anxious for the experience to be a good one for everyone. We could not have been more pleased. Check-in was smooth, and our room was exactly as promised. We arrived on a hot day, and after many hours of travel, the cold towels and champagne were a welcome sight. They had shirley temples for the kids, and the staff couldn't have been more gracious and inviting. The pools were beautiful and huge - their winding form makes for many tiny "inlets." I'm guessing it would not feel crowded even if the hotel was completed and full. We often felt like we had the resort practically to ourselves, even though there were nearly 200 guests on property. Except for one meal (the seafood dinner by the pool one evening), the food was consistently fantastic - absolutely not what I usually read about the food at all-inclusives. We ate everywhere except the a la carte Asian restaurant, and all were super. Although I loved the breakfast buffet, we ordered room service breakfast twice and loved the beautiful poached eggs and fabulous fruit plates. We also ordered room service for afternoon "snacks" a few times - smoked salmon, coconut shrimp, chicken quesadillas - not your typical snack fare, and fantastic every time. The soups were always wonderful - cold soups by the pool, hot soups at dinner. Some of my very favorites during the week: eggs poached in tomato sauce (buffet breakfast), "oats with milk" (buffet breakfast), white sauce pizza (wood pizza oven), grilled shrimp (Hacienda Grill), cold tomato and cucumber soups (Hacienda Grill), tenderloin salad (Hacienda Grill) creme brulee (a la carte Mexican), stuffed veal (a la carte Italian), pear tart (dinner at Hacienda Grill), coconut shrimp (room service), smoked salmon plate (room service), and all the burgers at the Hacienda Grill - American (not on the menu), Mexican and Sea Bass. The staff is a true highlight of the resort. They obviously love where they work, and they are thrilled to share their "home" with you. I know I will forget some of our new friends, but a few to note... Sergio was a wealth of information on our nursery/cenote tour, and we had lovely conversations with him throughout the week; the girls in the Kids Club were lovely and wonderful, and I can't thank them enough for trying to involve the kids in their activities; Francisco (ciao, Franco!) was a hoot and wanted everyone to be busy...but didn't hold it against us if we just wanted to lay by the pool; Oscar was delightful and certainly went out of his way to make sure things were running smoothly - and we certainly loved his food. To a person, the staff were friendly, smiling and ready to make our week memorable. Occasionally we had a service issue with something taking a while to arrive or not arriving without a reminder, but I've come to expect that in Mexico to a certain extent, and we didn't let it bother us. We visited Fisherman's one day and could not get back to Hacienda Tres Rios fast enough. The nicest thing I can say about Fisherman's is that it made us appreciate where we were. There were 6 of us in our group, ranging in age from 60'ish to 8, and we all had one of our best vacations ever. I had a hard time leaving this special spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Luxurious, Relaxing, Brand New Resort with Fabulous Staff!”
Reviews.Author: raakheesri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 19 month toddler just returned from a 6 day vacation at Tres Rios, and we could not have been happier with the beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. Our vacation began after a short 25 min drive from the airport to be greeted by our first names and champagne (apple juice for baby) and cool towels. The hotel is just as gorgeous and pristine and new as the photos depict. I was so pleased with the style, comfort and most importantly to me, the cleanliness, that I didn't think anything of my toddler rolling around on the ground of our room. The rooms were well equipped with flat screen tvs, dvd/cd players, soft beds with very nice linens/lots of pillows, sofa/living room area, jacuzzi on the balcony and spacious bathrooms with waterfall showers. The rooms were cleaned on time every day and we had turn down service with fancy towel art my daughter loved and homemade candy each night. The food was wonderful (think gourmet, not Chinese buffet bar) yet plentiful. The restaurants were open 7-11 am for breakfast; 11:30-4:30 for lunch; and 6:00-11:00 for dinner; plus there is 24 hour room service, prompt and served with a smile; pizzeria at the pool; grill at the pool; and a internet cafe so to speak with cappucinos and desserts and hors d'oevres all day. You could also get a drink any time of day at one of the bars or room service or your mini-bar...all included. More importantly, the resort was the perfect size such that walking from point a to point b was no problem. No golf carts or shuttles required here. The pools were gorgeous and again, pristine. The beach and the beds just perfect, with a gorgeous cenote area where the river meets the sea. The biggest perk of this hotel was the AMAZING STAFF. These people were so genuine, so thoughtful, hard working and friendly. They always greeted us with a smile and always asked what they could do for our daughter, and for my husband and I too. For example, one night my husband was asked by our waiter what his favorite food was and he replied filet; the next day at dinner, he was brought a tasty filet! Similarly, the night before we left, Chef Oscar asked my husband when we were leaving and what we would enjoy for breakfast. Even though the kitchen usually only opens for breakfast at 6 am, we were greeted at 6 am on the dot with delicious room service breakfast for 3! One evening when my daughter was particularly uncooperative with sitting at the dinner table, they moved a sofa to our outside table so my active toddler could "play" and eat alongside our table. When we were heading to the beach, we realized we didn't bring toys for baby -- no problem! The Kids Club gave us toys for our little to use. I could go on and on about these wonderful people -- Chef Oscar, Jose, Francisco, Syvia...to many to name and remember! Just trust me on this one -- we are well traveled and are confident that you will be pleased. On a side note, we did tip our staff -- but if you don't think you should do this at an all-inclusive, then I respectfully disagree. These people work hard for you and deserve something for there efforts. Nobody nickels and dimes you here, nor waits around expecting a tip, but it's the right thing for guests to do.) Honestly, I only have one issue with the hotel and it is something I know they are working on. The water at the beach has issues -- seaweed/grass that has bloomed since recent hurricanes which makes the water unswimmable and frankly only good for observing from the beach beds or your balcony (it is pretty from there). The upside is you can walk down the beach and find much nicer, blue water; or if you rent a car like we did (driving is cake on the 307 highway which is like a 3 lane state highway) and drive 10 minutes south to Playa del Carmen or even explore the gorgeous beaches of Akumal and Tulum. We would do this after breakfast in the morning and return around 1 pm, have lunch and drinks at the pool, go for a swim, take a siesta then go to the martini/tea deck, then dinner, then evening entertainment of live music and mingling with other guests and our friendly staff. The water being gorgeous would have made this hotel perfect, but even with this limitation, it was a completely marvelous vacation retreat. We had absolutely NO issues with timeshare solicitations or any pushiness described in some of the other posters comments. Frankly I looked at the worst reviews before we booked and went on this vacation, and now having been to this resort, I am shocked at some of the complaints. Either these people went before the resort was fully up and running (and probably went for free on a RCI timeshare promotion) or these are terribly grumpy and scroogelike unpleasables -- these are the only possible explanations! Look, if you're looking for a classy place without pretention and without noise/crowds/grime; if you're looking for a place where you'll be treated like a family member; if you're looking for beautiful surroundings and relaxing opportunities (kayaking, massages, swimming, music, great food and drinks -- this is your place. Hats off to everyone at Hacienda Tres Rios for giving us a luxurious vacation where we never missed home (and we love home!) We will see you soon -- planning our next visit already!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and peaceful vacation at the Hacienda Tres Rios”
Reviews.Author: emptynesters38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple spent an enjoyable week at Hacienda Tres Rios the last week of March, 2009. Once we made our reservation, we anxiously looked at the reviews and forum posts on Tripadvisor and were amazed and concerned about the range of reviews and the contrast between the submissions. We have therefore submitted a longer than normal review to give our opinion of this new resort. Check in did not go smoothly. When we arrived around 2::00 PM our room was not ready and we found that check in time was 3:00PM. I reminded them that we had requested a room with a king sized bed and was told that “we would love our room”. When I returned around 3:15, it was still not ready, I again asked to make sure it was a king sized bed and was again told that “we would love our room”. Around 3:30 PM, our room was ready and it was not a king sized bed. They did agree to change it later but it was a little frustrating. You do not get a wrist band unless you own a time share via RCI or Hacienda Tres Rios (HTR). I think it is purple for RCI and Orange for HTR. Since we do not own a time share, every time I went to a restaurant I was asked my room number and when I returned to the hotel after walking the beach I was sometimes asked my room number. That was not a problem. The hotel is situated on a beautiful site that was formerly a nature preserve. The main building contains what appears to be 60% or more of the hotel rooms, the main restaurants and the spa/gym. This building is completely finished. There are about 2 other buildings under construction with additional hotel rooms that are framed but still need a lot of work. The ongoing construction was NOT noisy and did not cause any problems. There are two main free form pools with plenty of chairs. Next to the pool closest to the hotel is the grille which has outdoor dining and a bar. On the other side of the pool is an outdoor wood burning stove where you can get pizza or calzones. There is also a rolling bar situated at the far end of the pool adjacent to the beach. The beach has a sufficient number of chairs and large outdoor beds that were always available. There were umbrellas for some of the chairs around the pool. Adjacent to the far pool were three hot tubs with different temperatures. There were waiters around the pool to bring drinks or pizza but the service was sporadic. It was the one weak link in the otherwise excellent service at the hotel. The pools were not as cold as previous reviewers mentioned (maybe we are used to the cold being from Mass.). When the sun is hot it was actually refreshing to cool off in the pool. We did not notice “wading areas” for kids but there was a section of the pool that the “kids club” would visit so that must have been a shallow part. The beach is wide but the sand is a little course. While we were there, there was no seaweed on the beach. The water was “churned up”. Due to the waves and wind, the water was not crystal clear like in the Caribbean. Do not expect to stand in the water and “see your feet”. People did swim in it all along the patch of beach that we walked. There is a lot of erosion on the beaches at nearby hotels. A fifteen minute enjoyable walk towards Playa del Carmen had water that was clearer if you need a “ocean fix”. When we were there, the hotel was between 40% and 70% full, depending on who you spoke to at the front desk (that was of the available rooms). As a result, you could eat at whatever restaurant you wanted almost at any time and there was never a problem getting a chair at the pool or the beach. That was one of the nicest things about our stay. Often while on vacation , it is a problem getting dinner reservations or a hassle getting a chair at the pool but it was a pleasure not having to worry about that. We usually do not look for entertainment while on a beach vacation so it is not an issue for us. For those of you that are looking for it, there was something going on each night but since there were not many people there, it was low key. They had a Mexican fiesta with a maharachi band, a casino night with “gambling”, karaoke night (twice) and fire dancers. The hotel is 6 miles, which is about a half hour from Playa del Carmen (there is a lot of traffic). There is lots to do at night in Playa if you are so inclined. The hotel offers a free shuttle during the day to and from Playa that goes to Sunset Fisherman which is on the far end of Playa near Fifth Avenue. (I have read that if you are staying at HTR you can enjoy reciprocal privileges there but was told that it only applies to RCI owners). A cab is 140 pesos. Since it is located on a former nature preserve, one of the prime assets of the hotel is the keynotes (small natural bodies of water), the plant and nursery and the kayaking. There are three different tours that you can take or you can use the kayaks by themselves if there are any on the shore of the river near the beach. We went on two of the tours and enjoyed them. We would recommend any guest staying at the Hacienda take the Nursery and Ceynotes tours. It’s part of the charm of the resort. One of the best features of the hotel is Oscar, the head Chef. I joked with him that I did not believe he was a chef, but that he was an actor hired to play a chef and interact with the guests. He was everywhere, at each restaurant, breakfast lunch and dinner and I even saw him during a tour of the ceynotes. He was great for customer relations and was always asking if everything was fine and if he could do anything for you. That being said, the food was good but not perfect. In addition to the grille and pizza oven by the pool, there are three other restaurants. The main restaurant is a buffet. Adjacent to it is an ala carte restaurant that was open most nights and alternated between Italian and Asian. Also, two nights the grille was open for dinner, one night for steak and the other for grilled seafood. I rarely eat at buffets but did eat here a few times. It was pretty good. Instead of large quantities of food in warming trays, the concept here is to have not too big platters of food that are constantly being changed. Sometimes, the food would change during the meal. Since the hotel was not full, this was a great system. It would be interesting to see how that will work with 3 times as many people. We ate at the Italian restaurant twice and we also ate twice at the gourmet Mexican restaurant twice. The food in both places was interesting and well prepared and the service was great. My biggest complaint was that the meat at all of the venues was not very good. The lamb chops at the Mexican restaurant were tough and inedible. The steaks were very thin and not up to the standard you would accept. Also, instead of butter with your rolls, they served little packets of unappealing margarine. I am not a big breakfast eater but the orange juice was fresh and they had a nice selection of fruit. My wife loves breakfast and noted that sometimes there would be pancakes or French toast but not all the time. There is an omelet station and we found they would also make French toast if requested. If there’s something you want and it’s not on the menu, ask. Chances are they can make it for you. There is 24 hour room service but we never ordered it. There are no snacks in the room and it would have been nice to have some available. There is a place for pastry off the lobby that is open at night that was a nice touch. The gym was fine with about ten cardio stations, recumbent bikes, trotters elliptical cross trainers and some machines for lifting weights. There were two flat screen machines but when the trotters were in use you could not hear anything. Since the hotel was not near capacity, I was always able to access whatever equipment I wanted at any time. We each had a massage at the spa, which was appropriately decorated and equipped for a hotel of this nature. The rooms were large and comfortable. My wife and I disagreed on the quality of the sheets. I thought they were fine but she thought they were somewhat scratchy. Towels both at the pool and in the room were plentiful. The bathrooms are spacious and the shower is big. The only complaint about the bathroom my wife had was with the hair dryer. It was a long tube with very little power. We suggest you bring a travel hairdryer. They can be used there. No special plugs are necessary. There is free wifi throughout the hotel that worked seamlessly and two public computers in the “exit lounge” off the lobby. In conclusion, we had an enjoyable and relaxing vacation. Although it is not at the highest level we have seen in Mexico, it has great potential and all of the staff was very friendly and anxious to help every guest enjoy their stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: ChicaDulce131
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Hacienda Tres Rios with my husband and nine year-old daughter. Initially, we had booked a 5 nights’ stay at RIU Playacar, but after two nights, we had experienced quite enough, and asked if they would refund our remained 3 nights. Luckily, they agreed and we quickly booked 3 nights at Hacienda Tres Rios. Upon arriving at the lobby, I took one look and thought that I’d died and gone to Heaven. I was thinking, “Now this is more like it!” The lobby is absolutely beautiful and the employees all greet you and make you feel so welcome to be there. When we opened the door to our room, we all were amazed at the large size, cleanliness and beauty of our room. We had two double beds and a sofa that pulled out into a bed. The linens on those beds are pure luxury. We thought they were better than our beds at home! My daughter was so excited to see a Jacuzzi tub out on our balcony! You usually have to pay extra for that at other places, but as far as I could tell, every room has one. We enjoyed our flat screen TV and made use of the DVD player by visiting the resorts’ DVD library. The bathroom was really nice. The shower was huge and beautiful and I appreciated having a make-up mirror that was hanging on the bathroom wall. The décor of the room is very tasteful and simplistic. It’s the cleanest hotel I’ve ever stayed it and by far the most comfortable. The food…wow! What a treat. The Executive Chef, Oscar is one of the hardest working people I have seen in a long time. Oscar is always greeting guests and making sure that are happy and well taken care of. We were very impressed with his level of service and skill. We ate mostly at the buffet where there is never a lack a variety. It is the best food we have ever eaten at an AI. One night, we at at the Mexican Food a la carte restaurant and I ordered Shrimp Bistek. I highly recommend it. It was delicious. The Hacienda grill out by the pool makes a delicious Churrasco burger that is insanely delicious. The homemade pizzas made fresh to order in a wood burning store are also a treat. Inside, you can go to the Paris Café and have some delicious treats and cappuccino/coffee/tea. The young man that works in the café is really sweet and really loves his job. I could go on and on about the food. I am scared to step on a scale after this trip! The pools are beautiful and everyone has plenty of space to have their own piece of privacy. The beach is pretty and as a bonus, there are comfortable beds and lounge chairs. My husband really enjoyed snorkeling in the river where it meets the beach. If I had to come up with a con about this hotel, I would say that the beach had a lot of plant life near the surface. Because of the excessive plant life, the water isn’t as pretty as it is at most of the other Riviera Maya resorts. I was wishing that I had asked if they could do anything to improve on that. My guess is that they will work on that. Other than not being a great swimming beach, it was still lovely and we enjoyed it. At the Kids Club, Argelia and Berenicia work very hard to treat the kids to a fun and special vacation. My daughter enjoyed going on a Garden Tour, visiting a Cenote, canoeing, swimming, playing Croquet, making crafts, etc. I would recommend that if you have young kids, you bring them to this kids club and let them enjoy it. Everyone that works at this hotel was wonderful. I have never been to a place where the staff makes you feel as welcome as they did. They were all so sweet to my daughter. I wish I could give everyone by name. I would also like to add that NO ONE ever approached us regarding Time Share Sales. It was a great vacation and I would recommend this to couples or families that are not into a Cancun party scene. This hotel is a class act. It truly was a special treat to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and getting better every day!”
Reviews.Author: mgangels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family holiday and we had a wonderful exerpience. There were 17 of us in total ranging in age from 72 to 18months. Everyone had a great time! The resort is smaller and we appreciated that after a number of years of family resorts that are massive sites where you can spend forever walking from one place to another and forget trying to find each other. At Hacienda its big enough to not feel crowded and small enough to find each other. There was lots to do as well during the day, walks on the beach, snorkling, kayaking, swimming, walking the trails in the nature park. The cenotes are beautiful for swimmng and kayaking! The morning walks with Silvia (from the activities department) were great! The rooms are beautiful and spacious and the cleaning staff are warm and friendly and willing to help out in any way. We used room service a couple of times and it took about 1/2hour but the food was delicious and hot! The staff in the restaurants need a little more experience but they make up for it with friendlyness and willingness to please. The food was good and if they didn't have what you wanted just ask they are so happy to take care of you. Oscar the head chef is so proud of his team and that kind of leadership and positive attitude filters down! It is well located between Cancun and Playa del Carmen so getting around was easy. I think what I liked best wasthe staff, they are so friendly and warm and eager to please. Franco from the activities staff was also a lot of fun! There needs to be a little more to do in the evening. There were a couple of shows, and Karaoke, casino night etc. But they are building a theatre and are planning on having more entertainment. Thank you everyone for making this a great family holiday we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Almost, but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: Moe_n_Noah
Reviews.Content: At times wonderful, at times very poor. Consistently inconsistent. On the other hand, the staff were all very friendly, very helpful, and very happy. Despite holding itself out as one of the high-class all-inclusive resorts, the Tres Rios is not there yet. It may get there, but it has a lot of work to do. The quality of staff they've hired is a good start, but a lot of work has to be done to bring the entire experience up to the level they've set for themselves. For the price they charge, the quality is not yet there. Finally, despite charging a fairly high price, and billing itself as a top-of-the-line resort, I found that there were a nickel-and-dime approach was taken with many amenities, such as charging extra for certain types of wine (as in merlot vs. cabernet -- not even high-cost brands), for matches (even after you purchased a $25 cigar), etc. These small things must be changed for this resort to move into the class it thinks it's already in. That category is within reach, but there's much to do. I wish them luck, but I won't be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “In start-up mode, but what an awesome place”
Reviews.Author: diveguy59
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Tres Rios. I first toured the resort in August and was really impressed by the eco-resort concept and could see that this was going to be a beautiful resort some day - there must have been hundreds of workers on site. I bought a time-share for Tres Rios this week. I was down Thanksgiving week for my first stay - the resort was still majorly under construction and only had one restaurant open. In spite of this I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff is wonderful and the chef Oscar is world class. I recently returned from my latest trip and was very pleased to see much progress being made. Yes, the resort is in start-up mode, yes, there are many things that need to be fixed, but being in the engineering/construction industry I understand that you can't be at 100% completion before you need to start generating some cash flow. I am so glad I bought at Tres Rios and will be heading down again in May.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation in one of the nicest hotels I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: cmdtraveller
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are huge and pristine, the beds very comfortable and the staff is the best I've ever encountered. I've travelled my whole life and we were blown away by how friendly, helpful, and genuine the staff are at this hotel. And every night when we came back to our pristine rooms, they were sparkling clean, the beds turned down, candy on our pillows, and some gorgeous "towel animals" decorating the bed. They actually teach guests how to make these creations! The highlight was the food. I lived in New York City for five years and ate at every good restaurant I could find, and this place is right up there with some of the five star restaurants I've eaten at in NYC. There is lots of variety, lots of very gourmet menu choices, and all beautifully presented. The food looks and tastes like art. Omar, the chef, is amazing. The Mariachi band and fire show at dinner were both wonderful. They plan to offer and welcome equestrian show in the future, which sounds amazing. The activities were fun: especially the cenote swim and kayaking down the river. Fun yoga and pilates classes as well. The beach is nice, with gorgeous king size beds to lay out on. but the water is much cleaner further down by Playa del Carmen. This is a result of the hurricane and will hopefully improve with time. The pools are beautiful, huge, but a bit cold. Who cares, when it's 85 degrees and sunny! I do think they could make it easier to do some of the activities without a guide. For example, I'd have liked to go cenote swimming or kayaking on my own after the initial tour. But they offered all kinds of fun activities and evening entertainment. If you get involved, you'll have a blast. As for complaints about the time share sales people: what do you expect when you agree to go on a timeshare tour? Of course they're going to try to sell it to you. Honestly, they don't need to try very hard. This place sells itself. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware timeshare sales!!”
Reviews.Author: StopSunset
Reviews.Content: Just a warning to anyone staying at the Hacienda Tres Rios or invited to attend a 'timeshare' presentation by Sunset Beach Club at this location. Do not involve yourself with this company! We signed a contract with them and have fought them for four months to get our money back, they used all sorts of unethical tactics to try to scare us into keeping our contract (which we had legally cancelled). This is terrible company that knows exactly how to prey on the unwary traveller, please do not support them or their affiliates!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Relaxing Stay in a Natural Setting”
Reviews.Author: swoodwor1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Hacienda. It provided the kind of low-key relaxation and tranquility we enjoy. We never left the property and never felt the urge! Was it fabulous over-the-top...No. Was it memorable...Yes. The staff is fabulous, very friendly and wanting to please. Samuel, Dario, Oscar, Alfredo, Franco, Francisco, Hector and many others went out of their way to make sure we had a pleasant stay. The rooms were beautiful, the views fantastic, the amenities plentiful, the food very good, but not gourmet. This is a new property and will only get better as the staff matures. The place has a great spirit which is contagious. I would definitely recommend those who are considering a low-key getaway without the "Cancun frills" to consider this resort. It`s a sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Ba_LouNebraska
Reviews.Content: We have traveled for over 30 years and this resort by far was the BEST. The service was impeccable. The Chef, Omar, was delicious, and so was his food. The management at this resort has it right. They understand the needs of the employees and it shows. Everyone loves their job and wants to serve you. The Spa is incredible, Aires is a must have. I can’t name all of the employees, but Jimmy, was the most pleasant. Always addressed you by name, what a nice touch. The 24 hour room service is included in your all-inclusive fee and we used it. We gained weight at this resort so watch out. The food preparation and display is beyond words. We will be back as soon as we can. Thank you so much for such a delight of a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: moreandmore
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why others are complaining...the service was fabulous...the food great...the room beautiful. We never had to wait for food or drinks at the pool or anywhere else. My 6-year old never had a problem finding food to eat. And 24 hour room service with your all-inclusive! OK - i'll admit that the Mexican Night was poorly lit...the tours of the resport to the cenote we too orchestrated. But in the grand scheme of things these were minor issues. My 6-year old enjoyed her days at the kid's club. They tried hard to keep them occupied. My only complaint was that the bed was "short-sheeted". This meant that the bottom sheet didn't reach the full length of the matress. But it was a comfy bed! What I appreciated about this resort was that it was quiet. No slamming of doors - no loud music by the pool. No stupid nightly shows. They did have live music at dinner or in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but would never go back...”
Reviews.Author: flwrchld6639
Reviews.Content: We were sent there after being bumped from OCC Allegro Playacar....I don't know why this is becoming so common but it sucks.... As nice as this place is it isn't what we were looking for and how dare these resorts assume what we want to spend our money on. OK in saying all that..... this hotel was ok for, it certainly wasn't the beach at all we were looking for, and everyone is so right about the pool service...NONE EXISTENT ....It really didn't seem right to have to walk to far to get a drink or wait an hour for a warm beer. The staff tried very hard and seemed to be always trying to please. We were friends travelling together so we weren't asked to attend the time share meetings which made me very happy. Over all this place is not for us at all we did like the Fisherman's the sister resort....we were never picked up when were suppose to so we did pay for our own taxi's to and from once or twice....the last return taxi was at 5pm.... we really enjoyed the food at the Fisherman's so most nights we wanted to eat there we had to pay for our own ride back. The shop in the resort is not at all very nice by any means the lady that was working wouldn't let us put a charge to her room because she said it was too much work...so we went to the bank machine outside the store doors and got some money, and then she said she couldn't sell it to us because it would take all her change...we did tell her that this is all the money we had because we just took it out of the bank machine...so she very reluctantly gave us the change and kept complaining the entire time....UNREAL!!! There were a few of us that had a few experiences with this lady that ran the store.... If we didn't have the other hotel to go and visit I would have been really upset about this trip....not a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Simplistic, still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: doshamacas
Reviews.Content: I have spent alot of time reading over all the reviews in the past few months. Some of them very fair and honest, others seemed to be a rant from people who ought to not travel anywhere out of country. I wish to be fair in my opinions and my intent is to only offer thoughts that will be productive for this great new resort. My husband I are frequent vacationers in the Playa area. We started visting many years ago and fell in love with the culture and the people. We have visited many resorts and found Tres Rios to be beautiful and the quiet holiday we needed. THE RESORT-still a work in progress, like any new business, it just takes time to make it all run well. THE ROOMS- really really nice, clean, very comfy beds and linens ( I am a linen snob and never thought once about my own sheets!) no room was to far from anything. There are DVD players in each room, so bring your own if you want. You can borrow from their list too. ROOM SERVICE-This is my biggest negative! The room service did not offer the same level of quality that eating out at the restaurants did. If Tres Rios want to attain the level of recogniton that they want then they have to "fix" the room service issues. Room service at an all-inclusive 5* HOTEL should be without a problem. We were told that our meals would be "up" in 30 mintues and many times took nearly and hour. Our orders were not as we ordered many times. Meals were never hot but warm or near cold. The staff did not seem to understand what condiments to bring for what meal....Salt, ketchup, butter, etc.... The resort needs to invest in those warming carts that many hotels have. The food would arrive warm as if it came straight from the kitchen. Room service is to be a treat for vacationers..unless you have a maid at home. THE POOLS- cold, never got in once...I thought they were to be heated???? THE BEACH- very nice, very quiet , water still brown with seaweed. You will have to go to PLAYA del Carmen to get your "blue water fix"..I have total confidence that the resort will take care of this in time...after all, a CAT 5 hurricane devestated the enviornment only a few years back. THE STAFF-gracious, kind and never without a smile..the resort needs to put more staff out at the pools so that guest do not have to serve themselves. The staff did everything they could to keep up with the guest demands. It is NOT the job of the poolside staff to get you a tissue...please treat them with respect. THE FOOD-Great and Adventerous..Oscar the chef? should have his own show! My only complaint is that the food on the buffet was never warm enough to really enjoy. I know that they were working on this and trying to adjust the temp of the warming tables. While I did not travel with my kids, I do undertand the food issues with the kids choices. The resort ought to consider putting in a kids station with kid-friendly food so that they can serve themselves. The parent's would love this. MY FAVE- the fennel cream soup and the guacamole from the grill ( not on the menu, ask, all homemade as you wait!) MY LEAST FAVE- the crickets THE BEST- I asked Oscar how I could get my hands on some chocolate strawberries because I always missed them being out out. After dinner that evening, we found a bottle of wine and a plate of strawberries in our room. VERY NICE! Would suggest to the resort- need to have more "snacks" out during the day. Maybe some small snacks in the rooms daily, fruit, chips, etc..Need some sweet snacks by the pool. Maybe cut up fruit and cookies? Ice cream? THE DRINKS~ needs a little more work...my husband gave bartending lessons to a few of the waitstaff. The WINE~ the resort needs a broader wine selection. I travel with some of the biggest wine snobs on the planet and they would have paid anything for more choices to go with the meals we had. THE SPA- I did the $12 massage with OSCAR...he's is great. I also did the hot stone along with the added jacuzzi afterwards...the "real" spa is not opened yet, but it was still great! TIME SHARE- we are owners at SUNSET FISHERMAN, all I can say is, get it ALL in writing and realize that it is a high pressure environment and you can always come back another day to buy and get the same deal! THE TOURS- loved the Kayaking..to short! THE "ENTERTAINMENT" STAFF- this crew is awesome. They were so fun, so nice and really had fun with each other and their job. KIDS CLUB- we did not have kids in the club but I still wanted to assure anyone coming to Tres Rios with thier kids, the staff was wonderful. I was very impressed by the way the girls "loved" on the kids and watched them. NEGATIVES-loud obnoxious guest that yelled across the pool to other guests as if we all wanted to hear about their life story. For heavens sake, get up an walk over to someone. SIGNAGE- THE RESORT needs to out up more signs from the main entrance to the lobby. Our driver got lost and we just kept driving until we saw lights. OVERALL- had a wonderful time and will be back! This resort has the potential to be the best around. It is unpretentious and blends in with its surroundings. The colors are simple and unassuming. It is a larger resort but is not obnoxious and does not scream "tacky resort." This place is very classy and tasteful.
